1531111122212.content:
Jen sat in her silver Lexus convertable on Main St. just a few parking spaces down from the salon that her girlfriend Stacy told her that her brother's fiancee was going to be at. She had Stacy on the phone giving her updates.
"So, you're postitive that Gwen is going to be a no show?" she asked into her cell phone.
Stacy was on the other end "Positive. I heard her calling this Christina chick and telling her that she wasn't going to make it. But she got pulled into a meeting right away so she didn't tell me to cancel her salon appointment."
"So the salon appointment should still be for two women?" Jen asked.
"Yes, I made the appointment myself and supposedly this is her first time at a salon because her ex didn't let her wear makeup or do her hair and things like that. Why? What are you going to do?" Stacy asked.
"Well I think I should get to know my future sister in law a little better so I'm just going to tell her, that Gwen sent me in her place. I'll act like I know everything about what's going on with the engagement, then after a couple of facials and hairstyles once she's gained my trust. She'll tell me everything about their little plot to get married according to the wishes in my grandmother's will and how they are going to be billionares, and then. Busted! I destroy her, Gwen and especially my brother." Jen explained.
"Oh my God, you're so evil Jen. Well if youre going to do that I should tell you that when she was on the phone with Christina, she called her CHRIS the whole time, so to make this more believable like you are in on the plan, you might want to stick with that." Stacy said.
"Thanks Stacy, That's good to know..this little wench is going to see first hand just how evil I can get." Jen while speaking looks in her sideview mirror and see's a dark blonde with a ponytail walking in the direction of the salon and her car. She looks at the clock phone on her dashboard that reads 1:17
"Oh, man. I gotta go. I think my little salon date just got here." Jen said hanging up the phone.
Jen let the girl pass and gave her a look over to make sure this was Christina.
She noticed the girl was in jeans and a purple tshirt. She seemed very self conscious and kept looking around, almost embarrassed. She was really thin and looked to be about the same height as Jen. She wore open toes sandels on her feet. She held onto a small white clutch purse. Her hair in a ponytail and sunglasses on her face. She looked at the stores on Main street as she passed them and then saw the salon. She timidly stopped at the window.
"Showtime!" Jen said to herself.
Chris stood outside the salon and took a deep breath. "Showtime!" He said to himself.
Jen closed the door of her car and took her sunglasses off, put them in her purse and approached Chris. "Chris? Christina?"
Chris jumped at the sound of someone calling his voice. Especially an unfamiliar woman's voice. He turned around and saw Jen approaching him. He pointed his finger at himself, and mouthed silently, "me?"
"That's your name, right? You're Chris?" Jen asked realizing that Christina was scared of her agressive attitude.
"Uh, yeah?" Chris tried to think who this woman was. Even though he was scared he had to stay in character so he remembered to speak in a woman's voice. He hated this though, here he was somewhere that he didn't want to be, dressed as a woman and now he was acknowledged by another woman that he didn't know. What was going on? He began to panic, hyperventilate, and sweat.
She got to where Chris stood and grabbed his hands. "Relax sweetheart, Gwen sent me"
Chris breathed a sigh of relief that although this is still embarrassing being a man dressing up and acting like a woman in public,
at least he wasn't going to be alone.
Chris smiled, "Oh thank God! You scared me, I thought I was going to have to do this alone." Chris replied looking around and still speaking as a woman.
"I'm Jennifer, I'm friends with Gwen and Patrick. She told me everything that's going on and I'm here to help, and for support." Jen explained.
Chris felt a little better about the situation. "Sorry that I jumped about a story high. I thought Gwen only wanted to keep everything between me, her, and Patrick? I didn't think she wanted to bring anyone else into this" Chris explained.
Jen thought Chris was still being vague with this, but if she acted, and played along like Gwen had told her everything, she was sure Christina would blab away and reveal that this was all about the will and the money.
"I can play this game" she thought.
"She wanted to just keep you 3 in the mix, but she was really upset about not being able to be here for you, being this is your first time, she ended up opening up to me and told me everything. I said that I would go down to the salon and put your mind at ease." Jen explained.
"Thank you, I appreciate this so much." Chris said in a girly attitude and voice and then leaned in closer and sort of broke character and said in a whisper "You gotta do a lot of the talking in here for me cause I'm so llost on this girly stuff."
"Well that's why I'm here, girl. Now let's get inside and make you beautiful!" Jen said going for the door and opening it and holding it for Christina.
Christana walked in scared and immidiately looked around...there was a lot to look at. The salon was deceiving from the outside. It looked small from the brick front. Once inside the room opened up into a different stations. Chris noticed rows of women under hair dryers, another wall had salon workers washing some women's hair, there was an upstairs that had a sign that read massage.
There were different smells and colors everything also. Chris thought he was in too deep.
Jen watched Christina taking everything. She turned around and faced Jen and whispered, "I can't do this. We're going to have to think of something else."
"Don't panic Chris, you can do this. I'm here with you. Just take a deep breath in."
Both Chris and Jen took a deep breath in.
"Now let it out." They both released their breath.
"This isn't helping" Chris whispered. "I'm going into panic mode."
A woman at the counter appeared and asked if she could help them.
"You've got this, don't panic, you've got this." Jen said, then walked up to the counter.
"Hi, yes, we're a little late, we have a 1:15 appointment under Gwen.
The salon receptionist looked at her scheduling book and saw their appointment. Next to Gwen's name it read , full treatment for abusive relationship woman.
"Oh yes, we've been waiting for you. We have a wonderful afternoon planned for you both. Two more women appeared to take the women into the salon. "Now which one is Gwen?" asked one woman.
Jen spoke up, "I'm Gwen's friend and this is Christina" She then pointed to Chris and said, "she is the one who needs the full treatment."
The women smiled and one put her arm around Chris and said, "Come with me honey, I'll take good care of you."
Chris turned around with a fear look on his face as Jen smiled and waved to him.
The woman walked with Chris and directed him to the stairway. "We thought we'd start you out with a wonderful relaxing massage., how's that sound?"
Chris repeated words he just heard in a trance, "Wonderful and relaxing. All the time Chris remained in his Christina character.
"I'm going to be able to see my friend after this, right?" he asked.
"You bet." the woman replied while climbing the stairs.
When they got to the top of the stairs they entered a room. The inside opened up to a desk where a stack of towels were. The woman grabbed one and then slid open a closet door and relvealed a row of large soft fuzzy robes. She took one out and measured it up to Christina and found a perfect match. She handed both the towel and robe to Christina and pointed down the hall. Go to the 2nd door on the right and get undressed and then lie on the table. I'll be in about five minutes.
"Chris listened and walked to where the woman had said and opened the door. He went inside and saw a dimly lit room, a massage table in the center room, and a small room that looked to be the size of a dressing room in a department store.
He went inside the room and began undressing. He slid the women's jeans off. He took them off so fast, he didn't realize that his cell phone hit the floor and the battery had come off the back of it. He was more concerned about whether or not he should keep the panties that Gwen made him wear on. The more he thought about it, he had his member tucked away inside so tight that if he undid that tape job, this might get real painful.
He undid the clasp of the bra and when he did the foam "breasts" that he had inside the cups fell to the floor.
He heard the woman enter the room. "Are you ready Christina?" she asked.
Chris quickly gathered the foam breasts and slid them inside the pant legs of the jeans so the woman wouldn't see them. He threw on the robe and exited the dressing room.
"Yes, Im sorry. I'm just a little nervous being this is my first time." He said in a timid woman's voice.
"Not to worry miss. We'll take good care of you." She replied as she patted the massage table telling Chris to lie down on top.
"You are going to love this, and then right after this we can...

15311111222121.content:
Chris sat in his fluffy robe lying on a salon chair that had been tilted all the way back so that Chris was lying flat facing up. He had been in this position for the past 45 minutes. A large light was above his face. Goggles were placed over his eyes and a technician worked steadily across his face with an electrode needle carefully zapping away at his face. The techinician worked on his upper lip and was just finishing up his chin.
He had enjoyed the massage that he received when he first got to the salon. he thought to himself, but this was pretty boring. He had no idea what electrolysis was or what the zapping was but the salon technicians wanted it done, and said that it was part of his package, so Chris didn't argue.
The technician that worked on him finally put down the needle. "We did a thourough treatment on your upper lip but your chin area just needed a little cleaning up so we took care of that. We suggest that next time you come back that you have this worked on again. A few more treatments and you should be looking beautiful and not have to worry about this again." The technician explained.
She turned off the above light, and made the back of his chair rise so that he sat upright again.
"There will be some redness, but we'll take care of that with some cooling methods and once we do your makeup, you will look great." She explained as she placed a cool cloth over his face.
"Next we're going to send you over to our eyebrow specialist and makeup artist, Molly, who's going to give you some wonderful brow shaping. After that we're going to wash and style your hair and then you'll return to Molly for a full facial makeover. Finally completiing your afternoon, you will be set up with acrylic naill extensions to show off that beautiful engagement ring. " She explained, she grabbed Chris' arm and helped him up.
Chris thought to himself, that's the only thing that he thought he was having done. Getting some nails, but someone had signed him up for a full salon treatment. Chris felt a little wobbly, he had been lying on his back for awhile and his face was tingling like crazy. But mostly after hearing all that, he didn't want to rush over to the next techincian. He just wanted this to end. "How am I going to get out of here ." Chris thought to himself as the woman led him into a small area in another room. "Eyebrow specialist? This can't be good." he continued to think.
Another woman greeted him and sat him in yet another chair. A familiar face sat in a chair next to his where a makeup artist was working on Jen's face. "Looking good, stranger." said Jen.
Chris saw that Jen had her hair done and commented on it. "I love your hair." he said in his Christina voice. He sighed a little relief, at least Jen was next to him. She would help hm. She knew what was going on with Patrick's plan so he knew she wouldn't do anything that was permanent, at least he assumed all this.
"Hi sweetheart, I'm Molly, what beautiful facial features you have." said the technician as she put a floral smock aroudn his neck.
"Thank you" Chris replied in his Christina voice.
It was true, Not only was Chris a short male, he also had slight feminine features. He had been told this growing up but of course he had never done anything to highlight these features and bring out the woman in him, that was until now. This was one of the reasons that Michael knew that this plan would work, he knew Chris would be able to pass as a woman.
"I'm going to take care of those bushy brows. Do you know if you want a full arch, a medium arch or what?" She asked.
"Uhh, as little as possible" Chris said again as Christina but then he looked at Jen for a little help.
The technician got out some tweezers. "Ok, you want them on the thin side."
"Oh no, that's not what I meant." Chris thought. but the technician had already started on one side of his face.
"I think a beautiful,not too thin arched brow" Jen said. "Our little Christina has never had a full makeover and basiclaly lived a sheltered life in a bad relationship, so she needs to be as girly as possible to start enjoying her new life with her new fiance" Explained Jen. Jen thought the story that Stacy told her was true, so that's why she explained it. Chris sat there with his mouth opened wide wondering why Jen would say something like that.
Molly comforted Chris. "It's ok, honey. Everyone here knows about your abusive relationship that you went through and how you never had a day at the salon like this. So we're going to make sure your day is full of lots of pampering."
Chris couldn't believe his ears. "Why would Jen say something like that? " He thought. "I know she wants me to pass as a woman, so she must have come up with a backstory to help me along. Great, just great...next time she could have let me in" he thought.
Molly looked like she finished with one side and then started to tweeze the other side of the eyebrows. Chris thought again to himself. "Well at least she doesn't seem to be taking too much off, this won't be too bad."
After a few minutes Molly put the tweezers down and went over to another table and grabbed a container.
"Ok honey, Now that I've got them cleaned up a little, lets wax those suckers ." She said.
"OH NO!" thought Chris.
She started to coat around one of his eyebrows with the wax. She set a strip over it and pressed down firmly
"Now honey, this is going to be a little painful, but I promise once it's over we have one more to do and then I'll send you both out to have your hair washed and set.
Quickly she pulled the strip off. Chris jerked back in the chair and held in a scream. The pain was terrible, he couldn't understand how or why women would do this to themselves. But here he was amongst them, being treated just like any other woman and no one saw anything other than a woman.
He looked down and in Molly's hand was the strip and on the strip was a good portion of his eyebrow. He wondered how much remained above his eye.
"Chris, it's the price we pay to be beautiful" said Jen
Molly immediately started putting wax around his other eyebrow. "Ok, honey, I have to even them out, then a little more tweezing and I promise they will be.."
"Beautiful?" Chris interrupted and finished her sentence.
"Of course honey, we aim to please." She replied.
Again she laid a strip over the wax area above his brow, and pressed down.
"Ok honey, here we go."
Chris dug his fingernails into the arm of the salon chair and held tight. Immediately she pulled again on the remaining strip. Once again Chris jumpped in his seat, and leaned back, fighting the urge to scream bloody murder. He muffled his cries again.
But felt his eyes water as he closed them.
Once he opened them again, he again saw another strip containing most of his eyebrow hair.
"Oh, you are going to love these when I get through with them." Molly said as she once again grabbed the tweezers and worked on a few stray hairs.
Chris' eyebrows were worked on a little longer with the tweezers then Molly pulled over another side table which Chris notices had different makeup on it.
She coated his eyebrows with the mascara wand. Then she began to remove the floral smock around his neck. Jen was also just removing the apron around her neck. Jen was finished getting her hair and makeup done and only needed her nails done.
Molly placed a mirror in Chris' hands. Slowly Chris brought the mirror up to his face. His eyebrows were now nicely thin and slightly arched. He no longer had a male eyebrow, his eyebrows were unmistakenly female.
"They look wonderful" Jen commented. The two women were escorted into the next room. It was both for hair and nails.
Jen watched as the woman took Chris towards the hair washing area.
She was escorted to the nail technician and was seated. Immediately the woman started working on her hand.
Jen's phone rang, she looked at who it was and answered it quietly.
"Hi Stacy, what's up?" she asked into the phone.
Stacy on the other end excitedly asked her about Christina. " How's it going? What is she like?"
"Theyr'e giving her the star treatment, so the little princess is getting pampered. Did you find out any dirt on this chick, or what?" replied Jen.
"I'm still looking for stuff on her, but I did find out something interesting about Gwen, and it could work to your advantage...."explained Stacy.
"Well tell me, cause I have to bring this bitch down." Jen replied.
Well it turns out, ....

153111112221211.content:
Gwen was just finishing up her conversation with her husband on her cell phone. She still sat in the empty board room where the meeting had taken place which decided that she was going to work in Washington DC for a month and get their files transferred into their new system using a special scanning tool which made it a snap to load. She had been part of the development committee so she was one of four other employees chosen to go.
"It's a good oportunity and we're supposed to meet with President Obama during our stay to show them that our software is flawless. I know honey, but I'll probably be able to come back for a little while." explained Gwen on the phone to her husband.
It wasn't unheard of that Gwen traveled with her government job. She had always taken weekend trips paid for by the government to set up different cities with new file software. The longest she had been gone was a week in NY, but this was by far the longest.
"We are leaving day after tomorrow. Yes, I still have the dinner tonight with Michael's family and then tomorrow night, I'm all yours. Ok, babe, I love you too. I'll see you soon." Gwen said, and then hung up her phone.
Before putting the phone back into her purse, she checked the time, and then she check her text messages. She realized Chris still hadn't called her. "It's almost 4:15. Chris should be home from the salon by now. All he was getting done were nail extensions, a massage, and a facial." Gwen thought. She dialed his number again. It would be the 5th time that she would dial his number and the 5th time that his phone would go straight to Chris' voicemail.
"Damn Chris! What could be so important that you couldn't call me!", she said aloud.
Meanwhile across town.
Chris once again held a handheld mirror up to his face. He again glanced at his reflection and again didn't see the man that he once was. He had just finished getting his hair washed, colored and styled. The stylist had made his hair the lightest blonde color that Chris had ever seen. In fact the hair was now almost a white color. It was also styled into a women's cut that gave his hair a lot of body and waves. "Don't you just love it?" The stylist asked.
Chris again whimpered as he continued to stare into the mirror. "Oh yeah, it's really something." He replied not showing too much happiness. The stylist explained everything. We started off with a color change. We colored your hair and got rid of the dark blonde and decided to go with a beautiful platinum blonde color. We then gave your hair some volume, instead of just the ponytail look that you've had it in for so long. We kept it long but gave you a beautiful layered cut with heavy side swept long bangs.
Jen noticed Chris' unhappiness being that she was only sitting a few chairs away. She was getting her nails done. They were finishing up her second hand. "Why do you look upset" She thought to herself. A woman having a day of pampering should be a little happier than she has acted." she continued to stare at Chris. " Then when she was getting her eyebrows done, she shot me a look of death when I told the specialist about her abusive relationship. What is really going on here.?" She continued to put more and more pieces of the story together. "I will find out your secret Chris, I know Gwen is a part of it and my stupid brother." She continued.
The tv in the corner by the nail station was on the Ellen show but quickly went to commercial. " The Wayan's brothers star as two disgraced cops who go undercover as two white women in the comedy White Chicks, tonight on TBS, very funny"
"I will figure out your secret." Jen continued.
"Now lets get you back over to Molly so she can do your makeup" Said the hair stylist as she helped Chris once again to his feet.
Chris was in a daze and walked like he was in one too. This was getting to be too much. Chris frantically and nervously thought as he was led back to Molly's makeup station. Was he in too far? Sure it was a lot of money at stake, but after every chair he's visited at this salon, the more and more he was becomming a beautiful woman.
The more he thought about it, he put together a plan in his head. After tonights dinner with Michael's family he was going to have to do some serious transforming back into a guy. He would have to undo everything that was being done today. He figured he probably wouldn't see Michael's parents again until closer to the wedding so he would have enough time to convince Michael to tell his family that they were just going to elope. He couldn't stay in this charade for 6 months. This had to end.
Chris was once agian greeted by Molly who once again put the floral apron around Chris' neck.
Meanwhile back with Jen at the nail station. She picked up her phone as she was just finishing up.
"Hi Stacy, it's me." She said into the phone.
"HI, how's it going?" Stacy asked.
Jen gave a deep sigh. "It's driving me crazy because I know there's a scam going on here, I just can't prove anything. This girl is just too perfect. She's got the looks, the personality, and everyone loves her. But why would my brother wait to mention her right after the reading of our grandmother's will which leaves him her entire fortune if he gets married before 6 months. I have to bring my brother and his wench fiancee down! Did you find out anything? Jen angrilly spoke.
Stacy grabbed some papers that Jen heard through the phone. "I pulled up her file, but reading through everything, I just can't see anything about this woman that would scream SCAM! She's on the up and up Jen. You might just have to accept this." Explained Stacy.
Jen's phone rang at that moment. I have another call, I'll call you back.
"Hello? Dr. Jen Reynolds." She answered.
The other end of the phone was a familiar voice.
"Oh hi daddy! It's great to hear from you? Tonight? 7:30, Why? What's going on tonight?" She replied. On the other end of the phone her father was explaining the family get together tonight which was going to introduce Michael's fiancee Christina to the whole family. "Oh really? So you and mom have met her already. Well, I'll have to see if I can get off, I'm really swamped at work. I have a nose job to perform tonight so I will have to get back to you. She hung up abruptly on her father.
Steam shot from her ears. Now she was pissed.
One of the salon employees approached Jen after she hung up her phone. She held a department store shopping back in her hands. "Hi Dr. Reynolds?" The woman approached the doctor cautiously after overhearing her phone conversation. "I just wanted to give this to you." She continued as she handed the bag to Jen.
"what's this?" She said as she looked at the bag from the Dazzle Me store at the mall.
"Well the girls and I at the salon wanted to get this gift for Christina. It's a dinner dress and shoes for her for a nice night out. We guessed on the size. She did look to be about the same size and height as you, so we just went for it and bought her this. Could you make sure she gets it?" Jen said nothing.
Jen just looked at the bag and then up at the woman walking away.
Another hour passed and Jen sat in the waiting room watching the televison. It was just about 5:30 when Jen looked up and saw Christina approaching her. Still with an expressionless look on her face, Jen had to admit with her hair, makeup, and nails done, she looked absolutely beautiful.
Many of the salon staff gathered around to see her as she came out from the last station, the nail station. Her nails had french tips on the end and they looked gorgeous with the antique engagement ring on her finger. Her makeover was complete and she looked like a new woman.
Chris couldn't believe his day. He just wanted to get out of her as fast as he could. All he had to do was get out of the robe, put his other clothes back on and pay. The salon worker then explained that they all chipped in to buy her a dress for a special occasion. Jen put the bag in Chris' hands and Chris opened the bag and pulled out a beige sleevless lace dress.
His eyes opened wide as he stared at the garment. He had walked in here wearing women's jeans, but still he felt like they were just regular jeans, but now they expected him to wear a dress out of here. This is just getting crazy.
Under the dress were a low heeled shoe.
He didn't know how to react. He couldn't do this for much longer and now he had to parade out of the salon not only looking like a fasion model, but now he had to dress like one. "Thank you very much" Chris said as Christina.
"Can you help me get dressed Jen?" Asked Chris
Jen really hated this, she didn't like how buddy buddy Chris was with everyone, including her parents. Now she had to also pretend once again to be the friend of Gwens who knew all about Chris. She just wanted to punch her in the face at this point.
"Sure, lets go." Jen replied.
Jen and Chris both entered the dressing room where Chris went behind a screen and removed the robe he had on. Jen stood on the other side of the changing screen and watched Chris place the robe over the top of the screen.
"Ya know," Chris started in a whisper. "You could have backed me up a little out there" Chris continued.
Jen got a surprised look on her face. "Help you? With what? You had everything under control.:" Jen replied.
"I don't know what I'm doing, this is all new to me and you go and create that story about me being in an abused relationship? What did that have to do with anything? Hand me my panties, please." He reached out for the panties he wore into the salon. Jen put them in his hand. She bit her tongue because she didn't want to say or do anything wrong, but she still didn't understand what Chris was talking about. If he wasn't new to being treated girly and he wasn't in an abusive relationship then what was going on? What's the big secret? Chris came out from behind the screen and...

choices: I'm going to make sure my brother gets his beautiful bride to marry.
1531111122212111.content:
"Can you go through the bag with my jeans in it for me? Chris still spoke from behind the screen.
Jen sighed as she fished through his bag and found his jeans and tshirt balled up in the bag. She took the jeans out.
"Uh, I think the girls would like you to come out in the dress that they just bought for you, why do you want the jeans?" She asked.
"I don't want the jeans to wear, I just need those stupid breast forms inside the pant legs. I shoved them in there when I first got here. I didn't want the massuse to see them." Chris explained to a still clueless Jen.
"Breast forms?" She asked? She had her hand up a pant leg, and pulled out a foam imitation breast, just as Chris came from behind the changing screen into her view. He wore a pair of panties that Gwen had bought for him in his size and that's all he had on. Jen looked up at a shirtless Chris and finally realized what the big secret was.
"OH MY GOD!" She gasped.
Chris didn't know any better, Jen had just told him hours earlier that she was Gwen's girlfriend and she had been told the whole story by Gwen about the charade they were trying to pull off. So when she screamed, Chris jumped.
"What's wrong?" Chris asked. Jen stared at Chis in shock. In front of her stood a person with a woman's made up face and hair and but bellow the neck was all male. She realized that Chris stood there wondering what she was gasping about. She had told him that she was part of her brother's plan, so she didn't want to give away, at this point that she really didn't know he was a guy.
"OH, I swear I saw a spider." She covered.
Chris looked down around the floor for a spider but saw nothing. "It's such dim lighting in here, how can you see anything? He replied
He hooked the bra behind him, and then put his hand out as Jen put the fake breasts into his hand.
He carefully fit them into the cups of each bra and adjusted them to look the same size and level.
Jen walked over and helped him straighten them up. Inside she was filled with excitement as she finally knew what the plan was and how they were going to beat the requirements of grandma's will.
She took the new dress out of the bag and held it by the top for Chris to see. She unzipped it and handed it to him.
Chris looked great to Jen. Not only because he could easily pass as a woman, but because he was looking like he was hating every moment of it.
She watched him step into the sleeveless mini. After he was in, she turned him around and zippered him up. She again faced him towards her and again adjusted his breast forms. The dress had a low neckline, but they could still pull it off without showing any boobs. "I don't know how you girls do this." She said.
"Well, your'e doing great Chris." As she handed him the matching low heeled shoes.
Chris sighed and stepped into them, and tried to lean over to hook the strap into the buckle. "This is going to be embarrassing, Gwen had me try on a couple of dresses when she was giving me a crash course in womanhood, but we decided that I could just be a woman who perfered to wear jeans instead." Chris explained. "I feel so cold, it feels so drafty down there." He continued.
Jen figured that she better try and help boost his confidence, because otherwise he would give up this charade, and give up the money and Jen wouldn't have the oportunity to blackmail them all as she was plotting to do.
"Try not to think about it, and just think that you have the jeans on. Try not to focus on it being a dress on your body." She said.
"Easy for you to say, you've dressed like this your whole life. This is my first and hopefully last day dressing like this for awhile. At least until the fake wedding draws closer." Chris explained.
Jen's eyes grew wide. "No, you can't think like that Chris. If this is going to be believable, you have to really get into the part. Try and make it as believable as you possibly can." She said.
"Now you sound just like Gwen." Chris replied.
Jen smirked as she thought, "I've got to keep this plan going, so that I can get some money out of this deal too."
"Well, I agree with her, I think we should do anything posibble to make people feel and believe that you are the woman that Michael is going to marry. You can't show up for one family meet and greet and then disappear for 5 months. We have to make you confident with this so we can pull it off without any problems." Jen explained.
Chris made a whinning face "You look great, now lets pay and get out of here." Jen said.
As they walked out of the dressing room Jen felt something hard in the bag with his clothes. It was Chris' phone and the battery had come off the back. She quickly put it in her purse and followed Chris out to the salon area again.
Chris and Jen walked back up to the front counter. Chris learned fast to walk in a dress. He still felt a little weird that he was wearing it and that it was so cold. A group of the salon workers had gathered. They all clapped for Chris as he approached.
Chris turned really red in the face. Jen saw this and smiled.
Chris opened his purse and pulled out the credit card that Michael''s father had loaned him.
He handed it to the woman.
She looked at it and asked, "And who is Michael McCarthy Sr. to you?"
Jen turned and looked hearing her fathers name and realizing it was his credit card that was going to be paying for this.
"You've got to be kidding me." She thought.
"That's my father in law. He said the spa day was on him." Chris replied.
The woman smiled and swipped the card.
Jen put on a fake smile as Chris signed the recipt and took the card and recipt and put it in his purse.
"We're going to need to keep up on this look Christina so we're going to make you another appointment for a week from now. That way we can finish the electrolysis on your face and Molly had said she would like to zap some of your brow area, so that we can keep the shape their in permanently." The receptionist explained.
Chris heard this and still wondered what the heck electrolysis was? But just smiled and took the appointment card she handed him.
Jen walked with Chris to the door as she held his arm close and finally explained what electrolysis was.
They opened the door to the outside and Chris yelled.
"IT'S PERMANENT HAIR REMOVAL?" PERMANENT?? LIKE IT WON'T GROW BACK?" Chris yelled.
"Shhhh, keep your voice down, you're sounding like a guy.
Chris paced in front of the salon. He was freaking out over everything. He held the hem of his dress and looked down. "Oh my God! This is getting unbelievable! He tried to look at his reflection in the glass. He again was reminded by the glass reflection that his eyebrows were thin and arched and he wore makeup on his face. He also saw the inside of the salon and the girls were watching him have a fit.
"Walk with me." Jen said as she finally got Chris away from the window. "Too many people over there."
The pair walked a few buildings down and stood by Jen's car. "Look, it's not terrible that this happened. So what, you got some hair removed on your face. How much did you enjoy shaving everyday anyway."
Chris smiled a little "Yeah, I know.." He sighed. "I guess this is just getting a little too real." He replied.
"It's for a lot of money, right?" Jen replied.
"Yeah, it's about 15 Million" Chris replied.
Jen tried to keep her cool as she finally heard how much Chris would be getting from her grandmothers inheritence.
"Well then I think you should go into this full speed ahead. Lets do what's necessary to make this real. You have a lot of people here to help you, including me. Once everything is over, you go back to your old life and you'll be...." She swallowed hard. "15 million dollars richer." "Thanks Jen, I appreciate you going with me, It really was a strange experience but it was cool that you were there." Chris replied.
"No problem, hun. I'll see you soon." Jen hugged Chris and gave him the bag with his tshirt in it.
She watched Chris walk down the street until he turned the corner.
Once out of sight, she quickly took out her phone and dialed Stacy.
Stacy answered and all Jen said over and over was, "It's a guy! It's a guy!!" Stacy tried to control Jen and calm her down but Jen had wanted to scream those words for about the last half hour.
"I don't understand?" Stacy said over Jen's screams. Jen finallly got ahold of herself and explained, "The scam is that Gwen and Michael are helping their friend CHRIS to impersonate as the woman CHRISTINA, and be Michael's fiancee. They must have faked all that paperwork about Christina and are planning to have a wedding to fulfill the wishes of my grandmother's will. Once they are married, they get a divorce, Christina disappears and Chris appears as a wealthy friend of Micheals. They're all in on it."
Stacy gasped! "Gwen must have forged thos documents and made Christina a real girl, Oh my God, I finally got this girl and I can get her fired and take her job." Stacy started to get excited.
"You can't do that. We have to let them go through with this plan." Jen said.
"WHAT?" After all this and you're going to let them decieve the governement and a will that will give them an unbelievable inheritence?" Stacy couldn't believe what she was hearing.
"I have to let them, how else will we get our money?" Jen said.
Stacy was again confused. "Our money?"
"If we blow their cover now and bust them, we don't see any money. BUT, if we let them have this little charade and they go through with it, get the inheritence and then tell them that we're going to reveal to everyone what they did unless they hand over the inheritence to us. Then we will get everything. And all we have to do is keep quiet." Jen said.
"You are so evil" Stacy said. "But you're just going to let them have their little plan?
"I'm also going to help them." Jen continued.
"Help them? How?" Stacy asked.
1531111122212111.title: Jen saw that Chris was a guy.

choices: Lets finally introduce Christina to Michael's family
15311111222121111.content:
"You're going to transform him into a woman? He's not just going to let you do that to him willingly." Stacy replied.
"No, but with Gwen out of the picture for a month, it's going to be easier for me to call the shots. He trusts me a lot more after today's trip to the salon. I'll start off small, introducing more and more feminine things into his life, he'll have no choice but to go allong with it for the sake of the money of course. Then by the time of the wedding, he should be more woman than man anyway, and my brother can have a beautiful wedding ceremony as he gets married to his beautiful bride. Then when they're ready for payday, we blackmail them for the whole will" Jen explained.
"You are terrible" Stacy laughed.
"Oh my dear, you'll have a part in this little charade that I have to explain to you. Can you meet me at my office later? I have to head there now seeing that I took the whole afternoon off." Jen continued.
"I will. I'll be there once I leave here." Stacy replied. "See you soon." And then both her and Jen hung up.
Later, back at Chris and Michael's apartment. A stunned Michael stood over Chris who was sitting on the couch.
Michael paced behind him and kept glancing at his friend and roommate. Only he didn't see any trace in his friend or roommate any longer.
Sitting properly in the beige minidress. With one leg crossed over the other. Sat a gorgeous woman straight out of the salon. Her healed shoe bounced off the other leg rapidly. Both arms were crossed across a scooped neckline that showed minor clevage.
On top of her head was platnum blonde hair, and it looked full of volume as it hugged her neckline. The face was made up with light makeup and day colors. Her nails were adorned with french tips which looked beautiful with her engagement ring. Her lips outlined and a beautiful pink shade covered her lips. Her eyebrows were think and slightly arched, and two diamond studs in both ears.
Christina was her name.
"You said they're permanently arched that way?" asked Michael timidly. He knew Chris was livid and didn't want to set him off even more.
Chris looked straight ahead. "I was set up man. I was all set for whatever Gwen was going to have set up for me. Which she explained would be a massage, makeup and nails. It turned into this." He pointed to himself.
Michael walked to the fridge and got out two beers. He opened both of the twist off tops and handed one to Chris.
Chris saw the beer in front of him and he grabbed for it right away. He brought it to his painted lips and downed more than half the beer in 10 seconds.
Footsteps approached the door and suddenly someone was knocking on the door and slightly opening the door of their apartment.
"Hey guys, where's my girl? How did she do?" Gwen peaked into the apartment as she followed the door opening.
Gwen saw Michael standing and the back of a woman's head on the couch.
"Oh I'm sorry, I didn't know you had company. Is this a bad time?" She asked.
Chris immediately got off the couch. "A bad time?" He started to get loud. "A BAD TIME? Does this look like it's a bad time?" he continued to raise his voice as he got closer to Gwen.
Gwen's eyes opened as widely as they could as she reallized that the woman turned out to be Chris.
"Oh my God, Chris. You look amazing!" She replied to his rants. "Tell me everything they did? Did you ask for all this, or did they decide for you?"
Steam was coming out of Chris' ears as Gwen tried to make light of the situation that had transformed Chis into looking like this beautiful creature.
"Why would I ask for all this? Did you see my eyebrows? Did you notice how thin they are? Did you know I learned a new word today? ELECTROLYSIS!" Chris fumed as he flaired his arms as he spoke. He took another swig of his beer bottle.
"Oh my God, you had electrolysis done? That's brave." She replied as she took a closer look.
Michael just stood there taking little sips of his beer watching the two "females" go at it.
"I didn't know what electrolysis was, they don't explain it to you. They just think that a woman is going to know what that is, so they put it in a way that just sounds so normal." Chris explained and then changed his voice to a female's voice to impersonate one of the salon workers. "We're just going to clean up those eyebrows a little and then we'll zap your upper lip a little so we won't have any problems."
Gwen put on a conforting face. "I'm sorry I bailed on you Chris. I had my secretary make the appointment and I guess I told her that I wanted the salon girls to take good care of you." She explained.
"Yeah, they sure took good care of me alright." he added. "Molly the eyebrow collector really waxed the shit out of me."
Gwen chuckled as Chris glared at her.
"Well look, Michael upped your take in the will so this will make up for that.' Gwen explained.
"You're damn right it will." Chris took another swig of the beer.
"I have some documents from work." She sat at the couch and opened up a folder that she had under her arm.
Chris sat back down on the couch. Once again, both friends noticed how Chris sat properly as a woman.
"By the way, where did you get the mini dress?" She asked.
Chris scoffed,"The girls at the salon had heard that I was in an abusive relationship so they all pitched in for me. That's also why I got the "Special treatment". He added.
Gwen's eyes opened widely again. "Oh geez, I guess I may have mentioned something like that to my secretary and she must have explained that to the salon." Gwen explained.
Chris shot a look at her again. Michael interupted. "You said you have some documents?"
Gwen dug through her folder and pulled out a social security card, and a birth certificate. "These are yours and for the driver's licence we'll have to go down and have our picture taken. I have you set up for a renewal so you won't have to take the test again." Gwen explained.
Chris looked through the papers. It felt weird that this imaginary person had come to life and was now going to be him. He looked through everything and said, "I can't wait until this is all over." He said as he looked down at the birth certificate. "Wait a minute" he said.
He read the date on the line that read Date of Birth. His eyes grew! "YOU MADE ME 21 YEARS OLD?"
Gwen got an embarrassed look. "oh yeah, I meant to tell you that."
"How could you do that to me? How can I play younger? This is nothing but a nightmare!" Chris ranted again.
"I was trying to fill everything out but then I got distracted by my secretary and I mistakenly hit the wrong date. So now Christina is 21 years old." Gwen explained.
Chris covered his face. He couldn't believe how this started out as a little charade and was escalating into this extravagant hoax.
Chris put all the papers together on the lap of his dress, "Well, I was going to bring this up later, but I want to say this now. Tonight, we are telling your family at this dinner meet and greet that we are eloping. There isn't going to be a huge wedding! I'm not going to live like this for 6 months. I will get all glamoured up again when everyone meets us down at the city court house in six months from now and they watch us get....you know." Chris explained but couldn't come out and say married. "But I'm not doing this full time." He continued to try and look tough but still looked very feminine in the process.
Gwen said, "I think I'm going to agree with you."
Both guys turned their heads surprised by Gwen's reply. "What?" They said in unison.
"I just got the order from work that I am going to be shipped out to Washington DC for a month or longer, so there's no way we'd be able to keep up appearances and I wouldn't be there to coach you." She explained.
Chris listened intently. "Oh, I know your'e torn up about it babe." She said to Chris as she put her hand on his knee.
As far as the salon goes, the one treatment of electrolysis might have gotten some hairs, but you really have to go for a few more treatments for it to take full effect. The eyebrows will grow back in if they were just waxed. I think this is too much and I won't be able to be there for you."
The salon booked me another appointment, so I"m just going to blow it off?" Chris asked.
"You want to go?" Gwen asked
"No, but everyone was pretty cool, oh and Jen was a big help." Chris added.
The two just dismissed the Jen refference as a woman at the salon.
"Well, we'll get back in touch with them before the wedding and have this done again, meanwhile after tonight, you can get back into your jeans and smelly tshirts." She explained.
Chris smiled from ear to ear. This was a good plan. He would just have to get through the one night now passing as a woman and then starting tomorrow he was back to his old male self. Of course it would take awhile before his face returned to normal and his hair needed a good cut, but at least he didn't have to pretend anymore.
"When do you leave for Washington?" Michael asked Gwen.
"I leave tomorrow night, so my husband and I are going out for the day. Work gave me the whole day off, so I will not be around. So I guess this is goodbye for awhile guys." Gwen said.
But first....
15311111222121111.title: I'm going to make sure my brother gets his ...

choices: Hello, I'm looking for Michael McCarthy
153111112221211112.content:
The night of the party was here. Gwen, Chris and Michael all practiced how and what they were going to say for a couple of hours at their apartment. They got everything down pact, from the moment of arrival to kissing everyone goodnight.
Chris was trained some more in proper women posture, and speech. His smile and how happy he looked to everyone. That was the most important.
Another important features which wasn't covered that much the first outting, but really needed to shine here was chemistry. Chris and Michael both practiced how to stand together, hold each other and yes even kiss.
They weren't passionate kisses of course. They wanted this to be believable but not over the top make out sessions.
Micheal practiced how to peck close to Chris' lips so not to mess up Chris' makeup and how to have Chris' reaction to the kiss, like it was the best feeling and how Christina looked to be so much in love with Michael.
They decided to keep their hands locked for most of the time, that would show how close they are and also show to Michael's family that maybe Christina was a little shy.
They pulled up to the fancy restaurant and vallet held the door open for Michael who was wearing a nice suit. Another parking attendent opened Chris' door.
Chris slid his legs out of the car first and by that time Michael had come around to lend his hand and have Christina close to Micheal. Christina pulled her purse on her shoulder. They locked arms and walked to the door.
"God, this is so uncomfortable man." He whispered, but still smiled as he gripped Michael's arm. Micheal was bigger, more muscular and taller than Michael and at this moment Chris really felt smaller.
"Just keep walking, we're almost at the door." Michael whispered back.
"It just feels like a million peope are staring at me." Chris continued.
"It's all in your head man. You look just like a woman and that's exactly what everyone is looking at. You'll be fine once we get a few drinks."
Chris pulled open the door and released his arm around Chris' arm and let Chris enter the resturant first.
It was a beautiful steak house. Very fancy. It was close to their home but definitely not a place that they would stop at. It looked like a burger alone would cost $25. Chris became well aware of his heel clomping on the marble floor.
Right away Michael's father met them.
"Hello again you two." Michael Sr kissed Christina on the cheek and gave her a hug and shook Michael's hand. Christina opened her purse and returned Michael Sr's credit card as Christina thanked him for the day at the spa.
"You look so beautiful!" He commented.
"Everyone is here, we're just waiting for you. Gwen also just got here." He explained as they walked towards the back and into a low lighted aread. The area had a long table and at that table were about 25-30 people.
Chris was blown away, he couldn't believe that so many of MIchael's family came out for the meeting of Michael's fiancee. "He bashfully waved to the whole table.
Michael on the other hand dove right into the room and gave hugs to his aunts and uncles and cousins. He realized that he left Chris at the door opening but his father had already grabbed Christina's hand. He pulled her to the front of the table and clingged his fork onto his glass of water.
"Everyone! Please take a moment and help me introduce Michael's beautiful fiancee to the family. We've had a rough time lately with the passing of grandma, and it hasn't been an easy time for anyone. But once we learned about Michael's engagement we decided to turn this around and celebrate the newest family member. This future Mrs. McCarthy. Christina!!" He finished his toast.
The whole table clapped. Some women got up immediately and gave Chris hugs and looked at Chris' engagement ring., as did a lot of the guys.
Chris thought, "I guess Gwen was right to have the nails done because everyone's looking at the hand with the ring."
From that point on the night moved and Chris' head was spinning. He was introduced to a dozen aunts and uncles and then cousins. There was no way he was going to remember all thos names.
Michael kept him with a beer in his hand at all times. It helped, but Chris still watched how much he drank. He didn't want to get smashed and say or do anything stupid, so he stayed slightly buzzed.
Dinner also helped keep Chris' buzz to a minimum. He sat at the head of the table next to Michael and Gwen and seating next to Michael's parents.
After dinner seats were traded. Chris, Michael and Gwen basically sat in the same seats as others had made their way over to the couple for small talk.
Many relatives asked where Chris grew up and went to school and what she did. Chris thought, "It was good we talked about all this before we got here"
Gwen knew family would ask a lot of questions so they made a back story for Christina as far as what town, and school she attended.
Chris bartended some nights he hated it because the bar patrons really didn't tip the guys so well. They thought about it before hand and thought that was a fitting job for Christina also, so they just kept it the same.
All in all Michael's fiancee, Christina was a hit. The family did seem disappointed about the couple decision in getting married at the local courthouse, but everyone understood that the new couple didn't want to make a big deal out of things. Chris was the most glad. That meant his time as Christina would only be tonight and then in another 6 months. Then they would all be rich! The plan was going great!
The night was wearing down, many relatives had left and only a few remained. Chris was talking to Micheal's mother who was asking if she could at least come and visit to take her wedding gown shopping.
"Oh that would be lovely." Gwen added, adding a few more shots at Chris' already pain.
He shot her a look.
"Aw mom. Even though I would love that. Gwen is going to take good care of me as my Maid of Honor." Chris explained.
"I understand sweetheart." Michael's mother replied. She did seem disappointed about it.
Gwen saw this and interupted. "Well, how about as we're making a decision, we send you picture updates as she's trying on the dresses."
Chirs shot another look at Gwen "Yes, we'll do that for you mom.' Said Chris.
The night had come to an end and Chris thought, "The torture is over."
The two roommates unlocked the aprtment door and walked into their house.
They did a quick celebration dance but realized how tired they both were.
"I'm going to bed" Chris said. "This has been a long day, and I'd like to just forget everyting." He continued.
"Well man, I do appreciately you doing that for me. We're going to thave a lot of money once this is all over. Thank you again for doing this." He finished up.
"No problem man." Chris replied. "I hope we're sleeping in cause I'm not setting my alarm." Chris continued.
He walked into his room and shut the door.
He plopped on the bed, still in the mini dress and full face makeup.
"I'll just worry about it in the morning." He thought. "I'm really beat"
His mind raced a little but all in all he was happy that this was over. He passed the test. He could pass as a woman and they were going to be rich.
He closed his eyes and was out.
The phone was ringing in the house. Chris opened his eyes dazed and confused. He looked around for his phone but couldn't find it. He realized that it was the landline in the other room.
He groggilly dragged himself out of bed and into the other room. He passed the clock and noticing that it was 10 am.
He got to the phone and picked it up.
"Hello?"
153111112221211112.title: Lets finally introduce Christina to Michael'...

choices: Well then, I'll make you into the best bride this family has ever seen
We better get started on wedding plans
1531111122212111121.content:
Chris pulled his long hair back and put the phone up to his ear. In a raspy, broken up voice he said, "Hello?" into the receiver.
"Hello, I'm looking to speak with Michael McCarthy, is he at home?" The woman on the other end of the phone asked.
"Hang on" Chris replied as he cupped the phone, "Miiichael, phone." Chris couldn't believe how much his throat hurt. He grabbed at his throat. He thought back at the night before and how he talked in a high pitch all night and plus all the drinks, he much have hurt his vocal cords because now without really even trying, he sounded like Christina
He heard no reponse so he walked to Michael's bedroom door and pushed it open, but there was no one in there and his bed was made.
Chris spoke back into the phone, "He's not at home right now. Can I take a message" He couldn't believe how soft and feminine his voice was.
"Is this Michael's fiancee?" The woman on the phone asked.
Chris pulled the phone away from his ear and mouthed "OH SHIT" before finally regaining his composure and bringing the phone back to his lips to speak.
This time before he spoke, he cleared his throat the best that he could and sounded more pleasant.
"Why, yes it is. Who am I speaking with?" He asked in a still raspy but whispery female voice.
"This is Jill Parks I have been asigned to the estate settlement for Michael's grandmother Estelle, how are you today?" Jill asked in a confident one word sentence.
Chris tried to take in the information Jill had just given to him, "I'm fine, thanks. What is this concerning?"
"As I've said, I've been asigned to the case of Estelle's estate. I know the terms that were requested in the will and I know that they pertain to Michael and clearly you are his fiancee, so I am to assume that you and Michael are going forward to marry within the six month time frame and receive the full inheritance as stated in Michael's grandmother's will?" she asked.
Chris swallowed hard. Having all this thrown at him after waking up only minutes before, he had to think hard about this. He didn't want to mess this up.
"Yes, we are going to be married in about 5 1/2 months." He said.
He heard Jill write something on paper as she listened. "Ahh, ok, very good Can you please state your full name for me?" Jill again asked.
Chris replied slowly, "Christina Mullens."
"Excellent, now that will be in early July then I'm guessing? Beautiful backless gowns feel so wonderful in the summer heat, and is there a date set yet?" She continued.
Chris paniced. He didn't have a date set but he had to say something to this woman so that this would all seem believable to her.
"Yes, July 4th weekend." Chris painfully answered while freaking out around the room. He watched his dress fly about as he realized he was still wearing it.
"Very nice, ok." Jill replied.
Chris was getting a little frustrated and frankly to him it felt like the woman was harrassing him for information.
"I'm sorry, what is your job again? Why do you need this information?" Chris asked with a sort of attitude now.
"Ma'am, I have been asigned to see that all of Estelle's holdings go to it's rightful owner, this is an extremely large amount of money and before the full sum get handed over to Michael and yourself, we have to make sure that there is no wrong doing here and that everything is on the up and up. It is my job to see to it that this isn't a scam." explained Jill
Chris listened intently and got a chill after that was all explained.
He didn't say anything he was still processing everything.
"Sorry, Christina? Are you still there?" Jill asked.
Chris came out of his trance. "Yes, I'm sorry I'm here, I was making tea" Chris walked to the kitchen and banged the teapot on the sink to sound like he was doing just that.
Nothing phased Jill as she continued with her grilling. "Now Christina have you started on any wedding plans as of yet?"
Chris again paniced. "Well, we were starting and then we had Micheal's grandmother pass, and then we were going to start again once everything got back to normal, so we're just again starting." Chris explained.
"I'm sorry you had to stop, but it's exciting to be able to start again, and with that kind of time frame you're going to have to plan fast. Halls can get sold out fast, gowns will take time to hem, along with the bridesmade dresses, picking out a DJ, a photographer, it can all be such a whirlwind for a young bride like yourself. You should get a wedding planner." Jill explained all the while making Chris more panicky.
He felt like an elephant was sitting on his chest as she spoke. This woman was making him freak out but not letting him get a word in.
Finally he butted in. "Michael and I have decided that we are going to elope, so all this talk about halls, and bridemaids don't apply to us. We thought it would be less stressfull and then we were going to talk about starting a family." Chris explained feeling like he was really sticking it to this woman, Chris thought. "Who was she to call up and ask all about our lives and what exactly we were planning." He thought to himself.
"Oh dear, then am I to believe that you have decided NOT to get Estelle's full inheritence?" Jill asked surprised.
Chris was confused for a second, "Well I thought Michael would receive the full inheritence if he was married within 6 months and married for another 6 months after that." Chris continued.
"Oh that's not entirely true. Yes, you have to be married in 6 months and live together married for another 6 months, so the inheritence wouldn't actually be Michael's until about a year from now." Jill had repeated what Chris had stated to her.
"Ok?" Chris replied puzzled.
"But, the will states that the bride that Michael chooses has to have a planned wedding ceremoney, with most if not all of the family in attendance. WIth bridesmaids, First dances, pictures, and with a reception to foloow, finally at least a weekend getaway as husband and wife."Jill said.
Chris was in shock and stood holding the phone with a frozen expression.
"It says all that?" Chris asked
"Indeed Christina, it says a lot more. I'm going to make copies and then send them over by courier today. Once you receive them then we can make our plans." Jill said.
"make our plans?" Chris asked
"I'm going to have to be there and be a part of all this so that I can keep records of everything. Consider me, the wedding planner's wedding planner. I'll be in touch." Jill hung up the phone.
Chris stood in shock.
Over on Jill's end of the phone, she hung up the receiver, only it wasn't Jill. It was Stacy who had just called Chris and scared him to death. Jen was right next to her as they both had a good laugh.
They were in Jen's doctor's office making the call.
"You were perfect!" Jen said.
"Thanks, I think I really freaked him out." Stacy replied. "You sure we're going to have time to do this before Gwen comes back?"
"Gwen won't return for about a month if not longer, this is the last thinkg that's on her mind. As far as she knows Chris and Michael are going to elope so there's nothing for her to race back here for. Meanwhile, that will be just enough time to get Chris started on some wedding plans and his path into womanhood." She explained.
Stacy thought a minute. "But what if he's calling Gwen right now? Aren't you worried he'll explain things to her and we'll have no time for anything?"
Jen picked up Chris' phone that she had taken from his spa day. She turned it on and opened it to "Contacts" And then dialed "Home"
"That is why I'm going to call him now,"
Chris heard the home phone ring again. He hadn't moved much after hanging up, he was still trying to take the conversation he just had in.
He picked up the receiver and put it by his ear again. "Hello?" Again he spoke in a cherry female voice.
"Hey salon buddy! It's Jen!" She said as she looked at Stacy and gave her a thumb's up.
Chris went into panic mode again and talked in his regular, still raspy voice. "OH my God Jen, you'll never believe what just happened. I'm in such big trouble. I don't know what to do. I'm going to need some help."
"Slow down, what happened?" Jen said
"A woman from Michael's grandmother's estate called, I think she's a lawyer. She is going to make sure that we're doing nothing wrong and that we'll get married in accordance to the will. They want us to have a church wedding and dresses and the works!" Chris explained in a panic. "What am I going to do? You gotta help me!" He pleaded.
Jen covered the phone as Chris talked to keep from laughing.
Then she came back on the line and said...
1531111122212111121.title: Hello, I'm looking for Michael McCarthy

choices: We need to hire a wedding planner
We need to make another salon appointment
15311111222121111211.content:
"It's a good thing I found your phone at the salon and I guess I called at the right time." Jen said.
Chris finally looked at the caller ID on the phone and realized it was his phone calling the landline. "Oh thank God! I was wondering where my phone was." Chris continued.
"But now you've got to help me. Gwen is gone and you're my only hope. I don't know what to do. This woman from the estate wants to see a full wedding between a man and a woman and theres no way I'm going to be able to pull this off and were going to get busted and I'm going to go to jail, I don't want to go to jail." Chris started to babble in hysterics which sounded funnier because he had a high little whiny crackly voice at the moment.
"Calm down Chris, we're fine." Jen spoke over Chris while he continued rant. She finally raised her voice." CHRIS!"
Chris heard this and finally stopped long enough to hear Jen.
"Now, I'm going to say what I have to say and I'm going to explain it into two parts for you to understand. But you have to promise me that you will be calm. Will you be calm?" Jen asked.
Chris sighed and caught his breath as he began to breath normal again. "Yes, I'm calm, go ahead." He replied.
"Now this first part, we'll call this the good news" She started.
"Oh God, there's bad news?" Chris started again.
Jen sighed,"Chris, you promised." She waited until Chris relaxed again.
Chris was silent again. "Sorry" was his reply.
"Ok, the good news about this is that everything is fine, we're going to be fine. Right now, no one suspects anything, right? As far as this estate woman knows, Michael and his fiancee will be married in 6 months and then they will live together for another 6 months after the wedding as they already do and then they will receive the inheritance. There's nothing to worry about, we have all the paperwork that backs up Christina Mullens existence and so far there are no red flags for the estate people to question. Sounds good, right?" Jen explained trying to ease Chris' mind in the beginning and make it sound like there will be nothing to worry about.
Stacy listened to Jen talk to Chris and work her magic. She high fived her as she talked and a few times the two women tried to cover their laughter.
Jen put her hand up and made the "calm down" sign with her hands.
"Chris, are you still with me?" She asked.
Chris cleared his throat, "Yes."
"Ok, now the bad news." Jen started again. " Remember your plan of Christina disappering after Michael's family dinner and not reappearing for 6 months?"
"yeah?." Chris replied lightly into the phone.
"Well, that's not going to happen. Christina has to be in the picture and I'm afraid she has to be in the picture more than we planned." Jen said while smiling at Stacy.
"What do you mean?" Chris asked hesitantly.
Jen covered the phone trying not to reveal her big smile as she explained this to Chris. If she wanted to sell Chris on this, she had to show the emotion and conpassion and sympathy to what she was about to explain to him.
"Christina has to be a full time woman, ...you, are going to have to be...a full time woman for us to pull this off." She explained.
Chris looked down at his body still wearing the dress from the night before. "What are you saying?" Chris asked.
"We're going to have to make you a passable woman and hire a wedding planner. How much money do you have in savings?" jen asked.
"Uhh, I guess roughly $8,000." Chris replied.
"Good, we're going to need it. Just remember, anything you spend will be fine because when all this is over. You're looking a lot of millions." She continued.
"Why do we need the money." he asked.
"In order to pull this off, we need to make weekly salon appointments, a new female wardrobe, makeup, a wedding gown, a reception." She explained.
"Oh God!" was all Chris could say.
"Let me ask you this? Do you want to call this whole thing off now and walk away from this?" She asked.
Chris paused trying to think about the question. He knew they were already in this deep by starting this charade, the false papers and identity and him masquarading as a woman. He knew they already have gone pretty far, but he wasn't sure just how much further they should take this.
"Well now I'm starting to get scared. I haven't really thought about it until now and all this stuff you're talking about plus I'm going to be watched by some estate woman...I'm not sure I can do that." He replied.
"I need to know right now if we're going forward with this and make you a millionare or forget it all and get out while we can." She replied.
"Well, maybe I should talk to Michael." Chris replied nervously.
"No Chris, we need to figure this out right here and now if were going forward with this. We have a lot of work to do if we're doing this, and I"m going to have to make some phone calls to get us started. I need to know." She explained.
Chris went into panic mode and didn't know what to do, he paced as they talked and his mind raced. He passed by a mirror that was in the hall and saw that he was still in full Christina makeup and his hair with all the hairspray and products in it held together pretty good. He stared deeply at his reflection. "Be a woman full time?" He thought.
"I can't do this. I'm going to bow out now." He said quietly.
He explected Jen to give some kind of reply or maybe another discussion but stood in shock as Jen's only word was, "Ok." and then hung up the phone.
Stacy also was shocked that Jen did this. "Oh my God, what happened? He said no?"
"Yup." She replied smiling.
"Well that didn't go the way I thought it would. I thought you said we were going to be millionares." She replied.
Jen put the phone down on the table. "We will be." She said.
"But he quit. He's not going through with it, so that's it, isn't it?" Stacy asked.
Just then Chris' phone buzzed again. The caller ID showed that it was Michael's home number which meant that it was Chris calling back.
Jen put her finger up for Stacy to be quiet and she answered the phone.
"Hello, Christina's phone" Stacy giggled a little as Jen cupped the phone hopping Chris didn't hear her.
"Hi Jen." Chris said lightly. He sighed.
"What exactly do we have to do?
Jen smiled, "I'm so glad you called back Chris, everything is going to be alright." Jen replied trying to sound sympathetic to the situation. "This is what he have to do."
