153111112221211112111.content:
Jen and Stacy were still at Jen's office finalizing their plans. Stacy was going to dress formal with buisness suit and all and appear to be the estate lawyer Jill Parks. She was going to make a surprise visit at Michael's and Chris' house later tonight. Jen was trying to prove to Chris that he had to always stay in his feminine role as Christina Mullens and this was a good way to do that.
"I'll talk to you later." Stacy said as she walked to the office door and walked out of the building.

Jill was by the main reception desk and was approached by one of the other doctors that were in her practice.
"Hi Jen. It looks like we have a full bill today. Mrs. Farrow is coming in for her nose job you have her scheduled on your roster for 2 pm. The first of our transgender women will be coming by to start on her hormone recplacement treatment, I can take care of that. Dr. Mack also has a transgender woman on her roster who was supposed to get her throat shave and vocal surgery might not have it done so soon because she is performing this week and wants to look her best. Not sure what that means, but, ok" The doctor explained.
"Oh that's right." Jen replied looking at the time. It was only 12 so she had some time to run her errands.
"I am going to run out and pick up some things for a friend. I will be back in time for Mrs. Farrow, but if she does come early and I'm not back yet, just have one of the nurses prep her and get her numb. I should be here shortly after." Jen explained.
"Ok" Said the other doctor as Jen walked out of the building.

As she made it to her car and reached in her purse for her car keys, she felt Chris' cell phone buzzing. She looked down at the caller ID and saw that it was Michael.

She quickly grabbed some tissues that were in her purse and wadded them up. She put them over the reciever and answered the call.
In a muffled deep voice she only said, "yeah?"
Michale laughed on the other end, "Dude, did I wake you?"
Again she spoke muffled, "yeah"
"Aww, man I'm sorry. I guess after last nights performance you've earned a good nights sleep, and now we don't have to worry about your disguise for another 6 months. I just wanted to tell you that I went with my parents to my grandmother's house. My mom wanted to go through some things in the attic and get the house straightened. I'm going to take the rest of the week of my berevement leave from work and help them out. I should be back later this week.
Jen's eyes widened, and she put one arm in the air in triumph.
"Uh huh" She muffled into the phone again.
"See ya buddy" and then Michael hung up.
Jen unlocked the car door of her Lexus and started it up. She thought, "This is going so much better than planned."
She dialed Michael and Chris' apartment number.
It rang a few times until Chris finally answered in a nasaly, raspy voice."Hi Jen."
"Hi Christina." Jen jabbed at Chris.
"Ha ha" He replied.
"Did you take a shower yet, wait...why do you sound nasaly?" She asked.
"I don't know, since I started doing the Christina voice it's really been sore a lot more and now I think my alergies are acting up." Chris explained.
"Well that sucks, ok just come to my office downtown at around 2ish and I'll take care of you. RIght now, I'm going out to buy you a few wardrobes." She said.
"I fogot you were a doctor. Hey, but why do I need a few wardrobes?" Chris whinned.
"Because silly, a woman can't be seen in the same outfit a few days in a row. You're going to need a bigger wardrobe. I'll spring for the first few and shoes, but you or MIchael are going to have to buy the rest."
Chris sighed in the phone.
"Ughh, this is going to be so expensive." Chris again whinned.
"Well, sweetheart, get used to it cause Christina needs a lot of stuff." Jen replied "Now did you shower?"
Chris looked down at his body which was covered by a towel along with another towel wrapped around his head. "Yeah I just got out." he said.
"Ok, dress in the same jeans and blouse like you did that day of the salon and then come down to my office around 2, then wait for me while I finish up a patient and then we have an appointment with a friend of mine." She said.
"What kind of appointment/" Chris asked
"Well, as it turns out..you and Michael are really late with wedding plans, so a friend of mine has agreed to help you get caught up to where you're supposed to be on your wedding checklist with only 6 months left." She explained.
Jen could hear Chris sighn on the phone again. "Look just be at my office by 2 ok and we'll take it from there."
"Ok, I'll see you then" He replied.
"And remember, work on your voice." She replied as she smiled and hung up the phone.
Chris hung up the phone and went back into the bathroom.
He removed the towel off of his head and let his platinum blonde dyed hair fall to his shoulders. He blew his hair dry and combed through it as he did. It was really easy to do. After he got it somewhat dry he pulled his hair back and tied it in a high ponytail.
He looked in the mirror at his hair and face. With the work that they did at the salon, his eyebrows thinned and high dyed, without makeup he still had a woman's face.
Below his neck though he was still male.
"Well, I better get a move on." He said as he picked up a bra that was on the bathroom counter and put it on. Inside the bra cups he put two of his socks. He undid the towel that was tucked and held around his waist and let it fall. He then did as Gwen showed him and "concealed" his penis. He pulled it between his legs and then took some padding that Gwen has given him and placed it over his penis. He ripped off a piece of medical tape and taped the padding between his legs.
Next he pulled up the pair of panties that Gwen left him. They matched the bra which was a plain white style.
He finished getting dressed by buttoning the blouse and then pulling up the pair of women's jeans. Now not only was his face looking female, his body was matching.
He slipped on a pair of sandals that were by the bathroom counter.
He looked in the mirror and sighed. "Six more months of this."
He looked down at the bathroom counter and saw all the makeup that was there. He started on his face, just like Gwen had shown him.
After about 45 minutes, once again Christina Mullens' reflection stared back to Chris.
Chris stood there and looked at himself. He couldn't believe the perdicament he was in. He was going to be stuck like this for the next 6 months. He did have to admit, even though he had no desire to be a woman. He sure did make a convincing one. He even laughed at how he looked at himself from different angles in the mirror, just like a woman.
He practiced saying his name in his female voice.
"Christina Mullens, Christina. Hi, I'm Christina. Hi I'm Michael's wife Chrisina." He held out his engagement ring and long nails to the mirror,"Yes, we just got engaged. We're getting married in 6 months." He repeated the same dialog over and over again.
After awhile he got bored with that, and sat and watched a little bit of tv. Time just wasn't moving that fast and when he looked, he realized he still had over an hour to go before he was meeting Jen.
"God I'm bored" he thought. "I gotta get out of here."
Seeing that Jen's office was just downtown near the salon where they worked on him, he could walk. He had nothing else to do so he decided to leave now even though Jen still wouldn't arrive there for another hour.
He locked the apartment and walked onto the sidewalk.
He put a little sway in his walk like he was shown. He did feel more confident being in jeans than in a dress. It just felt better because he was used to the jeans and the dress was so foreign to him.
After about a 10 minute walk he reached the doctor's office where Jen worked.
He walked in and saw the reception area. He picked up a Woman's Day magazine on a rack off the wall and sat down with it. He crossed his legs like a woman and flipped through.
The receptionist looked out into the waiting area and saw Jen, just as one of the doctor's noticed Chris too.
"Who's that out there?"
The receptionist took another look at the woman in the reception area,"Well, it isn't Mrs. Farrow so it has to be...
153111112221211112111.title: We need to hire a wedding planner

1531111122212111121111.content:
The receptionist slid open the waiting room window and peeked out. "Hi, can I help you?" she asked in a sweet voice.
Chris looked up from his magazine and said in his Christina voice. "HI, Dr. Jen told me to meet her here, I'm a little early though. I was a little hesitant to come early, but I'll just sit here and read some magazines until she gets here. She's got something she was going to give me, a shot maybe." Christina explained.
The receptionist smiled and the Dr who was listening in the back butted in and poked her head through the window.
"Actually sweetheart, you're with me today. I'm going to start you on your shots. You can come on back." she said.
Chris put the magazine back on the rack, and hesitantly made his way to the back room.
He followed the Dr to one of the rooms.
As they entered, she patted the top of the examination table and told Chris to have a seat.
Chris sat down, but still very nervous. "Are you sure this is ok? Jen told me she would take care of me." He spoke in his Christina voice.
The doctor smiled at Chris. "You have nothing to worry about, Jen told us all about you and that you were coming."
"Everything? So you know?....you know about me?, Chris asked.
The doctor smiled again. "Yes, we know." She continued to talk as she prepared some things on a table. She had a file chart opened too." I have to say, you do make a very convincing woman."
Chris was kind of relieved that he didn't really have to keep up the womanly mannerisms, but at the same time he was also a little pissed that Jen had told some people that she works with. "I don't want everyone to know" He thought.
The doctor turned around and faced Chris. "Can you remove your clothes please and put on the gown right here? I'll be right back."
She said as she left the examination room.
Chris raised an eyebrow and thought this was kind of weird. "Why am I getting undressed and in an examination gown for an allergy shot? Dr's do everything the hard way." He thought to himself.
He sighed and once again undressed. He placed everything neatly in a pile next to him and then he put on the green surgical gown. The back was open but he tied it shut and sat back down on the examination table.
He stared at everything around the room. He saw the typical Dr office things. There were syringes, tongue depressers and all sorts of Dr things. One big syringe stood out. It was the one she was getting ready while talking to him. She had placed it on top of the file that she walked into the room with.
"I wonder if that's my file." He thought. "But why would I have a file?" He leaned off the examination table a little to see if he could see the name on the file, but just as he was looking, the Dr reentered the room.
"That's great!" the doctor saw that Chris put the surgical gown on and was again seated. She picked up the file and pen and stood in front of Chris.
"Now, have you taken anything else? This is your first shot, correct?" She asked.
Chris nodded and spoke in his male raspy voice. "Yes, I'm not on any pills."
She wrote down on the file.
"..and you're health has been good?" She asked.
Chris nodded again, "Yes."
"..and are you a smoker?
"No, I'm not." Chris replied.
The Dr grabbed a tongue depressor and asked Chris to open his mouth. "Your throat is very red, and you sound like its scratchy. You haven't had any work done, to your throat or vocal cords, have you?
Chris thought that was a weird question, but did put his hands up to his throat. "My throat is really sore and scratchy, I think it's from a mix of perfecting my female voice and a mix of alergies acting up."
The Dr again wrote into the file. "DR Mack's patient was a no call/no show today, I can have him look at your throat, see if he can take care of the problem, then you wouldn't strain your vocal cords anymore and everything would sound natural." The Dr explained.
Chris thought about it, "He could make it so it wouldn't hurt anymore making the voice?"
The Dr nodded again. "Yes, the whole prceedure would take a few hours and then you'd have a day or two of minimal pain. After that, you would sound wonderful."
Chris again thought out loud. "That would be great to not have this pain everytime I made the voice, but I really don't think I have time today. Can I make an appointment for another day?" He asked.
"Definitely. You're going to have to come back for more checkup and another shot. I can schedule you again and maybe we can kill two birds with one stone." She explained.
"That would be great!" Chris replied.
The doctor continued asking Chris more questions, some were a little strange he thought. Then she got into a full blown conversation about feeling better after the shots and how he would probably mellow out and he might feel a little sick at first. She comforted him and told him it was all normal. She brought up changes in his body but at this point Chris was tired of hearing about some stupid allergy shot and finally she closed the folder and set it back down. Chris saw that it was about an hour later.
"Ok, the nurse will be here in a few moments, and she'll give you the shot." She held out her hand and shook Chris. "It was a pleasure meeting you, I'll have your medication perscription and next appointment card ready for you at reception. I'll see you soon, and congratulations!" She said as she walked out of the examination room.
Chris again made a puzzled face. "This is the strangest doctor's office I've ever seen." He mimiced the doctor. "Congratulations! Congratulations on your allergy shot! Happy allegy shot" He continued to mock until he made himself laugh.
The examination door opened again and in walked a middle aged woman in a floral top. She was the nurse who was probably going to give him the shot.
She smiled and said, "Hi"
SHe walked right over to the table and looked at the chart. She picked up the syringe and took the cap off of the needle.
"Could you stand up and then lift the gown up and bend over please?" She asked.
Chris did as she asked. He faced the wall and hiked up the surgical gown so that his rear was facing her.
The nurse took the needle and plunged it into Chris' hip and pushed the contents of the needle into him.
"There we go, you can get dressed now and you should be feeling better right away." The nurse said as she took his file and the needle and walked out again.
"Damn" Chris thought. He wanted to see what the Dr was writing in the file. He was hoping she would leave it. Chris started to get dressed.
Meanwhile out in the reception area Jen walked through the door and up to the receptionist.
"Hi, did Mrs. Farrow come in?" Jen asked.
The receptionist nodded, "She is here and waiting for you in your main office." She replied.
"Oh good, thank you.", She started towards the back and she ran into the doctor that just took care of Chris.
"Hi Jen, did you get your errends taken care of?" She asked.
"I did. Did any of our transgender patients come in?" Jen asked.
"Yes, I just finished with her. She is a beautiful woman already, and I gave her the first shot of her female hormones. I can't wait to see her body develop. I'm just getting her perscription ready and I'm sending her on her way. Mrs. Farrow is in your office waiting for you to start." She explained.
Thats great!" Jen said as she entered her office.
Just as she closed the door, Chris opened the door of his examination room and walked out dressed again in his female jeans and blouse.
He walked to the receptionist and she gave him his perscription. It had a lot of scribbled things on it that Chris couldn't make out and an appointment card which was for next week.
"Thank you" Chris said and then sat back in the waiting room..
Chris realized he didn't have his purse and Jen had made it a point to him to look as passable as possible and he knew she would critique him for forgetting it.
He left the Dr office and started walking back home.
Walking down the street he seemed to feel al ittle better. He could breath a little better, but that wasn't really it, he felt happier for some reason.
He was a little tired thought.
A few minutes later he reached his apartment and unlocked the door. He walked in and saw the purse Gwen had given him. and picked it up.
He looked at the clock and saw that he still had a little time before he met Jen, so he was going to sit for awhile.
He turned the tv on and sat on the couch. He took off his sandals and curled up on the couch. His hip was really sore from the shot, he thought.
The next thing he knew, he fell asleep.
He knew this because he was being woken up by someone knocking on the door. He was startled but got up.
He remembered his female voice and got to the door. "Who is it?" Christina asked....

15311111222121111211112.content:
"Christina, it's Jen, open up." Jen said through the door.
Chris unlocked the door and opened the door for his friend.
Jen walked in with a two handfuls of bags and she plopped them onto the couch. "What did you do, fall asleep?" She asked.
"Uhh, yeah I did"said Chris as he realized that he got up too fast. Along with the shot today, he was in a little pain.
Jen fished through her purse and pulled out Chris' cell phone.
"Here's your phone. Oh and there was a message from MIchael that he is staying with his parents at his grandmother's house for the week, he should be home towards the end of the week." Jen explained as she immediately began going through the bags that she brought over.
"Does he know what's going on with the esate woman? Or me dressing as Christina full time?" Chris asked.
"No, cause he only left a message. Look, he'll find out soon enough. We've got everything under control here, I don't want him to panic." Jen explained trying to not have Chris call her brother about this.
She quickly changed the subject back to the women's clothes. "I kind of went overboard on some of the stuff, but it was just too good of a deal to pass up. I ended up getting you 10 pairs of underware. Both bras and panties.
"Damn! That's a lot of underware." Chris was shocked by the number that Jen had bought.
"You can never have enough panties." Jen replied.
Chris rolled his eyes while Jen through something silky at Chris. This is for nighttime.
Chris held the garment up to his body and saw that it was a purple satin nightgown. Holding it up, he saw that it only reached down to his knees.
"It looks so small." Chris stated.
"Well it's to wear to bed, so there really shouldn't be too much to it." Jen replied.
"To bed?" Why would I have to dress up going to bed?" Chris asked puzzled.
Jen stopped unloading the shopping bags and looked at Chris.
"Chris, we've gone through this before. Our whole conversation the other night. Didn't you take any of that in? You have to play the part of a female for the next year. You never konw who is looking, or watching. Especially nosey lawyers who want to bust you on fraud and send you to jail." Jen threw that last line in to scare Chris a little.
Chris' eyes did widen when she said that. He just put the garment in the pile with the rest of the clothes.
Jen continued." OK, I ended up getting you 8 outfits, skirts and blouses, 2 dinner dresses, 1 mini dress. I got you 5 pairs of shoes. 2 are sandals, 2 heeled, and 1 pair of ladies sneekers. I got you 3 different purses. 1 is formal, the other two just to carry everyday stuff." Jen just continued to unload these never ending bags. She took out makeup cases, jewelry, ladies sunglasses, scrunchies for the hair, nail poish, perfume. Chris couldn't believe how much Jen bought.
Jen pulled a garment out and held it up to Chris' body frame. "This I absolutely love, we need to start using it everyday if we want to see any results. It's a corset. It's going to give your body that hourglass look. It's the real deal, not like those plastic insert ones. This one could really shape your body. In fact I want you to start on it tonight under your outfit."
Chris looked at it. He's seen pictures of corsets before but it was definitely his first time holding one, let alone going to be wearing one. "Oh man, I'm gonna hate this, it's so heavy!." he said.
He looked over the piles of clothes and woman's accessories thrown all over the couch. "This must have cost a fortune. I can't afford all this." Chris' response was.
Jen grinded her teeth. She knew once this whole thing was over. Both Chris and her brother were going to be millionares. She thought to herself, "Oh you can afford this."
But said out loud, "Just pay me back once you get the inheritence." She replied.
Chris was still in awe of all the stuff but was quickly brought back with Jen rushing him.
She picked up a pair of panties and matching bra and grabbed a skirt and a top and handed it to him. "Comon, you gotta get changed, we have to go see my girlfriend. She's going to be your wedding planner, and she said we've got a lot of work to do." Jen explained.
Chris was still a little tired and sore and made a whiny face and voice. "I don't wanna change again. Can't I just wear what I have on?"
Jen gave Chris a look, "Chris the whole neighborhood has seen that outfit twice within a days time. I think we're burning it after today. Lets get you in that corset.
Jen had Chris strip and reluctantly he did right there. Jen put the corset around his waist and Chris stood there feeling foolish.
"This thing is really hot and heavy Jen, do I have to wear it." Chris whinned.
"Oh God yes, better get used to it cause it's going to be worn everyday. Now hold still.
Jen began to tighten the laces in the back. Chris could feel it constrict his breathing and he was really uncomfortable.
"Jen, I can't do this, you gotta take it of." Chris said cringing for air.
"If it's tight it means it's working. I need to get it a little tighter.
Jen pulled the laces even tighter as Chris moved his body around to fit the position that Jen was placing it in with this thing on. His back was arched and because of the pain, Chris walked on his tip toes. His chest was pushed out and it did look like he had breasts up top.
"Almost there." Jen said still pulling and tightening.
Chris was just about to bust and finally Jen was satisfied that the corset was tight enough.
"OH MY GOD!" Was all Chris could get out. "I can't function in this." He screamed.
Jen noticed how Chris complained about the corset but also realized that he moved with a little more poise while he was tight inside the corset. She noticed how Chris stood on his tip toes because of the pain. She had an idea.
"Hold still a minute. She dug through the pile of clothes and came to the boxes of shoes, she opened the boxes until she got to the pair that she wanted. Jen pulled out a pair of navy blue high heels and walked up to Chris' feet. Stop into these.
Chris could barely look down but Jen guided his feet into the heels and tightened the strap across his foot. WIth the corset on and the hight heels she saw, that he was shapely and looked amazing.
"See how your hips look shapely and your chest sticks out. You have a beautiful figure with this on. I think we lost a few inches. I'm changing my mind with outfits, you're wearing the dress tongiht" Jen explained as she handed Chris a matching navy blue dress and pushed him towards the bathroom.
Chris angrilly grabbed the dress that Jen had handed to him and went into the bathroom.
Jen sat on the couch and took out her Iphone. She glanced to see if Chris was coming and she quickly sent a text to Stacy.
"Are you coming over, as Jill?" She sent
About two minutes later Stacy sent a reply text. "I'm parking the car now."
Jen smiled
"Jill" the estate woman would accompany them to the wedding planner and Chris will freak out even more with how girly I'm going to make him and this wedding." Jen thougth to herself.
Jen text back, "Come to the door in exactly 10 minutes and knock." "OK" Stacy text back.
Jen got up and got a wine glass, she went to the fridge and poured herself a glass.
She called into Chris, "How are we doing Christina?"
From the bathroom Chris once again whinned. "I can't breath Jen."
"You have to adjust your breathing in the corset, you'll get used to it. Just put the dress on and come out." Jen said.
A few minutes later Chris walked out of the bathroom.
Jen couldn't believe her eyes.
Chris' features, made him a beautiful woman , but now he had the body of a godess too. He had a beautiful hourglass figure thanks to the corset and it added to the illusion. She would train Chris body with the corset so that he would have a beautiful figure permanently by the time he put on a wedding gown.
Just then there was a knock on the door. Both Chris and Jen froze.
Chris spoke in his womanly voice. "Yes? Who's there." He said through the door.
The voice on the other side of the door said, "It's Jill Parks from the estate of Estelle." Stacy answered as Jill.
Chris' eyes grew with fear. "OH MY GOD!" He mouthed to Jen.
Jen acted scared also.
Jen grabbed Chris' hands and whispered for him to relax.
Chris couldn't breath as it was in this corset but now with the added pressure of Jill at the door, he was mess.
Jen quickly scooped most of the clothes up on the couch and put them back in the bags as she went along. She ran into the other room. When she came back in to grab some more clothes, she saw Chris still standing there. "Well answer the door already." She said.
Chris popped out of his trance just as Jen grabbed the last of the clothes and ran into the other room. Chris opened the door.
On the other side was Stacy. She was dressed in a woman's buisness suit. She had on a pin and said her name, but in this case the pin read "Jill"
Stacy extended her hand and shook Chris' hand.
"Hi, I"m Jill Parks and you must be the lovely bride to be Christina." Stacy explained.
Chris shook her hand and put on his female voice, and said, "Pleased to meet you."
Jen entered the room and immediately shook Stacy/Jill's hand "Hi, Dr. Jen Reynolds. Nice to meet you. I hear you're going to tag along with these wedding plans so that everything is on the up and up, right." Jen said
"Yes, I have to make sure that Christina and Chris are happilly married and not put up to do this, or forced into a marriage that they didn't want." Stacy/Jill explained.
Jen smiled, "Well I"ve known these two for awhile now and they are very happy together. As a matter of fact, we're on our way to the wedding planners buisness right now if you would like to join us." Jen said.
"I would like that a lot," Stacy/Jill said. Chris's eyes went into shock as her heard that Jill was coming with them.
"God help me" Chris thought to himself as he grabbed his purse off the kitchen counter and walked out the door.
15311111222121111211112.title: It's me, Jen!

choices: We have to go get your driver's license
We have to open Christina Mullen's a checking account
153111112221211112111121.content:
Jen and Jill had sat at a table for 2 and 1/2 hours already. Christina started out sitting between the two women, but soon after had decided on standing.
On top of the table were piles of pamphlets, and brochures and catalogs of different things a bride needed for DREAM WEDDING. As a matter of fact, that happened to be the name of the company that was going to plan Christina and Michael's wedding.
In front of the two women were patterns of table clothes, napkins, sitting on top of catalogs of local restraunts and halls that had wedding packages, next to those were catalogs of bridal gowns and tuxedos, and pamphlets for local bands or DJ's for wedding, and so on and so on and it just looked like a never ending pile of papers.
The wedding planner was an older woman maybe in her late 40's. She just returned from the back room with even more brochures.
She saw Christina standing behind Jen and Jill at the table. She noticed Christina's eyes were huge and she was bitting on her long French tip nail.
"Darling, you shouldn't bite on such beautiful nails. You look so nervous. Why don't you come sit with the other women." The wedding planner asked?
Jen and Jill turned around in their chairs and stared at Christina.
It was true, Chris was in a trance because of the whirlwind of wedding activity in front of him. It was a lot to take in and it felt to him like he was having a nervous breakdown. It wasn't a random person's bridal wedding that was being planned. It was his bridal wedding that was being planned. It hit him all at once that he was going to be a bride.
Two other reasons caused Chris to not sit down. One was the shot he received in his hip earlier and the other reason was the corset that was constricting his breathing.
"I'm good." Christina replied.
Jen turned back around to the table. "I think we have everything just about picked out anyway." She held up a restaraunt brochure for Christina to see. "This is where we're having your reception."
Chris got a quick glimpse at the restaraunt before Jen pulled it away and held up another brochure.
"These are your wedding invitations"
Again Chris blinked and Jen had pulled the invitation sample away.
She continued to rush through things that she had picked out for Christina's wedding. Chris was thankful though because he didn't really know patterns or anything about planning a wedding.
The wedding planner had taken all the brochure's and pamphlets from Jen after she had shown Chris and placed them into a big binder.
Once she showed Chris everything, the final brochure was placed into the binder.
"I will keep this binder here for you and you can come in and look at it anytime you need to. We are up to date and the only thing we have to plan now is making an appointment to try on wedding gowns." The planer said.
Chris' eyes bulged out like they did a lot lately. "Already?" He said out loud.
Everyone turned to look at Christina.
"Well my darling, you do need to know what you will be walking down the aisle in. We will need to have it fitted and then maybe resized depending on how much your weight fluxuates in 5 months." The wedding planner explained.
Jen tried to cover up what Christina blurted out.
"What she means is that, we are in the process of getting Christina down a few sizes so she thought she had more time to fit into a gown." Jen said.
"Oh darling, like I said we can make adjustments to the gown up to weeks before the wedding. It is my job to have everything perfect, and you, my dear are going to be a beautiful bride." The wedding planner said as she put her arms near Christina's waist.
"Now what days are good for you my dear? The planner asked and once again Chris had a blank look on his face. Inside his head, he was freaking out.
Jen again stepped in for damage control.
"Well, we are planning on another salon trip to get a facial peel, Christina has some waxing she needs to get done and I would like to have her hair styled up for our day of trying on the wedding gowns. I would say, maybe this Friday?" Jen looked to Chris for assurance, but Chris was no help.
The wedding planner wrote down the date and Christina and Jen's name on her appointment book and planned to meet them at the bridal gown boutique on Friday.
"Very good then, the last thing I need from you my dear is your signiture here." The planner said as she produced a contract for Christina to sign.
Chris moved the best he could over to the table. He took small steps but it looked like he was just walking sexy. His back was stright his chest and rear stuck out of the tight dress. He looked over the contract and signed it at the bottom, Christina Mullens.
THe planner looked at the signiture and put took the copy off the back of the contract and put it into Christina's binder.
"Ok, I will need a check on Friday for half of the money so please make the check out to "Dream Wedding."
Chris snapped out of his trance long enough to hear about the price. "And what exactly is half?" Christina asked in a little voice.
"Well we sitll aren't sure about number of guests, and this isn't including the bridal party which you haven't given me yet. Also not included is your wedding gown, brides maids dresses and tuxedos. Half of what we have now is...$7500" The wedding planner explained.
"Wait, my whole wedding is going to cost $15,000?" Chris replied in shock
"If not more, lilke I said I didn't add in the gowns or tuxes." The planner said.
Chris was just about to have a heart attack, Jen grabbed her arm and pulled her toward the door. "We'll have half the money on Friday, we'll see you at the bridal boutique then."
Jill followed the two out the door.
The ride home was pretty quiet and Chris just spent most of the time staring out the window.
THey finally pulled into Chris' driveway and the 3 women exited the car.
RIght away Jill wrote something on a piece of paper that she had pulled out of her purse. What Chris couldn't see was that Stacy was only scribbling lines on the blank paper. Jen and Stacy had practiced this because they knew Chris was gong to be too freaked out to plan a wedding so everything was going according to plan. Jen going along with the plan said, "Is there a problem Miss Parks?"
Stacy replied, "Well I'm just notiing the activity the went on today and I'm making a note about how Miss Mullens seemed distant and not interested in the planning of her own wedding."
Chris spoke up as Christina, "That's not true? I'm just overwhelmed. I'm excitied about everything."
"You do have a funny way of showing it. Christina, in order for me to report back to the board a good report that everything is legit and you are a happy bride, you have to appear as a happy bride. Otherwise I will assume to believe that this wedding is a farce, and a sham. Michael will get no inheritence and we will investigate further to see if any fraud has taken place and perhaps some jail sentencing." Jill explained.
Jen and Christina both listented intently and had their mouths open.
"I can assure you Miss Parks that I am in this wedding both body and soul. There's no need for investigation. I'm just really tired and out of it, but I promise that I will be in better spirits on Friday for the dresses." Chris really turned it on with hopes of proving to the estate lawyer that this engagement was legit.
"I hope so, but I'm not going to see you Friday next, I am going to the salon appointment with you both." Jill replied.
Jen smiled. "Absolutely, we will be at the place on main on Wednesday. We will see you then." Jen said.
Jill turned and got into her car and drove off.
Chris and Jen walked up to the apartment and went inside. Chris threw his purse on the table as Jen noticed some mail on the floor from the mail slot. She picked it up and looked at it.
Chris sighed."Oh man, this is really a lot. Everytime something new happens I can't help but freak out." Chris explained.
"It's really showing too." Jen replied.
Chris got defensive. "I can't help it, I've never pretended to be a woman before and I've never planned a wedding. Everything we do, and everything we talk about and once I actually start processing it in my head, I freak out. I mean, Michael and I are really going to have a wedding ceremony and be "Married" in a church in front of his family and friends and it's really freaking me out!"
"Well, there's a lot of money riding on your performance, so you have to turn it up and play the part of a happy bride or they'll be no money and possibly some jail time. I will pick you up something that will calm you down. I'll bring it over tomorrow, now let me help you out of that dress and into your nightgown." Jen explained.
Chris and Jen both removed the dress and Chris turned around. He stood there as he kicked off the heels.
Jen started putting the nightgown over Chris' head.
"W-Wait, what about the corset?" Chris asked.
"No way, that's staying on." Jen replied.
Chris freaked out. "I can't sleep in this." He stated.
"You're going to have to get used to it. You will, I promise. By mid week you'll be alright." Jen replied.
Chris took a big breath in, "yeah, there's no way I can sleep in this."
Jen laughed, "Well it's not coming off."
Chris tried pulling at it but he couldn't do at and was too tired.
Jen put the nightgown over his head and fed it down to his knees. She walked with Chris to the edge of his bed and then pushed him slightly backwards.
Chris collapsed and scooted up to the pillows. He thought, there was no way he could convince Jen to let him take it off, so why try. Plus he was tired. He had a rough day and he swore that shot really irritated his hip. He felt weird all over but he thought it was just the allergy medicine working.
"Get some sleep, we have some things to do in the afternoon."
"What things?" Chris replied.
Jen held up a letter addressed to Christina Mullens...
153111112221211112111121.title: The 3 women went to try wedding gowns on...

choices: Go get his new stronger perscription filled
1531111122212111121111211.content:
Chris walked out of his bedroom in a liight blue babydoll nightie. He walked into the kitchen and poured some water into the teapot and placed it on the stovetop and turned the burner on.
He grabbed two pieces of bread and slid them into the toaster and pulled the lever down. He lifted up and sat on a barstool that was in his kitchen at the countertop. It had just been common for him to sit ladylike lately and that's exactly how he sat. He crossed one leg over on top of the other.
On the counter in front of where he sat was his purse. He opened it and pulled out a hair scrunchie. He pulled his long hair back into a ponytail and put the scrunchie in it.
He took a mini calendar and noted that today was Wednesday, today was his salon day. He looked back at the previous days that passed and saw what a busy week he's already had. One day said "Driver's License", Saturday, Jen and the wedding planner spent the whole day mailing out the wedding invitations to Michael's friends and family, he skipped to Friday, which of course was his appointment at the wedding gown boutique. That was the day Chris was really dreading.
He put the calendar down and took out his women's wallet that he recently purchased on a shopping trip and opened it up. One lone card sat behind the plastic . It was a driver's license. He chuckled a little while he examined the card like he had done so many days now since he's had it. The name said Christina Mullens Sex: F Height: 5' 6", Age: 21. The picture was of a beautiful platinum blonde staring straight ahead into the camera with a blank look in her eyes and a slight smirk on her madeup face. Chris could hardly believe the picture was of him. In fact a lot had happened since Gwen and Michael both disappeared and boy did he have a lot to tell them. He knew they'd be in shock at how feminine he looked so fast.
This is exactly where he said he didn't want to be, living his daily life as a woman. But now he was trapped, as long as Jill Parks was in the picture and she seemed like she was going to stick around for awhile.
His toast popped up and he got off the stool and grabbed a paper plate. He put both pieces of toast on the plate and got some butter out of the refrigerator. As he closed the refrigerator door he saw his outline in the refrigerator and was once again reminded of the corset on his body. His waist was small and his chest stuck out.
Chris sighed, grabbed a knife and buttered his toast he heard the tea pot start to whistle. He grabbed a mug out of the cabinet and turned the stove top off and got a tea bag from off the counter. He poured his tea, and brought both his mug and plate over to the barstool and again sat down.
He hadn't had much of an appitite lately, he thought as he bit into the buttered toast. Even though he was starting to get used to it, the corset definitely constricted his stomach. Plus Jen wanted him to eat light up to the wedding gown day so he would look good when he tried them on.
Chris had just taken a sip of his tea which burned his tounge a little when he started to sneeze. First only once, then 2 more back to back.
He grabbed from a tissue and held it up to his nose. Then again 2 more times.
He once again reached into his purse and dug around until he found the perscription bottle that he had gotten filled earlier in the week. He popped the top and took out 2 pills. He popped the two pills in his mouth and swallowed them hard. They got stuck without having a water chaser but he got them down.
He sneezed again 3 times. "Oh man, these stupid alergy pills are useless." He said to himself.
Only it wasn't alergy pills that Chris had been taking . It was actually a female hormone that was perscribed to him. The doctor at Jen's office had mistaken him for another transgender patient and unknown to him had him in transition to becoming female.
He was about to make an even bigger mistake as he grabbed the phone and dialed Jen's office.
"Good morning, Dr. Reynold's office." answered the receptionist.
Chris disguised his voice as Christina because he wasn't exactly sure who knew his secret at her office. He knew Jen did and the doctor who saw him last week, but to be safe he kept up the ruse.
"Hi, I was in late last week, to see Dr Reynolds, but she wasn't there and you and another doctor spoke to me, and then that Dr. saw me. I don't remember what her name was." Christina started to explain.
The receptionist thought for a minute. "Oh right, the blonde. You saw Dr. Cox." She replied.
"Oh great I didn't remember her name, anyway she gave me a perscription but I really think I'm going to need a higher dosage. Also she had mentioned to me about having something done to my throat, I would like to schedule that too. Would it be possible to see Dr. Cox this morning if I come now?" Chris added in a cute almost pleading voice.
The receptionist paused then said, "I don't see anyone on Dr. Cox's schedule until 10, the other doctor's are off today so if you come now she can fit you in." She explained.
"That's great! I'm going to get dressed quickly and I'll be right over." Chris said as he hung up.
At the Dr's office Dr Cox approached the receptionist. "Was that a cancellation?" She asked.
"No, actually our transgender friend is coming back, she says she needs a higher dosage of pills and would like to set up an appointment to have a tracheal shave." The receptionist explained.
"Oh that's great, and I think she also inquired about her vocal cords being worked on if I recall." Dr. Cox replied.
Meanwhile, Chris had thrown on a pair of jeans and a low cut women's tee. The corset made it look like she had nice breasts with this top on. He didn't really do his makeup much just a little lipstick. He was still meeting Jen and Jill at the salon at noon and he knew they would wash his hair and do his makeup there. He grabbed his purse and was out the door.
Close to 15 minutes after making the Dr appointment, Chris arrived at the office.
He was greeted by the receptionist again.
Chris didn't wait long as Dr. Cox opened the door and told Chris to come back to the examination room. Dr Cox once again led him down the hall with a file folder in her hand.
They ended up in the same room he was in last time. He again was told to undress put the gown on and sit on the table.
Dr Cox left the room briefly while Chris did this and minutes later came back into the room.
Chris had the gown on but he had kept the corset on because he couldn't take it of himself.
Dr Cox with pen in hand and file open asked, "May I ask what name you are going by as of now?"
Chris fished for his wallet in his purse and took out his new driver's license. "Christina Mullens" he answered.
Dr. Cox looked at the llicense and smiled. "You pass so well, it's hard to believe that you weren't born a woman."
Chris made a sour face, "Thanks..I think."
Dr. Cox looked up from the file. "I didn't mean to offend, I hope I didn't upset you. I know what you're going through and passing as a woman isn't an easy task." She explained.
"Oh no, I didn't take offense, but it does seem to be getting easier each day." Chris explained.
Dr Cox handed the license back to Chris and looked up from her file. "What can I do for you today?"
"It's those pills doc, I need a stronger dosage." Chris said.
"Well it has only been about a week since you've been on them, you should give them a chance to work." The dr explained.
"I know, I guess I just want results right away. WIth that, and the sore throat I've been having. I feel sore and itchy on my chest, ughh, I'm just a mess." Chris replied.
Dr Cox dug through the drawers of the desk and pulled out a body tape measure.
She noticed the corset. "Oh, you're doing some corset shaping too? That's probably the soreness. I can give you some cream that you can rub on the sore areas at night." She said as she got behind Chris and started to unlace his corset.
Minutes later Chris breathed a heavy sigh of relief as once again he could breath as the corset was removed.
The doctor wrapped the tape measure around Chris' chest and then wrote the number in his file. He then wrapped the tape meaure around Chris' waist and wrote the number in his file.
After writing down some more things she continued writing on a piece of paper and said, "Your body is progressing along. I think I could give you a stronger perscription. But you have to take the dosage that it says, don't take anymore." She explained as she handed him a perscription.
Chris looked at the perscription paper again, but it was all scribble to him.
"Now as far as quick fixes, there are some cosmetic things we can help you with. WIth the nose we can have some work done on it." She explained.
Chris listened to her say that and immediately thought she was talking about a deviated septum. He would love to have that done to his nose, he thought.
Only while he thought about that he failed to hear Dr. Cox explain how they could make his nose smaller and turned upwards and he immidiately said he wanted that operation done.
"Ok, I could make an appointment for you. I also hear that you wanted the throat worked on. It's still bothering you?" She asked.
"Definitely, I think making the female voice has really irritated it, Ahh, to be natural again, that would be perfect." Chris explained not even realizing the doctor thought that Chris wanted his vocal cords worked on to sound like a natural woman.
"We can definitely schedule that. Of course results vary with it. But it would probably hurt for about a day or two and then the pain would be gone." She said meaning that once his throat was shaved the healing process wasn't long
"Sign me up!" Chris said as he pulled out his small calandar from his purse. The Dr made his appointment for the throat first and scheduled him for next Saturday. Then she put him down for his nose work.
After the appointment Chris decided he had enough time before the salon day to...
1531111122212111121111211.title: We have to go get your driver's license

choices: Lets do our second round of treatments.
Let's get those eyebrows nice and thin
15311111222121111211112112.content:
Chris was just getting home from the pharmacy. He had gotten the perscription filled and wanted to get started on this dosage right away before he started another sneezing fit.
He poured a cup of water and popped the top off the perscription bottle. He produced two large pills in his hand and swallowed them with the water chaser.
He heard the door start to open, and quidkly tossed the perscription bottle into his purse. He knew it was Jen but he didn't want her to know that he was going to her office behind her back for help with his allergy. "Morning doll face." She said as she entered the apartment.
Quickly he shot Jen a look and greeted her with a pleasant but fake "Morning." back.
She noticed that the corset was next to his purse and that he was already dressed.
"You took it off?" Jen questioned.
"Oh, I took it off just now. I did sleep in it so don't get your panties all in a bunch." He replied.
"I hope so" Jen said as she grabbed it again and straightened it up, brushing some hairs off of it. "Lets get you relaced and ready for our appointment."
Chris took off his tshirt and threw it to the couch. Jen looked at Chris' chest and saw a slight puffiness. "It must be really cinching his chest" She gigled to herself. "I'll have to make it tighter" She thought.
Chris again made a face. As he turned around after Jen wrapped the corset around his slim body. She began tightning the laces and really pulled hard. Chris was already used to this routine as Jen has done this just about everyday for him since she bought it.
He still threw in his remarks "THAT'S ENOUGH JEN" as she pulled the laces tight.
Once again he felt everything constrict as she pulled and laced harder. He held on to the countertop for dear life and air as Jen squeezed his body to it's limits.
Finally satisfied, Jen finished and had Chris turn around. His body had a perfect hourglass shape. Now get dressed and lets head over to the salon. You won't need any makeup cause they'll take care of that."
Chris was putting his shirt back over his head which was harder with the corset on.
"What am I having worked on today." Chris asked.
"Well, we have to definitely get your hair styled today. I want them to put it up for Friday's wedding gown day. But I want to see a few styles before we pick one."She explained, while she picked up the piece of cold toast on the plate and took a bite.
"more than one style?" Chris whinned.
"Yes my dear, I want to see a few styles. But think of it this way, with Jill there seeing you try a few hairstyles, that will probably satisfy her and detour her away from any feelings that you aren't into this whole wedding planning." Jen replied.
Chris still made a face as he went into the bedroom to grab his sandals. He continued to talk from in there.
"Well, can we please stay away form Molly's station today? I don't want any more electrolysis done. If they remove anymore hair from my face permanently, I'll never look like a man again once this is all over." Chris explained.
Jen smiled from the other room "Ok, we'll stay away from Molly." Jen knew that wouldn't happen but she wasn't going to tell Chris everything that she had in store for him today.
"Don't forget your check book." Jen called into the other room.
That was another thing Jen had Chris do on Monday, she went with him to open a checking account in Christina Mullens name. He first withdrew all the money he had in his "Chris" account, then they went to another bank and deposited it all into Christina Mullens name. This way he could pay for things using the bank card he was given or write a check.
Chris hated how everything that was his was converting into Christina's life. Chris hoped that things were only this hectic and spotlighted on Christina up until the wedding. Once the wedding was over, he could somewhat get his life as Chris back and would only have to dress as a woman again for special occasions, like on Thanksgiving or next Christmas. Then after 6 months of living together, they could announce a divorce but not until Michael gets that big 'ol paycheck from his grandmother's esate.
"That's what it was all about" Thought Chris.
Chris came out of his bedroom with his check book in hand. He slipped it into his purse, grabbed his keys and locked the door.
The two women made their way down to the mainstreet and only minutes later walked up to the Salon entrance.
Sitting in the waiting area inside Jen immediately noticed Stacy. She gave her a smirk as Stacy got up and greeted the two women.
"Hello miss Parks." Chris said in his Christina voice.
"Oh please Christina, call me Jill." Stacy replied.
Christina couldn't stand Jill but he knew he had to keep things pleasant and play the part of a happy bride.
The three women approached the receptionist. Jen spoke, "Hi, we have an appointment for 3.
The receptionist remembered Christina and smiled at her, "Hello again. You look so beautiful today, we're going to take good care of you." She explained.
Chris got a little red in the face "Thanks" He spoke in his womanly voice.
The 3 women were led into a changing room and we're each given a robe with sandals, and a bag to hold their clothes and purses.
It took the women minutes to change and all appeared again in their fluffy robes and sandals on their feet.
They were next led to a room with 4 examination tables. They were told to lay down and they were going to start thier European deep cleansing facial, which also included an extraction, facial massage cleansing and ending with a nourishing mask.
After they lay down, 3 salon specialists got right to work. "Just close your eyes and relax" The woman whispered into Chris' ear.
He did so and she was right, it was very relaxing. It didn't hurt and he was just glad that it wasn't the skin zapping that was happening to him. He felt really good and was about 1/2 hour into the treatment when the woman who was working on him tapped his shoulder.
Chris opened his eyes and saw the woman put her finger to her lips and make the "shhh" motion. He looked over at Jen and Jill and saw that they had the masks covering their faces, but Chris didn't get that part. The woman helped him off his exam table and led him out of the room.
"There's nothing wrong" The facial specialist said. "I just didn't want to apply a mask to you because I was told to send you to the teeth whitening station. " She explained.
Chris was at first scared but the relieved that he was just going to go to the next station. At least things were moving along here. He just wanted this day to end. Unlike real women, he didn't want a day of pampering, and hair done, and facials. He would rather watch the playoffs at home which were still going on.
The woman led Chris to a salon style chair and after he sat, the woman reclined it back. She then filled up a cup with mouthwash and told Chris to rinse and spit.
Chris did like he was told. Just like the dentist. The woman opened his mouth and looked at his teeth. "They already look great, but we'll get them white, shiny and beautiful with your smile." She said.
THe woman prepared something behind Chris while he continued to rinse his mouth and spit. Minutes later the woman appeared in front of Chris with a mouth guard that was covered with the whitening solution.
Carefully she placed the guard into his mouth and aligned it on his top and bottom teeth, slowly she had Chris close his mouth.
"Now bite down, don't open your mouth and don't move your jaw. Actually don't move your head."
Chris sat there for a few minutes wondering how long he would have to keep this in his mouth and keep still. The specialist was preparing something else behind Chris but approached with a tv remote. "I'm sorry, this might be awhile, but I don't want you to be bored." She said as she turned on the tv that was in the upper corner by the ceiling.
Chris remained still, he only moved his eyes when she turned the tv on and he started watching a talk show that was on.
Moments later the specialist appeared before Chris again, she had on a surgical mask, and gloves. She sat on a stool next to him and wheeled over a little tray that was out of Chris' view. Chris' eyes widened and he made a face.
"Just relax darling" The specialist said as she took a needle and injected it into Chris' bottom lip. Chris flinched a little as he didn't expect the prick in his mouth.
She stood up and again did some stuff out of his view.
Chris tried to turn and face her but couldn't. Instead he just made a moaning voice so she would look.
A few minutes passed and the specialist came back over into view, "Oh good, you should be feeling numb now."
She sat back down and grabbed another needle. Before Chris could grunt or squirm, she had injected the needle into Chris' lips. She repeated the prcess a few time. A few tears rolled down Chris' face.
"What the hell!" He thought to himself.
Minutes later the specialist got up again. "Ok, your collegen lip injections are finished. The filler I used should keep them beautiful and plump, but we'll have to keep up treatments." She said as she walked out the door.
Chris couldn't believe what just happened. "Collegen Lip Injections? How the hell did that just happen? I'm going to have Angelina Jolie mouth. This can't get much worse.
Chris heard the specialist come back into the room, only it wasn't the specialist that just injected his lips. It was the electroysis specialist from last visit. She wheeled over her tray.

Stacy and Jen sat under the hairdryers for the past half hour. They watched a soap opera that
was on one of the many tv's that lined the room.
It had been a few hours since they've been there. They had their European facial's done but Jen just realized that it was the last time she saw Chris.
She was sure they would cross paths after the got their nails done, then again maybe after their hair wasing, makeup applied? but here they were having their hair dried and they haven't run into Chris once.
"I wonder if he left" Jen thought as she looked around the room of hairdryers.
Jen looked at Stacy. After a minute Stacy looked at her and worded a puzzled "What?" to Jen.
Jen looked around, and then worded back to Stacy, "Where's Chris?" She asked
Stacy shrugged her shoulders.
Jen's hair specialist walked over and checked the time on Jen and Jill's dryers and turned them off and lifted them off their head.
"Jen you'll be with our stylist Stephanie and Jill you'll be with Rebecca." The specialist said.
"Can you do me a favor? Do you know what happened to the third woman that was with us. Christina? We haven't seen her and we're hoping that she was still here." Jen asked.
The specialist stopped walking and turned around. She looked around the room and spotted Christina under a hair dryer in the far corner. she pointed, "She's over there. She asked for a private dryer away from everyone, said she had some thinking to do."
"Can we have a few minutes." Jen asked the woman.
SHe nodded and walked away.
Jen and Jill looked to where the woman pointed but still didn't see Christina. They saw one woman in the corner. She was in a white robe like they were. As they walked closer, they saw her hands sticking out from under the robe's arms. Long pink nails sat on her fingertips and her toes were painted the same color.
Her face was beautiful and smooth. Her makeup was flawless. Light foundation, a soft pink lipstick rested on her thick plump lips. Her lashes long and curled and just a dusting of eyeshadow above them. The eyebrows were soft and thin and neatly arched.
"Oh my God Christina!" Jen said as the women approached their friend.
Christina looked up from her dryer and noticed the two women. She had a panic look on her face and looked like she wanted to cry, but put on a happy smile when she saw Jill.
"Hi girls!" He said as Christina.
"You look amazing! What did you do different?" Jill asked.
Chris swallowed hard and looked up again. "They injected lip colligen into my lips to make them plump." Chris replied and he had a hard time saying it.
"Oh my God, your lips look fantastic. They look a little swollen but I'm sure that will go down a little in a day or so." Jill expressed.
Chris continued, "Then.." He paused and tried to regain his composure. "Then they did another treatment of electrolysis on my lips, chin, cheeks and" Another short pause and swallow..."brows."
"They permanently arched your brows? See that's the way to go, then you don't have to worry about stray hairs or unwanted growth. Well, they did a wonderful job, and you look amazing." Jill continued.
Jen tried to hide a smile with her hand and then asked Jill if she could talk to Christina for a few minutes.
Jill walked off to find her stylist and get her hair finished.
Jen leaned over and sat in the salon chair next to Chris' hairdryer.
"Well, at least you won't have to worry about shaving." Jen tried to make light of the subject at hand.
Chris shot her a look of death. "How do I go back to being a guy with these arches? They permanently thinned them to this!" Chris exclaimed as he pointed to his face.
Just as Chris' meltdown came to an end, another hair specialist came over and turned off Chris' hairdryer.
"Ok, doll. You're finished. Now I understand that we're doing a few bridal hairstyles today?" She asked.
Chris who was ready to go home, was about to say that except Jen spoke first.
"Yes, that would be great!" Jen said.
Chris shot another look of death to Jen and the two women followed the specilist to the stylng chairs.
Jen pulled back a little and leaned in to talk to Chris again, "You better put on a happy face for Jill, I think she's taking notes."
Chris rolled his eyes but saw Jill already in a stylists chair and put on a big smile as he walked up.
The two women were seated in a stylists chair and Jen's stylist approached and began working on her hair.
Chris sat and waited for a few more minutes when his stylist finally walked up. She walked up with two other women.
The first woman spoke,"Hello and welcome to my salon. I am Jackie. We have heard about you Christina from your last visit here. Everyone fell in love with you and your story of hardship and we couldn't wait for you to come back. We wrote in to TLC channel " Bridal Makeover" and told them all about you and your abusive relationship and how you fought your way back. THey were very interested with your story and wanted to be a part of your upcoming wedding. They would love to follow you for a few months and film your wedding preparations and just get all the emotions of a happy bride in a loving relationship with a man she loves. Is that something you think you would like?" The owner asked.
Chris sat there with his eyes widened and thought, "You've got to be kidding me"
The woman from TLC cut in and said, "We will pay for anything that we film. Like today's salon treatment. We filmed some of your spa day. Like when you were under the dryer in the corner away from everyone and you had tears of happiness roll down your cheeks. That was touching. Our viewers are going to love that. We added those special treatments to your spa day, the teeth whitening, eleyctrolysis, and colligen in your lips to make you feel like a woman should feel. A woman that never had the chance to experience these feelings because she was always verbally abused. We want to get moments like that. We already spoke to your girlfriend Jen here, and she tells us that you are trying on Wedding Gowns on Friday. We would love to pay for your gown. Then we hear your fiance returns from a trip this weekend. We would love to capture the reunion and treat the both of you to a romantic evening.
Chris couldn't believe what was happening. He didn't want to be on a tv show dressed like this. What if someone saw him and recognized him. He couldn't get married on tv in front of millions of viewers. He had to tell them no.
"But I'm not getting married for 6 months." Chris said.
The producer explained. "We understand that. We will cut and splice it all together. Once we piece all this together it'll look like it was all a months time before the wedding."
Jen jumped in and said, "This is all so wonderful. My girl is still a little in shock with all the attention and how nice everyone has been, but we think this is great."
CHris turned and couldn't believe Jen just did that.. But before he could say anything the woman from TLC waved to the entrance of the salon and the camera crew of the show walked over, along with a man.
The producer once again explained. "You my dear are in for a treat. We have in our salon just for you, the famous hair stylist Armando. He is here for you to make your hair beautiful." The owner of the salon explained. "Now, if everyone will take thier places, we'll start with Armando approaching Christina's chair, and Christina remember to look excited and surprised. Ready, in 3, 2, 1 and action." she said.
Chris just sat there as the camera crew got in their places and then Armondo approched Chris' chair.
"Hello Christina, I'm Armondo. I'm here to make your hair beautiful for your wedding day." He explained.
CHristina smiled a big fake smile but a tear fell down his cheek at the same time.
The producer gave Chris a thumbs up she thought that was perfect for the show.
"Lets try a few styles and then you and your friends could tell me what you would like." Armondo explained and then got to work on Chris' hair.
He took his time and explained everything he was doing as he did it.. He would put the hair up or to the side. He would do it all up to a certain sytle which took a lot of time, then film it. Then wash it again and style it in another style. They did this 4 times altogether when they finally decided on the 2nd style Armando had done. So once they washed his hair this last time, they restyled it into a beautiful updo. One that Armando explained could hold the bridal vail well.
It was about 6 hours later when they finally filmed Chris expression of seeing his hair and getting a great reaction.
Finally the producer yelled "CUT" and finally wrapped things up.
Chris was exahusted, and so were the other girls. They spent the whole day there with only one hour and a half break for a lunch.
They ordered salads for the girls but Chris was a little too upset to eat, so he only picked at his.
He was now more tired than anything.
The girls all took their clothes and changed in the dressing rooms then they walked back into the receptionist area.
The producer was true to her word. She paid for Chris and his friends salon bill.
They thanked them and then said they would see them on Friday.
Jill also said her goodbyes and told Christina that she had a better day than the other day.
"Ill write that in my report." Jill said. "I'll see you two on Friday also." SHe said as she walked away to her car.
Chris and Jen again walked back to Chris' apartment Chris didn't say much as he couldn't believe the day's evenets. There was nothing really to say. Jen was bursting inside. She knew Chris was pissed and she knew he had every right but this was just too good.
They got to the apartment and Chris unlocked the apartment door.
The mail was once again on the floor and Jen picked it up again.
Chris threw his purse on the table and then collapsed on the couch.
"Oh my God!" Jen said shocked while looking at the mail.
"what's wrong" Chris asked.

Chris opened his eyes, he realized that he had fallen asleep on the couch.
He saw a big blanket on top of him. He sat up and looked at the clock.
The clock read 2 pm.
"2 pm? on Thursday? Did I really sleep that long?" Chris thought out loud. "Hello?" He called out into the apartment.
He pulled the blanket off of him and he was wearing a peach colored nightie. Under the nightie he was again tightened into the corset. "Why don't I remember changing?" He thought to himself.
He tried to remember back to the night before but he just couldn't. He relaly had to pee though.
He got up and went into the bathrom. He opened the lid of the toilet and started to pee.
The mirror was facing him and he was quickly reminded of what he looked like. He immediately thought that If anyone had walked in on him right now, they would see that a woman was peeing standing up.
His hair was still styled up and as he put one arm up to it, he felt how stiff with hairspray his hair was. He saw how thin and arched his brows were, and then remembered the electrolysis that was done on them to permanently keep them that way.
As he flushed the toilet he washed his hands and looked at his long pink nails and then looked at the engagement ring on his finger.
Then a memory triggered in his brain. "Oh no! The TLC show!" He thought as he started to get chest pains. "I gotta put a stop to that." He thought. He remembered that he freaked out about that last night and then Jen had given him a pill to take. That must have knocked him out.
"Oh, right..my pills. " He thought as he ran for his purse and opened his perscription bottle. He took out two large pills and poured himself some water and downed his daily estrogen.
In Chris' mind he thought the pills were allergy medicine and he thought they were working because he wasn't sneezing or having any sniffles.
Chris put the perscription bottle back into his purse and saw a note on the counter. He read it to himself.
"Hey Christina,
I had to run to work and get a few things out of the way. On my way home I have to pick something up that I'd like to try out. Hang out and I'll be by a little later."
Love,
Jen
Then Chris noticed the mail from yesterday sitting on the counter. Then he went into a panic mode again as he realized what freaked him out so much last night.
He shuffled through the letters until he came to wedding RSVPs from guests. There were only two but his eyes widened when he realized who the two replys were from.
One envelope was from his parents. He quickly opened the letter. and pulled out the RSVP.
It said the they would be there. Next reply card was a note from Chris' mom and dad. Chris read it out loud.
Congratulations Michael to you and your bride. We are going to be in town next week and we would love to stop by and meet your fiancee and take you both out for the day! We already set something up with your parents so we will see you next week.
Chris looked down and slowly brought up the other wedding reply. He opened it and pulled out the reply card. It was from his ex girlfriend.
Chris and Shannon had gone out for 5 years. They were going out while Chris was in college. Shannon was 4 years older than Chris and wanted things a little faster than Chris did. Chris wasnted to still go out and have fun with her, while Shannon was looking to settle down and get married. Shannon ended it with Chris when she realized they wanted different things.
Shannon's note fell out of the enveolope.
Dear Michael and Christina
Congratulations on your wedding! Im driving out with Chris' parents next week with my boyfriend. Can't wait for you to meet Brian and I can't wait to meet Christina. See you next week.
Love Shannon
Again Chris' heart felt like it was going to burst out of his chest.
"Oh my God! What am I going to do?" Chris began freaking out.
"My ex and my parents are coming to see me next week, and I'll be dressed as a woman!" He kept reapeating out loud.
"Oh my God!, what am I going to do, What do I do?" He kept saying.
He went to the refrigerator and took out a beer. He quickly twisted off the cap and downed half the bottle.
"I have to run away!" He thought. "I can't face my parents dressed like this!" He continued to say.
"Who invited them anyway?" he continued to freak as he again took a log sip of his beer.
Just then Jen burst into the apartment door.
"Hey babe!" she announced as she walked in carrying and large tote bag. "I didn't think you were every going to wake up.' She continued.
Chris shook his head as if coming out of a trance and said, "We gotta call this whole thing off."
"We can't do that, you know that." She replied.
"We have to!" Chris replied in a panic.
"Actually what I have in this bag is going to save us." Jen said.
Chris stood there waiting as Jen went into the tote bag.
She pulled out.

Jen sat in the coffee shop on main. She was a few blocks away from her office.
She had been nursing her large coffee and scone for the last 15 minutes and was in no rush. In fact she kind of felt good not having to rush somewhere.
Jen was using her time to do some serious planning about how everything was going to pan out. She thought as she wrote some notes in a notebook.
At the top of the page she wrote: "Things to Prepare For" Then she started jotting things down that she needed to take care of in the coming weeks.
The top of her list she wrote, Michael and Gwen's return. Obviously, she has been playing a big part in transforming Chris into Christina with the pair away, but she knew that she had to disappear once they returned.
Michael's return was going to be sooner than Gwen's but she couldn't let her brother know that she was involved in this, not yet.
She took her phone out of her purse and dialed Stacy.
"Hello Miss Jen" Stacy answered from her office at work.
"Hey Stacy. Is everything taken care of?" Jen asked
"It is, I have exactly what we need downloaded and ready for you." She explained in code.
"Great. I will stop by later. I'm taking care of our "girl" today." Jen replied.
Stacy laughed. "I can't wait to see her tomorrow. She is going to be a knockout trying on those wedding gowns tomorrow. We're not going to pick one right away, are we?"
"Oh God no! She's definitely going to get the FULL wedding experience. We'll have her try on at least two-welve dressed." Jen replied.
The two laughed and then they hung up.
Jen smiled thinking about how this blackmailing plan was going to come about. Stacy had gone into Gwen's files and took a screen shot of the Christina Mullens file and how this mysterious woman appeared out of nowhere. That along with the fact that Christina Mullens is really a guy will make her brother give her and Stacy the family fortune or else Gwen, Chris and Michael will do some hard time in jail.

It was now about a half hour since she dropped Chris at her office, she should be getting back now. She saw someone standing at ther table from her side view. She looked up and standing there was Michael.

"Hey Sis! Long time no see." He greeted her.
"Hello dear brother." Jen replied and then kicked out a chair for him.
THe two were being as sarcastic as they could be. In reality they couldn't stand each other.
Michael did sit though.

Michael smiled cause he knew she had to be nosey about what he was doing.
"I've been at grandma's house with mom and dad. We're going through some stuff that mom wanted and getting some paperwork." He replied.
"Oh, trying to get as much as you can out of the old bag even after her death, huh?" Jen replied.
Micheal made a face. "It's not like that at all. I visited grandma every weekend. I took her to church and lunch every Sunday, which is more than your twice a year visit."
"Whoa, whoa, bro, you don't have to explain to me, it's no secret you were her favorite. Don't feel like you have to justify anythign to me." She said with a smile.

Jen raised her eyebrows. "Oh and you're going to fullfill her wishes and get married? I didn't even know you were dating anyone." Jen started to make Michael sweat.
"Uhh, As a matter of fact, yes I am. She's my roommate Chris, mom and dad have met her and we are going to get married and get grandma's inheritence. It's either that or it just goes to the state. Once we have the money, we're going to help mom and dad out and then move out of our small apartment." Michael explained.

Michael broke eye contact and stared down at the table. "Well, maybe sometime."

You now had to take hormones and get implants. It cost you thousands and thousands. Your career didn't accept your decision to transition, and you were laid off. You eventually went to Thailand for the many surgeries you needed because it was cheaper.

They did a fantastic job, and you came out looking like a model. There, you found no trouble finding work in a local sex club. The work was easy and the clothes were fun to wear. Too late to help you, but it helped future generations.

Michael learned of the discovery and felt responsible for your death. But he couldn't do much about it as Jen had won the inheritance. Life sucked for him, and he began drinking heavily.
