153112222222.title: Something else

15312.content:
And that was it. Mike didn't push Chris any further, and after a month or so hired a lawyer to fight the terms of his grandmothers will. He rarely spoke to Chris after that, partly because he was mad his friend didn't help him out, but also because he was embarrassed he even asked.

A few years later, Chris was finding work very hard to come by. He often thought back to that plan and the $10 million he would have made. He could have retired early rather than slave away in a cubicle paying off his student loans.

Yes, he had to admit, if he was honest with himself, he often wished he had said yes to the plan. I mean, actors get paid to dress up as women, so it wasn't really that different.

Oh well, too late now. He returned to his job, and lived a moderately happy life. He never struck it rich, but did one day marry...then got divorced since his work schedule was too demanding. He later had a fiancée, with whom he had a chil with, but they called off the wedding when she confessed she was really a lesbian. She was a good mother though, and Chris worked as hard as he could to pay the child support, and mostly was able to do so in time.

But the recession of 2029 hit him hard, and he. Was laid off. When he couldn't pay child support, she eventually took their son away moving to Texas with her domestic partner. Chris rarely saw his son anymore, and typically only 1 holiday a year or so at best. He took a job as a cashier at Walmart, and months turned to years and turned into 12 years before he realized that so much time had passed him by.

His career was non-exist ant, unless you count becoming an assistant manager a career. He made ok money now, enough to survive, but had no wife and only 1 child he barely ever saw. He spent most of his money and free time at a local bar, but really...he was very lonely.

He often thought back to that easy $10 million, and wished he had taken that chance. He died alone from depression and alcohol abuse in 2045 at a relatively young age. He never held more than $5000 in his bank account, and never paid off his loans. He wasn't a happy man, but at least he died exactly like that...as a man.

And if you could have asked him and shown him the alternative, I suspect he would have been happy about that at least.
15312.title: Not a chance, even for all the money in the world.

1532.content:
Jasper sighed deeply, his hand brushing through his long midnight black hair as the woman in the red hat revealed her royal flush. Groans broke out around the poker table.

"Looks like...Lady Luck is looking my way..." The woman smiled in triumph, sliding the pot, and the last of Jasper's chips, away and into her pile.

Jasper grimaced, his hands clenching into fists. He KNEW he was good at poker. This entire time he could have sworn the woman had been cheating, but no matter what, he never could catch her in the act...

It couldn't end like this... He was supposed to hit it big at this casino and start living like a prince!

"One more game..." the young man demanded quietly, even as the others stood, deciding not to risk losing more money.

"Hmm?" the woman looked up from her winnings.

"I'm sure something's not right here, " Jasper looked the woman in the eyes, "One more game, but I get to deal the cards."

"Young sir." the table attendant interrupted, "you have no chips left to play. And how do you plan to pay off the tab you've built?"

"Hold on..." The woman interjected. She looked Jasper up and down. "So because you lost to a girl at poker, she must be cheating, is that what you think?"

Jasper stayed silent.

The woman matched his gaze. She looked him up and down, from his light brown skin to his eyes as dark as his hair.

"Percy, give the boy the deck."

"Miss Jacqueline, but he has a large tab and-"

"Tell you what...you beat me and I'll pay off your whole tab and by you a new set of chips." the woman, Jacqueline, locked eyes with Jasper.

Jasper smiled. Things could be looking up...if she paid his tab, he might still be able to rack up his fortune with the chips...all he had to-

The woman slid the deck in front of Jasper. She folded her hands under her chin and gave him an unnerving smile.

"But if I win, you will have to do as I say. After all, the casino would turn you over to the authorities of you have a big bill you can't pay back..."

Jasper swallowed. That was true...he HAD lost track. Still...

This might be his only chance...
1532.title: A gambler who owes too much money, and is given...

15321.content:
In what felt like the longest game of poker on his entire life, Jasper couldn't believe it had come down to this.

A seven. A two. A Jack. A ten. A five.

...A totally wothless hand.

He had to keep it cool...bluff well enough, and she might fold. He maintained an air of confidence until it came time to reveal their hands...one that Jacqueline matched, to his dismay.

"Last chance." Jasper warned.

"Come now, where is the fun in that? Flip 'em over." she replied with a smile.

Jasper's stomachs flopped. Folding now would be simply disgraceful...

Jacqueline began to quietly giggle. Jasper stated at her hand in disbelief.

"And the lady is the winner with the hand of...one pair of eights." the attendant gestured toward Jacqueline.

"Oh my...you nearly gave me a heart attack." she smiled, "Figured you had me dead to rights."

He couldn't believe it. So much for his theory. She definitely hadn't cheated. He was just super unlucky.

"That's that I suppose." Jacqueline scooped her chips into her bag and stood. "Now, young man, have a choice. Come with me or face the casino manager about your debt. Hurry up now, honey..."

Jacqueline smiled that unnerving smile again.
15321.title: "Alright...I'll cut the cards."

choices: Jasper disguised as a girl hits on the con artist
153211.content:
Not seeing a choice, Jasper stood, rounding the table to stand next to her.

"Good call." the lady in red turned on her heel and began walking away from the main gambling floor. "Percy, put his tab on hold."

"Yes ma'am." the older man bowed as she walked away.

Jasper looked back and forth between them for a second before hurrying to catch up with Jacqueline.

"What...who...why did he...?"

"Oh, didn't I mention? I own the casino." the woman smirked, turning down into a hallway.

Jasper's jaw nearly hit the floor.

"Now...I will erase your debt...if you..." Jacqueline unlocked a door to one of the guest rooms and stepped inside.

"Will do a favor for my friend here."

She gestured to the bed, where a woman with dark hair and skin like his was sitting, her head buried in her hands.

She looked up. "Oh! Jackie! Did you figure something out to get me out of this?"

Jacqueline smiled, her eyes flicking over to Jasper. "Yes, Jasmine...I think I did."

"What's going on?" Jasper asked, confused.

Jacqueline turned to him and smiled. "Jasmine got scammed by a con artist and a cheat at my poker tables. He kept winning and winning, and in their last match, he gambled that if he won, Jasmine would have to marry him."

Jasper frowned. He hated cheaters. "So you want me to help get rid of this guy?"

Jacqueline looked at Jasmine and the two women smiled. "You could...say that."
153211.title: Go with her

choices: Jasper wakes up in the chapel
Time to make a blushing bride!
1532111.content:
"It turns out the guy was serious. He arranged for a wedding within a couple days." Jacqueline shook her head before walking over to the fridge, opening it up and taking out a bottle. "If Jasmine isn't there at seven tonight, he will tell the police about her debt. She'll go to jail...and I can't stand here and do nothing about it." Jacqueline took off her hat and set it down as she began to pour the contents of the bottle into glasses.

"...Jackie was the only friend I could turn to..." Jasmine said somberly.

Jasper felt sorry for her. This was blackmail...

"Well...I'll do whatever I can to help." Jasper tried to reassure her with a smile.

"Good to hear."

Jacqueline held out a cup for him.

"Then how about I tell you the plan?"

Jasper sat down in a chair and took a drink from the cup.

"Alright. Let's..."

It only took a couple seconds for him to realise something was wrong. His head became hazy and his vision blurry, like he was underwater.

He could barely hear her as Jacqueline took a sip of her own, non-spiked drink.

"I call it... Operation Decoy..."


Jacqueline clinked her cup to Jasmine's. Before swiftly drinking the rest of the shot.

"I think it'll still work. He is about your size and his skin tone is near identical."

"I do feel sorry for him..." Jasmine mused, "but I don't want ANYTHING to do with that man."

"Right..." Jacqueline rubbed her hands together. "Let's get started."
1532111.title: Jasper the replacement bride

choices: "The Ceremonial is starting! Hurry up and bring her out!"
"Where is she? I want to see my lovely prize..."
15321111.content:
The misty fog in his head was finally starting to clear.

Jasper slowly opened his eyes, eyelids feeling heavy.

Where was...?

He was lying down, but...not in the room he had just been in. Where was he?

He slowly sat upright, trying not to flinch from the fading headache he was having. Jasper felt...weird.

"Morning, sleeping beauty."

He turned quickly at the sound of the familiar voice. "Miss Jacqueline?"

He started to push the white sheet that had been draped over his chest off him but to his surprise it didn't budge.

"Wait...what am i...?" Jasper stammered.

"Tada."

Jacqueline took a step to the side, away from the mirror behind her and dramatically gestured towards it.

Jasper's eyes grew wide.

The dark haired maiden in the mirror was wearing a pure white wedding gown that drapped over her shoulders, leaving the smooth tan skin exposed. The skirt line was asymmetric, exposing her long, shapely, and well-shaven legs down to the silver ankle bracelet and white stiletto heels. The dress's sleeves ran down her arms like gloves, coming to an end around her middle finger.

Her hair, wavy and beautiful, fell seductively down her shoulders to rest on her breast, while the rest was tied up in a messy bun. Pure white pearl earrings alighted the tip of each earlobe and a choker that resembled the wings of an angle wrapped about her neck. Her lips were dark red and her soft eyes were framed in black eyeliner, dark brown eyeshadow, and mascara lifted her lashes to voluptuous allure.

Jasper blinked and gasped.

So did the beauty in the mirror.

"Incredible how much of a figure the corset gave you." Jacqueline mused with a giggle. "That and the lingerie set underneath that lovely little number..."

Jasper felt himself blush in embarrassment, suddenly aware of the underwear cupping his butt.

"What's going on? Why are you doing this to me?" Jasper demanded, pointing at the woman in red. He suddenly realised his nails had been painstakingly shaped into delicate tips, each lightly covered in nail polish.

"Didn't you listen earlier?" Jacqueline asked coyly.

"You...are Operation Decoy."

Before Jasper could protest, a loud knock came from the door.
15321111.title: Jasper wakes up in the chapel

choices: Jasper, feeling trapped, has to begin his bridal march
The nervous bride freezes like a deer in headlights
153211111.content:
Jacqueline was at the door in an instant.

"Yes, yes...she's in her way out!" Jacqueline waved whoever it was away dismissively.

She quickly turned on her heel and grabbed Jasper by the wrist.

"Hey, wait what do you-" he was cut off as he was pulled to his feet and dragged out the door by Jacqueline. He struggled to keep up, wobbling in the unfamiliar height granted by the high heels.

Jacqueline came to a stop at a large pair of double doors, letting go of Jasper but not pausing for a second as she started rummaging through her bag.

"Now...'Jasmine' don't be nervous..." Jacqueline slid a tiara stop his made-up hair, a long white veil attached to it that flowed behind him. "Remember to smile..." she pulled a bouquet out and shoved it into his hands. "And most importantly..." she muttered, trying to find something else in her bag.

Jasper took a step forward, determined to stop this once and for all, getting right up in the woman's face.

"Now, wait a-"

Jacqueline moved quickly with the perfume bottle, spritzing it right into Jasper's open red lips.

"No talking." Jasper was going to have nightmares about her smile.

The taste of the perfume as lingering, but no matter how he tried, he couldn't cough.

"There. Shouldn't be able to do more than a whisper now." Jacqueline gave his dress and neck a few sprays as well.

"W-what the?" Sure enough, Jasper's voice came very quietly, sounding like the meek confused bride he appeared to be and not the angry retort he attempted.

"Oh...'Jasmine'...don't look so glum." Jacqueline 's face formed a pout.

On the other side of the door, a familiar tune began to play. Jacqueline took advantage of him being distracted to push the faux bride in front of the door.

"You are marrying rich after all!" she thrust the door open, letting dozens of eyes turn to look directly at Jasper.

Jacqueline grinned as she hurried away. If nothing else, the boy being quiet and nervous meant more of a head start for Jasmine before the con man would know he had been had.

Hell, maybe if she was lucky, they'd not see through the ruse and just get married anyhow!
153211111.title: "The Ceremonial is starting! Hurry up and b...

1532111112.content:
Jasper froze, the gazes of people on both aisles ahead of him turned to look at him. He brought the bouquet up to his face defensively.

As the organ music played on, he could gradually make out a man up at the alter, his would be suitor, turning and smiling towards him. There was no way he was going up to him, there had to be a way out.

Suddenly a huge man came up to Jasper's side. Dressed in a dark suit, he wore a trilby over a bald head, and had a cheek scar and stern look. While Jasper was still trying to figure him out, he looped an arm tightly around his elbow, and started stepping down the aisle.

Pulled along, Jasper made a few stumbles on his high heels, most of his attention was instantly focused on keeping balance, while being acutely aware how the eyes of numerous strangers could see his shaven legs. With effort Jasper gradually regained balance and got into the rhythm of stepping forward without his feet falling to the side. He tried to tug against the arm, but it was immovable as it continued to follow its owner down the aisle. He looked up again to see the smiling man at the altar. Suave, jet black hair, thin moustache, clearly rich. The smile was clearly intended for some beautiful, blushing bride and being on the receiving end of it threw Jasper off. For a moment he didn't appreciate that with the pure white dress, the subtle makeup, all the little details, he looked like he was a bride that had waited all her life for this moment.

Jasper was pulled up to the altar, the big man finally letting go and taking a few steps back.

Jasper looked over his bouquet to see the smart man facing him, in front of an altar, in front of a congregation of people.

"Dearly beloved, we are gathered here today..." the priest started..

The world seemed to spin around Jasper and he cursed Jacqueline, this had all been some cruel trick. Who was this guy anyway? Something vaguely rang a bell about him he couldn't focus on it right now. And don't you need documents for this sort of thing? Jasper had half a mind to turn tail and walk out, but somehow could feel the huge man behind him, ready for him to do just that.

As the priest droned on, Jasper started glaring at the smart man across from him, but for some reason the man only seemed to smile more. Jasper didn't appreciate how the red lipstick accented his scowl, or the mascara and eye-shadow styled his glare.
1532111112.title: The nervous bride freezes like a deer in headli...

choices: Jasper is too overwhelmed with shock to resist
15321111121.content:
Damn that viper of a woman! How on earth was he supposed to get out of this?

"And in sickness and in health..." the priest continued.

Jasper ignored him, taking a quick sideways glance at the side doors in hope of finding an exit.

"I do."

There were four scattered throughout the chapel. Two on either side.

"And do you, Jasmine, take..."

No such luck though as men like the one behind him were guarding each one. He looked above and past the suitor at the window past him, looking to see if there was anywhere he could climb out to escape either above or below, but no luck.

Sudden clapping distracted Jasper, as the crowd had suddenly began to politely celebrate. Wait a second...

His left hand was gently lifted away from the bouquet in that distracted instant. He gasped quietly in surprise as the smart dressed man slid a stunning diamond studded ring past his delicate red nails onto his ring finger.

Wait, WHAT? Wasn't the priest supposed to wait for the bride to say I do?

He froze up slightly. When he looked up and down at the window...did he look like a timid bride nodding shyly to accept her wedding vows?!

"You may now kiss the bride." the priest closed his book with a smile.

Jasper felt his blood run cold as the man, (his HUSBAND??) lifted back his veil. The fear that crept into his eyes probably merely looked like nervous anticipation to all those involved.

"You... are my babe now." the man said with a pleased smirk.

Jasper was stunned, his long dark eyelashes blinking in a way far more seductive than he wanted. He was someone's WIFE? His...babe?

In this moment of stunned vulnerability, the husband grabbed the bride tenderly by her chin and pulled her crimson lips into his.
15321111121.title: The ceremony continues.

153211111211.content:
Jasper couldn't believe it, a mixture of shock, fear and sheer disbelief stunned him to the point that he couldn't believe that this man's lips were now pressed against his, that his moustache were tickling his face, and what? He could feel the man's tongue in his mouth, firm and energetic! Through this he could hear applause and cheers flood the church. This was crazy, they actually thought Jasper had married the guy!

Jasper was getting out of here. No question, he was done.

As the long deep kiss gradually came to an end, the man moved away and Jasper turned to face down the aisle, practically blinded by the countless camera flashes. Through them, Jasper could see the double doors he'd entered the church by were now open.

The tang of the man's tongue on his echoed through his mind, but Jasper forced himself to ignore it. With at breath, and also trying to ignore those big men, he strode straight towards the doors.

It was chaotic, the cheers continued, the crowds seemed to reach out and touch him from the aisle, he heard "congratulations" and even a "you're beautiful" between all the yells, the flashes continued; Jasper just kept skating forward, as fast as his heels would allow him.

Upon reaching the doors, he suddenly realised he was still holding the bouquet. Angry at both the crowd and this physical symbol of femininity, he launched the bouquet up and behind him into the church. The crowd suddenly started getting ecstatic, Jasper just walked on.

As his light adjusted to the bright sun, he could make out an big black limousine at the bottom of the church steps. Florally decorated, and with cans trailing behind it, Jasper had no illusion what it was there for. A smartly dressed chauffeur was even holding a door open in front of him.

Jasper wanted to give the limo a wide berth, but navigating the church steps in heels without tumbling and breaking his neck became his next immediate concern. He found he had to hold up parts of the wedding gown skirt to make sure they didn't interfere with his steps. After carefully making his way down the stone steps, he found his feet on slightly less stable gravel, and looked up. The chauffeur was still looking at him with a smile on his face, and he seemed to be indicating the passenger door of the limo. Before Jasper could react he felt an arm around his waist and he found himself nose to nose with the man he'd just (gulp!) married.

"Steady on," he said, "there's plenty of time soon."

The man turned Jasper to see the huge crowd come out of the church doors. Coming down the steps, flooding to the left and right, Jasper and the man faced them side by side. There were photos and cheers and suddenly a rain of rose petals came down upon them.

"Thank you all for coming here," the man announced in a loud voice. "I know some of you think this is sudden, but when it's love, it's love!" More petals rained down, Jasper found himself trying to wave them away, stop them getting caught up in his mascaraed eyelashes.

The man continued "It is heart-warming to see everyone share the joy and love that Jasmine and I have found in finding eachother. We hope this is the first of many great memories that we'll share together."

Jasper stopped waving, and turned towards the man. Jasmine? What sort of reality did this guy live in?

The man turned towards Jasper too, and moved in for a kiss.

Oh no, Jasper wasn't going for this again. Even with their lips touching and the man's arm behind him, Jasper moved back, into the open limousine door and the limo itself. The moment the man's arm loosened, Jasper broke free and scrambled across the plush leather seats (in spite of the skirt/gown), and pulled the handle of the door on the opposite side.

It didn't open. Jasper yanked it several times more, flipping the locks on and off while doing so, but the door didn't budge. Child locks? Really? Jasper awkwardly rotated, and got himself sitting down on the the soft leather seats, facing the rest of the limo. The ruffles of the white dress seemed to push up around him and the veil had spun back into his vision again.

Looking to where he had come from, Jasper saw the man enter the limo from the same door. He landed on the seat beside Jasper, and with a pull he closed the door with a clamp, instantly dampening the sounds of the crowds outside.

Okay, Jasper wasn't doing this. Maybe there was another door on the far end of the limo? Looking forward towards the rest of the limo, he found it was surprisingly spacious with more leather seats, visible bottles of champagne in ice buckets, a minibar(?) and something that looked like a curved large sofa at the far end end. Jasper certainly wasn't used to this standard of living, coming from humble beginnings and finding that his actions tended to lead to more humility. He'd always yearned for this level of luxury, and his efforts to gain it had now borne fruit in the most perverse and unexpected way possible.

The man clasped Jasper's hand in his "My dear" he said. This brought Jasper back to the current moment, along with the crowds now seemingly pounding and slapping the outside of the limo with somewhat muffled cheers, and the engine starting up. Jasper tried to get up, but at that moment the limo pulled forward and unsteadily Jasper fell back into the seat.

The rattle of cans and the sounds of the crowd rose up from behind them. Jasper craned his neck and looked out the rear window, pulling the veil out of his delicate eyes as he did so. The crowd was still waving, the cans rattling, and the church seemed to gradually move away from them. In desperation Jasper slammed his partially loved hand against the rear window, but it held solid. He tried to call out but barely a whisper came out. "For the last time I'm not doing this!" he tried to yell, waving fanatically, the crowd just waved back. Slapping his hand against the window one more time, he paused he noticed the glaring big diamond ring that now sat square at the base of his ring finger. As some of the implications about this hit him, the crowd and the church pulled further and further away into the distance, until the limo finally turned a corner, and they were gone.
153211111211.title: Jasper is too overwhelmed with shock to resist

choices: Accept the hand. This dress is hard to move in
Deny the hand and risk giving the crowd a little display
1532111112111.content:
It had all happened so fast.

Jasper turned back in his seat and, realizing the asymmetric skirt of the wedding gown had ridden up to reveal practically all the way up to reveal the white floral garter high on his left leg, quickly corrected the skirtline to grant himself SOME sense of decency.

A wolf-whistle brought a blush to Jasper's face.

"I am glad that you and Miss Jacqueline came to see things my way, my little angel." The man in the seat next to him smiled, one that unnerved him just as much as the one that had gotten him in this mess. Jasper averted his eyes, looking out the window.

The driver turned, headed for a building not far from the church, equally grand and appearing to be of similar architecture. Was THAT where the reception would be?!

Suddenly the man reached out a firm, sturdy hand to Jasper's smooth leg. Jasper froze, his eyes wide.

"Why should a lovely and beautiful rose like yourself have to slave away working day in and day out?" He gently caressed the leg, sending a shiver down Jasper's spine. "From now on, you've got just one job."

Jasper felt the parts of his body relax that he hadn't even realized had tensed up when the man released his leg.

However, the man's voice suddenly was much closer as Jasper realized he had his mouth right next to Jasper's ear.

"...Be beautiful."

The kiss to his neck was sudden but brief, over before he could recompose himself to react.

So much was happening and it was hard to keep up.

The door opened and the man stepped out. The crowd was already starting to rebuild around their car as more and more guests hurried to keep up with the newlyweds.

The man turned and slightly bowed, holding out a hand to help his bride out of the car.

"My dear..." that smile again...
1532111112111.title: On their way

15321111121112.content:
Jasper had had enough, he wasn't taking the guy's hand and he wasn't getting out of the limo. Maybe the wedding dress was influencing him a bit too much, but he just crossed his arms and pouted.

The man's smile flickered for a second, then he regained it. "Alright then," and he sat back into the limo beside Jasper, closing the door.

"I know what this is. You're still sore about that whole police thing... the whole getting thrown in jail for your debt... maybe the whole thing made you feel a bit vunerable."

That hit a bit close to home. Jasper got up and walked down the length of the limo. It turned out there weren't any extra doors at the front part of the limo, the only doors were at the back where he'd come in. In a huff, he sat down on the curved, sofa like seat. Unfortunately the man followed him and sat close beside him.

"Look, you don't need to worry about that now. As my wife you now have more than enough money to pay everything off, such petty concerns such as debt and gambling are beneath you."

Jasper paused, and turned towards the man, questioningly. Despite everything, the lure of money was still a pretty powerful pull on him. The allure of that mountain of gold would always shine on him.

The man, smiled at "Jasmine's" reaction and reached up to knock on the smoked window to the driver's compartment "One more loop, we need to prepare." and the limo took off again.

Turning back to "Jasmine" with her deep searching eyes, the poured on what he thought she'd like to hear.

"Yes, it's sudden, and such and adjustment, but can you really say your life was better? Desperately searching for the win that will make everything easy? Poker can be a dignified game, but to play it when you're not good enough to win, and don't have enough money to lose?"

Jasper ground his teeth, the effect compressing his ruby lips. This guy was not scoring an easy victory against him, he may not be the best gambler, it was all just a scam.

"But you don't have to worry about all that now. You've had your win, this is it? The gold at the end of the rainbow! The high life." Smoothly, he took a bottle of chilled champagne out of the minibar and two flutes. Deftly filling them both up, he offered one to Jasper. "Taste what is has to offer, I'm sure its something you've never had before."
15321111121112.title: Deny the hand

choices: In the crowd, Jasper spots Jacqueline (Here to earnestly thank him?)
153211111211121.content:
Jasper looked at the liquid. High quality champagne, and he knew it.

The kind he and his run down apartment could never afford.

The kind that cost more than his rent.

The kind brewed near exclusively for the wealthy upper class that never had to count out change on a table and hope it would be enough for that week's food.

The kind the other players drank but he could only imagine when he played at the casino with all he had scraped and saved on a bid to change his fortune with one lucky hand.

And here it was being offered to him.

He could feel his hand, nervously held to his chest, want to reach out and take it. To at least feel like, for one time in his life, he wasn't a nobody.

To taste a more comfortable life.

...All he had to do...was become a bride?

Jasper wasn't sure about that...but still his hand slowly rose and, slightly trembling, took the drink from him.

The man smiled, seemingly satisfied with Jasmine's 'reply', clinking his glass with the other in a toast.

"Then here's to you, my love."

Jasper was too distracted to properly notice, tenderly lifting his own glass to his mouth and sipping it.

It wasn't as strong as he was expecting, rather it went down somewhat smooth withsubtle undertones of fruity flavors.

Jasper couldn't help relaxing a bit and letting his red lips form a smile.

The man looked at his newlywed bride and for the first time, she smiled.

He tapped on the driver's window, who complied immediately, headed back for the reception.

The crowd from the chapel had all arrived and were eagerly awaiting the new couple's return.

There was so much Jasper wasn't sure about right now, but there was one thing he was sure of. He wanted to get out of the car before his new husband could seduce him with more of that alcohol.

This time when he offered, Jasper took his hand to lift himself and the dress's skirt out of the limo without flashing too much of his legs.

He had hoped the man would let go, but instead, once to his feet, the man had slid his other arm around Jasper's back, a gentle hold on his bride's hip.

Jasper decided to just try to ignore the man's hold on him and walked with him toward the steps to the building.
153211111211121.title: Jasper accepts the drink

1532111112111211.content:
The reception itself was at a large extravagant hotel, they walked through the lobby across soft, plush carpet (which Jasper found tricky in the heels), that was laid out over a marble floor. Marble columns raised up on either side that held up a vaulted roof, and ornate sculpted details could be seen in the high ceiling.

Overwhelmed by this, Jasper didn't notice he was leaning a bit further into the man for support.

They walked by the reception and towards a large corridor that had a great big sign and arrow with fancy cursive writing on it: "Reception for the wedding of James and Jasmine" It took Jasper a moment to register that James was the man that was right beside him. They walked down the brightly lit corridor. A huge swarm of people followed, far back enough to give space, but close to make their presence felt.

The couple went through another double doors and the next thing Jasper knew, they were in a huge room with a whole crowd of flickering of faces.

"Congratulations James! And Jasmine, I don't believe we've had the pleasure?" Jasper hesitated, then shook the guy's hand. Someone else came up, "I wish you the very best in happiness, if there's anything you need..." It went on, Jasper tried to remember some of the faces, some elderly, some young, one was a little girl who just said "I want to be as pretty as you when I get married" and Jasper found himself blushing. James smiled as it went on and offered quick replies.

Then a somewhat elderly couple came up and James switched his tone to a more sincere voice. "Mum, Dad, I'd like you to meet my wife Jasmine. Jasmine, these are my parents." Out of sheer awkwardness ("wife"), Jasper smiled and shook their hands. Part of him wondered if with some of that mature parental wisdom, they'd instantly be able to see through the sham and know what was going on. If that was the case, they certainly didn't show it.

"Jasmine," the father said, "To be honest, my wife and I still find this a bit surprised by all this, but we know our boy James knows what he wants. We wish you the most happy returns."

"You look so beautiful," the mother said, "I know you're both going to have many happy years together."
1532111112111211.title: At the reception

choices: The music starts, James takes "Jasmine" to dance
Jacqueline suddenly arrives to congratulate the new couple
15321111121112112.content:
"Alright, let's take a break."

James excused himself and his wife and guided Jasper to the catering table. He reached into a tub of ice and pulled out another bottle of expensive champagne.

He looked back at his wife and smiled as he began to pour two small glasses. Of course his parents had their doubts. He had been married before, but for the wrong reasons.

His encounter with Jasmine had stirred up something inside him. She had been just as timid at the poker table that night, and he had initially thought it merely a ruse as her winnings began to build.

While he heard that Jasmine had gone to Jacqueline saying he had cheated, he had not. He told Jacqueline, that firey woman, as much.

True, he had in the past, but something about playing with a woman that could match him excited James. So he asked Jacqueline to persuade her to honor their bet. And it seemed she had decided he was right, after she calmed down, he assumed.

Getting her to marry him...he suddenly wanted nothing more. He had only seen her for a few hours (and she looked far more elegant today compared to the plain look she had then), but there was one thing that he wanted.

Her, by his side.

James walked back up to his bride and held out her drink. She actually looked happy to see it and slowly took it from him.

...God, she was beautiful. And her smile...how he loved the look of her looking happy and content, not the upset grimace she wore at that table. The next time she played cards...she would feel beautiful and liberated, not desperate.

He watched her ruby lips as she took a drink, sighing contently. Her sexy eyes met his. She blinked, her long enticing lashes making his heart skip a beat.

For the first time in longer than he could remember, James blushed with a smile, caught staring at his own wife like she was a goddess descended from the heavens.

...And as heavenly as she looked in that dress, he was certainly looking forward to tenderly taking it off her...
15321111121112112.title: Onto the cocktails

choices: The alcohol is getting to Jasper. He considers becoming a bride...
153211111211121122.content:
Jasper took another well-needed sip of that expensive alcohol.

What was he even supposed to do at this point? Any attempt at escape would definitely fail with more men like at the chapel guarding every door.

He looked back at James, who, to his surprise, averted his eyes.

"Congratulations, Mr. and Mrs. James Monroe!" a familiar voice suddenly said.

Jasper's mouth fell open in shock as the woman in red approached, drink in hand.

James stiffened up a bit before regaining his composure. "Miss Jacqueline. You are too kind...especially considering the way you initially reacted."

Jacqueline waves her hand dismissively. "Now, Jimmy, you aren't being fair. I had to take a little bit, calm down...but you were right. A bet was a bet."

Jasper, feeling his anger boil up, started up to her, but to his surprise, Jacqueline grabbed his wrist first and pulled him into a hug.

"Mind if I steal her away for a second before she starts spending ALL her time with you?"

James looked puzzled for a moment, but then he nodded, gesturing his approval with his glass.

"Great. Thanks, tough guy!" Harper found himself being pulled around by the woman once again. After getting a short distance away from James, she let go of Jasper and raised her hand to cover her smile.

"Hey, I know I made you beautiful and all, but I didn't think you would actually up and marry him! Way to take on for the team."

Jasper frowned, trying to deny it, but his voice still failed to manifest.

Jacqueline suddenly moved forward and Jasper found himself in another hug...but this one felt genuine.

"Thanks to you, I managed to slip Jasmine out and get her safely on a bus out of town without anyone seeing her. You really came through." she took a step back and gently held Jasper by his hand.

"Thank you." she said bowing her head in respect.

Jasper found his anger subsiding as he remembered the entire reason she dressed him like this was for the sake of her friend.

He smiled, finding a little contentment in that she was ok.

"Well, like I said though, I didn't expect you to go and actually do it though!" she snickered, glancing at the ring on Jasper's finger.

Jasper opened his mouth to say something, but suddenly a violin began to play. The other members of the orchestra began to join and the lights on the hall dimmed a bit.

James crossed the distance between them quickly and before Jasper knew it, had taken him delicately by the hand.

"Sorry, Miss Jacqueline. I'm afraid I must steal her little rose back."

One of those smiles appeared on Jacqueline's face. "Sure, go on you two! Be happy."

Quickly placing a hand in Jasper's top, James escorted "Jasmine" to the center of the dance area.

A spotlight shine down on them both, making the bride practically glow like an angel.

He turned, giving a bow.

"My lovely...May I have this dance?
153211111211121122.title: Jacqueline suddenly arrives to congratulate the...

Jacqueline suggests James play the blindfolded remove "Jasmine's" garter game
1532111112111211222.content:
Maybe the alcohol was kicking in.

Maybe the way the light was shining dazed him.

Maybe he felt like he had no choice with all those expectant eyes on him.

Jasper slowly and delicately extended his hand, the wedding ring on his finger glittering like a star.

James took his hand, a soft kiss on Jasper's fingers before pulling his bride close and wrapping his arm around her hip.

Jasper's free hand found its way to James's chest, and it stayed there as the pair began to sway rhythmically over the floor.

Following James's lead, Jasper felt the skirt of his dress move elegantly around him. Despite the high heels, he never stumbled.

Why was he so transfixed by James's eyes?

Why was he going along with this?

Jacqueline had not done a thing to help him escape!

...Did she think...he didn't want to?

Why would he?

Why...

...To be fair...there was appeal to this high brow lifestyle. The promises of security and life without worry.

If he just accepted it he could live like a prince...ss.

James guided him into a gentle spin and Jasper caught a glimpse of his reflection in the window.

...He certainly did look like a princess.

The music came to an end and James pulled Jasper close, pulling his chin up to look into his eyes.

"What a lucky man I am." he smiled, pressing his lips to Jasper's, much more gently this time.

Jasper simply accepted this kiss, unable to fight back.

...Was....was it just his fate to become...a bride?
1532111112111211222.title: The alcohol is getting to Jasper. He considers ...

"...You think this changes that you are beautiful as an angel? You are my wife."
15321111121112112221.content:
As the kiss ends, the crowd breaks into applause. James turns and waves, a large smile on his face. Jasper on the other hand, simply stood meekly, James's hand still on his hip.

"Thank you! Thank you! Please, eat drink and be merry! I thank you all, friends and family, for being here for this very important day!"

The applause resurged as Jasper felt himself guided along. The whole world felt surreal. He wasn't Jasper, the small time gambler, trying to make it big...

He was a bride, on her wedding day, being whisked away by her new husband. Every swish of the dress, blink of his eyelashes, click of his heels...it was like he has suddenly been throw into the role of someone else (to be fair, he had).

The doors closed behind the two of them as they exited the hall. James let out a content sigh.

He took Jasper's hands in his. Jasper looked up at him, stunned.

"My beautiful wife..."

What was he supposed to do? It wasn't fair, everything he ever wanted, just...spread out in front of him...and all it would take was...

James guided the star-struck bride along, leading her into the elevator. He hit the key for the penthouse and walked behind her, wrapping his arms around her waist and gently caressing her from behind.

Ding.

The doors opened to a luxurious room, a massive bed, glorious view of the city night out the window, paintings over the walls, expensive stonework...

James could see the wonder on his bride's face. He put his hands on her shoulders and began to massage them.

"And all of this...is yours now."

Jasper couldn't think. It...

James gently began to guide him into the room.

"Now...what say we..."

Jasper felt himself be guided toward the bed and the massive mirror beside it.

A beautiful bride looked back at him. Her stunned expression was like his, but she almost looked...happy.

"...officially make you...my wife."

The zipper of the dress was slowly pulled down his back. Jasper looked on in the mirror as the dress slunk down the beauty in the mirror's shoulders until it fell to the floor, exposing her pure white lingerie and corset. Her skin was dark and smooth, standing out from the ivory of her undergarments. Her garter Sat tantalizingly on her thigh, and her hair fell freely over her "breasts" and down her back as James undid her hair.

All it took to never struggle again was...

James scooped his hands under her, lifting his bride into his arms. He gently kissed her neck, making her shiver in anticipation.

To be taken care of...and doted upon...and treated like something to be cherished...and it just meant becoming...

He placed her into the bed where she sat...angelic...beautiful...waiting.

Jasper sat on the bed, clad in only bridal intimates, the white choker, the heels, and the veil.

Everything was within reach. He just had to reach out and become...

Beyond James he could see his reflection.

The young woman in the mirror looked at him...

And she smiled.

James set upon his bride gently but eagerly, starting with kisses from her ankles, slowly up her leg to her thigh. Her eyes rolled in her head and her breaths grew sharp.

He jumped up to her bosom, every touch of his lips eliciting a tiny noise from her. Up and down each breast, over her collarbone, her neck, ears...

And she just quivered underneath him as her breathing got heavier.

Jasper lay there, every kiss sending a tingle up his spine and across his skin. That he shouldn't be enjoying this was becoming more and more silent a thought.

After all...it is only natural for a bride on her wedding day.

Arousal was building in the air, James worked his way down and up her other leg and, knowing what he wanted next moved to...

James froze. His bride looked at him, a puzzled look on his face. She sat up slightly to look at him...but he was too busy looking at her crotch.

She looked down and then blushed, embarrassed. She looked up meekly at James and waited his judgement.
15321111121112112221.title: James is ready for the two of you to have some ...

"You think this changes that you are beautiful as an angel? You are my wife."

James leaned to the bedside drawer and pulled it open. He produced a condom from it and slowly worked it into place on his wife and then tuck it back away into her lingerie.

"There...so we don't make a mess of those pretty clothes."

The world felt like a rush around Jasper. He lay still as James again approached and sent electricity through his...her skin.

Jasmine began to quietly squirm as James again peppered her legs with kisses.

Up and down he went, sending a rush through her. She looked up at her husband. Their eyes met.

At first, those eyes had looked at her like she was a prize to be won...but now...

She was an angel, his most treasured of all his riches...

She felt him turn her over. Kisses over her shoulder and back, bliss filling her.

He righted himself and pulled her hips towards him.

She would never have to struggle again... She would live the life she had dreamed...

She felt James draw closer, gently and tenderly.

And then...

Jasmine...truly become his bride.

1532111112111211222121.content:
"Are you ready, my angel? It is about time to rejoin the reception."

Jasmine turned her back to him, showing the zipper of the wedding gown still not all the way up.

James smiled, pulling the zipper up slowly and his fingers grazing her skin as it went. She smiled at him, before applying a bit more perfume to herself and the dress.

James went to the door and opened it holding a hand out for Jasmine.

"My sweet..."

She took his hand, her ring glimmering vibrantly. The couple walked to the elevator, hands around the other's hips and a long gentle kiss before the doors opened.

The entrance to the reception hall was just ahead. It was almost time for the poker tables to be set up.

James pulled Jasmine close and gently lifted her chin to look up at him.

"I am yours...forever." James pressed their lips together, her arms wrapping around his neck. The two slowly pulled apart.

"And I am yours..." Jasmine responded quietly, her voice smooth and soft.

She finally spoke to him...and with the voice of an angel.

The couple reached out to hold hands and pushed open the door.

1543112.content:
You stand as still as you can possibly manage, scared out of your wits. The feeling of your body being spread without your consent, along with your current state of undress, can't help but make you feel vulnerable.

"How could anyone ever feel comfortable doing this?" you think to yourself.

From the top of the tube a robotic eye descended and hits you with a horizontal line of red light. Slowly it follows the shape of your body, starting at the top of your head and down to your feet. Once it hit your feet, it then went back up again to you head before going down once more. It did this a few times before an image appeared on the glass of the tube, which appeared to also be a screen of some kind.

On screen was a message stating that there may be an error and that it was sending a message to an Operator before continuing. Before it sends however, you hear the light sound of the machines and lights power down to silence. The lights go out and you are left in darkness. Unfortunately, the arms didn't release you when they powered down. You pull at your restraints but your freedom is still out of your hands.

You begin to wonder if someone was going to come back and check on you but the thought is still in it's infancy when everything kicks back on again.

"Scan Complete."

"Commencing Cleansing."

You had little time to register what was said before your body was hit with water. Water sprayed out from tiny nozzles that were lined inside the tube's walls. If you could jump, you would have when you feel something touch your hair. You can't see but you guess that one of these arms are cleaning your hair, which you can confirm as you watch suds flow down your front. Your hair is teased and manipulated before you feel something cover the top of your head. You look down and expect to see the tube filling with water, but instead see the suds circle small drains on the floor.

The water stops before you are hit with some kind of foam which sprays on you and sticks to your skin. The foam is fine at first but soon begins to feel hot and uncomfortable. You start to worry about being burned by this chemical as it's flowery odor fills your nose.

Again, water hits you, this time a huge relief. The growing pain is gone and replaced with the soothing water as it rinses the foam and your body hair away. After the foam is gone the water stops. You continue to stand dripping as you feel your hair released from it's covering. more arms come into view with cutting implements and brushes. There is a flurry of cutting and brushing as your hair is cut and styled in a feminine style.

The arms complete their job and leave, signaling another spray of water to wash the hair away. Once the nozzles finishes, the tube is filled with moving air, drying your supple, smooth skin.

"What the fuck?!" you say as you look at yourself reflected in the glass of the tube. You are disheartened with how girly your body looks, not to mention your hair. It's clear that something has gone horribly wrong. You stand, mouth agape, as the machines begin their next move.
1543112.title: There's a problem with the scanner.

choices: You make a selection of clothing
15431121.content:
"I can sense the tension in your body," NOVA said, her voice emulating human speech, but with a hint of computerized speech in it. "I will take the utmost care to get you prepared for your blind date. He won't be able to resist you!"

"Wait!" you shouted. "Blind date? He? I'm not going on a blind date with a guy! I..."

Before another word could be said, a bucket-like helmet descended down the tube and covered your head. There was a hiss of air and you could feel pillows or bladders being inflated inside the helmet, holding your face in position. A tube was extended pushing into your mouth, and you could feel your lips being lifted by smaller bladders, and something pressing against your teeth.

NOVA's voice filled your ears from small speakers that had been positioned over your ears in the helmet. "My scans showed your teeth could use some whitening. And I will shape your brows. There is no need for concern. The helmet will not harm you. There may be some discomfort as I proceed. Please enjoy some musical selections as the process begins.

Some pop music filled your ears as you could feel little stings on your brows, making your eyes water. The tube in your mouth began pumping something slimy onto your teeth. And you could feel something greasy tracing itself onto your lips.

After several songs, the stinging in your brows stopped, and NOVA's voice again filled your ears. "Makeup application initiating. Please keep your eyes open until told otherwise."

You closed your eyes tightly, dreading the thought of what this system glitch was doing to you. You wanted to tell the machine to stop and let you out, but the helmet and the tube prevented anything more than a muffled grunt out.

Again, NOVA's voice said, "Please open your eyes until told otherwise. You will not be harmed."

You closed your eyes tighter.

"In order to complete your desires, I am going to take steps to ensure your wishes are carried out. Again, there may be some discomfort, but you will not be harmed."

You felt a metallic object placed against your eyes, which were immediately wedged open with two specula. You felt eye liner being applied, and some mascara, and there was nothing you could do. After several coats of mascara, an eyelash curler made sure your lashes looked wonderful. The curler wasn't immediately released, though. The special withdrew, and a slight downward tug from the curlers closed your eyelids, which were immediately assaulted with eyeshadow.

You felt other cosmetics being applied in the helmet. Lotions and powders were dusted over your face. You felt brushes on your cheeks, and a sharp pain in your earlobes.

The tube in your mouth suddenly sprayed cold water on your teeth. With a hissing deflation, the tube relaxed it's grip on your lips and retracted. The helmet hissed with its release, and was lifted off your head.

You stared at disbelief at what NOVA had done to you.

Your face was... pretty. For a girl. Delicate brows arched above smiley eyes. Your lips glistened with color. Your ears had been double pierced on both sides, and earrings dangled from your ears.

You blinked. Before you could get any word or command out, NOVA announced, "Again, you may experience some discomfort, but you will not be harmed. Please select a style of dress for your blind date."
15431121.title: The machines dress Andi for her blind date

154311211.content:
"I have several clothing selections for you to choose from, each intended to make you look your best for your blind date. Please make your selection at this time," NOVA purred.

The screen sprang to life in front out you, displaying several clothing selections. None would be thought of as anything other than, "perfect for a date."

One outfit consisted of black knee high boots, sporting a pretty high heel, tight jeans, a wide belt lazily draped about the hips, and a vintage rock tee shirt tucked into the jeans. The tee clung tightly displaying curves with the collar notched, revealing just a hint of cleavage. Some jewelry and a baggy purse completed the look.

The other outfit consisted of black pumps, sheer dark hose, and a strapless black tea length cocktail dress. The dress had a few crinolines peeking out from under the skirt. Not enough to make it super poofy. Just enough to give the dress some shape. The strapless top of the dress had a sweetheart neckline and a very thin red belt encircled a similarly thin waist. Like the other outfit, some jewelry and a small clutch completed the look.

You stared in horror, still.immobilized by the machine, at the outfits before you.

"I'm not a woman. I'm not a girl. I'm not going on a blind date with anyone! Now stop this and let me out of here!" you said to the machine.

"Your safety is of my utmost concern. You will be released as soon as you are prepared for your date," NOVA said.

"I told you, you stupid machine," you shouted, "I'm not going on any date, and I'm not wearing....that!" nodding your head in the direction of the video screen.

"Outfit selected," NOVA said.

"Wait! Stop! I didn't..."

"Again I warn you that the process may be uncomfortable, no harm will be done to you," NOVA said, talking over your objections. "Let's get you gorgeous!l

Which outfit did you pick?
