"I hope I can find someone willing to help me," Will thought as he minced towards the town.
15533222211111111111.title: Will Gets Sick

choices: He findsa cobbler that sees his warn boots.
155332222111111111111.content:
It took time but Will eventually made it to town. His stomach had pretty much settled down, which he was thankful for. He did have to pause a few times due to feeling lightheaded, though. He would lean against a building with his hands behind his back and take deep breaths. His chest rising and falling was noticed by more than one person and caused two people to collide since they weren't watching where they were going. Once he would feel better he would wiggle down the streets until he needed to rest again.

Something he noticed pretty quickly was that people seemed really nice here. Everywhere he went other guys would smile at him. He smiled back with his inviting red lips as he passed and many would turn around to watch backside sway. He kept his eyes out for a shop or something so he could try and find a way to ask for a healer. He didn't want to ask someone passing by because he knew it was going to take time to try and explain without a voice.

It wouldn't be long before the towns folk would begin gossiping about the pretty girl that walked into town in her silk dress.
155332222111111111111.title: Will's arrival draws a lot of attention.

1553322221111111111111.content:
Will came to the first shop he saw and entered. There was only a single man there and by the looks of the scene, must have been a cobbler. There were shoes everywhere and he had pair he was currently working on. He didn't notice Will enter so will tried to get his attention. He tried his voice again but his vocal cords were still non functional from those blasted berries. The he finally settled on pursing his lips together and whistling.

The man jumped at the sudden sound and his jaw dropped when he saw Will, or rather, the beautiful woman Will appeared to be. He somehow found a way to pick his tongue up off the floor and came over to will.

"Hi, how can I help you?" he asked.

Will's pretty mouth opened but yet again, nothing came out. The man looked confused so will tapped his throat.

"...You can't speak?" he asked, unsure.

Will nodded and gave the man a smile that quickened the man's heart. Will did a pantomime of writing and the man understood and grabbed a quill and parchment. Will quickly wrote out what happened and handed the page back to the man. The man studied it for some time, but didn't react. He looked up at Will who was looking back expectantly.

"...I uh...I can't read," he said apologetically.

Will slapped his forehead and turned trying to think.

The man got a better look at Will and his back looked just as lovely as his front. That is when he noticed Will's boots. There most have been a time when they were shiny and new but that day was long ago. It was curious to the man to see a woman of such elegance and beauty wearing such a thing. Maybe he could help her out?
1553322221111111111111.title: He findsa cobbler that sees his warn boots.

15533222211111111111111.content:
Suddenly, a pealing echo seems to rip through the sky, a deafening thunder blast. Will started and crouched as best as he could in the silk confinement, before looking back at the shopkeeper who already seems to have headed out a back entrance in panic. Looking around Will half wondered if he should stay, but another, almost screeching noise picks up; and suddenly Will decided that the best thing he could do was to move as far f from that sound as fast as possible.

That was easier said than done with the silk skirt still keeping his legs together, and his sword still pinned to his side under all the silk. Will made it for the door as fast as he could and as he was leaving the shop he tried to pick up speed. But his more frantic pace and the uneven street ground caused him to stumble, falling forward. Bracing for the ground, his fall was arrested at the last second by a strong arm that held him, and then pulled him back onto his feet. Will turned to see a large, well built knight facin him, wearing no helmet but otherwise in full armour.

As Will looked into the knight's blue eyes, the knight seemed to hesitate, almost like he was staring at Will. Will tried to thank him but again no noise would come out. Fortunately the knight seemed to snap out of whatever daze he was in and quickly responded. "No need for thanks, but we must get you to safety."

Before Will could try to respond, he suddenly found himself hoisted up by the knight and in a princess carry. Before he can say anything else, the knight picked up pace and dashed down the street. Will was stunned at this turn of events, but he'd heard of knights going about doing good work. He must have seen Will's limited mobility and come to help, and Will certainly wasn't about to turn down help to get to safety, he could see several several villagers rushing in the same general direction... but safety from what?

Another screech ripped through the air, and that's when Will saw it. Far behind them but closing fast. A great, dark dragon.
15533222211111111111111.title: A sudden storm arrives

choices: There is trouble on the way, maybe involving helping someone
155332222111111111111111.content:
As they raced on, the knight suddenly took a left turn around the side of an inn, and then delicately placed Will back on the ground. Will turned to see what the delay was, but the knight was already furiously unhitching a horse from a post and very quickly checking the saddle.

Well, Will thought, a horse would definitely be a fast way to get moving, but how would Will be able to get his legs on both sides of the saddle with his silk casing? His thoughts were interrupted has the knight suddenly hoisted him up onto the horse and placed him sidesaddle. The knight mounted the horse astride behind him. With a click of the reigns, the horse was back on the main village street. Will tried to get a look at the dragon but somehow his view got blocked, often by the big knight behind him who held Will close to stop him from falling off. The saddle was clearly not designed for a sidesaddle passenger and every gallop the horse made threatened to dislodge Will from the horses back, so Will pressed against the knight and wrapped his arms around him. The knight thankfully seemed to understand.

"There's a shelter up ahead," said the knight, "either a cave or some building. I haven't seen it myself, but I made sure to know of its location when I arrived here. That's where we're all going."

Will could looked as they overtook several running villagers. He couldn't imagine how well he would have fared if he hadn't been rescued by this knight... who's name he didn't even know...

"I'm Kevin by the way." Will looked up at Kevin's face and smiled, happily noting Kevin returned the smile warmly. Kevin seemed to understand without Will having to say anything, which was a relief.

The galloped on leaving the village behind, the sounds behind them seemed to change in nature including great big whooshing noices, and mix with more human yells and screams. Will was totally unused to this and began to feel a sick, Kevin just rode on.
155332222111111111111111.title: They keep racing to safety

choices: A little girl comes up to him
Something rouses Will from his perch
1553322221111111111111111.content:
Soon they reach the shelter, a deep low cave into the side of some surprisingly low cliffs. Being on horseback they were some of the earliest people to arrive, but more villagers seemed to arrive every moment. Slowing down, Will finally got a good look at the village behind them and was horrified, at several parts flames leaped into the sky while other parts were charred and smouldering. Smoke billowed up and, with a suddenly erupting tongue of flame, Will could suddenly see the dragon, swooping across the city like a bird of prey, flame lashing the city below. Will could just about see some other villagers trying to leave the village and his heart sank.

Kevin gently lowered Will to the ground and looked down at Will from his steed. "I need to go back, other people need me." Will simply nodded.

But then Kevin hesitated, he focused his deep blue eyes strongly on Will's brown eyes and said "I promise I'll be back, your safety is something I shall always do my utmost to protect" and with that he turned his horse and galloped off.

Will blinked. Safety? He was already at the shelter, Kevin was certainly dedicated to the people he rescued.

But as Kevin galloped off into the distance, Will felt a pang of... guilt. Kevin had quite possibly saved his life, his life instead of some other villager who'd probably lived in the village his whole life. Will never pretended to be some noble hearted adventurer, but he didn't want his quest for fortune to cause hardship for others. And now the dragon, he looked at it as it swooped a wide angle, ready to make another pass over the town. He'd been looking it as his ticket to great riches, but here it was causing huge devastation and problems for real people....

Sighing, Will sat down on a sloping boulder. Arms supporting him from behind, pushing his chest up; legs resting on the boulder pointing his knees to the sides, like a statue of poignancy. A couple of villagers came up to him, but he just responded non-committally. His eyes glazed over as he watched the dragon seem to calm down, and more toy with the village, but still breaking buildings and driving people away.
1553322221111111111111111.title: They reach the shelter

choices: ...stay out and see if there's something you can do
15533222211111111111111111.content:
Why the destruction? Why the devastation? Will's glazed eyes looked on...

"Hello, you're very pretty."

Will started, he looked down to see an 8 year old girl looking up at him with big eyes. Confuddled, Will tried to say that the girl was pretty too, but of course couldn't say anything. Instead he smiled, nodded, and lightly pointed towards the girl. Something about kids made it easier to be theatrical.

"You think I'm pretty too?" the girl asked open eyed. Will nodded, and was delighted to see the girl beam back at him. Something about her bright and enthusiastic demeanour broke through his cloudy mind.

"Can I... can I paint your nails?" Will laughed silently. He'd heard of kids doing such thing in the name of fun, and while some men would scoff at doing such a thing, who was Will to get in the way of a child's happiness?

He nodded to the child's delight and sat down in the grass beside her. Apparently the kid had what looked like her Mum's cosmetics in a small bag she had tied around her waist. It was surprisingly high quality stuff, her Mum must have really cared about appearances. The child furrowed her brow and focused on painting Will's nails with the concentration of a surgeon. "My name is Samantha," she said, "and one day I'm going to go to a castle and make all the princesses look beautiful. And the queen too! But Dad says you have to work up to that, so I'll make the princesses look beautiful and the Queen will be so happy with that she'll want me to make her beautiful too!"

Will's heart is lightened by her upbeat nature and smiles as she talks on. Soon a worried looking mother approaches, she's a bit taken aback to see you (though you nod to reassure her), but she then urges her daughter to move into the cave. "Just a minute Mummy," she replies, and against her Mum's protestations, she finishes her work.

Looking down at his now bright red nails, Will is surprised that Samantha did such a good job, they look bright and vibrant. Looking back to her he smiles thanks, she smiles back and then her mother hustles her off to the cave, throwing an apology to Will, while Samantha says she hopes to see him soon.

With Will's mood lifted, he decides what to do. Should he...
15533222211111111111111111.title: A little girl comes up to him

155332222111111111111111112.content:
Will takes a few steps forward and tries to look around. It's been getting dark, but the cave is nearby and part of him is a bit worried about Kevin. The village is still on fire and smoking, though the fire has spread to some new areas and has died down in others. There are far less cries and screams, everything seems quieter, eerily quiet, like an aftermath. No matter how hard Will looks through the gloom, the dragon is nowhere to be seen.

By this stage Will was used to the trickle of villagers passing by the rock to enter the cave, but then he notices something a bit unusual. Two horses pulling a broken cart and at a pretty decent speed. Looking close he sees a knight on one of the horses, and the horse the same brilliant white as the one he was on earlier that day. Skuttering closer, Will sees it is indeed Kevin on the horse, and the two horses combined are dragging a barely functioning cart holding a whole family of people, who are clinging on as the two horses pulling it up the slope.

Will waved at Kevin and Kevin waved back and soon the cart has stopped at the cave mouth and its passengers are dismounting. After quickly checking over everyone Kevin returned to Will.

"A farmer family," he explained, "they broke an axle trying to get away on the cart. We've probably done even more damage to the cart by having dragging it here but more than worth it to get to safety. But enough of that, get into the cave, the dragon might still be about."

Deciding it hadn't been the best move to stay outside, Will joins Kevin, the farmer family, and even some horses, and enters the low but fairly spacious cave.

There are murmurs of "is it over?", crying about lost friends or possessions, much talk of who is okay, and so on.

Will feels he can't engage with this, it's too much and still doesn't know anyone, so with a few comforting shoulder presses, he find an unoccupied part of the cave and lies down. After a bit of discomfort, a kindly stranger hands him a bag with something soft in it which Will thankfully accepts as a pillow. Lying back, and despite being famished, everything that he has done today catches up with him and Will drifts off to sleep.
155332222111111111111111112.title: ...stay out and see if there's something yo...

choices: Will wants to go with Kevin
Will mingles with the poeple to learn about the dragon
1553322221111111111111111121.content:
Will's sleep was deep and turbulent, spiders wrapping him in more and more web, dragons firing flames into him, giants bashing him against stone, it seemed like the whole world was unsafe, out for him. But he gradually woke to bustle and talk and commotion as the cave gradually came back to life.

Someone had put a blanket on him, which he appreciated, but didn't know who.

Some had managed to bring or retrieve food, and were now cooking it over a campfire. Coming closer, Will found himself offered milk and porridge, which he gratefully accepted and ate with gusto, though he carefully manged each spoon of porridge since he imagined spilling any would give a bad impression if the dragon attack made any of this food scarse. He had to admire the people, they'd received a blow, and certainly their spirits were down and would take some time to recover, but they were continuing on, making food, keeping going, even offering food to someone who had been with them less than a day. He would have liked some way to help them.

The early morning went to mid-morning, a few seemed to leave the cave, and then Kevin appeared at the cave mouth.

"Greeting everyone, I am Kevin of Hofstead, a knight currently in the employ of Lord Denham," there were a few cynical remarks at the mention of the Lord's name, but nothing too vitriolic, "From what I can see, the dragon has left us, and the town while badly damaged does have some areas intact. You all have my deepest sympathy for anything you may have lost." More low key discussion, "I will not pretend to know what you are going through right now, but I will do everything in my power to stop it from happening again. First I shall send word back to Lord Denham about this attack, letting him know the dragon is a serious threat to be dealt with. This may lead to some strong action, but I won't wait for that because, second. I shall challenge the dragon myself." There were gasps from around the cave, Will's eyes widened. Why would any single man think he had a chance even getting near a.... oh!
1553322221111111111111111121.title: Next morning

choices: Look for a sword or someone who can cut you free
See the campfire heat would help
15533222211111111111111111211.content:
Kevin talked a bit more about how he was prepared, it was his duty, and that if he definitely could not defeat the dragon he'd learn what he could to support a future attack. Many villagers thanked him and expressed best wishes for him, some villagers were just glad they weren't him. After a few more words to inspire and comfort the villagers, and quickly confirming that his message to Lord Denham was on his way, Kevin returned to his horse a made a final check before leaving.

Will wasn't sure where to go at this point. Sure, his original goal had been the Dragon's Horde, but he'd seen with his own eyes how formidable a dragon was. At the very least he'd need.... someone who could back him up.

Will looked at Kevin again. Reliable, trustworthy, was heading straight to the dragon, probably more experienced and less likely to walk into spider webs, and when they reached the lair? Well, deal with that issue when they come to it but he would definitely have more options with someone by his side. And surely Kevin would be happy to have someone have his back too?

There was just one minor issue... the silk. It was nice that no one had made fun of him for effectively wearing a spider web as clothing. Feeling himself down (not noticing some strange reactions from villagers), Will confirmed it wrapped around his arms, his full upper body, and most frustratingly: still wrapped his two legs together to below the knees. He'd need to make sure he had full leg mobility before doing anything close to questing.
15533222211111111111111111211.title: Will wants to go with Kevin

choices: It's too late, Kevin has left.
155332222111111111111111112111.content:
Will considered asking Kevin for his sword, but decided not to bother him especially in case he damaged something they'd need. Looking around, Wills saw among some foodstuffs a short, serrated knife used for stuff like cutting ham, and borrowed it. Going back to a more private area of the cave, Will pushed the knife down into the fabric between his legs, but the silk proved tough. A cutting motion at the very end of the skirt seemed to cause minor fraying but that was it. Then Will had a brainwave, he returned to the campfire, placed the knife blade in the fire, waited, and then took it back to the alcove. This time, will was delighted to see the web sizzle and give way as he attacked the hem.

However, it was still slow going and the knife cooled down fast, but Will had another great idea. Heating up the knife again, this time he cut at the side of him, and after some surgical cuts... he could see his great sword hilt peeking out. Will finally had his sword back, and pulling it free he saw a chance to speed everything up. He put the sword blade in the fire, left it a long time, even throwing in a bit of wood; and back at the aclove finally put its point to the ground and pressed its blade against the silk, pushing his hard as he could to cut the silk through between his legs.

With sizzling and a bit of steam, Will feel the sword move as it made its way through both sets of silk. He could feel his legs getting freer and being able to move them apart. Finally looking down, he saw instead of a skirt, what looked like two silk leggings, perfectly sealed all the way his legs. Somehow when cutting the skirt, he'd also managed to seal the front and back parts of it together. Just like his arms, they were wrapped in spider silk, though thankfully not bound or restricted.

However, it hadn't perfectly sealed up a the crotch area. He took the opportunity to discretely relieve himself, but Will really didn't want people to get a view there however brief. So with delicate and understandably nervous motions, Will pulled the silk together and moved the flat of his still hot blade up to it. The silk sizzled, but seemed to melt and join together in a seamless seam. Then suddenly it dried and... hrk! The silk suddenly tightened and pressed against his crotch with tremendous strength. Will dropped the sword and doubled over in pain as he imagined the web ending him in such an unexpected way. But, gradually the pain eased and he could see that webbing had constricted, flattening his crotch area. While tight, it all looked smooth, and Will had to take comfort in the fact that this was far preferable to accidentally flashing people.

Taking heart in this Will decided overall this was definitely an improvement, and making a few strides up and down the cavern, Will felt more confident.
155332222111111111111111112111.title: Look for a sword or someone who can cut you free

choices: Maybe staying in the village isn't so bad
1553322221111111111111111121111.content:
As Will walked back through the cave, some villagers noticed this apparent outfit change and it drew their eyes and murmured. Some watched as Will walked out of the cavern and up to the great knight on his horse. Others were already gathered around the knight to see him off.

As Will approached, Kevin caught sight of him, smiled and quickly dismounted. "I'm so glad to see you! I was looking for you earlier but you seemed to have gone off. Anyway, I understand you're not a native to this town so I've spoken with the mayor and he says he'll arrange for someone to give you lodgings. I shall go to the dragon and if the result leaves me still able to walk, I shall return here. I don't know what you intend to do in the meantime, but I hope to see you here when I return." He said the last bit leaning a bit closer.

Will shook his head, and Will's face fell. "Of course, I wish you luck in what you plan to do."

Will shook his head harder and gestured to the horse trying to make a mounting motion, Will's eyes widened "You want to come with me?" Will nodded. "To the dragon's lair?" Will nodded again. "It's dangerous, very dangerous, I cannot guarantee your safety. There are many things out there, bandits, giant snakes, steep terrain, not to mention the dragon itself. Are you sure you're ready for that?"
1553322221111111111111111121111.title: Will goes to Kevin

choices: They keep travelling till first camp
15533222211111111111111111211111.content:
In answer, Will brought up his sword, and wielded it in a professional stance (thank goodness for leg movement). He tried to wield it as he'd been taught to, but frustratingly Kevin looked at him in astonished amusement, almost like he would burst out laughing. "Well... that is quite a lot more spirit than I was expecting out of you!"

Will looked at Kevin with a mix of confusion and annoyance. Was he being patronised?

Kevin noticed the look and tried to push his humour aside, "I'm sorry," he said, "I just did not swordplay to come out of someone like you."

Will sagged his shoulders looking down, he guessed he would need more actual experience with a sword before a greatly experience knight like Kevin would take him seriously. But then Will felt Kevin's heavy gauntleted hand on his shoulder, and Kevin was looking into his eye "But one should not judge by appearance, a very fatal mistake to make. I'm sure that's not the last surprise you have." Will smiled weakly, but noticed that Kevin was now looking at him thoughtfully. "You want to do something don't you? Anything you can? Whatever you can?" Will nodded vigorously. "And you realise there are no guarantees? I will do everything I can to protect you, but if you choose to join me on this quest anything could happen and I can't, and it breaks my heat to say this, but I can't promise I'll be able to keep you safe." Will nodded, more slowly this time.

Kevin smiled wryly, "Very well, but you need to do exactly what I tell you to do and heed my advice, in the wilderness there is very little margin for error and we can't leave anything to chance." Will nodded, he felt Kevin was underestimating him but admittedly his most recent escapades had left him wrapped in a spiderweb and unable to talk, following someone more experienced seemed like the smart option.

Kevin nodded once, "Then we are off." Kevin stowed Will's sword on the saddle, mounted the horse and pulled Will up onto the saddle in front of him, Will thankful to be astride.

Will was suddenly surprised by the reaction of the villagers. They were anxiously insisting he shouldn't go and saything these terrible warnings about what could happen to him, some men even offered him lodgings. So little time he'd spent with them, and yet again they seemed to care so much for a simple stranger. "Your concern is appreciated, but we all must be free to make our own decisions," Will nodded in agreement, glad once again Kevin put effect to his thoughts. Will waved to the villagers to thank them, and in a flash of good humour, theatrically blew kisses. The thunderously enthusiastic response to surprised him and he started to think that now was the right moment to leave.

But there was one more event before they left, the young girl from before was waving with both hands, and anxiously trying to give them something. Kevin slowed down the horse for her and some of the crowd even went silent to support her.

"I know you're doing something dangerous, but my charm will keep you safe. Also it looks pretty." Will took what she held out and examined it. It was a well crafted handmade bracelet, a series of nice stones threaded by a simple piece of string. Some were bright colours like green, others seemed transparent, others were marbled or textured. Probably not worth much but beautiful to look at. More to the point, Will was touched by the thought. He got off the horse and thanked the girl with a big hug, the crowd cheering at the touching moment.

Now was really the time to get going. Will remounted, Kevin flipped his reigns and the horse cantered then galloped off, the crowed behind them cheering as they fell further and further behind them.
15533222211111111111111111211111.title: Definitely

choices: The Janbiya bandit wants to take Will somewhere
Will and Kevin try to deal with the robbery
155332222111111111111111112111111.content:
They had been travelling for a while, big trees passed by on both sides of them as they cantered down a dirt track. Will's long black wavy hair would occasionally get in his eyes, reminding himself to get another ponytail when he wasn't constantly dealing with one thing or another, but for the moment he just swept it aside. At first the saddle was uncomfortable, pressing Will and Kevin's body together as they bumped along, but he'd gotten used to it. Sometimes Kevin's arm would come in front of Will and hold him securely to Kevin's body. It seemed unnecessary but Will knew Kevin was determined to keep him safe.

Overall the journey was... boring. Kevin hadn't spoken much, probably with many deep thoughts on his mind of the days ahead, and with Will unable to speak and neither able to read each-others faces as they were both looking the same direction, conversation would have been frustrating. After the initial buzz and excitement, it was now trotting along forest trails. Will wished for something to liven it up.

Men jumped out "Stand and deliver!"

Be careful what you wish for, thought Will.

Kevin pulled the horse to a stop. Four or five men approached from all sides but two at the front (one with a crossbow, the other with a bow and arrow) seemed to keep their distance.

"I am Kevin of..."

"I don't care who you are, get down and empty your saddlebags," the thief with the crossbow said. Kevin slowly dismounted. "You too Rose."

Rose? thought Will. A memory stirred, and he reached his had back through his hair to find... the rose was still there! Dammit, no wonder the girl called him pretty. It seemed it was still tangled in his hair, and still fresh.

"I said get down," the bolt's point waved at him menacingly. Hurriedly Will turned to dismount, only he wasn't that used to saddles and horses. His foot got caught in the stirrup, he lost his balance and fell face flat right into the dirt, wrenching his foot slightly

"Rose!" Kevin called out. Great, thought Will, now even Kevin had picked up the nickname, I should have spelled a name out for him before we.... Will had been pushing himself up while trying to wave away Kevin's concern, but now a bandit wielding a Janbiya (very exotic) grabbed Will one handed by the neck, pulled him up and pushed him against the side of the horse, which shuffled but remained still. Will immediately grasped the arm that was holding him with his painted hands, but held back. The bandit looked into Will's deep brown eyes, then to his wavy jet black hair with a single fragrant rose, face with bright red lips, white silk encased body with the narrow waist, and then back to the brown eyes.

"So... what are you doing out here?" asked the bandit with a broadening grin.

Moving to Will's side, Kevin answered "We are on our way to kill the dragon." The bandits burst into laughter.

"And what are you going to do? Make an offering?" the bandit replied nodding towards Will. Will and Kevin scowled.

"If you're interested at all in ending the dragon's reign of terror, surely you'll let us go."

The crossbow bandit stepped forward with an air of authority. Still pointing his crossbow at them he said "Well we could, if, you know, I thought you had a snails' hair's chance of doing more damage than just pissing on it. And that's if I even believed you are going off to the dragon, and not, maybe, some couple going off to elope."

Will rolled his eyes at the low-brow humour, he was worried that Kevin would feel his masculinity attacked and get angry, but encouragingly he let the comment slide. "I suppose you have no reason to believe us, but know this: We have just come from a town ravaged by a dragon attack, mothers, fathers, children all flushed out of their home, lives destroyed, buildings and livelihoods decimated, and that is only the most recent in a long line of destruction that dragon has wrought. Maybe that dragon has led to you having to take this course of action to survive, or maybe you have long subsisted off this way of living yet you've noticed a drop off in gains as the dragon's actions have made everyone poorer. Either way, it is best for all of us that the dragon is vanquished from this land, and whatever you do to us, whatever parts of us remain, we will fight on and do everything we can to make sure that dragon sees its last day."

As the crossbow bandit heard Kevin's speech, he gradually relaxed his grip and lowered the crossbow, as Kevin finished the bandit stood, looked around, nodded to Kevin, then quickly raised the crossbow "Nope, we're still robbing you"
155332222111111111111111112111111.title: Bandit attack

choices: Wait for the bandit to take the first move
1553322221111111111111111121111111.content:
"Well you can all rob him, I'm taking this one off to get... information..." the Janbiya bandit smirked, hand still clasped around Will's neck.

"NO," yelled Kevin, lurching forward, eyes wide with terror, but was stopped by a sword bandit. Will had to admit, going with the bandit probably wouldn't lead to a good time.

"Really?" the crossbow bandit asked, ignoring the knight, "If you do this you're not getting as big a share"

"You can have my whole share if you like."

"Alright, but be ready when we finish or we're leaving you behind."

"Deal, now c'mon," the bandit grabbed Will roughly by the arm and hustled him toward the forest.

"You will not lay a hand on -OWWWW" a bandit punched Kevin squarely in the face, another one knocked him down from behind, and suddenly bandits all around were kicking at him. Shocked Will struggled towards Kevin to help him.

"He'll be fine if you don't resist," said the bandit wrenching Will back towards the trees, "Isn't that right lads?" The other bandits replied half heartedly in agreement and eased off attacking Kevin. Will felt he had to accept this, at least until they were out of sight and went with the bandit towards the woods. As they were crossing the threshold Will thought he could hear Keving groan "Rose!" but without an obvious choice, he stepped on.

Will couldn't figure out what all that talk back there had been about, or exactly what to do now, but he knew he was going from a 2-4 situation to a 1-1 situation. Of course he didn't have his sword, and his foot hurt.... his foot! Will started limping hard, If he exaggerated his injury it could help to take the bandit off guard, but the bandit just got more annoyed in response to this and pulled Will along hard.

Before Will could give the situation more thought, they reached a mini cliff of earth. "Sit" the bandit commanded, and Will sat on the embankment.

The bandit steadied his breathing and looked a Will, looking him all over. Will did not like the look in his eye, he wanted something from him and it wasn't information. The bandit looked more, his breathing becoming heavier, tossing the Janbiya from one hand to the other and suddenly Will realised... The bandit was a serial murder! A vicious monster that killed for the sake of killing before moving onto his next victim. He wasn't going to let Will leave the forest alive.

The realisation chilled Will to the bone and his stomach lurched. Why did he keep ending up in these situations?
1553322221111111111111111121111111.title: The Janbiya bandit wants to take Will somewhere

choices: See if there's anything in the area that could help
15533222211111111111111111211111112.content:
Will steadied his breathing with calm breaths, an tried to figure out the situation. If only he could speak. He knew he was quick-tongued when under pressure and could probably find some way to gain an advantage or opportunity, but instead he'd have to grab whatever opportunities came up.

"You know, you should smile more," the bandit said distastefully.

Will shot back with a mix between a wry grin and an outright grimace.

"Ah, come on now" the bandit said as he approached. "We don't have very long here," another step, "so lets make every moment count." Now crouching in front of Will, he reached out and brushed a strand of hair out of Will's face and behind his ear. His eyes glistened with anticipation, "C'mon, be more enthusiastic!"

Will responded with an expertly timed full force head-but, smashing the top part of his head against the bandit's face.

The bandit staggered back and lost his balance, Will jumped to his feet and approached for another hit, but the bandit partially recovered and swung with his curved dagger. The blade seemed to graze off Will's leg, but there didn't seem to be damage or pain. Of course, thought Will, the magic belt was still on him, but no time to consider that now. Will kicked hard with his full body force against the Bandit's upper body and he fell back on the ground. Before he could recover, Will jumped up and slammed his foot down on the bandit's midsection, and again, and again. The bandit spasmed each time and dropped the knife, but on Will's fourth kick, the bandit grabbed his boot. Frustrated, Will tried to move away, struggling for a moment like a tug of war before he pulled his foot free. The bandit fell back with the boot, but the prepared Will quickly regained balance and with one bare foot he took a step forward and slammed his other boot into the side of the bandit's head. At last, it seemed to do something as the bandit became dazed and disorientated. Will furiously kicked a few more times until the bandit's eyes slid shut and he clearly seemed unconscious.

The furious fight was over, simple woodland sounds took over, Will took a moment to take it all in, but knew he had little time to think over the events right now.

First he ensured the Janbiya was well out of the bandit's reach. Examining the dagger, Will appreciated it's good quality and sharp blade. Then he noticed the dagger's sheath, attached to the bandit's belt. Seeing no reason not to take advantage of the situation, Will unclasped and removed the belt from the bandit, carefully ensuring he was still unconscious while doing so, and strapped the belt to his own waist instead, sheathing the Janbiya firmly. The belt hugged his waist snugly, and looked good with its brown leather contrasting strongly against his pure white "clothing". Patting the sheathed Janbiya, Will affirmed he would not be caught unarmed again. There was also a pouch on the belt containing some coin and a couple of vials of chemicals that Will did not have the time to examine right now. Checking that the bandit didn't have anything else on him, Will stepped back and admired his took in the supine body before him.

What he'd done, he'd needed to do, but now what to do with the bandit. Will decided that he wasn't a murderer, but just leaving the man out here seemed like asking for trouble. He'd heard stories of unconscious enemies left unattended only for them to come to and spoil the heroes' plan at the last moment; and more to the point if Will's assessment of him was right, the man was a serial murderer with every future murder he committed could potentially be on Will's conscious.

Pondering it for as long as he dared under the circumstances, Will made a decision. He found a big rock and lugging it to the bandit, he heaved it above his head and brought it crashing down on the bandit's leg. He wasn't sure if he hard a crack, but knew the bandit's chances of walking were severely diminished over the short term. What would happen to him in the long term would be left to the bandit, the forest and the stars; but not to Will. He had other priorities, chief among them, rescuing Kevin.
15533222211111111111111111211111112.title: Wait for the bandit to take the first move

choices: Rescue Kevin while the leader is gone.
155332222111111111111111112111111121.content:
Heading back to where they'd come from, walked slowly and quietly so as not to alert anyone, Will tried to come up with a plan. While possibilities presented themselves to him, he'd need to see what the scene was like to figure out what would work.

He finally made it to the edge of the road and crawling under a bush, he got the best view of the hold up site as he could. Three, definitely three, bandits in sight. Kevin on his knees with the sword bandit hovering over him. The leader still holding his crossbow, with his back towards Will and engaged in conversation with Kevin, and the archer looking through items taken from Kevin's horse, putting some of them in the saddlebags of a new horse tied up nearby. As Will took it all in, snatches of conversation wafted to him.

"And how can we tell that your are telling the truth?"

"A Lord Denham bond is always honoured, and I have sway. If need be I can forfeit some of my property to contribute to it."

"But only if your 'friend' is unharmed?"

"We can make deals with criminals, even bandits. But never with people who enact the greatest evil upon others in return for only brief a brief moment of pleasure for themselves."

Muttering "Hmmmm, a lot that could go wrong, but still..." the leader thought for a moment, "Brandon," he called to the archer, "see if you can stop Erik. I know he likes a good leadup so you may have time."

"No way; not while he's waving that knife around, you let him go out there in the first place, you can stop him."

"Alright, keep things secure till I get back," and turned towards the forest.

Will scuppered backward out of the bush and crouching he put more trees and bushes between him and the leader, hoping any noise he may have made would be attributed to woodland creatures. Kevin's touching gesture had put the odds more in their favour. Will had to take advantage of this.
155332222111111111111111112111111121.title: Return directly to help Kevin

choices: The swordsman holding Kevin hostage, futher away
The archer with holstered bow dealing with the stolen items, closer
1553322221111111111111111121111111211.content:
A fast departure was preferable, but Will needed to be sure they had a good chance of success. Will moved far back into the forest to be sure that the most obvious sounds would be muffled, but a shout or a yell...

While the forest didn't have a path per say, Will could see the most likely route the leader would take in following his comrade. There was cover all around but Will needed to take the leader as off guard as possible. Time to go with the classic.

Will grabbed a whole handful of red berries off a bush and squeezed them so a red juice came out. He patted it against his stomach so the front of his garment was stained red. Throwing the belt into a bush, he kept the Janbiya in his right hand and put more berries in his left hand.

The delicate part: lying back down on the ground, right side of him facing away from the bandit's approach, right hand and Janbiya close to his body and partially covered with leaves. With his left hand he squeezed again and left a trail of red juice from the side of his mouth down his left cheek, then he simply patted his left hand on the big red stain, rolled his head back and waited.

The approaching cracks of branches and footsteps showed, the leader had no concern for stealth, something followed by his sudden yell "ERIK? WHERE ARE YOU?... I NEED YOU TO STOP, THERE'S MONEY INVOLVED, WE NEED TO..." he stopped, there before him, white with a strong accent of red standing out against the drab woodland colours, lay Will.

"Oh dammit!" the leader raced up to Will, taking in the red stains, and then crouched low,putting a hand on either side of Will's face in a surprisingly close gesture. "Please, give me some sign you're alive." Will obliged...

Will didn't like to think about what happened next, for many they would question whether this sort of life was really for them. Will thrust, and pulled and thrust again. The bandit's face was a mask of shock, Will took this opportunity to push him back, his red stained hand over his mouth, and took this guaranteed silence to stab again... and again...

Will was no doctor, but in a short while he could see the life draining out of him and removed his hand from the man's mouth with no risk of shouts arising. Will stood up, a bit shocked himself, his pure white garment now vividly blood stained. He'd been in fights before, but he'd never killed anyone before now. Then again, before now there'd never been anyone who he desperately wanted to protect. Kevin had done so much for him, and a decent person like him deserved to be safe.

Will avoided looking back at the blood stained thief, giving one solemn nod and once again focused on the task at hand. He picked up his belt again, and the bandit's crossbow on the ground a bit away (must have put it down on seeing Will). Still loaded with a bolt, Will picked it up and returned once again to the side of the road, taking up position again under the bush.

With all the chaotic events that had happened, things now seemed pretty simple. While not skilled with a crossbow, Will could pick off a stationary target from a steady, prone position. He just needed to choose.
1553322221111111111111111121111111211.title: Ambush the leader

choices: They see a light not too far away
15533222211111111111111111211111112111.content:
Aiming towards the swordsman, accounting as best as he could for drop off, Will pulled the trigger and let the bolt fly. Embedding itself a little lower than centre mass of its target, the swordsman looked at the shaft stunned and dropped his sword. Kevin did not miss a moment, up against the swordsman, his leg behind the swordsman and knocking him over. Quick as a flash he picked up the fallen sword and plunged it downward.

The archer, of all ironies, had two weapons but neither of them ready. He struggled to get the bow off his shoulder but seeing how fast Kevin dispatched his comrade, he tried to draw his sword instead. He was barely ready when Kevin faced him, bloodied sword in hand and a moment of silence passed as they looked at eachother. Then the archer turned and ran pell-mell into the forest on the opposite side of the road, disappearing with a rustle of branches.

It was... over?

Will stepped out from the forest. Kevin caught sight of him. In a moment they were together and suddenly embraced. After a moment, Kevin pushed them apart looking at Will and his blood soaked clothes "Are you harmed? Did they hurt you?" Will shook his head. Kevin glanced at the crossbow and the holstered Janbiya and got a sense of what had happened. Without saying anything he embraced Will again.

Will placed his chin on Kevin's shoulder, finding himself crying. Was this normal? Kevin sensed Will's emotion and patted him on the back as they held eachother "You shouldn't have had to go through that. It was terrible.... But you saved us. Thank you." Will burst into more tears and wished he could say something; something about how Kevin saved them too, or asking if it was all his fault, or apologising for forcing Kevin to negotiate with bandits. But right now maybe he just wanted to be held, to be near someone who understood. Someone who had ended human life yet still remained a decent person; someone who knew the world could be cruel and sometimes we are faced with difficult decisions and have to make the best of it; someone who knew that Will had killed yet would look at him without judgement. Someone who he was very lucky to have.

For many moments they embraced, Will finding Kevin a great rock to cry on, and then gradually the tears dried up, his sobbing subsided, and soon they stepped apart.

Will felt emotionally drained and somewhat fuzzy headed, but Kevin took charge. He regathered the the stolen items, checked over the swordsman, sorted through some of the bandit's possessions, and then surprisingly hitched the bandit's horse to their own. Despite this extra horse, Will was glad to see that after mounting his own horse Kevin pulled Will up in front of him. Maybe early on all this personal contact would have been awkward, but all that they'd been through had forged a bond between the pair, an understanding. Will didn't mind, and even welcomed, that Kevin wrapped his arm around in front of him him and held him close, and that this lasted through their entire journey.

They galloped on until twilight.
15533222211111111111111111211111112111.title: The swordsman holding Kevin hostage, futher away

155332222111111111111111112111111121111.content:
By evening, everything that the pair had been holding back fell on top of them at once.

Firstly they were saddle sore, but they quickly stretched their legs and after getting the main aches out they figured the rest would settle down while they attended to more pressing needs

Secondly, they were exhausted, but sleep wasn't that far away so that would be sorted.

Thirdly, they were ravenously hungry.

The sensible thing to do would have been to stop in the afternoon to eat but either through emotion, adrenalin stalled appetites or just to put as much distance between them and the bandits as possible; they had rode on.

This need was dealt with with food supplies the knight had brought. Bread, cheese, fish, apples, some weak beer and even ham, it was good, filling and invigorating. Will suspected that due to what had happened today, Kevin was playing loose with whatever rationing system he'd set up for the trip. Just as well.

But the eating exacerbated the fourth issue: Will really needed to relieve himself, in both ways. Kevin had already discretely wandered off, but Will had problems that were pressing hard on him like the lower part of his garment. No fire had been lit, so Will didn't have a heated blade open the garment. Hee'd have to find some other way to do it not to mention way to fix it afterwards.

Kevin returned, "If you wish to to clean yourself, I heard running water off in that direction," he said pointing.

Ah yes. Fifthly, Will was still totally bloodsoaked, dried thankfully. With this and the previous problem using a spiderweb as a clothing garment had probably outlived its novelty, if it had one in the first place. Maybe he could finally deal with it.

Which would lead to, sixthly, clothes. If he was going to get the web off... if he COULD get the web off... he'd need them.

Will sighed, deal with a life and death situation and make it through; and you still have to deal with stuff like THIS.

Tired but tense, Will stood up, checked his Janbiya was still holstered, pulled what seemed like a robe from a saddle bag on the bandit's horse, and walked in the direction Kevin pointed.

"Here," said Kevin, offering a slightly bulging single strap leather bag. Will had seen Kevin with that bag when sorting out their and the bandit's gear after the attack (when Will had seen the robe). He didn't know what was in it, but trusted that Kevin would ensure its contents were good. Without stopping he nodded thanks, took the bag and headed for the rumoured water.
155332222111111111111111112111111121111.title: They stop and make camp

choices: Cut off the entire spiderweb garment
Just cut the garment enough to relieve himself
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
Will reached a shallow but wide pond in the middle of a small brook in the forest.

Dropping the robe and bag beside the pool, he quickly marched a safe distance away from the water and took out the Janbiya. It blood glinted in the failing light and on catching sight of it Will hesitated, but urges of nature forced him on. He could either:
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: Continue

choices: Will remembers to clean the blood
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
Will lowered his curved dagger to his leg. Anxious not to mix the blood on the blade with his own, he at first made careful cuts, but anxious to be able to relieve himself he became more and more forceful. Then his knife slipped...

...and Will remembered, again, that he was wearing the Giant's belt. Knowing the blade would not harm him, he quickly made the cuts he needed.

First he cut a slit, starting against his inside upper thigh, along the bottom of his crotch (very thankful for belt protection at this point), and down the inside part of his other upper thigh. Already the garment released some of its pressure and he exhaled, but his task wasn't over. The slits on both sides stopped a bit above the knees, here Will simply cut around the leg, splitting the entire garment into its main part and two "leggings".
Grabbing both sides of the garment around his thighs, Will pulled up. With relief he found the garment separated from the lowerpart that covered his legs, and with the slit he was able to pull past his lower regions up to his waist. His nether regions being free, Will finally ducked behind a bush and let it all out. As he did so, he let out an almost inappropriate sound of relief.

Later, and with Will feeling somewhat drained (partially in a literal sense), he returned to the brook, washed up downstream from the pool and went up to the pool to sort out his clothes.

The bag Kevin had given him thankfully contained a basic sewing kit, which Will used to mend all the cuts he'd made to his garment. Sewing it back to how it had been before would run into the same problems, and making more cuts could make the whole thing more likely to fall apart. So for now Will joined the left and right parts on the front, and also the left and right parts on the back. Looking down, he could feel the smooth garment flow from his body down past his hips to hug his thighs in one single tube. He had to admit he'd done a good job with the sewing, but hoped Kevin wouldn't mind the slightly unusual style. Then again, he'd been understanding so far.

The silk "stockings were harder to figure out. At first Kevin just wanted them gone, and tried to pull them off his feet. But with a cold breeze he decided some sort of leg warmth would be a good idea. He pulled them down so they covered his ankles, and with his boots on, his whole lower legs were covered. Still though, he felt they went up too far, and he wouldn't mind some knee mobility. Kevin considered just cutting the them just below his knees, but was wary of wasting more "fabric". So then he opened them at the top and folded them back on themselves so they were shortened to just under his knees.

With his boots back on, it looked like he was wearing a long thin stockings over his feet and calves, then his bare knees, then the hem of his upper garment that coated his torso and arms. It was too dark for Will to see himself properly now, but he decided that people didn't remark on clothing as much as you'd expect, and besides, having functional clothing was a priority if they were really going to take on a dragon.
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: Just cut the garment enough to relieve himself

1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
As Will moves to put the Janbiya away, one of the last rays of daylight light shafted through the trees and glinted crimson on the blade. Will froze, the ambush coming flooding back to him. He needed to clean it, and is clothing too.

Will moved over to the pond which by now had a swarm of fireflies glinting above it, dancing in erratic patterns that at other times would have brought Will mirth. Putting the belt aside for now, he plunged the blade it into the cold water. While carefully cleaning it he didn't notice the fireflies gradually becoming more frantic and numerous. He had noticed some old stone positioned around the pool as if the pool had some significance, but assumed such significance had long since past. Just when Will thought the cleaning was almost done, a bright light burst from above the lake grabbing Will's attention.

YOU DEFILE THE SACRED POOL WITH BLOOD?

Will's mouth gaped open, hovering above the pool was a being of light. It's features seemed feminine, yet exuded an otherworldly power. The booming voice seemed to strike his very soul.

TELL ME, WHO'S BLOOD IS IT? WAS IT BLOOD THAT YOU SHED?

Will raised the Janbiya from the lake, most of the blood cleaned off. Fight or flight seemed like dangerous options, and striking out was what led him to this situation in the first place, he froze.

NEVER MIND, I SHALL FIGURE OUT MYSELF.

And to Will's terror, the figure moved towards him. It reached out an indistinct appendage that may have been an arm and Will raised the Janbiya protectively. The arm touched the Janbiya... and stopped.

For a moment things were frozen in place.

I SEE....

The voice, while powerful and authoritative, seemed different now, subdued and slightly poignant.

IT IS NOT WHAT I EXPECTED. I SEE HOW YOU CAME BY THAT WEAPON AND WHAT YOU HAVE DONE WITH IT. I SEE WHAT EVENTS LED TO YOU TAKING SUCH ACTIONS.

Will simply nodded, he would take all the sympathy he could get, but to be honest, he still felt guilty about what he had done. Kevin had been sympathetic, but to have someone else know. Would they also be sympathetic? Will then shivered upon asking himself, what would they do to him if they weren't?

BUT I DO NOT SEE YOUR INTENTIONS, SO ANSWER TRUTHFULLY: DO YOU WISH TO FORGET ABOUT WHAT YOU HAVE DONE AND EVERYTHING THAT HAPPENED?
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: Will remembers to clean the blood

1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
Will couldn't help but tell the truth, he nodded.

THAT WAS A MISTAKE!

Will's blood ran cold.

YOU ENDED A HUMAN LIFE. EACH AND EVERY LIFE DESERVES RECOGNITION, AND WHILE IT IS FORGIVABLE TO DENY SUCH RECOGNITION TO PEOPLE IN EVERYDAY LIFE, IT IS UNFORGIVABLE TO DENY RECOGNITION TO LIVES WE OURSELVES HAVE ENDED.

Will stood up from his kneeling position and tried to look responsible. He had been awed to this being so far, but with the sense that things were turning sour he needed to be ready to run.

His instincts were strong, as the next time the voice spoke, it had a savage edge.

YOU SHALL REMEMBER HIM, HIS BLOOD SHALL REMIND YOU. RED SHALL REMIND YOU.
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: Yes

1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
In the blink of an eye, lightning shot out from the being and hit Will. Feet rooted to the ground, Will felt tingling all over as sparks raced over him. His vision brimming up with electricity, he could feel the lightning grow bigger and bigger... and then abruptly it ceased. Will stood stock still for a moment, then looked down.

In the glow of the being, Will could see that his main body garment, previously white with bloodstains, was now vibrant shiny red; from its hem at his thighs, through his body, all the way its sleeves at his wrists, all bright shiny red.

Stroking the smooth texture with his hands, Will then noticed his previously painted nails were now a bright varnished red. Looking down, his boots they were now bright red, as were his stockings that coated his legs from his boots up to his knee.

Had Will taken off his boots, he would have noticed his toenails were now also varnished red. What also escaped his noticed was that the rose in his hair has been revitalised with its leaves now as blood red as ever; and his lips which were previously just stained red were now a perfectly formed, strong, plump, luscious crimson.

The bracelet was for some reason untouched, its many coloured stones glistening in the light.

Overall, redness seemed to shoot out from him, like a bright signature. However, the being was not yet done.

TO REMIND YOU WHERE YOU GOT YOUR SPOILS...

The belt and the Janbiya handle flared in a hot, electric fire. Will dropped the blade which fell point down onto the pool bank. After a moment, the fire cut out. The Janbiya handle and the belt, save its buckle, were now jet black.

Will waited, but the being was silent. Was it done? Looking between the being and his items, Will gingerly reached down and picked them up, lightly tapping them at first to ensure they weren't hot. They were covered with a very light layer of soot which Will wiped away with his hands, but they were still jet black underneath. Will gradually put the belt back on, it's large silver belt buckle to the front. In the black sheath he holstered his blade, its blade still shining, but when put into the sheath only its black handle showing.

Due to tiredness and now having to look back at a being that was emanating light, Will rubbed his eyes, not recogising his hands were now covered with soot. The soot smudged his face, darkening his eyelids to a smokey black and thickening his eyelashes making them darker and more vibrant. In taking his hands back down, Will noticed the soot and knelt to rinse them in the pool (thinking too late that the being might object). With his hands clean again, but his nails no less shiny, he stood up again.

The being faced him.

SOME DAY YOU MAY REDEEM YOURSELF, BUT UNTIL THEN THIS SHALL ALWAYS REMIND YOU OF WHAT YOU'VE DONE.

And the being vanished.

Will blinked in the now near pitch darkness. As he waited for his eyes to adjust he let everything sink in.

Red. He was now marked with the blood of the man he killed, and the being was right, it would remind him everytime he looked at it.

Bending down, Will picked up the cloak that he'd left by the lake, thankful that it indeed was a cloak and large and covering. It was also jet black and Will had trouble remembering if it was always this colour (it would work for stealth in the dark, something a bandit might like) or it had also been changed when his belt and Janbiya had been. Either way, Will donned the cloak letting it drape around his body, hitching it closed around his neck and pulling up the hood. It covered up all his redness with some exceptions: his red boots that peeked out; the red that peeked through the long slit in the cloak's front (which Will tried to keep closed with his hands from inside); and, unknown to Will, his luscious red lips that shone out from a face that also held his smokey, long lashed eyes.

Furtively it seemed, Will looked back and forth, eyes darting under his dark lashes, than grabbed up the bag and and with his cloak flowing out behind him, he quickly stumbled back to the camp.
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: Will is marked

1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
A glint of fire caught Will's eye as he walked through the wood approaching the camp. It seems that Kevin was able to start a fire after all. Indeed, Kevin was sitting there, head bowed as the light from illuminated the edge of his face. Will was relieved to see two bedrolls unfurled beside the fire, Kevin's forward thinking again, and Will decided to do nothing other than move directly for his bedroll and get to sleep.

With the noise of his approach, Kevin suddenly looked up. "Ah, you're back. I was worried..." Kevin suddenly broke off, starting at Will's face. Will quickly pulled the cloak around himself tighter and jumped into his bedroll, cloak and all.

"I'm sorry..." Kevin said, but Will rolled to face away from him.

Silence lasted a little longer, only the fire crackling.

"Normally I'd leave this on tomorrow, or not at all," Kevin began, "but we are on a quest together and need to be able to rely on eachother. I've heard it said that it's best to resolve arguments before the sun sets, and while the sun is already down, well...

"I don't know what you want out of this... relationship between us. I took you on as a companion in our shared quest to end the dragon's reign. I sensed you had some dispute with the dragon, but it was your strength of will that impressed me. You've since proven worthy, far more worthy than I imagined, to be part of such a vital quest as this one, and more to the point, I am indebted to you for rescuing me. Few have supported me as you have done."

Will continued looking away, but took in every word.

"But I feel that something deeper is developing between us. I don't know how you feel about me. Maybe you don't care at all or maybe you care a great deal. I understand that it is sometimes hard to know ones own feelings, yet other times they are certain. I just want you to know, that I am happy with whatever feelings you have. They are your feelings and your decision on what to do with them."

By this stage Kevin had walked a few steps and crouched just behind Will.

"I would like to know you more, I would like to find out what drives you, what makes you who you are. But those are just my desires. I respect you. If we go forth and kill the dragon, and in the end you smile and turn away, never to see me again, I will be accept that. You have no obligation to do more, however much I would like there to be more. But I want you to know that whatever path our relationship goes down, whatever misteps or mistake or misunderstandings we may encounter, I will always respect you as a warrior and adventurer. That will always be the case."

At these last words, Will rolled over a bit and looked up at Kevin, his blue eyes, broad shoulders (less broad than normal without the armour), his earnest yet well defined face, his expression of earnest concern.

Taking it all in, Will felt he could do nothing other than smile broadly. A smile accented by his ruby red lips.

The film of concern over Kevin's face broke, and a smile broadened his face. "Thank you," he said, and leaning forward he kissed Will gently on the forehead. Then he got up and, with the occasional glance at Will to ensure everything was okay, he retired to his bedroll.

Will was surprised at the kiss, were all knights this emotional? Still, as he said, it was good to deal with this stuff before going to bed. More relevantly, Will's guilt had been blown away by Kevin's show of confidence in him, and his concern over his well being. He thought more about Kevin as his somewhat confused words swam in his head, while he couldn't quite figure out the form, maybe there was more they could gain from eachother.
Smiling again, Will rolled onto his back, and sleep hit him faster than he could expect.
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: Kevin reacts to Will's return

choices: They meet someone who needs help
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
Next morning they set off on horseback and continued down the trail. The trees thinned somewhat and at one point they rode along the side of the lake, before returning to the forest.

For the first time, Will rode his own horse, or more specifically the bandit's horse. While he assumed this would be comfortable, the skirt of his deep red long sleeved garment didn't work well with the saddle. It thankfully wasn't as long as its previous length so he could still ride astride, but it was hard to ensure that everything was covered. Fortunately wearing the cloak covered up what was needed so Will had the cloak wrapped around him. Since his (nail-polished) hands with the reigns went through the slit in the front of his cloak, he kept his arms close to his body and his hands together to ensure the slit remained narrow. The effect made him look like a prim and inexperienced horse rider, daintily guiding their horse along.

While the cloak covered most of his body, it rarely covered his red boots in the stirrup, and even with the hood up, Will's red lips and wisps of long black hair could be seen.

Both riders seemed in good spirits, Kevin pointing out the odd landmark or making a remark about his life, Will smiling and nodding at his remarks, Kevin seemingly heartened by Will's responses. Will felt that in the short time they'd know eachother, they almost seemed like good friends. As they trotted up and down hills and under the the dappled sunlight of the leaves, he felt he could trust Kevin, maybe even more than many he'd known his entire life. Then Kevin cracked a joke and Will bent over in a fit silent laughter, Kevin beaming at this response.

The day went on, the warmth both in the air and between them grew. It seemed idyllic, like dragons existed in another universe altogether.
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: Next morning

choices: The merchant will not leave them
The merchant imparts some useful information
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
Of course, soon something came along to break it. In the distance they could see figure on steed approaching. As it came closer, they could make out a plump man on a donkey that seemed overburdened with large saddle bags. While they moved aside to give him berth, he seemed to give them a lot of attention, particularly Will, and as they passed by he turned his donkey around and trotted along side the pair, with Will closest to him.

"Good morrow," he called, "rarely see such individuals as yourselves in this part of the country, what brings you here?"

"Killing a dragon," said Kevin deadpan.

With all due respect to the merchant, he didn't miss a beat.

"Oh You'll need all sorts of things for that: Dragons bane, dragonspear, got any flame resistant potions?"

"We're not buying anything," said Kevin with a snap to his voice.

"Oh, and I suppose you speak for both of you." He turned and put the full force of his energies towards a Will. "And is there something you would like?"

Will was a little surprised to have been pitched to so suddenly, but was a little curious as to what the merchant had. The merchant quickly picked up on this and with a smile he opened a side of his jacket. "I think I know what you want," and with that he took out a ring from his inside pocket.

Will stared at the ring, it had a bright red stone set into it that flashed his mind back to the events of the pond. Wondering if this was some sort of sign, Will reached for the ring, and found the merchant grabbing his wrist slipping the ring on his middle finger.

"Oh it suits you," said the merchant quickly pulling his hands back. Will Was struck by how the bright red stone matched his nails. "For such beauty, it would break my heart to charge full price. For you, only 20 coin."

"Stoats head it's worth that much," said Kevin uncharacteristically hostile.

"It's valuable, it is. I swear on my life. The stone comes from the distant land off..."

"15 coin, and if you try to split the difference, I'll have Lord Denham perform the most viscous tax audit on you that the world has ever seen."

"Alright, alright, 15 it is then, but only," with a. wink at Will, "because it would be wasted on anybody else."

Kevin moved his horse back and then forward between the merchant and Will, then quickly gave the payment. With a wave he seemed to dispatch the merchant although the merchant continued in the same direction if a bit further from them.

Will blinked, he hadn't even been sure if he wanted the ring and now he owned it. What's more, Kevin had bought it for him. He didn't understand it, but there was no returning it now. If he could talk he would ask why, but for now he had no choice but to go along with it.
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: They meet a merchant

choices: They feel no longer welcome and quickly leave
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
The merchant now seemed to be travelling alongside them, effectively going back in the direction he'd come from. He tried to strike a conversation with Kevin, but was met with stony silence. Will wondered if Kevin had something against travelling merchants. They could be tricky, and outright deceptive in trying to sell you something... be it some potion with allegedly miraculous properties, or some piece of clothing which.... clothing!

Will could have hit himself, the merchant could have some good clothing in those big saddlebags. Casually he took a hand off the reigns and felt the smooth, glistening fabric under his cloak. Something more appropriate than this, he thought.

He looked over to the merchant, but Kevin was largely blocking the view. He could try signalling or... no, it was best to wait for the next time they stopped, if they merchant was still there by then.

And he was. As they rode on he'd comment on some of the local area or make a small anecdote, with Kevin not responding and Will being unable to. Yet he continued by their side, as the forest seemed to close in and the track they followed got a bit rougher. Will honestly thought Kevin should have asked the merchant for more information, he had come from where they were going after all, but Kevin seemed tight lipped and just stared ahead with the occasional glance to his right to check on Will (and no glances to his left).

Eventually, they came across a cabin on the right side of their trail, alongside a small brook. As they passed by, a hunter came out the door, and upon greeting them asked if they would not stop for a brief rest. Kevin gladly accepted, Will was thankful.

Will found the hunter quickly moving to help him down from the horse. Will smiled a ruby red smile at him, the people in this region were very friendly. He settled them down at a wooden picnic table in the dappled sunshine, the merchant eagerly grapping a position at the table, and Kevin brining some food supplies, though with a glare implying that the merchant would have to bring his own (which he did). The hunter returned with a jug of water from the book, and soon a small repast was prepared.

"So what brings you to these parts?"

"We, that is to say the two of us," he said indicating himself and Will, "are on a quest to kill the Black Dragon and restore safety to the surrounding lands."

The hunter chewed thoughtfully. "So what's its hide strenth?"

"Sorry?"

"Hide strenth. How thick is its skin?"

"We do not know, it's possibly reinforced by magics."

"Where does it eat? Drink?"

"Presumably close to the cave."

"So where abouts would it hunt for its food? What are its watering holes?"

"I don't know, we can scout the area when we get the..."

"Weapons?"

"Well, swords of course, I may have to get a lance."

"And is that how you plan to kill it?"

"Well we shall see when we arrive at the dragon's cave."

The hunter shook his head, "You can't hunt a rabbit without knowing what you're doing, how do you intend to hunt a dragon?"

Kevin raised his voice, "I am of the authority of Lord Denham, this is a decision we make for the safety of our domain."

"I've seen many like you. You come up thinking you can defeat the dragon, receive riches and glory, when you really haven't the tiniest clue what you're doing."

"We are not doing this for riches or glory, we're doing this for protection. Down the road, not two days from here, is a village that has been ravaged by the Black Dragon. Lives destroyed, buildings in flames, the whole village taking shelter in a nearby cave. Now tell me, should we just nod our heads and let such a thing continue to happen?"

The hunter was silent for amoment. "There are ways to help them other than killing the dragon."

"But not many other ways of ensuring it doesn't happen again."

The silence rose again, an awkward tension lingered in the air.
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: The merchant will not leave them

choices: Follow the men into the cabin
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
After a moment, Kevin spoke up.

"Look, it seems we've managed to wander into an argument. I can assure you, while you make some valid points, our course is already set."

"It's just....," the hunter sighed, "I've seen too many, I don't want to see more people walking towards their deaths." He looked towards Will for this last bit, "The knight I understand, but you? Don't you want to spend your life in a way other than this?" Will was taken aback, but quickly recovered and set his lips in a thin line. While the hunter had a point, he'd known Will far to little to be able to judge his choices.

"I do understand, but perhaps it would be more helpful if you could use your experience to give us advice, rather than dissuade us from doing what we set out to do."

"Advice? I don't know, I've never hunted a dragon. The usual I suppose? Know your quarry, figure where its weakest, choose your weapon, end it as fast as you can. But it takes more than that, it takes skill and experience, you need to build that up over time. "

"I suppose you're not interested in joining us?"

The hunter laughed nervously, "I erm, I see maybe you will have enough to defeat the dragon by yourselves after all."

Silence fell again, and the meal continued.

As they were wrapping up, the merchant spoke up for the first time. "I say, do you have any furs or leathers you're looking to sell. I assume all your hunting is done locally."

"Well, I already have person who sells my furs in the market, but if you can offer a good price..."

"I'll need to see their quality first."

"Well, they're right this way." And the two men disappeared into the cabin. The exchange quickly reminded will that he meant to ask the merchant about clothes.
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: Kevin defuses the situation

choices: They mount their horses and continue on without much delay
Kevin has heard some troubling things from the hunter
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
While Kevin tidied up, Will slipped into the cabin. The two men were already talking by an open chest of furs and looked up to see Will when he entered.

This is going to be tricky without being able to speak, thought Will, but the men looked intently at Will, waiting for Will to speak. Will pointed at the fur, and then pinched his own clothes. As quick explanation he took some coins from the belt pouch and held them out while still indicating the clothes he was wearing.

The hunter seemed to smile. "I'm sorry,' he said indicating the furs, "these are just pelts, I imagine you're looking for something more... tailored?" Will nodded.

The merchant spoke up "I may have just what you're looking for, any particular item you need?" Will gestured towards his body in general. He opened his cloak and the two men gazed at the blazing red outfit he was wearing. Will figured they wanted to get a good idea of the clothing he wanted to change so he turned a bit back and forth to give them a better look, their eyes locked onto his shape beneath the cloak as it moved, taking in every little detail.

At that moment Kevin opened the door, Will let the cloak drop. "Am I interrupting something?"

The merchant huffed, "Yes, it's fine. I just need some time with Rose here, we're discussing clothing." Will nodded while absent mindedly touching the still-fresh rose in his hair, once again it was giving him a nickname.

"I wanted to talk to you about the terrain up ahead, local knowledge would be helpful."

"Well he lives in this area, I'm just passing through. And while you're discussing do you mind leaving us two alone?"

Sudden silence, both the hunter and Kevin unsure how to respond. Will suddenly found they were both looking at him. Deciding his clothing really needed to be cleared up, he nodded to them that he agreed with the merchant.

"Alright," replied Kevin, "we'll be outside, very close outside," and with that Kevin and the hunter went out the front door.

Smiling, the merchant turned to Will. "Now, I may need to take measurements." Will nodded and led his cloak drop to the ground. The merchant beamed an enthusiastic smile. It was nice, thought Will, to see someone who liked their job.

With a length of tape, the merchant went up to Will and gave him the most thorough measuring session he'd even been through. Smoothing the tape against him with his hand, the merchant measured his outside leg, his inside leg (stopped short by the skirt), his waist, his chest. Each time stroking the fabric gently and Will's body beneath. His arms, his hips, his thighs, his calves. At one stage the merchant looked Will straight in the face and said "We must find something to go with those beautiful eyes." Will raised his eyebrows.

The merchant resumed and turned Will to face away from him, draping the tape around in front of him while fixing it from behind. While waiting, Will felt the merchants arm move around him to the front of his midsection, and the merchant leaned in close from behind. "Why don't you come with me?" the merchant whispered into Will's ear, pressing against him, "I'm off to the capital of fashion, I can find you all the great pieces of clothing you want, all the styles and fabrics you could imagine." Will frowned in confusion, what exactly did this merchant... but in an instant the merchant was off of him, returning to his measuring like nothing happened. For a second Will wasn't sure if he'd imagined it.

Arms, forearms, wrists, the merchant caressing each part as he took the measurement, but soon he seemed to wind down. "Well, that's enough for now, I'm sure I can find something that would be perfect, if you trust my judgement." Will nodded.

Putting the tape away, the merchant and Will went back outside. True to his word, Kevin had been standing very close to the door, though clearly talking to hunter who was standing close by.

"Everything go okay?" Kevin asked, nodding towards Will. Will just nodded, whatever the merchant was at, at least he'd be getting new clothes.
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: Follow the men into the cabin

1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
