Expecting that they'd be off pretty soon (the table was clear and Kevin had already packed everything away), Will was surprised that Kevin seemed a bit hesitant.

"Malcom here has been telling me about a snake problem at Adderlay Point."

"Ah yes?" The merchant asked.

"Know anything about it?"

"Only that there may be a snake problem at Adderlay."

Kevin fixed him with a hard stare, "Anything more?"

"I didn't come from that area. Adderlay is upriver, and I came the southern route."

Kevin nodded and looked toward Will. "Rose I... I know the dragon is... you want to defeat the dragon, just like I do, correct?"

Will nodded.

"It just... we may have to.. it may be an idea to take a diversion."

Will nodded, slightly concerned, but trusting there was a good reason.

Encouraged by this, Kevin went on. "There's a snake terrorising Adderlay, a giant snake apparently. We don't know how big or serious it is, but there have been deaths, and apparently many are afraid to leave their homes." Will nodded. "Normally, it would be my immediate duty to help them, were it not for my current duty to protect people from the dragon." Will couldn't help but smile at this, Kevin was so earnest in taking feeling responsible for so many things.

Adderlay is somewhat on the way to the dragon's lair, but it's still quite a detour, not to mention the time it would take dealing with the snake. Being closer to the lair, the town may have some way to prepare us for tackling the dragon, but as it is a standard logging village we should not be certain of that. And so this is the decision we must make: primarily deal with the dragon, or detour to deal with the snake, and deal with the dragon as soon as we can after that."
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: Kevin has heard some troubling things from the ...

choices: Will insists they return to the hunters cabin
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
Will had a moment to take it all in. Already he'd signed up to defeating one incredibly dangerous monster, now a second one? And this one was likely to be without any sort of reward. This whole thing started out as a quest for riches, now he was being asked to help people? But then again, isn't that what he wanted, what prompted him to go with Kevin back at that village? An image of the decimated village sprung to his mind and then of the smiling faces of the villagers who were so nice to him, the little girl with her smile and bracelet. Then suddenly, an image of the bandits and everything faded to blood red. Will tried to shake his mind of those thoughts, and then looked up to Kevin. Into those blue eyes. The eyes of a man who wanted to help people, no matter who or where they were, whether or not there was a great reward at the end.

Will nodded.

"The snake?"

Will nodded.

Kevin beamed, "Superb, we shall set out immediately."

They went to their horses and mounted them, the merchant quickly mounting his donkey around the same time. Turning to Malcom Kevin said, "Our thanks for your hospitality and warm welcome. Your advice has not gone unheeded and I have taken note of preparations we need to make. For now, I wish you long life and good health."

"The same to you"

And with that, Kevin whipped the reigns, and the trio trotted onward.

It would only be after a great distance before Will realised with a bolt: He'd left his cloak in the hunters cabin!
1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.title: Deal with the snake first

1553322221111111111111111121111111211111.content:
Will could have kicked himself, he'd been so distracted by the merchant's antics and Kevin's information he hadn't thought about picking his cloak back up before leaving the hunter's place. It was probably too late to head back now and he didn't want to hold everyone back. Exasperated, Will looked down. The bright red garment that covered his upper body and arms, and the tubes of red fabric that still clung to his legs... Thankfully people seemed pretty open to different clothing styles. Maybe he should worry less.

Still, the red couldn't help but remind Will of the events that led to the colour in the first place... He shook his head. He couldn't let his memories keep dragging him into the past like this. He'd need to find some way to put the whole thing behind him, but for now he focused on the trail ahead.

The group travelled for many miles before crossing a bridge over the wide Brinx River. After crossing, they turned right up a dirt track that ran upstream along the river.

"You often see logs and big tree trunks floating down this river," spoke the merchant as they trotted along. "It's how they get the wood from Adderlay to other places."

Noone replied, and In silence they continued. The sun moved across the sky, the sounds of the birds and other forest life mixed in with the sound of the river as it flowed by them. The brimming of green and the shallow turns as the river meandered one way or another. They didn't see another soul, concerning to Kevin as they were heading towards a village.

The sun sunk lower, the sky darkened, and Kevin felt concerned. Concerned enough to speak the the merchant directly "How much further is it to Adderlay?"

"Oh, I don't know, I haven't been in a while. There's this rock you see when you're getting near, but I haven't seen it yet."

"We may have to camp out for the night, but I'd prefer not to do it if we're close to the village."

The merchant looked around, "I really couldn't say."

"Well we'll need to decide."

"If there is a dangerous snake about, it's probably not safe to stay out in the open." Kevin agreed with the merchant, got a nod of agreement from Will, and the party pressed on.

"Why are you travelling with us anyway?" The question sounded casual, but clearly the question had been on Kevin's mind for a while.

"Well, I don't have any set routes or plans, I go wherever seems like a good idea."

"And why does going with us sound like a good idea?"

"Well you're going to kill a dragon are you not?"

"That is our plan, yes."

"Well, you'll need supplies."

"You say you have items that would help us defeat a dragon?"

"Yes, that was one of the first things I said to you."

Kevin made a gruff comment and looked forward again. Finally he said, "That can't be the only reason."

"Well, there are always opportunities that pop up in a quest like this, a good merchant can take advantage of," he made a quick look to Will at this point.

"You can also get burnt to a crisp by a dragon."

"Always risk if one wants reward. I'd imagine someone of your profession would know that."

Kevin just gave a brief nod, and they continued down the path under the constantly darkening skies.

She tended to be portly, and instead of warts had full, red cheeks (though that was probably due to the still she kept out in the woods). Her house was near the center of town. She'd had several husbands in her life (some of them her own) and her numerous progeny meant that most of the town was either descended from her or were her in-laws.

Two stout men carried Will's bound form to her and she quickly called for a large, warm bath. They filled a trough and she added certain chemicals and potions to it. "Don't you worry now, sweetie," she said as they lowered will into the water, "we'll get you out of there lickity-split." She then shooed everyone away. "Leave the poor thing in peace!" Will had no idea what was happening outside as he tried to get comfortable in his room. His stomach was still not great even though he was pretty sure it was empty by now. His head also felt pretty dizzy and foggy. He eventually found sleep as his presence was still being talked about.

"She must be a noble," some would say.

"All on her own? No, she has to be a witch of some kind," said others.

"A white dress? Could she be a bride for our Lord? I knew not of wedding plans," still more would ask.

As Will slept his story was guessed upon and not a single person came to the right conclusions.

He woke late into the next day but he still did not feel much better. He was going to need to find a healer before his throat closed up again or his conditioned worsened. He tugged at the webbing but it was just as strong as it was the day before. He sighed and went down stairs.

Will struggled against the web again... How had it stayed so solid and strong so long... Must be magical webs, damn giant Spiders...

He rolled out of his bed, not feeling much better, in fact he felt a bit weaker, probably due to the fact of not eating anything, and then eating something that made him sick, his stomach must be completely empty.

He stumbled down to the entrance, leaning on the wall. Seeing the Manager again.

"Have a good night... You look a bit under the weather."

Will attempted to reply but found the words wouldn't come out... his voice had gone again, his throat was killing him with every attempt to make a sound tried to speak

he wondered how he should go about asking for directions to a local healer but got stopped.

"There's a Carriage out front waiting for you by the way."

Will gave him a quizzical look.

"Don't ask me... I figured you knew them... They asked about the figure in white..."

Who knew he was here... and they knew about the webbing he was stuck in... Had somebody been watching him... Must be A Wizard... spotted him through a Crystal ball... He wasn't sure if any of what he'd heard about Wizards were true... but who else could know about his adventure and or his White "Outfit"

He exitted the Inn, and two Burly Men grabbed him and escorted him into the Carriage. Will didn't have the strength or currently any weapons to resist as he got manhandled into the Carriage...

Little did he know that Word of The Women in the White dress had spread quickly, and it was all a matter of mistaken Identity. Someone recently had gone missing, wearing a white dress... But who.

Will had no idea what was going on as the carriage took him to parts unknown. He tried to open the door but his hands were brought down to his lap by one of the large strangers.

"None of that now, we will be at our destination soon enough," The guy holding his wrist said.

Will wondered if these people worked for the wizard he assumed had found him. He tried to ask them what was going on but couldn't get the words out of his throat. The bumpy ride wasn't doing him any favors and he found himself getting dizzy again. The whole cabin spun around and he had to put his head down against the side of it.

The two large men exchanged worried glances at each other. Will's behavior wasn't what they were expecting.

Will lost consciousness before too long, just not having the strength to keep awake. The next thing he knew, he was being dragged out of the carriage. They had arrived.

15533222211111111111122111.content:
Prince Henry waited nervously as his betrothed was being collected. The royal adviser was doing what he could to keep the prince calm but he wasn't having much success.

"Please, my prince, sit before your the floor has been warn out by your steps," he pleaded.

"You expect me to sit? I'm going to be married off to some stranger and I am to sit?" Henry asked without wanting an answer.

"My prince, you knew this would happen one day. It is your duty to your kingdom," the adviser tried to reason.

"So I have been told. Over and over all of my life. What of love?" Henry asked.

"Prince Henry, this marriage is more important that than that," the adviser declared.

"Nothing is more important than love," Henry spat.

"This marriage will see the end of a life long feud between your families. War will end. Lives will be saved. Our armies will unite and we will end the great dragon's terror."

Henry turned away and looked out the window, hating the sense that the adviser was making.

"If love is so important, than think of your people. By making this sacrifice, you will see to it that no husband nor wife will loose their own love to needless fighting. No child lose their parent. You will be the reason, My prince. By giving up your chance at love, you save the love of hundreds," the adviser said.

He knew his words were landing true. The prince's heart was soft and his words were like arrows. The prince's sigh was enough to know that the conversation was over.

"You will make a fine King one day. Who knows, you may even like your queen if you give her a chance," the adviser said, joining Henry by the window.

They both watch as the Carriage arrives.

Will was fairly rudely manhandled out of the carriage, in front of him was a castle... a huge castle, this wasn't just some lord, this was huge, maybe even a King's

The Prince watched from his room, watching his Fiancee being brought in from her carriage..

"What if She's unbearable, like she's annoying? or she talks to much?"

"You shouldn't have to worry about that." The advisor informed him, "I've just gotten word that the princess hasn't spoken a word since she was... caught... She apparently fled her protectors during the night, but she was caught in a nearby town, She hasn't spoken a word since."

"So it seems she's as against this as I am."

A few minutes later, Will Found himself being led firmly upstairs until he was brought to a large door. It was opened and he was beckoned inside.

With no other choice Will walked into the room, it looked like a large study, some books lying around, a few seats along with a fireplace, near a desk, a Man Stood up, and approached him.

"It's an honor to finally meet you." He took Wills hand and bowed. "I'm Prince Henry..." He paused, clearly waiting for Will to answer.

"Oh dear, You are unable to speak?" Henry asks.

Will shakes his head and looks around the room. This guy wasn't lying, he had to be the prince. Even in a simple study, there were silks and gold and silver everywhere...he could make a lot of coin if you could swipe a few things.

Henry looked at his bride to be. She was certainly beautiful, that was for sure. Despite himself, her loveliness quickened his pace. He unease, however, kept him from getting comfortable.

"I know you are displeased but I assure you I mean you know ill-will. Would you care to walk with me? I would like to show you around," he offered will his arm.

Will looked at him confused and the Prince found himself feeling foolish.

"This way please," He said bringing his arm back to himself.

Soon After

155332222111111111111221111221.content:
Three handmaidens entered the room of the bride to be and looked upon the princess of their nation's enemy with envy at her natural beauty. She was the definition of loveliness and the handmaidens dare not look her in the eye nor speak. They had been warned of the strange customs of the princess's land though it is hard to say how true they are as few survive their visits there.

They set to wok getting her ready for dinner. They had been instructed to make her presentable for sharing a table with the king, though they knew that it wouldn't be too hard. As one removed her boot's, another prepared a bath. The third attempted to find the buttons on the princess's dress but was unable to do so. The garment was beautiful and unlike anything she had ever seen before. She was bewildered it and soon was joined by the other two. All three of them marveled at it and silently agreed to pull it off. Again they were unsuccessful and were becoming a bit distraught. The princess seemed out of it and offered no help.

They gave up and instead chose to give her a sponge bath. They struggled with the pants she wore but finally removed them. They gave knowing looks at each other at her hairy legs. They heard the women were very natural where she comes from, but their instructions were clear. They removed her undergarment, though the restriction of the dress made it difficult to do. Soon they were washing her and the princess squirmed at their touch, especially as they blindly cleaned her private areas.

Once she was clean, The maidens worked on her face, while one of them shaved her legs smooth. The princess drifted as they worked and soon she looked even more lovely than when they first saw her, impossibly. Heels were slipped onto her dainty feet and strapped into place. Once ready, they woke her and lead her to dinner.

Will hadn't noticed how hungry he was until he had a moment to himself, He hadn't eaten anything since Yesterday morning before meeting the giants.

He suddenly felt very faint and took a seat on the bed before nearly fainting, The Next passage of time was a blur, he knew somebody had come into the room, maids but the rest of was unclear.

He started to clear up when he smelled food, it smelled glorious. He was sat in a seat across from the prince and before long food was brought to him, Will was too hungry to think clearly and began eating ravenously.

It was a few minutes into Dinner when Will Began to come to his senses, he was currently feating on a leg of some small bird, he didn't know what, There was also some wine in a glass in front of him, he'd never had wine before, only mead and weak Beer at Poor Taverns.

He became aware of what he was wearing, while he was still tightly wrapped in the Webbing the maids had dressed him in a bulky for lack of a better word, dress

Will figured the outfit may have been some sort of Fancy Outfit maybe a Ceremonial Gown of sorts, He'd seen priests wearing something similar to dresses before, maybe this was what he was wearing.

His shoes were harder to explain, they looked to be some sort of very clean leather, they were small and delicate, with a medium sized point on the bottom raising his heel, He'd never seen shoes like them before and wasn't sure what the point of them was.

As he continued eating the Prince once in a while would say something, Will Found that his voice still escaped him.

As Dinner began to come to a close Will looked again at the Gown that he wore, and Decided

Did they think he was a priest? It was possible, Will thought. They could have thought he was someone else entirely. It was the only thing that came to mind as making any sense, seeing as the prince spoke to Will as if he already knew some things.

Will was at a crossroads in this moment. He could attempt to convince the prince that he wasn't the priest though it would be hard to do without his voice. On the other hand, if he played along he could get some special treatment. The food was amazing and the clothes did feel really nice against his skin. H wasn't used to this type of treatment and it was really nice.

Another thought came to him. If they found out that he wasn't who they thought, would they be angry that he ate their food? It would be petty but that's royalty for you.

He also decided something else. Wine was amazing.

1553322221111111111112211112211212.content:
Will awoke groggily to the gentle warmth of the sun on his face. He twisted and turned under the fine sheets, a silent yawn escaping him.

At first, the aches and pains of the day prior seemed like naught but a distant memory, but, upon sitting upright, felt their return and put his fingers to his forehead, brushing his hair away from his eyes.

Perhaps he should not have eaten with such fevor the previous night...

A knock came at the door. Will opened his mouth to reply but still no sound escaped him.

"Excuse me...? We're coming in."

The door opened, the maids coming to attend to the princess.

The women bowed. "Prince Henry is making arrangements for the apothocary to concoct an antidote for you, but in the meantime wishes for you to join him in the garden."

Will nodded, his head still feeling muddled, and swung his legs over the side of the bed. His head, however, felt faint and his legs became wobbly.

Seeing the princess rise, the maids moved quickly to prevent her her dizzy spell and began assist her in dressing, as per the Prince's orders. The night gown was removed, leaving her in her white dress. Knowing it was no use attempting to remove it, they instead decided to wrap a shawl about the princess's shoulders. While one maid ensured her legs were still smooth and clean, another slid the white heels back onto her feet.

Once again, the princess seemed to fall asleep as they worked, the gentle brushing of her dark hair lulling her in the chair. The maid tried to pull the rise free, but it held fast, even as her hair fell into place along her shoulders.

'How odd.' the maid thought to herself. Was the rose in her hair enchanted?

Seeing her closed eyes, another maid took this time to gentlely brush a fine light brown powder over the princess's eyelids. After this she took a small tool of charcoal and followed around the edges of her eyes, leaving a thin black line framing them, ending in a delicate wing.

She put down the tool, looking in jealousy at the princess's natural red lips. Her beauty really was unfair.

"Milady...the Prince awaits you in the garden."

The princess remained quiet, so the maids gentlely helped her to her feet and began to guide her to the garden.
1553322221111111111112211112211212.title: The Next Morning.

choices: Prince Henry gives his future bride a kiss
15533222211111111111122111122112121.content:
Prince Henry sighed and stopped pacing. Word had come at last. The Apothecary had worked long into the night with promises of a salve for the silent princess come that next day.

Apparently, the old man could truly work miracles and was preparing to travel to the castle.

This was certainly a relief to the Prince's mind. With his betrothed's voice restored, they could start to prepare for the wedding in earnest. Why, maybe she'd tell him about herself...or her secrets...maybe she'd open her insecurities and he would earn her favor through comforting her... He had reservations at first, but found her liveliness endearing, especially with how it went hand in hand with her mysterious, yet shy, demeanor.

The marriage he could not begin to conjure in his mind's eye narry two days prior was now so vivid in his...

As she descended the stairs, on hand delicately helped along by one of the maids, her hair and face bathed in the gold of the morning sun, Prince Henry felt his heart skip a beat.


Will's head had still not cleared by the time he reached the steps that led down to the garden, but apparently one of the maids had realized it and held his hand, ensuring he didn't lose his balance.

He smiled to her in gratitude after his words again failed in his throat. Ah well. They still seemed to think him some sort of priest, at least if this shawl was any clue. The only people Will had ever seen wear one were members of the clergy.

The maid released the princess's hand as she reached the bottom step, bowing and quickly retreating back up the stair. The princess walked to him and bowed to him.

"Oh." Prince Henry broke out of his trance. "Come now there's no need in for that."

Will lifted his head back up. So much for just bowing since he could not speak... He decided instead to simply give the Prince a smile. It was best for this priest ruse that he stay in the good graces of...well...his Grace.

Henry felt his heart flutter as her made-up eyelids opened to look at him. This swelling in his chest...he couldn't explain it. He had just met her...he barely knew her... Her beautiful, dark hair alighted with a single, delicate rise... The white, silken dress that cupped her frame so alluringly...Those red, oh-so-kissable lips formed a smile...

Was...was he leaning in closer to her?

155332222222221.content:
David Johnson looked at his wife's photo and sighed. Valerie had been gone for two years and it still didn't get any easier for him. She was the love of his life, up until the car accident. He felt like a part of him died that day too. He knew his 16 year old daughter Sarah missed her as well. She and her mother were very close. But life must go on, and he knew that Valerie would want the both of them to move forward with their lives, So he decided to make a fresh start, and move he and Sarah to a new town with no bad memories. Sarah was going to be starting her new school in the fall, and he knew that he would find a job soon. They were taking life one step at a time.

Then he heard Sarah say from behind him, "Hey Daddy, guess want I found in the attic!" He turned around and smiled at his daughter. "What is it princess?"

1553322222222212.title: I found a pair of Mom's shoes!

15533222222222121.content:
"Try on the shoes? Why?" he asked.

Sarah looked sheepishly. "Well, I've always thought you an Mom's feet looked about the same size. And I'd always thought that you probably could fit in her shoes. So right now we have a chance to find out."

"But wear your mother's shoes. I really don't know Sarah."

"C'mon Dad, were just having a little fun. Besides there's no one hear but us. Who's gonna know?"

Despite his misgivings, he decided to indulge his daughter and sit down to take off his shoes and socks. Sarah then took one of Valarie's heels and slid it on to his foot.

"A perfect fit" Sarah said. She then slid the other heel onto his other foot.

"Wow" said David.

"Stand up Daddy." David stood up and took a moment to get his balance on the 4 inch heels. "Go on, strut your stuff in those heels." David tried to walk in the heels. It was tricky at first, but after a while he was able to walk on the heels. He walked back and front all while him and Sarah were laughing.

He looked at his feet. These were the same shoes he had seen Valerie wear often, but now he was seeing them on HIS feet. It was a totally different experience.

He sat down and began taking off the heels. "Well that was fun, but I don't think can be anymore graceful."

She laughed. "Awww, you're no fun" as she went to put the heels away.
15533222222222121.title: Would you mind trying on the shoes

155332222222221211.content:
The next day, David awoke and got showered and dressed, all the while thinking about yesterday when he put on and walked around in Valerie's heels. He still couldn't believe that he actually did that. But something about it did feel kind of nice to him. In some way, wearing something of Valerie's made him feel like she was close to him again. He wondered if there was a way to feel like that again.

He looked down at his wedding band, http://www.mens-wedding-rings.com/assets/images/MWR_CATEGORY_HOME_TITANIUM-1.jpg... and suddenly got an idea.

He went over to a keepsake box he had on his dresser, and pulled out Valerie's wedding ring, http://applesofgold.com/Merchant2/gemstone-and-diamond-jewelry-closeup/SZWBS194L.... He then took off his wedding ring and placed it in the box. Finally, he slid Valerie's ring onto his own finger.

Suddenly he felt that warm feeling of her being close to him again. It was almost like she was back in the room with him.

Smiling, he went to the kitchen to join Sarah for breakfast.
155332222222221211.title: Next day

choices: Search the attic to see if any more of Valerie's things are up there
1553322222222212111.content:
He went downstairs to see Sarah already at the dining room table. She was already eating because she had promised to meet some of your friends in a little bit. David poured himself a bowl of cereal and sat down at the table with Sarah.

"Morning, Daddy." she said as he sat himself down.

"Morning, Princess." he replied "Eating so fast."

"Me, Mary and Lucy are going to the mall."

"Well that's nice." David was glad his daughter was beginning to make friends in this new town. It was a sign that they were beginning to move forward.

"Well I gotta go." Sarah finished eating and was about to leave, when she noticed her mothers wedding ring on David.

"Daddy," she asked, "I hope you don't mind me asking, but are you wearing Mom's wedding ring instead of your own?"

David blushes. "Well Sarah, I guess I am. Its just that when I was wearing your mother's heels last night, it made me feel close to her. So I thought that if I had something else of hers near me, I'd feel close to her again.

"Awww, Daddy, that is so sweet!" she looks at your ring again. "I think you should wear Mom's ring from now on. Its so much prettier than your old boring one."

"I'll think about it." David replies.

"Well, I better be going. Luv ya Daddy!", Sarah says as she runs off.

"Bye sweetie." David yells back.

He looked at Valeries wedding ring and sighed. What to do next?

David looked at his wife's wedding ring again. It was amazing how just wearing her ring himself made him feel. It really was kinda like she was next to him again. He had really missed these sensations when she passed away. Now they were starting to come back.

Then David had a thought. If wearing the ring reminded him of Valerie a little, then perhaps that feeling might me amplified if he had something else of hers next to him. He had given away most of Valerie's things to Goodwill, but he knew that like the heels there might be a couple more of her things upstairs in the attic.

He walked upstairs to the attic and turned the light on. He was greeted by the sight of tons of clutter. When they moved to this new house he had put of ton of his families old things up here and promised to rearrange it later, but he never did. He shook his head as he just hoped that he could find something of Valerie's through all of this mess.

He was just about to start digging through the mess when he spotting something on top of one of the boxes. Under a fine layer of dust, he saw
15533222222222121111.title: Search the attic to see if any more of Valerie&...

choices: The cashier notices Valerie's wedding ring on David
15533222222222121112.content:
David looked at his wife's wedding ring and sighed. It felt so good to have something of hers close to him again. He felt better than he ever had since Valerie died. For the first time he felt he could really move on with his life again.

He finished his breakfast and thought about what he should do today. For a moment he thought about trying to find were Sarah put the heels away, but he decided not to bother. He was wearing Valerie's wedding ring, and that was enough for him.

He looked around the kitchen and noticed that it was looking a little bare. Time to go grocery shopping, he thought.

He got into his van and drove toward the supermarket. It wasn't a very busy day and there weren't many people out or many cars on the road. Thank god for that, David thought himself. Hopefully I can get this done quickly.

David parked and entered the supermarket. He knew what he needed already so it didn't take him much time to find the items he wanted. He found the last item and put it in the shopping cart before heading towards the register.

At that time there was one cashier avialable, a young man David had never seen before. Must be new here, he thought. He brought his cart to that register, and the cashier begins to ring David up.

What next?
15533222222222121112.title: Go to the supermarket

155332222222221211121.content:
As he begins to ring up David's purchases, the cashier says, "Was everything fine today sir?"

David smiled, "Yes, I was able to find everything I came here for."

The cashier continued to ring the items up. "Glad to hear that sir. Hope that there wasn't much trouble finding what you needed."

"No, since it's practically barren in here."

"I hear ya man, this is the one time of day I can get any piece and quiet." The cashier finishes ringing up the items and prints out the receipt.

The cashier hands over the receipt to David, when suddenly he notices Valerie's ring on David's finger. Suddenly the cashier get flustered and begins to blush.

"Oh, oh, oh, I'm so sorry Ma'am!" the cashier exclaims.

"Excuse me?" David, confused, replies.

"I'm so sorry, Miss. I mean, when you came I accidentally thought that you were a man. I don't know how I made that mistake but I am so sorry that it happened. I really hope I didn't offend you?"

Not knowing how to reply, all David can muster is a weak "Don't worry."

"I mean, I should have known. I knew I had made a mistake when I saw your wedding ring. That is unmistakably a women's wedding ring. Since you are wearing it, that must mean that you are a woman. Believe me, Ma'am, I am a true gentleman, and I always try to treat a lady with respect. I promise you this will NEVER happen again!"

Totally confused now, David without saying a word grabbed his bagged items and the receipt and left the store.
155332222222221211121.title: The cashier notices Valerie's wedding ring ...

choices: One of the women from the neighborhood comes over
David goes out for the evening
1553322222222212111211.content:
David drove back home trying not to think about what happened. It was all just too strange. He didn't think he looked like a woman, yet that guy automatically thought he was one as soon as he saw the ring. Okay, it was a woman's ring, and he could see how one could possibly think that someone wearing a woman's ring must logically be a woman. But still... He tried to forget about the incident.

David went into his driveway and parked the van. By this time there were alot more people out and about in the neighborhood. Also the sun was
out, and the sunlight began to reflect of the ring, making it immediately noticeable on David. Several of the people began to whisper to each other after looking at him. David however didn't appear to really notice this and went back inside.

He put the groceries away, then began to look over the family finances again. He realized that he was going to be alone for the next couple of days. He had forgotten that Sarah was going to be visiting some of her old friends back in her old town and would be gone for at least 3 days. He thought that was a bit excessive, but he knew that she missed some of her friends and anyway she was old enough to take care of herself.

He finished looking over the finances for the day and then made himself a sandwich for lunch, He sat in front of the TV and ate his sandwich while watching the football game. Ring or no ring, he knew that he was still a guy's guy like he had always been.

Then he suddenly heard a knock at the door. He opened the door and saw a middle-aged man standing there. He was wearing a suit and thick glasses. He give a quick bow and said, "Greetings, my name is Chester A. Wilkinson, head of the neighborhood committee. Might I come in for a brief moment?"

David wondered why the committee head would be at his house. Had he done something to offend someone in the neighborhood already? "Sure, come on in."

Mr. Wilkinson came into the living room and sat on the couch. "Well, I just wanted to come over on behalf of the committee to apologize."

David was surprised. "Apologize."

Mr. Wilkinson turned to face him. "Yes, Mrs. Johnson. You see, when you and your daughter first arrived here, all of the committee members thought that you were a man. But then today we saw the ladies wedding ring on your finger and we realized our mistake. The fact that you are wearing that shows you can't be anything other than a woman, and we all sincerely apologize for this grave error.

"But, but, but..." David stammered.

"Now now, there is no need to do anything Mrs. Johnson. Rest assured that from now on we are going to treat you as the woman you are. We have changed our records to show that a woman and her daughter now live in this house. Now there is no worry of anyone here mistaking you for a man again."

"No...well...you see"

"Oh look at the time!" Mr. Wilkinson says looking at his watch, "I've got a million more people to speak with today. I just wanted to assure you we have had that problem resolved. Hope you have a pleasant day ma'am!" And with that final word Mr. Wilkinson quickly got up and left.

David's head was spinning. What just happened?
1553322222222212111211.title: Go home

1553322222222212111212.content:
David pulled into his driveway, having left the supermarket and that weird exchange with the cashier behind. The event still left it's mark on him, however. After he parked he looked at his hand that was resting on the steering wheel and at the ring on his finger.

“How could a ring possibly be the thing that convinced that guy that I was a woman...that is just ridiculous isn't it?” David said to no one.

He got out of his car and popped the trunk to retrieve his groceries. He made his first trip into the house and placed the bags on the table before returning back to his car. It was on his return to the house that he caught his reflection in the window of his car. He looked at himself and noticed that his hair had come out from his business ponytail. Normally he kept it back while he was doing errands but that was no longer the case.

“I didn't notice that it came undone. I guess my last hair-tie broke,” he thought to himself.

He placed the last bags on the ground and started playing with his hair a bit until he noticed someone behind him in the window's reflection.

“Eep!” he cried in surprise as he turned to face an old woman.

“Oh, I'm sorry dear. I didn't didn't mean to startle you. I was just coming over to say hello. You and your daughter just moved in the other day?” the old woman asked kindly.

“Uh yes, we did,” David said while he calmed back down.

“Oh, please speak up. My ears aren't what they used to be,” she said sweetly.

“YES, WE DID,” David loudly confirmed.

“Ah good. I think you two will like it here. It's a nice place with plenty to keep a young lady entertained,” She said catching eye of the wedding ring on David's finger.

“Well, my daughter will be happy to hear that,” not realizing whose she was referring to.

The old woman took his hand into hers without hesitation or awareness of personal boundaries. She retrieved her glasses dangling from the collar of her dress and put them onto the end of her nose. She tilted her head to an exaggerated angle as she held his fingers. David was at a loss for words as this strange lady held his hand in a girly position.

“This is a beautiful ring. I didn't realize you were married,” she said in surprise.

“Thank you. It was my wife's but she is no longer with us,” he explained wanting this exchange to be over.

“What was that?” she asked.

“THERE WAS A LOSS IN OU FAMILY TWO YEARS AGO,” he stated louder.

“Oh, I'm sorry to hear that,” she replied with sincerity.

He took his hand back and picked up his groceries. He smiled and shrugged just wanting to get away. The woman took the hint and smiled back.

“Well, I'll get out of your hair. If you need anything, I'm just next door,” she said heading back to her house.

“Thank you. Have a nice day,” he told her while entering his house.

The old woman headed back to her house and thought to herself, “I should tell my grandson about her. With a little bit of attention I'm sure she could be quite pretty. Two years is surly enough time for a young woman to grieve.”
1553322222222212111212.title: Back at the house

choices: Decided to sleep it off and fix it in the morrning

Letting my hair down, I quickly cover my towel up to my chest, being sensitive to the older woman.

As I quickly open the door I invited her to my living room she noticed my ring

The door closes

I'm bright red, the town registered me as a woman all because of the ring
