1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
As Becky wandered about her brother's place, she noticed a package on the counter with several pieces of paper beside it. She was curious what sort of mail he might have received, and wanted to get a better idea of what exactly it was he was doing with his spare time.

Taking a closer look she spotted the covers of the games that were sent to him.

"Barbie?" She muttered. "Maybe Eric really is my little sister."

Alongside all that was the letter sent by CosplayGirl91. "It's so refreshing to see a Girl who's confident and doesn't have to play up her Gender to get views."

"Oh. My. God. Eric's fans think he's a girl. He must have been mortified." Becky smiled.

"Hey little sis!" She called out to him.

"Don't call me that."

"Even if you're still in high school, isn't that a bit too old to be playing Barbie games?"

"Stop saying I'm in high school. And what do you mean by Barbie games?" Came Eric's response from the bathroom.

"I mean I can see the game here on your counter. It seems like you're a great role model for other girls. I bet all of your fans are really pleased to see a girl not playing up her Gender to get views." Becky said, poking fun.

Eric rushed out of the bathroom, makeup only half applied. "Look, that's just a misunderstanding. The girl who sent that is obviously just mistaken, maybe seeing what she wants to see. I mean I'm glad she likes me, but it's not like I'm a role model. I don't know why she'd think I was a girl. Everyone can see and hear me when I stream after all." Eric said, defensively.

Seeing Eric in front of her, Becky was able notice the similarities between Eric and the Mercy figurine on the table, along with her halo-like headdress and its life sized replica resting on the table.

"Oh yeah," Becky countered. "And I suppose your hairstyle is the same as this angel girl's by coincidence? Is that why you have her halo too?"

Eric paused. He hadn't put two and two together. He gazed at Mercy with a blank stare, actually seeing himself as her like basically all his viewers had.

"Oh dear." Eric ran back to the bathroom, snatching the mercy figure as he went.

Becky was legitimately confused. Was Eric really that oblivious? How could anyone not see him as that character? The resemblance was uncanny.

"Oh my god." Becky heard Eric say from the bathroom, dumbstruck. "I really do look like Mercy."

"Is that what she's called? Maybe once you're older you might have her figure."

Eric returned. "Stop it. This is your fault."

"Oh?"

"Connie cut my hair like this. She must have seen a picture of Mercy on my phone while I was reading about game strategy."

"Well you need to be more careful then Ericka, unless you want the rest your fans to see you like CosplayGirl91 does."

"It's definitely a misunderstanding." Eric denied. "I might have the hairstyle, but there's no way people think I'm not a guy. If they noticed, they probably just think its a joke, like I said my nails were."

Becky noted the statement about Eric's nails, but chose not to pursue it further. "Well whatever. We're running late. I'll fix your makeup so we can get out of here quicker." Becky pulled Eric back to the bathroom.

Feeling a bit mischievous, Becky decided to give Eric a more adolescent look, fitting of his status as an honorary high school girl. Plus it would make sense that a younger girl would know less than a regular salon employee, which would help Eric blend in.

As they rode to the salon, Becky ensured Eric had at least a passing knowledge on the sorts of things he might be asked at the salon. Enough that a girl Ericka's age would know at least, she thought.

Once they arrived, Becky settled in to work. As did Eric, who was tasked with learning some of the other simple goings on at the salon so he could help out beyond just cleaning. Eric picked up what he could. He wasn't really eager, but he did need the money and it didn't hurt to be more knowledgeable, after all.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: She finds the girly gifts and the note from Cos...

choices: Becky gets Eric and Elena to spend more time together after work
Eric concludes the conversation without any more bonding
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
Eric was shadowing Becky, learning how to apply highlights when he heard the jingling of the door being opened and closed. A customer.

Eric turned quickly in order to help the new arrival, but upon seeing her, froze.

Becky turned to look. "Oh hey Elena! Good to see you again. Here for a touchup?"

"Nah, not today", came the reply, "just want a quick mani-pedi since I've got a bit of time to kill."

"Alright cool, I'll have Ericka sign you in." Becky responded, gesturing for Eric to approach.

"I can't.." He whispered awkwardly. "I know her. She'll recognize me."

"Oh, puh-leaze, how do you know her."

"We went to high school together. We were in the same class. She dated Ben for like a year so I hung out with her maybe almost a dozen times"

Ben had been a close friend of Eric's, though after high school most people moved away and drifted apart. It was curious that Elena had decided to stay, since she seemed like the sort of girl who would have had more opportunities.

Becky stepped away from her customer, moving closer to Eric. "Listen. Even I wouldn't have recognized you if I hadn't practically dressed you this morning. There is no way she'll recognize you from high school. You look, at best, like you just graduated. There's no way she'd think you were her classmate, let alone her male classmate. Now go help her, or you'll look suspicious. Don't make her wait."

Eric nervously approached the counter, too worried to be bothered by Becky's comment about his apparent age and gender.

"Hi, I'm Ericka," Eric said, trying to calm his shaky voice. "so you're in for a mani-pedi right? Any specialists you'd prefer?"

"Nah, anyone is fine. Don't worry about it." Elena said, trying to be as accommodating as possible for the obviously new and not especially confident girl.

"Alright, well I think it'll be uh.." Eric looked around quickly. Everyone was busy. "about a 5 to 10 minute wait, uh.. or so."

Connie called over to Eric, "Why don't you get her started Ericka, You've learned how to file and clean nails, start with that, and somebody will be over to assist in a bit."

Eric was on edge: even more time near Elena. More time where she might see through the disguise.

Elena, recognizing Ericka's insecurity, put a hand on her shoulder. "I'm sure you'll do just fine."

Eric lead Elena over to an open seat and began readying the supplies.

Elena continued, hoping to ease Ericka's nerves, "Anyways is this your first day here? I feel like I've seen you before."

Eric started. "Oh! Uh.. That's.. because I'm Becky's little sister, probably. Uh.. I mean I am Becky's little sister, of course. That is, you probably recognized me because I'm her little sister, not that I may or may not be Becky's little sister. I am. Her.. little.. sister... I mean." Eric trailed off as he realized what he was saying. He wasn't pleased to have just so adamantly claimed to be a little sister. He didn't like the sound of it one bit.

Hearing Eric's terrible attempts at conversation, Becky chimed in. "No. She's my baby sister."

Snapping out of his near-breakdown for a moment, Eric rolled his eyes. Elena noticed and laughed.

"Seems like you get along well. I'm jealous. Becky's the best and I'm an only child." Elena explained. "So you must've grown up around here then? What year are you?"

"Oh I've graduated" Eric corrected, but realizing he almost inadvertently let slip their connection backtracked, "... just recently."

"That's so cool!" Elena responded. "It's great to be newly independent. What are you planning on doing now that you're out of school. Hoping to make a career as a hairdresser?"

The thought of that sent a shiver down Eric's spine. "No. I'm actually, uh, trying to become a streamer. On Twitch, you know? Video games."

"That's incredible! I love video games! What sorts do you play?" Elena responded enthusiastically.

"Uh, Overwatch mostly."

"Oh man that's great! I play tons of Overwatch too!"

In the mean time, Becky finished up and moved to take over for Eric, who was at that point painting Elena's toes.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Someone Eric knows shows up at the salon

1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
"You play Overwatch?" Eric perked up, intrigued.

"Don't worry, my friends! I'll be your shield!" Elena affected a rugged, enthusiastic German accent.

"That's awesome. Yeah, so the patch. I feel like they're having a hard time with Zenyatta. Like, he feels like an assault character right now."

"That's fair. It maybe was a little much, but I think it needed to happen. Pre-patch Zen would basically die to a swift breeze. They need to change something to get people to use him more."

"Well it definitely worked." Eric laughed, forgetting his predicament as Becky took over the pedicure. "Every match has one right now."

"For now at least. That's what I like about the game, that they keep balancing it." Elena countered.

Becky was pleased that Eric was making a friend, but sighed as they went on and on. This sort of stuff wasn't her cup of tea. She did hear Eric make a couple mentions of Mercy, the character he looked like. Apparently Mercy was 'falling out of the meta' or something, though Eric was pretty adamant that a good player could make all the difference. It was a bit over her head.

The conversation went on even past the end of Elena's mani-pedi. They were still talking even after she had paid.

"Sorry to interrupt." Becky stepped in. "But Ericka needs to get back to work before she gets into trouble. Why don't you two get together after work?"

"You up for it?" Elena asked

"Of course! That would be great!" Eric responded in a snap, before considering the ramifications.

They exchanged numbers and Elena left. Eric, seeing her go turned to Becky, mortified.

"What am I going to do?"

"Uh... get coffee?" Came the response.

"No, I'm so stupid. I should have said no." Eric said, too caught up in his own worry to give his sister's mocking statement an appropriate rebuttal.

"Why? You were having a good time." Becky said, confused.

"Because now I have to go out as Ericka!" Eric whispered.

"Ah... right. Well, that's fine. I'm sure I gave you something cute to wear." Becky responded.

Eric wasn't sure if she was intentionally being obtuse to bother him, or if she really didn't see the problem.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Becky gets Eric and Elena to spend more time to...

choices: I need to go shopping. I'm working on a Widowmaker Cosplay
Nah, let's just hang out and chat. Maybe get some coffee.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
An hour or so later Becky and Eric arrived back at his house.

"I'll help you find something cute to wear." Beck said, enthusiastically.

"Thanks..." Eric did not share his sister's enthusiasm.

The two headed inside. Becky made a beeline for Eric's new box of girl's clothes, still unsorted.

"Well this seems good. It's something I would have worn back in high school."

"I don't want to look like you looked in high school."

Becky rolled her eyes. "Look, you mentioned that she though you looked familiar right? Well you seemed pretty sure you were my little sister then. I guess you could just wear jeans and a T-shirt, take off your makeup and swear off anything girly. You'll probably won't look as young, more like the old Eric. She's definitely not any more likely to recognize you if you do that."

"Alright ok... I get your point. The younger and girlier I look, the less likely she is to think connect me to Eric. It's just... I'm worried..." Eric trailed off.

Becky giggled slightly. Ericka reminded her of herself. The nervousness and lack of confidence. Sure it was for different reasons, but it just seemed so appropriate. Of course her little sister would be contending with the same insecurities she had had. Becky just needed to help her get over it. Ericka was too worried about being recognized.

"Don't forget to wear a bra." Becky added. "Elena met you with boobs, so you can't suddenly be flat as a board."

"Damnit damnit. I was just about to take this damn thing off too..."

"Just be more confident in your figure. I'm sure you'll grow in eventually." Becky teased.

Eric chose not to respond. He needed Becky to choose the rest of his outfit.

He'd texted Elena earlier and they had made plans to go to the mall across town. Elena had offered to pick him up when he mentioned his car was in the shop.

Eric removed the clothes he had worn to work. He noticed, as he took off the leggings, that they had been padded like the jeans.

He turned to Becky. "Damnit Becky. These leggings were padded. Why did you put me in these?"

"I didn't want you to be insecure about your lack of curves." She winked. "I know you're a bit embarrassed about your boyish figure."

Eric sighed. "You would phrase it that way."

Eric changed into the knee length skirt and frilly, lacy blouse that Becky had selected. He touched up his makeup reluctantly.

"Do I look OK?" Eric was still nervous.

"You look gorgeous, Ericka. " Came the reply.

"Can you not call me that. There's no one else here. I get enough of it at work, you know?"

"I'm afraid I don't know what you mean. Just because my little sister is out of high school and working doesn't mean I can't use her name, right?"

Eric frowned. "You know."

On that note, Becky gathered up Eric's work clothes for washing and headed out. Leaving Eric with a wink and assurance that he 'just needed to be confident in herself.'

Shortly after, Elena arrived at his house. Eric, realizing that his short heels were the only girl's shoes he had, put them back on. And stepped outside.

"Damnit, I should have gotten some tennis shoes" Eric lamented to himself, before piping up to Elena. "So, we doing anything specific?"
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Girls' night out

choices: Elena ends up inviting Ericka to spend the night
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
"That's cool. I've never done anything like that, myself," Eric told her. Though, he reflected, he did look too much like Mercy for his taste.

"I think it's a lot of fun." Elena mentioned as she drove.

"You go to cons ever?"

"Oh yeah, often. It's the best time to sport my stuff." She responded, smiling.

"I've never been to one actually. They seem fun." Eric admitted.

"You should come out with me some time. You know, you could rock a Mercy cosplay." She said, thinking about Ericka's appearance.

"Thanks." Eric responded, cringing internally.

"You're fine with this? We could go do something else if you're not into." Elena offered, picking up on some of Eric's discomfort.

"No, it's good. I'd like to see what the process is like and stuff." Eric said, honestly.

"Cool yeah. Well I've already got the shoes done and I'm working on the headset. Keep your eyes out for a purple swimsuit." She tells

They arrived at a goodwill store and headed inside, seeking something that might work to copy Widowmaker's shiny, purple ensemble. They didn't really find anything that would work though. Elena wasn't surprised. She explained that sometimes you get lucky at stores like this, so it's smart to look out, but mostly she just ordered what she needed online. She ended up buying a one-piece anyways to use as practice for the intended altering.

"I prefer to make test cuts to get an idea of how it might look on the final costume. You don't want to spend a lot of money on something doomed to fail." She clarified.

"Totally makes sense. Sounds expensive."

"It is a bit expensive, but for me it's worthwhile." She responded.

They left the store.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: I need to go shopping. I'm working on a Wid...

choices: Eric thought Elena knew he was crossdressing
Eric realized that Elena thought he was an underdeveloped girl
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
They continued driving around. Stopping at the mall for a bit like they had planned, then some more local thrift stores. They passed the time with conversation about costumes and strategy. They found little to work with, at least until Elena appeared from an errant clothes rack looking pleased.

"Check out what I found!" She showed Eric some dark orange leggings and a long, bright orange skirt.

"Widowmaker?" Eric asked, confused what the orange color was all about.

"What? Oh no of course not, but don't they seem perfect for a Mercy cosplay? They seem small but they look your size." Elena examined Eric's thighs. Did they seem... thinner than they were at the salon?

"What!?" Eric panicked. "Oh no I couldn't, uh.. I'm not sure."

Elena realized what the problem was! Ericka's thighs were thinner, and her butt was smaller. She must have been wearing padding! No wonder she was so unconfident. She was embarrassed about her figure. And now Elena had just called attention to it. She was so stupid.

"Wait that's not what I meant! It's just they'd look great on you. I don't want to make you uncomfortable or anything. You're fine regardless. It's just rare to see something so perfect. If I ever want to throw together a Mercy cosplay I'll already be started for cheap." Elena smiled, hoping to assuage some of Ericka's insecurity.

She decided to ring them up, hoping she hadn't made Ericka too uncomfortable.

Afterwards, the two of them returned to the car. Eric was still fidgeting uncomfortably. He was already worried about looking too much like Mercy. Looking exactly like her was too much.

"You know." Elena said, hoping to take Ericka's mind off her underdeveloped appearance. "I have other cosplays back at my place. I bet you'd love them. My roommate's out of town so you could totally come over for a bit."

"Other cosplays?" Eric asked. Suitably distracted. Elena was pleased.

"Of course, I said I was working on Widowmaker, but I've been doing this for years now."

Eric was amazed. When had Elena become such a... geek? She seemed like a stereotypical girl in high school. Then, maybe she just acted that way in front of guys. It makes sense that she'd be more open around other girls like... him. Eric turned his mind away from that thought.

"I'd love to check them out." Eric responded enthusiastically, avoiding his previous musings.

"Great! I love showing them off!" Elena said, positively giddy with excitement.

Minutes later they were pulling up to Elena's place.

"Sorry about the mess..." she said, thought the room was far from messy. Just a bit cluttered. No worse than any other living room.

They entered Elena's room. She extracted several outfits. Some from Overwatch, more from anime or other games. They chatted for a while while Elena showed off her costumes. They were all almost completely handmade, and the craftsmanship seemed to improve as the costumes became more recent. It was impressive the amount of effort Elena had been putting in to this.

Honestly high school wasn't that long ago, and some of these outfits were made in the timespan. Eric wondered if he and Elena could have bonded like this back then. Though, he supposed, he wasn't Ericka back then.

"Hey," Elena said inquisitively, "Do you work tomorrow?"

"What? Oh uh, no. Only weekdays, far as I know..."

"Awesome, me neither. We can hang out all night if you want."

"Where do you work?"

"I'm just a Barista at Starbucks. I'm hoping to make a career out of cosplaying and tailoring for it though. I've already made a couple bucks off of small commissions, though I haven't got anything consistent going."

It seemed the two of them were more alike than Eric realized. She wanted to cosplay professionally and he wanted to stream professionally. Elena seemed to make the connection as well, remembering his statement at the salon.

"You mentioned you wanted to stream right? That's super cool. You said you usually play Mercy right? I bet I could put together a quick Mercy cosplay for you, only a few days with that stuff I bought! You could wear it while you stream, I bet the viewers would love it!"

Eric was afraid about where this was going. If he dressed up as Mercy on stream then everyone would mistake him for a girl.

He voiced tentative concerns. "Oh no I couldn't. There's no way I could pay you for that, and I probably wouldn't look that good in it either..."

"Nonsense!" Elena countered. "I'd put it together for you for free. If you really wanted to pay me back for it you could just direct your viewers to my website, more traffic means more commissions, so you'd essentially be making up the cost for me anyways. And of course you would look good in it. Come with me."

Elena grabbed Eric's arm and pulled him into the bathroom, grabbing a couple pieces of clothing as she went.

"Take of your shirt." Elena said.

"Sorry, I uh.. I can't" Eric was a deer caught in the headlights. What if she found out he was a guy? What would she think? Would she call him a pervert? Kick him out? Report him to the salon? Oh god what was he going to do?

Sensing Ericka's insecurity Elena pushed harder. "Come on it won't be a problem. There's nothing to be ashamed off."

Elena started removing Eric's blouse. Eric froze, offering no resistance, not knowing what to do. Elena pulled the shirt off and got a good look at Ericka's torso.

Wait, was her bra stuffed? Of course! She really was a late bloomer. Elena facepalmed, chastising herself again for being so inconsiderate with a teenage girl's embarrassment. She knew what it was like to want to hide things, after all.

Eric was mortified. Elena knew! Oh god! "Wait!" He yelled. "I can explain! I'm just doing this because... the salon! I uh, my car broke down! I needed the money and I was afraid that if I didn't look like a girl I wouldn't get to work. And I uh, I'm sorry. Please, please don't be mad."

Eric closed his eyes. Hoping Elena would let him off easy.

"Oh honey." Elena said, sadly. "Don't worry, it's not that weird. It makes sense that you'd do that to fit in at the salon. I totally understand. Why would I be mad?"

Eric opened one eye. "So you don't think I'm weird."

"No, of course not. It's totally reasonable. In fact, I think I can help you out."

Eric sighed in relief, confident now that Elena hadn't realized that they had met before when he was Eric, and relieved that she wasn't furious at him.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Elena ends up inviting Ericka to spend the night

choices: Elena gives Eric some female hormones her roommate used to use
Elena grabs some anti-anxiety pills that she doesn't use anymore
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
"I'm so glad you understand. I've just been so worried recently. I got a letter from a fan saying that she thought I was a really good female role model. But I've just been worried that other people have been misconstruing me. You know? Like people are seeing me as a girl and role model. And I'm just afraid. I can't be the person people might think I am. What if the mistake makes people think I'm a fraud." Eric babbles, so happy that he can be honest with Elena. "But now you can see why I can't dress up as Mercy right? It'll give the wrong idea."

Elena was honestly shocked. She didn't realize Ericka was having so many reservations. She seemed so enthusiastic about video games earlier. Elena knew how Ericka felt though. After all she had gone through something similar when she had decided to seriously pursue cosplaying and costume making.

She resolved to try to help Ericka out. "You shouldn't be so worried about people's perceptions. It's ok if they think of you like that. There's no reason to go against it right?"

"I suppose..." Eric wasn't sure how to feel.

"Like, you should just embrace it! It'll be fine. People will love it. And if it's based on what you think is a flawed perception that doesn't matter."

"You really think so? But what if people find out?" Eric was still not convinced. How could embracing people thinking of him as a girl work out?

"They won't. Just be confident in yourself and there won't be anything to find out!"

Eric considered that for a moment. He guessed Elena had a point. He didn't really want his viewers to think he was a girl. But he was already having fun streaming and building up a viewer base. If they already thought he was a girl... Well then nothing would change would it? He'd still have fun streaming right?

Eric conceded. "I guess you're right."

Elena was ecstatic. "So you'll dress up as Mercy on stream then? Oh that's so great! I'll get started on the costume right away! We already have the leggings. All we need is halo and wings. The armor should be fairly easy with the stuff I already have here."

Eric was happy that Elena was happy, but he was still unsure. "Oh, I uh, already have a halo. A fan sent it. But what about--" He gestured to his flat chest.

"If you're really so worried about stuffing, maybe I can find something that will make you less anxious."

"Could you?" Eric asked tentatively. "It's just... I wouldn't want to mess up."

It'd be nice to have something to ease his nervousness, but he also didn't want to impose any more. Elena was being so understanding.

"Absolutely, in fact I think I have just the thing in the medicine cabinet. I can set you up right now."
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Eric thought Elena knew he was crossdressing

choices: Eric agrees to model for the rest of today and tomorrow
Eric makes some sort of excuse to get out of it
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
Upon hearing Ericka's assent, Elena opened up the cabinet behind the mirror, pulling out a nondescript bottle.

"My roommate used these for a while, but she doesn't need them. They'll take a while before you really see results, but I still think they'll help. I hope just knowing you have them will give you the confidence you need. Take two a day. Four if you really want quick results."

Eric took the pills. "Thanks so much. Are you sure I can have these? What if your roommate needs them again?"

"Nah, she won't. She used them and they did their thing. She's not gonna take anymore, so they're just sitting there gathering dust." Elena assures Ericka. "I can always buy more, anyways."

Eric set them aside, his fears assuaged. "Alright cool. Now, can I, uh.." He gestured to his blouse, still in Elena's hand.

"Oh right!" She responded. "Wait I wanted you to try this on." She picked up the shirt she had grabbed from her room. "It should be a tight fit, but it's what I would use as the base for Mercy's armor. While you throw that on I've got another thing to get."

Elena left the room, leaving Eric with the smooth long-sleeved black shirt. Eric put it on. It was a tight fit, but not too tight. It wasn't restricting, at least, and it was very comfortable. As he adjusted it getting it to sit right, Elena returned carrying something.

In her hands were two large pieces of.. plastic? It seemed more flexible than hard plastic was.

Eric asked her about them. "What are those?"

"These are what I plan to use as the base for Mercy's armor. I originally got them for my Reinhardt armor because they have the right look, but their too flimsy to stand on their own like I'd need for that, so I had to get something more rigid. They'll work great for Mercy though, since her armor will hug your body. Check it out."

Elena laid the pieces against Eric's torso, moulding them along his stuffed bra. It made Eric's figure look decidedly feminine, but he supposed that was the goal if he was going to look like mercy.

"It's cool that you have these, but is it really alright that you're using these pieces for me?"

"Of course it's alright. Plus I'm pretty sure we're basically the same size, I mean look how well that shirt fits you."

Eric nodded. "Right."

"So like you can always give it back to me and it'll fit me. Still I don't think I could possibly pull off Mercy like you could." Elena looked Ericka over. "I mean your hair is just the right color and the style is perfect on you. It's incredible. If she was real, I'd say you were her little sister."

Eric was getting used to being called someone's 'little sister' at this point. But the thought still stung slightly. It certainly wasn't what he was hoping for when he'd gotten Becky's hand-me-downs. Eric voiced his quiet assent.

"Anyways." Elena continued. "Looking at this I bet I could get this outfit cooked up at lightspeed. I just need to paint on the designs and carve up the material into the right shape. We already have the leggings, and it'll be easy to cannibalize the skirt to get all the rest of the orange cloth. If you're willing to stay still and act like a mannequin I could probably finish everything but the wings by the end of the weekend! We can work on it tonight. And then continue tomorrow. We'll make a whole day out of it! Uh, I mean if you're down, of course"

Elena trailed off, having gotten caught up in her own excitement.

Eric, having already decided that dressing up as mercy on stream would be fine, saw no reason at this point to not oblige her. Elena would probably be fun company to play video games with, and he didn't have plans to do anything else over the weekend. Though he was remiss about not using the next as an opportunity to stream for a long while, he imagined that dressing up as Mercy would make up for it. CosplayGirl91 would love it. Though Eric still had reservations about 'confirming' that he was a girl..
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Elena gives Eric some female hormones her roomm...

1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
Uh.. Sure, I guess." Eric agreed, weakly. "Sounds fun."

"Great! Let's get started right away." Elena replied, rushing out of the bathroom.

Eric followed awkwardly. As soon as he entered the room after her, Elena positioned Eric in a specific spot.

"Alright, just stand still there. The lighting's good."

Elena pulled out a sheet with what looked like measurements, then began examining the armor material she was planning on using. Eric stood there awkwardly while Elena went to her computer and pulled up several reference pictures of Mercy.

Grabbing a stool and setting her computer on it next to Eric, she got to work.

"Hold this" She commanded, pressing one of the panels to Eric's torso. "Make sure you keep it steady."

Elena grabbed a pen and measuring tape, first putting marks in specific locations, then actually tracing out a line where the armor would end on Mercy's side. She repeated the process with the other piece on Eric's other side, using the first to ensure that they were symmetrical.

"Alright that's all I need you for for now. I'm gonna start cutting and work on the bits that I need to compare from Mercy's pictures."

"Is it really that quick?" Eric asked. Less than an hour had passed.

"Well normally no, but assuming your measurements are basically the same as mine, a big portion of the work is already done. I've done similar armor before for other cosplays, so it's almost rote at this point. The hard part is going to be the wings, but we don't have the materials for those right now anyways."

"Alright." Eric was impressed. Elena seemed to have this almost down to a science. Her were area seemed a bit cluttered, but Elena always had the right tool on hand whenever she shifted to working on something else. Holding the armor in place, carving it, shaping designs, sewing, it was all there.

Eric watched Elena work for a while.

"You know this bit's going to take a bit longer. Just take off that shirt and once I'm done modifying it I'll need you again. In the meantime you can play some overwatch on my computer or something."

Eric thought that was a fine idea and removed his shirt. This time not worried about his stuffed bra since, after all, Elena knew he was a guy.

Elena was pleased that Ericka was much less embarrassed about dressing down in front of her this time.

"Don't forget to take those pills" She reminded Ericka. Seizing the opportunity to try and reinforce her confidence.

"Right." Eric replied, heading to the bathroom.

He opened up the pill bottle and was a bit surprised to see circular tablets. Anxiety medication that he had seen before was usually in capsules, but he supposed that this wasn't anything particularly out of the ordinary. He swallowed four pills. They left a pretty terrible taste in his mouth.

Eric returned to Elena's 'workshop' and fired up Overwatch on her computer. Elena continued to work, occasionally looking over at Eric's play and complementing him. Elena was impressed at how talented Ericka was. Maybe Mercy could be viable in this meta?

Eventually Elena finished up her work for the night. Conscripting Eric as a mannequin again for a short while after splicing the armor with the shirt and altering the sleeves to be primarily orange.

"Hey," she asked, "do you plan on staying over? Like I said, Roommate's out of town, and this place gets lonely."

Eric didn't see much reason to decline. He enjoyed her company and he didn't have any plans for the night. Though he was remiss about spending the night as a girl...
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Eric agrees to model for the rest of today and ...

1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
"Sure, I mean if you're fine with it" Eric said, thinking it a bit odd that Elena would want a guy to spend the night. "I didn't bring anything to sleep in though. Should we head back to my place really quick?"

"Nah, we're the same size remember. Just throw this on." Elena dug out a thin night-dress and tossed it to Eric.

In the mean time, she stripped down, digging out a comfy looking, and much more conservative pair of pajamas for herself. Eric averted his gaze, embarrassed.

"Do you have anything more like what you're wearing." Eric asked pleadingly.

"Nope." Elena replied cheerfully. "You'll look great in that anyways. Don't be so worried. This sort of thing is what those pills are going to help with."

Eric didn't feel much better yet, but he supposed there wasn't any point pressing the issue. He donned the outfit, removing his skirt and socks. He was embarrassed by the sheer gown, transparent in several places. It did hide his chest, making him look decidedly feminine, much to his chagrin. He removed the stuffing from his bra, but it did little to help the matter.

Seeing Ericka's red face and boyish figure, Elena did what she could to be reassuring. "You look great. Probably better in that thing than I ever have... oh, you've got plain nails. Hey, let me return the favor for the salon earlier."

Eric tried to decline. "You payed at the salon. It was hardly a favor."

Elena, however, insisted. "Pretty please? I owe you for saving me from staying here alone tonight. Plus you're going to be my Mercy."

"If anything, dressing up like that is a favor to me!" He continued to resist, not realizing the path his argument had taken.

Elena just kept looking at him like a forlorn puppy.

Eric finally capitulated. "Sure alright. Go ahead." He could believe he was agreeing to this.

Elena gave a little cheer, sitting him down at the desk and pulling out her nail care materials.

"This could take a bit." She said. "You should play a game of Overwatch while I work."

Eric was fine with that. Anything to take his mind off of how feminine he was becoming. He allowed himself to become engrossed in the game.

Once Elena was done she shook him out of it. Waiting, of course, for him to finish his match. Looking down at Elena's urging, Eric saw that Elena had painted his toes hot pink. Even going so far as to adorn his big toes with flower designs. It was honestly impressive.

"Wow, that's really good." Eric complemented, the skill behind the painting taking his mind off the fact that those were his toes.

Elena and Eric continued playing games and chatting through the night. Staying up altogether too late before finally deciding to go to get some actual sleep.

"You asleep?" He heard Elena ask?

"Wha? no... i don't think I was", Eric was awoken from his tired stupor

"Either way its probably time to get some shut eye, thanks for hanging out with me, I don't have a lot of geeky girl friends." She says shutting off the game and climbing into bed.

"Me neither," Eric replied tiredly, following Elena into her bed. He was too tired to pay any heed to Elena's 'girl friends' comment.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Stay for the night

choices: Elena and Eric run into Becky at the hardware store.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
The light sneaking into Elena's room danced across Eric's face, forcing him awake. He was lying at an awkward angle in Elena's bed, her arm resting over him almost protectively. Squinting, Eric gently lifted Elena's arm off his flat chest.

As he did, he heard Elena's sleep muttering "mmMm.. brave little sister..".

He did his best not to wake her. He felt extremely awkward about this whole sleeping situation. It had been a while since he shared a bed with a girl, and it had never been like this. He stretched, working out the sleep-borne kinks in his arms, and yawned. He finally got a good look at what he was wearing and blushed. He'd never expected to wear anything like that to sleep either.

He tried to slide out of bed, not wanting to be stuck in this outfit any longer than he needed to. In doing so he disturbed Elena. She yawned and stretch.

"Good morning." She said, sleepily. "Sleep well?"

"Yeah actually."

"Me too." Elena hopped out of bed with an energy that she hadn't possessed a moment earlier.

She stripped, much to Eric's embarrassment, and put on some regular clothes.

"Ready for some more modeling today? I made a lot of progress last night. I think all that's left is the more elaborate construction, joints and designs and stuff."

"Sure" Eric replied, eager to see how the final outfit would turn out. Though he didn't see the prospect of wearing it with the same enthusiasm.

Elena walked out and made some coffee. Eric took the opportunity to change back into his 'going out clothes'. He and Elena continued their conversation from last night. Talking about video games primarily, but also about their career pursuits. Eric was intrigued by the intricacies of cosplay and costume construction, and Elena was likewise intrigued by Eric's streaming.

"So," Elena asked, "When are you planning on streaming next? I'd love to watch. What's your handle?"

Eric was still having his misgivings about streaming as a girl. Telling Elena who he was meant there really was no going back. If he did, she was going to watch his stream. And he had agreed with her that he would stream as a girl. His audience was going to think he was a girl. Still, he had already given this its consideration. It would be fine, right? Streaming wouldn't be any different. Who cared if they thought he was a girl. He knew the truth and that was good enough.

"I'm probably going to stream tomorrow, maybe tonight even, if I'm feeling up for it. I stream as Eric KaBoom."

"Ericka Boom?" Elena confirmed. "I'll be sure to tune in."

Eric, not noticing her mispronunciation continued with the conversation.

"Actually if you want you could cameo in the stream." He offered. "If you really finish with the Mercy costume that quickly and I wear it, then you can show up and I can give you a shoutout. It's the least I can do, after all."

"Really? That sounds fun. I'd love to watch you work." Elena agreed.

"It's settled then"

Eric and Elena ate breakfast and Elena took a shower, leaving the door half-open. When she finished, she walked out with only a towel wrapped around her, wringing out her hair. Eric was a bit uncomfortable.

"Need a shower too?" She asked.

"I don't have any of my stuff." Eric said awkwardly.

"That's no prob." Came Elena's reply. "Just use my products. The body wash is the pink bottle, the shampoo's purple and the conditioner's the blue one up high."

"Oh, uh, ok." Eric agreed, seeing no available excuses.

He went into the bathroom and closed the door, being sure to lock it. He noticed that his makeup had smudged overnight. He really ought to have washed it off. He quickly stripped and hopped in the shower. He cleaned up, using Elena's products as directed. He climbed out of the shower smelling distinctly of lavender, but he didn't really think too much of it. He walked back into the living room.

Seeing him, Elena perked up. "Great." She said, grabbing his hand. "Help me out with my makeup."

"Uh, ok." Eric obliged, applying a subtle amount, as directed.

"Now I'll do you." Elena said, beginning before Eric could protest.

Elena expertly decorated his face, applying the makeup in a way that looked significantly more girly than anything Eric would have done for himself. She looked pleased at her work.

Eric looked in the mirror, seeing a pretty young girl looking back at him. It really was well done. Eric was moderately impressed. His protests at the reflection being his own being pushed out by his admiration for the execution.

"It's great." Eric offered. "Did you just pick the skill up, or what?"

"I get a lot of practice from cosplaying." She explained. "A lot of really precise stuff."

Eric was a bit unsettled by how girly he looked. Honestly how could someone not see him as a girl like this? Still it was fine, it's not like anyone else would see this. And Elena knew his secret too. She must have just been dressing him up in anticipation of him playing Mercy.

"Anyways." Elena said "We've got some more work to do on this Mercy costume. The body's basically finished aside from a bit more construction that will only take an hour or so. What we really need now are the wings."

"Yeah you mentioned that the armor material wasn't sturdy enough?"

"Exactly, but I know just the thing. I've made protruding fixtures like that before. We need to take a trip to the hardware store."

"The hardware store?" Eric asked. "I'm going to go there dressed like this?"

Upon Eric stating that, Elena realized he had a point. "You're right." She said. "You can't wear the same clothes two days in a row. We're the same size. I'll grab you something."

"Wait.. That's, not what I meant..." Eric trailed off. Elena had already left the room.

She returned with a light blue sundress.

"Put this on", she said "It's loose. It'll look good with your figure."

"Are you sure? I mean that's not really hardware store attire." Eric tried to get out of it.

"Doesn't matter. Not like we're going to be building anything. It's just like shopping for clothes, except we're going to be picking up pipes and whatnot instead."

"Alright.. I suppose." Eric conceded, not really having much reason to not wear the thing. He was already wearing that makeup after all. Wearing a dress wouldn't be any different from wearing the skirt and blouse.

Eric donned the sundress. It physically wasn't too different from the skirt, but it felt off. More breezy and girly.

"Great, let's go." Elena said enthusiastically.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: More modeling tomorrow

choices: He was able to convince her not to come
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
Elena and Eric walked out of Elena's house. Eric felt awkward wearing the dress. Going to a hardware store wouldn't be any different than going to a thrift store, he justified. They were just going to pick up some more costume materials.

They stepped into Elena's car. Elena started the conversation. "Yeah I go to the hardware store pretty frequently. Turns out there's a lot of useful stuff there for making costumes. Tools, materials, the works. Plus when I have something really intensive I need to build I sometimes ask an employee there to help me out."

Eric was surprised. Basically all he ever did at a hardware store was buy lightbulbs. He supposed it made sense though. Elena had demonstrated her tool knowhow and organization yesterday.

They pulled up the the hardware store and stepped out of the car. Eric smoothed his dress. Examining the place, it was a rather small building. 'Ericson's Hardware', it was called. A simple name. It was tucked into the corner of a shopping center, sort of out of the way. Through the front window shelves with arrays of valves on them were visible, a strange thing to have at the front of a store, but whatever. The front counter was also in sight, though it was unmanned. There seemed to be nobody inside as well, though the sign on the front said the store was open.

"So what exactly are we looking for?" He asked.

"Several things." Elena said, "but I know a guy."

"Oh?"

"Just observe."

They stepped into the store. Nobody was around.

"HEY ERICSON!" Elena called out. "Get out here you lazy asshole! There are paying customers waiting for you!"

Eric flinched at her outburst.

A call came from some distant corner of the store, which seemed much larger now that you were inside. "If it isn't my least favorite customer!" A man's voice yelled back, though there was no malice in it. "Come to apologize for your past misdeeds?"

Elena led Eric towards the voice. "No." She called back. "I came here to buy things, idiot." Elena smiles.

A third voice came from some other place in the store. This was getting ridiculous. "Elena is that you?" Becky?

"Hey Becky! What a surprise to find you here!" Elena responded.

Eric had yet to see any of the people Elena was talking to. Was that normal at this store?

They reached the corner that the man's voice came from in short order. Standing there was a twenty something guy with short cropped brown hair and... no shirt on. His muscular body glistened slightly with sweat. Eric noted how much more fit the guy seemed compared to him and his scrawny body. He was probably only slightly older too. He was fixing something to the wall, but as Eric and Elena approached he turned.

"Elena! What brings you to my humble shop. Need something?" He grinned wildly.

"It seems I don't" She responded. "No shirt, no shoes, no service and all that."

"That's not how it works." He quipped back. "It's only customers that've gotta obey the dress code. Though I'd probably be willing to make an exception for you or your cute friend." He turned his gaze on Eric, who blushed and shifted slightly behind Elena.

It was then that Becky made her appearance, materializing from a rack between Elena and Ericson.

"Oi" She chastised. "Stop bothering Elena's friends. You did this to me when she brought me here too. You'll lose your business that way." Becky pokes him on the forehead.

"Alright alright." He conceded. "What is it you're here for Elena. And who's your friend."

"I'm a bit interested to know too. Who have you cursed now with this horrid-- Ericka?" Becky paused as she caught sight of you. Her grin widened unsettlingly. "And why are you here on this fine day, little sis"

Ericson chimed in. "Little sister? You never told me you had a little sister. Why didn't you set me up with--"

"Ericka's too young for you." Elena cut him off. "Now are you going to help us or what?"

"Ericka" Ericson smiled. "Good name choice."

Becky piped up, "Isn't it?"

"So what are you here for?" Ericson asked.

"I'm making a cosplay for her." Elena said, gesturing at Eric. "And I need some materials. We're basically trying to build what look like robotic angel wings. I've got several reference pictures."

Elena pulled out several photos of Mercy, and what looked like some sketches that she had made. When did she draw those up?

"Alright cool" Ericson nodded, taking the pictures from Elena. "I think we can throw something together."

Becky peered around his side, getting a look at the picture "Oh? Dressing up as that angel girl Ericka? I thought you didn't want to."

Eric shot Becky a glare. "Elena convinced me it was a good idea."

Ericson mentioned something about pvc and he and Elena walked off with purpose, leaving Eric and his sister alone in the corner of the store. Becky gave him a smug look.

"Your makeup looks extra cute today." She said "And that dress is super cute. Where'd you get it?"

"Elena loaned it to me. And she did my makeup."

"I wish you would have been so willing when I was trying to decide your outfit" Becky pouted. "She's even getting you to dress up like a beautiful angel. How come you've changed your mind about being my little sister?" She smiled again.

"Elena convinced me." Eric began explaining.

"So you really did change your mind?" Becky asked, actually surprised.

"No! Well, yes, sort of." Eric snaps off. "I was thinking about that note I got from my fan, you know. And I told Elena about how I was worried my audience might see me as a girl."

"You told her that you weren't a girl?"

"Well she saw me and my stuffed bra, so she figured it out. It was fine though. I slept with her over at her place last night. There was no problem." Eric supplied.

Becky pondered for a moment. Elena was certainly treating Eric like a girl still. Perhaps he had misunderstood. Still, it wasn't important. What was important was how unbelievably cute he was in that dress and how he didn't seem that uncomfortable. He certainly was acting less out of place than he was yesterday, even when they were in private together.

"That doesn't explained why you're dressing up as a female video game character now."

"I'm getting to that." Eric said, bothered. "Anyways I told her I was worried that my audience would think I was a girl, and she basically said it didn't matter. She put it better, but like, regardless of what they think of me, if I enjoy streaming and they enjoy watching then their perception of me didn't matter. Nothing changes if they think I'm a girl. She even gave me some anti-anxiety pills. Well I considered that and it made sense. So I figured I wouldn't change anything..." Eric trailed off.

"Go on." Becky said, helpfully. "Now you're dressing up as an angel."

"Well Elena said I looked like her, and that she had the materials. And then she begged me to let her make me an outfit." Eric clarified exasperatedly. "Long story short I'm going to wear the costume on stream. Short story short I'm really going to need those anti-anxiety pills."

"That's great!" Becky said. Clapping Eric on the back. "You're going to look so cute all dressed up. I can't wait to see it. You just have to send me pictures. Better yet, I'll come back with you and watch the magic in process!"

"No!" Eric said, quickly. "No, you can't."

"And why is that?" Becky feigned confusion.

Eric searched for a reason to muster up. He didn't want his sister seeing him cosplaying. It was too much already.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Elena and Eric run into Becky at the hardware s...

choices: Elena and Ericson had made surprising progress in their little time.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
"Uh.. It's just.. You can't just invite yourself over. I mean Elena's already hosting me, wouldn't it be imposing on her to come too? She's going to be working and.. uh.. you're not interested in video games anyways.." Eric concluded weakly.

Becky grinned. "Nonsense. I'm friends with Elena. I'll simply be showing up to help her deal with my little sister. I'm sure I'll be nothing but helpful."

Becky put her arm around Eric's shoulder. "Why are you here anyways?" Eric asked, half to Becky and half to fate itself.

"I was buying lightbulbs." Becky shrugged, holding up a bag. Huh.

"Alright, whatever." Eric capitulated.

"I knew you'd come around." Becky said cheerfully. "Now why don't we see how the construction crew is doing?"

Becky put her arm over Eric's shoulder and started leading him to some other part of the shop. Casually throwing open an Employees Only door, Becky strode in to what appeared to be a sort of break room, pulling Eric in after her.

"Shouldn't we wait outside the employees only area?" Eric asked.

"Nah, Ericson's the only person around right now and he knows me. There's never any business at this hour so nobody else shows up and he just holds down the fort. Now come on, they'll be in the workshop."

Upon entering the workshop, Eric and Becky saw what could generously be described as a horrid mess. The whole place looked like a tornado had gone through it, with random shapes of various scrap materials piled haphazardly wherever there wasn't some sort of machine. The saws, mills and other such things did have islands of tidiness around them, either surrounded by empty space or by neat racks with drill bits and that sort of thing, as necessary. Eric wasn't really sure, but this seemed like more than basic hardware store equipment. He looked around for Elena.

Eric and Becky crossed the threshold of the room, hoping to get a better view. After only three steps they were met with the sound of Ericson's voice.

"Stop! Safety glasses!"

Becky froze immediately. "Sorry." She yelled back, looking legitimately contrite.

She pulled Eric backwards and towards a rack on the wall, grabbing a pair of plastic glasses and shoving a second pair onto his face.

"Since when are you so concerned about safety? Or perhaps do you have some other motivation?" Eric teased.

Becky blushed for a moment, before masking her face. "Oh little sis, you don't want to go down that road with me." She said ominously.

"Don't I?" Eric asked coyly.

"Did you paint those nails yourself? It's a great design. You'll be a full stylist at the salon in no time!" Becky looked pointedly at Eric's toes.

Eric blanched. "Elena did them." He said quietly.

Becky stood back. "Victory. Now let's see how my little angel's costume is coming."

Eric pulled his arms closer to himself, embarrassed. "Can't you just let me have a little teasing, considering the last few days?"

"I would never let my little sister get one up on me." Becky pulled Eric over towards when Ericson's voice had come from.

Navigating the scattered piles of junk and various high quality machines, they arrived at the table Elena and Ericson were working at. The thing had a serious of symbols on it in strict fashion that probably would have made more sense to someone with more experience in carpentry or whatever than Eric and Becky had. As it was they were both lost.

Sizing up the situation, Eric was at least able to tell that:
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: His excuses fell flat

1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
Eric was at least able to tell that Elena had made some significant progress. Arranged on the table were various pieces of plastic clearly laid out in the shape of one of Mercy's wings. Sure they were blocky and not connected, but to Eric's untrained eye it seemed like all that needed to be done was that they needed to be put together somehow. Surely that would be quick. He had thought this was going to be a much longer process than it was turning out to be.

He approached the preliminary construction. "So this is going to be a wing?" He asked. "Is this as close to done as it looks? It seems like all you need to do is make all these pieces look smoother."

"Nah." Said Elena, Ericson nodding along. "This is just part 2 of sketching basically. We're trying to see if these pieces could be made fit together right. After that I want the wings to articulate, so we'll need joints for all the connections. Then we also need the light feathers, which I have an idea for but still need to set up. Then finally we can sand down the pieces, then paint them. And THEN we still have to attach them to the torso robustly."

"Basically what she's saying is we'll be finished by the end of the day. Just for you." Ericson said, giving Eric a wink. Becky's expression soured slightly.

"Well.. He's not necessarily wrong. Everything we need to construct the actual wings is here in the machine shop. There's so much spare stuff that we'll certainly be able to find the pieces we need. Plus the tools here are great. We can even suspend the pieces in place while we construct the thing so we can do it in any order!" Elena excitedly gestured to some sort of apparatus with several vice-looking things with that last statement. "If I just stay here and work on it for a while. I should get it cranked out in a couple of hours.. but I'll need Ericson's help." At that, she looked at Becky penitently.

Becky cocked an eyebrow.

Ericson put a hand behind his head somewhat awkwardly. "Well I can't just leave the shop unmanned you see, even if it is the weekend. Plus the materials we're using and the machine time aren't actually free..."

"They are for me." Elena said. "You still owe me a favor."

"Fine, ok. But the point is if there were some cute girls handling the front of the store then I could work back here just fine."

"Wait Elena." Eric jumped in. "I don't want you to use a favor just for me. You're already making this costume free. I mean I really appreciate it.. I, it's just, you don't need to do so much."

"Nonsense. This is as much for me as it is for you. You're a perfect Mercy, Ericka, and I've been itching to use some of my ideas for this costume. The wings are going to be super cool." Elena responded.

"Ok. If you're sure.." Eric agreed.

Elena turned back to Becky. "Anyways if you and Ericka could handle the front while we work on this I'd really appreciate it. Ericson's the only one allowed to use some of these machin--"

Becky interrupted. "Ericka will do it. I'll help out here."

"I will." Eric asked. "Huh?"

"Don't you need to pay off Elena for this costume?" Her malevolent gaze turned on Eric, who had to resist the urge to flinch.

"Nah, it's fi--" Elena began, but was cut off by a look from Becky.

"Sure that's fine too. We could use an extra pair of hands." Ericson chimed in diplomatically.

"Wait, I can't run a hardware store." Eric said nervously. "What if someone asks me for something?"

"Nobody ever comes here." Said Becky.

Ericson dramatically feigned being wounded. "How could you say such a thing?"

Becky gave him a withering look.

"Yeah but it'll be fine. There's a 'secret' store map in the front counter: middle drawer on the left. If someone comes in and asks for something, just look it up on that." Ericson agreed awkwardly.

"But I don't really know anything abou--" Eric was cut off by Becky. She walked up to him and marched him around the corner. Elena and Ericson just watched awkwardly.

"You can. It'll be just like the salon. Please just be a good sister and do this for me." Becky's demeanor changed dramatically. She was figuratively on her knees.

"Ok, but you owe me. Especially if someone comes in and sees me like this." Eric replied.

"Even after I gave you my clothes and got you a job and helped you out so much?" Becky's tone changed abruptly again.

"But actually though." Eric said.

"Fine." Becky agreed. "I owe you."

"Actually can I get this in writing? Is there a recording device around here I could borrow? Does this count as your little sister 'getting one up on you'?"

"That depends. Are you my little sister?" Becky left Eric with that, gesturing for him to get moving. As she did she spoke to Elena and Ericson, "So let's get started." She said cheerfully. "How can I help?"

Eric shuddered slightly. In the past couple of days it had gotten far to easy for him to think of himself as a girl. As Becky's 'little sister', even. And it didn't look like that was going to be stopping any time soon. Still, he had made a friend right? And the stream had been going well aside from the whole girl thing.

Lost in his thoughts Eric meandered back to the store entrance, taking up a position behind the front counter much like he would do at the salon. This wasn't how he expected today to go. Then again, what exactly did he expect after agreeing to model Mercy for Elena? Actual modeling? He supposed this was probably better than that. There was no dressing or undressing, for one. He wondered what exactly he was supposed to do as he stood awkwardly at the counter.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Elena and Ericson had made surprising progress...

choices: Costume assembly finishes without a hitch. Eric streams as Mercy
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
Eric waited for a short while. He wondered how it was exactly that he ended up in this situation: working as a clerk for a hardware store so his sister could spend time with a guy who was helping his new friend make a costume so he could dress up as Mercy, a female character, on a public stream. He didn't have time for the absurdity of the situation to sink in, however, because he was interrupted by the door opening.

In walked a twenty-something woman. Her long stride carried her smoothly forward, her heels clicking on the concrete floor as she glided towards Eric. Her sundress swayed with her in a way that was eerily similar to the way Eric's did. He lacked the grace this woman possessed, but the comparison was no less unsettling to him.

Shaking Eric from his thoughts, the woman asked "Hey, uh, is Ericson here. I was hoping to drop something off with him." She held up an envelope.

"Oh yeah, he's just in the back. I can go give it to him, I guess." Eric responded.

"What's he doing, taking a nap? Don't answer that." The woman chuckled, but then began examining Eric more closely. "Say, you don't actually work here do you?"

"No, uh.." Eric stammered, but was interrupted.

The woman's expression brightened. "So you must be Elena's friend then! That's perfect. I'll just leave this with you."

She handed Eric the envelope. He took it, nodding awkwardly.

"Make sure that gets to her. I owed her a favor and that's how I'm paying it off." The woman said. "Anyways I'm Amelia, what's your name?"

"Ericka." Eric responded.

"Well, always nice to meet a friend of Elena's, see you around." Amelia left as quickly as she came, leaving Eric alone in the store once more.

Eric debated for a moment heading to the back in order to give Elena the envelope, but figured he wouldn't bother. No reason to interrupt the work, and he probably wasn't supposed to leave the store unmanned. He went back to waiting. No patrons showed up at the store.

A few hours later Elena, Becky and Ericson finished their work and returned to the main floor of the store. Finding Eric still standing near the front, twiddling his thumbs, having nothing to do.

"Anyone show up while we were gone?" Becky asked, cheerfully. Eric was jolted out of his stupor. He was surprised to see everyone there.

"Yeah actually." Eric responded.

"Oh," Ericson was mildly surprised. "Were you able to find everything ok then?"

"Well she wasn't actually here for the store. Said she owed Elena a favor and wanted to drop this off here." Eric gestured to the envelope. "She assumed I would be able to give it to you, which I suppose wasn't incorrect."

"Oh hey!" Elena said. "That's great. Who was it, did you ask?"

"Her name was Amelia." Eric responded.

"Ooh, I think I know what's in there then." Elena snatched up the envelope and tore it open in a single motion. "Spa coupons!" She held up two small green pieces of paper.

Ericson cocked his eyebrow.

"Say," Elena said, "Are you doing anything tomorrow Becky? There are two here, I get a bonus guest."

"Yeah actually." Becky put her hand behind her head awkwardly. "I, ah.. had some errands I needed to do today that I forgot about."

Eric shot her a smug look.

Becky narrowed her eyes at him. "Ericka's not doing anything tomorrow though! She'd love to come with you."

Eric flinched. "Wait, uh, you know I couldn't." He directed the statement at Elena. "Uh.."

"Oh that's great!" Elena said. "We'll have another girl's day. It'll be super fun! Don't be shy."

"ok.." Eric shrunk down.

"I bet it'll be relaxing after your stream tonight. You said you were really stressed about it right?"

"Yeah, uh, I wasn't even sure I was going to stream tonight." Eric replied.

"Oh no, you have to! We're gonna get your Mercy costume done super quick. We've already assembled the wings and sanded them down. Yeah, and all that's left is painting back at my place and putting in the feathers of light. They're not going to light up like I was hoping but that's not a big deal." Elena said, becoming more subdued at her last statement before piping up again. "I guess there's a bit of finishing left on the torso beyond just painting, but that's going to be trivial. Plus, Becky's helping so it'll be that much quicker." Elena pulled Becky in bodily, practically wrenching her to the side.

"I wouldn't want my sister's costume to be anything but perfect, after all." Becky said, her tone held a note of malevolence that didn't really fit the words of the statement. Eric was the only one who noticed.

"Well, see you all later." Ericson concluded. "I've got to stick around here. It was nice to have an actual project to work on, fun stuff. Though I'm a fan of the design as much as the construction and Becky already had all that hammered out. I'll see you around." Ericson took Eric's place behind the counter. "Come back any time Ericka." He said with a wink as Eric left him there.

Becky, Eric and Elena departed. Elena held the Mercy wings gingerly, as though they were children. Though they looked fairly sturdy to Eric. Elena's caution did little to hide her glee as the walked though. She was practically bursting at the seams with excitement. She kept talking about the various elements of the design that she had worked out some time ago, mentioning worries that had proved unfounded in the construction and redundancies that she had put in. It was all a bit over Eric's head, Becky's too. They nodded along though. Eric pleased that his new friend was having fun. Becky was pleased that Eric was going to be wearing those things, Elena's excitement was a bit contagious though, she took care not to get too caught up.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Someone enters looking for help

choices: Becky notices the tablets are female hormones but doesn't say.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
After arriving back at Elena's, Eric, Becky and Elena went to work finishing up the costume. While Elena painted and finished up everything, Eric and Becky were tasked with cutting thin yellow fabric into 'feathers', then wiring the pieces so they would stay in place on the wings. After a few hours the work was done. The costume was fully assembled.

The whole thing one basically boiled down to two pieces, a legging piece and a torso piece. The torso piece came apart in the back and could be stepped into sort of like a one piece swimsuit. Once it was cinched. Appeared sort of like a robust plastic leotard with 'armored' sleeves that extended all the way into a pair of gloves. The wings were attached to this piece and could be articulated by the wearer. Rather ingeniously, Elena made them able to extend and retract much like the wings actually could in the game. When they were extended, the 'feathers' made of a translucent yellow cloth became visible. Elena lamented the fact that she hadn't had the time to rig up the lighting system she'd thought of to make them glow.

Beyond that was the leg piece, where the orange leggings became a metallic-painted pair of boots that Elena had cannibalized from some other project. They fit surprisingly well on Eric's feet. Additionally, tabard-like pieces of cloth hung from the front and back of Mercy's torso, along with several fauld pieces.

Finishing up the design was the spine piece, part of the torso, which covered the cinching in the back. It was decorated with a caduceus. And then there was the halo, gifted to Eric by CosplayGirl91 previously. The whole thing made for a very feminine getup, with the armor designed to represent a thin waist and wide hips, leaving only the dark shirt below in other places. Eric was impressed, but also regretted that he was about to be the one wearing it. He steeled himself in preparation.

"Honestly' I'm astounded this got finished so quickly. We spent less than 20 hours working on this." Eric commented.

"Well it's not normally this quick, sure." Elena said. "But I'd already finished nearly all of the design, plus we had most of the materials on hand. It didn't hurt to have two extra hands helping me out. Thanks."

"Oh it was nothing." Becky grinned evilly. "Seeing this beautiful costume on my baby sister is going to be its own reward."

"Not so fast." Elena shot Becky down. "We still need to wait for the paint sealant to dry."

"Yeah, plus if I'm going to stream tonight I really ought to get set up." Eric pointed out.

"That's perfect." Elena said. "I'll drive you home and we can wait for the costume to dry while you set up."

Elena immediately set to work, carefully moving the costume onto a stretcher-like sheet. She handed Eric his clothes and new pill bottle as well.

In the mean time, Becky stood around, giving Eric her widest grin. Eric chose not to pay it any heed.

They all filed out, back to Elena's car. "Say," Eric asked "How'd you get to the hardware store in the first place?"

"I got a ride." Becky commented.

"For lightbulbs?"

"Well I also had other errands I was going to do." Becky said more importantly. "This was just, uh, more important."

"Ah" Eric said. "There were 'matters' you needed to attend to at the store." Eric teased.

"We're attending to your 'matters' now, Ericka"

Elena just smiled at the sibling banter.

The car pulled up outside Eric's place. He led the two girls inside. His living area was a bit of a mess, what with half-unpacked boxes of Becky's old clothes, along with worn clothes strewn about the area haphazardly. Neither girl made any comment on the mess, but Eric still apologized for it and made a token effort to sort it out before getting to work.

Eric posted 'Erickaboom streaming in one hour with a special surprise. Be sure to tune in ;)'. He began getting his technical stuff in working order for the broadcasting to begin. Elena set down the Mercy costume and began watching Eric over his shoulder.

"Shouldn't the 'B' in Ericka Boom be capitalized?" She asked.

"Oh right." Eric said. "Because I'm streaming.. as.. Mercy.."

"Now isn't the time to get cold feet." Becky stepped up. "You said you've been getting followers and people have been enjoying your stream. This one's only going to be better than the last couple. You have a rad costume and you have your big sister backing you up." Becky gave Eric a thumbs up.

Eric didn't feel very comforted but went on preparing anyways. When he finally finished, he stood up.

"Is the costume ready." Eric asked tentatively.

"Yup." responded Elena. "Whenever you are."

"Alright." Eric shuddered. "Actually let me just get a bit more prepared."

Eric grabbed his 'anxiety' pills and downed four on the spot, then retreated to the bathroom to psych himself up. He also inspected his makeup and hair for any flaws that wouldn't be fitting. Once he was ready, he walked out to bring the costume back to the bathroom and change into it.

In the living room he saw Becky inspecting his pill bottle. She looked at the tablets inside inquisitively.
