choices: The chat goes wild. Erickaboom's stream grows unprecedentedly
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
Becky was rather intrigued by Eric's 'anxiety pills'. First off, they were quite clearly tablets. Secondly, they where multicolored, one half of each was white and the other purple. That struck her as quite uncharacteristic of anxiety pills. In fact, they looked quite like combination anti-androgen and estrogen pills, something Eric would not be taking willingly.

Becky's first thought was to tell him. He really ought to know what he was putting in his body, but seeing him walk out and grab the Mercy outfit she stopped her self. There's no way he would put that on if she interrupted him with this. She could always tell him later, right? And really he'd been so cute recently. Being her little sister wasn't so bad. Honestly he didn't seem that unhappy either, just put off. He'd been fairly excited about the angel outfit, if not the prospect of wearing it publicly. He could use a little confidence and telling him now could only hurt, she justified. Becky chose to say nothing. What was the worst that could happen?

Eric, in the meantime, was donning his Mercy costume. It fit him surprisingly well. He and Elena really were the same size, it seemed. The location of the plastic armor pieces gave him the appearance of curves, the tight fit of the body piece only serving to accentuate the look. His shape was a bit smaller than Mercy's, but really no less girly. Eric couldn't help but see the female character in the mirror. His reflection might as well have been something out of the game. The hair, the face and eyes, the armor, and hell even the body were all those of a high teen or low twenties girl. He sighed.

Eric at least took solace in how cool the armor was. The design really was elegant. By shifting his shoulders around, he could make the wings extend and retract. Really how did Elena even do that? The whole thing was just mechanical and was really impressive. The design was spot on, maintaining near perfect fidelity to the game. While he was disturbed by that accuracy as it pertained to his appearance, he couldn't help but admire the costume itself. Had it really only taken two days to build the thing? Eric was in awe. He chose to focus on that positivity as he walked out of the bathroom, bracing himself for his sister and Elena's reactions.

Out of the bathroom walked the spitting image of Mercy. Maybe a little younger, to be fair, but still.

"How does it look?" Eric asked.

Becky was speechless. For the first time ever, Eric thought.

"It's AMAZING!" Elena shouted. "Oh my god it's better than I could have ever imagined! Where did Ericka even know? How did Mercy get into the real world. Oh my god! Oh my god!" Elena was literally jumping with excitement. She was hopping across the room.

"Yeah it's--" Eric started.

"The halo! The halo! Put on the halo!" Elena ran into the kitchen, sliding across the floor. She grabbed the halo and practically slammed it onto Eric's head. He flinched.

"Ow." Eric rubbed his head. "Haven't you made costumes before? This isn't anything new is it?"

"It is though! You look like Mercy incarnate. Everything is perfect. I've never gotten everything this perfect before. Honestly I'm a little jealous even. I wish I could be Mercy."

"Holy shit Ericka." Becky said quietly. "My little sister is a literal angel." Any guilt Becky had about not mentioning the pills was gone. Ericka was this character. No doubt about it.

"Ha.. Right.." Eric wasn't used to Becky being legitimately in awe. He felt like he was wasting a situation he should be capitalizing on. "WELL I'm going to fire up the stream then, uh, I guess."

Becky watched Ericka walk over to her chair and start fiddling with various things. Lights, a microphone, a camera. It all seemed rather professional. She stood out of the way of the camera, not wanting to distract her or get in the frame of her stream.

Elena simply looked on with glee.

"You guys can monitor the chat for me." Eric said. "I'll be playing, but I'm interested to see how they react." Dreading it, really, Eric thought to himself. He turned his second monitor slightly to give them a better view.

Eric went live.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Becky notices the tablets are female hormones b...

choices: More viewers and subscribers than ever before
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
"What's up everyone!" Eric said, affecting a cheerful demeanor. "You might be able to see what I meant by a special stream." He stood up and gave a quick twirl.

"That reminds me actually." He continued. "I need to change the title."

Eric switched the stream title to 'ErickaBoom as Mercy plays Mercy!'

"Now let's get into the game!" Eric hopped into the queue.

In the meantime, the chat response was absurd. The viewers that had seen the notification that he was going live and tuned in were spamming the chat like it was their job.

MercyMainBTW: I feel like I'm having an identity crisis! I thought I was Mercy ;)

wo0o0o0ow: reported. characters from the game can't be allowed to play. that's cheating Kappa

ReinhardtAttack: "Woah, you look like the spitting image of Mercy!"

Senmeina_Desu: "SHE"S A LITERAL ANGLE"

wo0o0o0ow: "LUL @Senmeina_Desu >angle"

ELITEGAMERXX: "^ an acute angle"

Senmeina_Desu: "@ELITEGAMERXX this."

ReinhardtAttack: "@ELITEGAMERXX yup"

CosplayGirl91: "OH MY GOD! Did you make that costume? Is that my halo?"

Eric, still sitting in the competitive queue, got a good look at his chat. He smiled at the compliments. He was a bit unsettled by the comments about his cuteness, but he knew those were coming. If he was really going to commit to this, he ought to be appreciative.

"Hey thanks for the kind words everyone." Becky saw Ericka give a wink. It was distinctly feminine. "Anyways, CosplayGirl91, a new friend of mine is really into cosplay. Actually, Elena why don't you come into the screen."

Eric looked over to Elena and gestured for her to come over. She was a bit out of her element, but obliged.

"Elena here made my costume one she saw my haircut. Had the whole thing planned and just put it together. Though your halo was the finishing touch! Thanks for that! Tell them about your stuff Elena."

"Oh, uh. I do costumes and make cosplay. I'm, uh, trying to make it a career actually." It was Elena's turn to be nervous.

"Yeah!" Eric took back the mic. "This here getup is courtesy of her skillful hands. If you like this, you ought to thank her!"

Elena retreated out of the frame, somewhat embarrassed. She wasn't used to be watched by strangers, though there were only a few at that point. The stream viewcount was growing surprisingly quickly though, considering Eric hadn't even started a game yet.

CosplayGirl91: "Do you have any more examples of Elena's work? I'd love some more inspiration."

Eric noticed. "Hey Elena, mind if I link them your website?" He asked.

Elena nodded. "Sure I guess."

"Yo I'm posting a link in chat. Check it out if you want to see what Elena's all about." Eric got the website from Elena and typed it in.

After a bit more time talking about the costume and receiving compliments he'd perhaps rather not have gotten, Eric eventually got into a game. His viewcount was already about what it had been near the peak of his last stream. He had no idea just dressing up as a character could get him so much exposure. Maybe someone had made a post about how similar he looked to Mercy or something.

Eric picked Mercy, obviously. And got ready to focus. He really wanted to give his best performance, partly because his views were as high as they had ever been for Overwatch, and partly because he was dressed as Mercy. Wouldn't want the Avatar of Mercy to disappoint, after all. Plus he had some new tactics thought out from talking with Elena.

As the game went on, Becky and Elena monitored Ericka's chat partially. Elena was a bit distracted by actually watching her play, so it was up to Becky to catch anything her sister might want to hear. The chat was overwhelmingly positive.

l1IIll1I1lI: "Did you see her positioning on the last play? That was pro level shit."

xX_SniperAssassin_Xx: "sick that she's willing too pull out the pistol. Too many Mercy's are too timid."

WoverAtch: "@xX_SniperAssassin_Xx good aim too. this might be the best Mercy stream out there. most streamers don't play her and the girls that do tend to be pretty bad I find"

xX_SniperAssassin_Xx: "yeah she might be the best female player ive watched. Most are pretty bad i think."

sneakycymbals: "Hey there are plenty of good female overwatch players out there. Not to take away from ErickaBoom's play though. She's incredible :D"

And so on. Becky called some of them out to Ericka as she read. Ericka thanked people for the kind words, ignoring the emphasis on her gender. Becky was happy to see her sister appreciating the attention. She hoped that this would keep up.

Ericka finished the stream rather late in the evening. Becky was dog tired, but staying up with her sister had been worth it. Elena had already fallen asleep on the couch.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: The chat goes wild. Erickaboom's stream gro...

1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
"Thanks again everyone for tuning in to the stream! I'll be back tomorrow with more Mercy as Mercy and maybe some other games too. This is Erickaboom signing out." Eric shut off the stream.

Becky yawned. "Cool stream sis. I dunno how you manage to keep your attention on the game and keep up the cheery demeanor this late in the evening. Morning now, really." Becky was impressed with Ericka's constitution. She didn't look tired at all.

"Well it's just fun. I get into it. I'm tired now though. I need to get this costume off too." Eric said, gesturing vaguely to his whole body. "It's actually really comfortable, but the wings get in the way. Help me out?"

"Sure." Becky stirred herself, stretching and slinking off Ericka's bed. She walked over to her sister.

Ericka pointed out the spine and cinching and explained how to undo it. She slid out, pulling off the leggings and revealing her panties below. She then went back to her computer.

"Holy crap!" Eric exclaimed. "My viewcount tonight spiked past 400. That's way more than I've ever gotten. I practically doubled my subscribers too!"

"Hey, good for you. You put a lot of effort into that, glad to see it didn't go unnoticed." Becky grabbed Ericka's shoulder affectionately. "I ought to get going though. I need to get home. Can I borrow your car-- oh right.." Becky trailed off, remembering that her sister's car was still in the shop.

"You can stay the night if you want." Eric shrugged. "Looks like Elena already is." He gestured to her sleeping form.

"Thanks. I owe you." Becky walked into the bathroom. She did what she could to clean up before going to sleep, using the stuff she had given to Ericka.

"I'm sure there's something for you to wear to sleep. This was all your clothing originally." Becky heard Ericka say. She grunted her assent.

They both lapsed into deep sleep shortly after. Becky's thoughts were of how much closer she and Ericka had been in the last few days than they had been in years. She'd always wanted a younger sister, and it was great to finally have one. Becky had been really enjoying the time they had been spending together recently. She smiled.

Eric was awakened roughly by Elena holding his shoulders and shaking him back and forth. "Wake up sleepyheads! It's getting late."

"uunnng" Eric groaned, covering his eyes to prevent the harsh light of day from reaching them.

Becky responded similarly.

Elena dragged Eric out of bed, revealing the loose shirt and boyshorts he had worn to bed. "Come on! Come on! Time to change. We've got a SPA day ahead of us. It'll be relaxing after your long night of streaming." Elena stood over Eric with a smile, before bounding over to where Becky was sleeping.

Becky had been lying on the ground in a pile of clothes and pillows, having opted to neither steal the couch from Elena nor share the bed with Ericka. She could have, but thought her sister deserved her unperturbed rest. She rose stiffly, not wanting to receive the same treatment Ericka had had at the violent hands of Elena.

"I don't suppose you could drop me at my house on the way to your spa trip." Becky rubbed the sleep out of her eyes.

"Sure." Elena responded in the affirmative. "We'll need to leave a bit earlier to make the appointment I set up, but that's not a problem. We still have like half an hour or so."

"Spa first thing in the morning? I wasn't prepared for this." Eric complained.

"Nonsense, you had long night last night, fun though it may have been." Becky pointed out. "You deserve some relaxation."

"Yeah. You owe it to yourself.!" Elena agreed.

"Ok." Eric conceded. "I'll guess I'll throw together a quick breakfast then, it's the least I can do."

Thirty minutes later they were out the door. Elena went a small ways out of the way to drop Becky off. She and Eric arrived at the spa not long after.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: More viewers and subscribers than ever before

choices: Instruct workers to give Ericka 'advanced' hormonal treatment and electrolysis
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
As Elena drove to the spa, Eric couldn't help but wonder what she had done to warrant getting a free trip for two. She also had free reign over the entire machine shop for the hardware store for a favor as well. Didn't she only work as a barista and make cosplay or whatever?

"Say," Eric asked. "What'd you do to get this free spa trip anyways?"

"Oh I just helped Amelia out with a thing." Elena said vaguely. "I do a lot of favors. Like with Ericson I fixed the mill in the hardware store. I'm good with materials and construction and precise stuff so there's a lot of little things I can help out with. Like at the club I fixed their stage. I've even helped a friend of mine out with some top secret research projects of hers."

"Top secret research project?"

"Well not really 'top secret', but I'm not supposed to say a lot about it. Something something trade secrets or whatever. They needed help building some sort of large tank for water or something, since their equipment wasn't good for larger scale stuff, so she brought me in. It was pretty fun actually. Like they had a bunch of really specific stuff, openings and the like that needed to be in precise spots, so it was like everything I was good at. Big project, but with a lot of details. I thrive on that stuff. So now a science lab owes me a favor." Elena gave Eric a wink. "Along with several other people."

"Huh." Eric was surprised. "So, like, do you ever think about monetizing your repair skills? I mean that sort of thing probably pays better than working at a coffee place right?"

"Yeah, but it's not consistent right. Well, at least not until I can get my costume building thing up and running." Elena looked wistfully off, somewhat worryingly considering she was driving. "It pays the bills fine. I think favors are more useful than hard cash though as long as I'm not struggling to make ends meet. Like all that stuff at the hardware wouldn't have been possible with whatever the going rate is for minor industrial repairs I'm sure. And then we wouldn't have had the treat of seeing Mercy."

Eric blushed. "I guess I get that. I dunno it's just for me, I'd take the cash. I'm running on borrowed time at my place. I can't even use the salon money to pay rent since I need to repair my car. My Mom's cutting me off after June."

Elena nodded. "It'll work out though. You got how many viewers last night? Some obscene amount."

"Yeah." Eric agreed. "Hopefully it will."

"Well today is for relaxing, so don't stress about stuff! That's against the rules at the spa."

"No stressing." Eric considered. "Got it, I guess."

"I hope so."

The conversation died down. Eventually Eric and Elena made it to the spa, a rather fancy looking place that was somewhat out of the way. Not in any sort of shopping center, but rather out towards the hills. The structure was built into the ground. The front of it paneled, unpainted wood, but with sealant or something on it to protect from the elements. Eric thought it had an almost rustic sort of look, but that the sign, glass doors and structure all seemed too clean to really keep that going. He honestly thought it sort of clashed, but maybe it was just a modern art thing. Too advanced for his plebeian tastes. It didn't look bad, he supposed.

He and Elena got out of the car and walked up to the building. Upon entering, Eric saw a front area more fitting for a high class sort of country club establishment. The front desk was polished stone. The walls had various pictures of people fishing, riding horses or whatever other strange thing Eric guessed rich people would do. It was above his pay grade to be honest.

The from room led directly into the locker rooms, with the men's on the right and women's on the left. Behind the front desk were doors that presumably opened into an employee area.

Elena walked up to the front counter confidently. Eric trailed behind, feeling out of place.

"Hiya" Elena greeted. "I've got two vouchers for the 'full service'." She brandished the coupons at the receptionist.

"Alright." The receptionist took the vouchers. "If you'll just make your way into the locker room and shower up, we'll have people waiting for you right outside."

"Cool." Elena set off to the left.

Eric walked to the right before he was stopped by Elena, who jogged over to him.

"Silly." Elena laughed. "That's the way to the men's locker room. Follow me." Elena dragged Eric off.

"Wait, but shouldn't I..." Eric protested feebly. He was pulled into the women's locker room.

"Now let's shower up." Elena began stripping. "Come on." She said to the uncertain Eric.

"I, uh.."

Elena got completely naked. "Well, you'll catch up. The shower stalls are off down tho the right." Elena gestured down a hallway. "Just put your stuff in a locker and grab a robe."

Eric went completely white. How was he supposed to deal with this? Didn't Elena know he wasn't a girl. "I, uh.. I don't really feel comfortable getting completely naked." Eric shrunk down. "I'm, uh, um, embarrassed."

"Oh don't worry about it." Elena brushed it off. "They aren't going to look at you naked, it's just for the baths and stuff. Here, I'll even get you privacy. I'll be sure to inform everyone that you're a bit uncomfortable. Just remember that this is what those pills are for. You don't need to be worried about anyone making fun of you for your figure or chest. Be confident." Elena patted Eric's shoulder, then walked off towards the showers, grabbing a white, lacy robe as she went.

Eric flinched at the close contact with a naked woman who obviously was not aware that he was not a woman. How did he mix that up? Hadn't Elena seen him naked? It was just his chest, so he guessed that that was it then? Elena just thought he was a flat chested girl with no confidence? Well I mean she was right about him being very nervous and uncomfortable, but she definitely got the reason wrong. Still, he supposed he'd make it through this. Elena had said not to worry about them seeing him naked. He stripped down, grabbed a lacy robe, then went over to the showers.

Elena exited the showers before Ericka. That girl. Elena thought. She really needs to learn to be more confident. She has some sort of crazy complex about her appearance. Honestly she looks fine! If only I could show her that somehow. But Ericka's clearly too caught up on her figure. Her boyishness.

Elena considered what she could do to help.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Eric is further feminized

choices: Eric and Elena leave the spa without further event.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.content:
Elena donned her robe and made her way out of the locker room, proceeding further into the facility. She accosted the first worked she saw, who just so happened to be waiting for her.

"Hey." Elena said, perhaps a bit too forcefully. "My friend is on her way, but before she gets out here I have special instructions for her treatment. To put it bluntly, she's embarrassed about her figure. Thinks she looks too boyish in general. She's not very developed for her age, so what I'm thinking is she could use a little push. Do you understand?"

The woman Elena had almost violently pulled aside looked unsettled. She was not equipped to handle this sort of situation. How was she supposed to deal with violent patrons.

"I'll, uh, uh.. I'LL GO GET AMELIA FOR YOU!" She pulled out of Elena's grip and ran off fearfully.

Elena sighed. Not four seconds later Amelia popped out from the nearby hallway.

"Why do you insist on frightening my workers so?" Amelia asked, amused.

"Well that was certainly quick." Elena commented.

"I figured something would happen. Though I thought you'd be dismantling some panel that was crooked or something." Amelia laughed. "Anyways I know just the thing for your friend. We can help her look as 'not-boyish' as possible."

"Oh thank you so much Amelia. Really this is great. She needs a confidence boost. What would I do without you?"

"Oh please, what would I do without you. This place would have been a borderline wreck without your help. I'll give you and your friend the best." Amelia said. "You know, we just added a new procedure you and your friend might try out. It's electrolysis, but it's much better than most current methods. Faster and less damaging; only a few sessions for completion with no soreness in between. You two can have it along with the day's service."

"You're underselling yourself. This place was great before I came in. I just helped it shine, figuratively. Anyways we'd love the procedure. I'm sure it'll be great." Elena gave a smile. "Can I get my bath really salted like that one time though? Everything else should be the same as normal, but I like the super saltwater bath."

"Of course" Amelia agreed. "I'll inform the workers. Once your friend is out just make your way to the massage area to begin. You'll only be splitting up for your friend's hormonal treatment, which won't take long."

"Cool." Elena waited. Amelia walked away, hips swaying and heels clicking on the tiled floor.

Eventually, Eric made his way awkwardly into the hallway. Elena was waiting impatiently, but when she saw him she perked up.

"Great! We're starting with a massage. Follow me and don't. stress. about. anything." Elena instructed.

"Alright. You lead boss." Eric replied, mildly amused out how serious Elena was being. "I'll be sure not to stress."

"Good." Elena lead him down the hall with practiced ease. She clearly knew her way around the facility.

The massage and baths and so on went without a hitch. Originally Eric was a bit worried about someone seeing him naked, but after time went on the fear was assuaged. The spa workers were quite considerate of his privacy. The treatments were also very relaxing. Eric felt tension that he didn't even realize he'd built up over the past several days drain from him, leaving him relaxed and lethargic.

After a stint getting a foot massage and pedicure that Eric was too relaxed to be bothered by, Elena directed him down a different path than she was going.

"What's up." Eric asked.

"I got you a special. Tailor made for you. It'll help you with your worries. They'll tell you where to go once you're done." Elena explained.

"You're not getting it too?" Eric asked.

"Nah, I'm not as self-conscious as you, no offense." Elena said. Perhaps a bit too callously, she worried.

"None taken. Lord knows I've been a bit on edge." Eric sighed. "It'll be good."

"Yeah." Elena gently pushed him towards the door he was supposed to enter. "Good luck." Elena winked.

Eric entered, trying not to be uncertain. It was weird not sharing the room with Elena at the spa. His worry was quickly assuaged by the presence of a spa worker in the room with him.

"Just lie down and close your eyes. I'll wait outside for a moment while you get settled, and once I come back in we'll begin." The worker stepped out of the room and closed the door.

Eric took the opportunity to pull off his robe and lie on the cushy table in the middle of the room, taking care to cover his behind with a towel, just in case. Eventually the worker reentered.

"Now, we've got a procedure to help you with what Amelia describes as a 'stress problem'." The worker tried to word it gently. She'd gotten harsh words from Amelia about doing everything possible to not draw attention the this patron's figure, or lack thereof. "It's going to use a needle, but don't worry. It won't hurt a bit."

"Like acupuncture?" That made sense, Eric had heard about that sort of thing. Some sort of Eastern way to release tension. He was open to try it.

"No, like drugs." The worker corrected.

Eric understood. "Oh ok. I have pills for this already, is that fine?"

"Yeah." The worker said.

"It's just I've heard that you're not supposed to overdose you know. It'll mess up your liver or something?" Eric thought back to stories about prozac and whatnot staying in your system for a long time. It was like binge drinking alcohol for several days straight. Or maybe it gave you ulcers or something? Eric wasn't actually sure what the dangerous of too much anti-anxiety drugs were. Hell he didn't even know exactly what he was taking; he was just trusting Elena and the fact that the drugs were presumably over-the-counter.

"Don't worry about it. The stuff we've got here is pretty newfangled and fancy. It'll be quicker acting. Like, you'll get results in a week. It's safe though. Won't fuck up your liver or anything. All approved, don't worry."

The worker seemed a little defensive about the safety of the procedure, but if Elena set it up for him it wouldn't be a problem. She had told him not to stress, so he wouldn't.

"All good." Eric said. "Let's start."

The procedure was over in a minute, surprisingly. It was basically nothing. The worker stepped out so he could get dressed again, and he made his way as directed to the room Elena was in.

She greeted him, then jumped right in to the next thing on the itinerary. "Next up's electrolysis, but don't worry. Amelia said they have a special version. No redness or soreness and you can put on makeup no problem the next day and so on, so it won't get in the way. Plus it's only like 7 sessions total to get it done. Really it's just better in every way."

"First top secret scientists, now bleeding edge spa technology." Eric joked. "What are you, a spy?"

"Ssh!" Elena affected worry. "Don't tell anyone, I'm undercover." She laughed. Eric laughed along with her.

Eric received the treatment relaxedly. It felt weird on his face, like someone was freezing it but also heating it. He supposed it was like those masks of cream or whatever that you see people wear in media, but with metal stuff. He didn't think much more about it.
1553322222222221121211211121112112121111.title: Instruct workers to give Ericka 'advanced...

1553322222222222.content:
Kyle and Sam Gladstone were sitting in the backseat of a very fancy limousine. Having just been picked up from the airport, they were both jet lagged and rather worn out. Not that it stopped them from exploring all the cool features of what was easily the fanciest car they had ever been in. From the mini-fridge to the massaging seats, they tried everything. The driver didn't care, he was separated by a partition and couldn't see or hear them. Finally tiring of the gadgetry, they sat back in their seats. Sixteen year old Kyle took a cola from the fridge, and his fourteen year old brother followed suit.

"So," said Sam, breaking the silence as he cracked open his cola, "What's with the limo?"

"You got me." answered Kyle with a shrug, "I know Uncle Mark's pretty well off. Maybe he splurged a bit cause he wants to make a good first impression since he hasn't seen us since we were toddlers?"

"And what's with us having to come all the way cross-country anyways? Why couldn't we go to the ski resort for the summer with Mom and Megan? How come while they're off in Europe we have to spend the summer with some relative we barely remember?"

"You heard Mom just like I did," snapped his brother, tired of the oft repeated question, "He asked for us to come visit. Aunt Mary and our cousins are on a cruise, so he had the house empty. And in some sort of mid-life realization thing, he decided that he needed to get to know us better since he's got no sons of his own. He even paid for the plane tickets."

Not having really expected a different answer, Sam sat back and drank some of his cola. Both brothers sat silently for a bit before Sam commented,

"Mind you, that plane ride was kinda strange. Everyone I met was acting really weird."

Kyle half-choked on his drink, sputtering as he held back a laugh. He composed himself and set his face in a faint, but smug, smirk.

Sam fixed him with a steely gaze.

"What. Did. You. Do."

At this point, some background would probably be useful. Kyle and Sam were average brothers. They played and fought like normal boys. The only really different thing was their never ending prank war. Sure most brothers will pull pranks every now and again, but their war had been going on for years. Though both were tech whizs, most of their pranks were effective in their simplicity. Each prank didn't really have to top the last, no, these boys went for subtlety. Adding glitter to bodywash so one brother came out sparkling like a romanticized vampire. Cutting apart a swimsuit and resewing it with water soluble thread. Putting a hot dog inside the hollow bars of a bicycle so it mysteriously stinks for weeks on end. Sam, in fact, had recently gotten his brother by adding some stitching to the back of Kyle's shirt so it looked like he was wearing a bra underneath. Kyle had yet to get him back.

"Tell me." Demanded Sam, "Tell me what you did!"

Kyle smirked in response.

"Wouldn't you like to know..."

"Kyle, tell me now or so help me I will coat your laptop's hard drive in magnets!"

"You wouldn't!" gasped Kyle, who loved his laptop like his own son.

"...Neodymium magnets." threatened Sam coldly.

"Alright, alright! Sheesh, if you want to know that badly."

"I do. Now spill it."

Kyle sighed, his internal joy at Sam's obliviousness to knowing he'd been pranked was fading.

"Fine. Just keep your magnets to yourself. You know that time you went to the bathroom for ages at the beginning of the flight? Well, while you were gone I told everyone, nearby passengers, flight attendants, random people walking by, everyone that you... uh..."

He paused, savoring the last moments as he held his brother in panicked distress.

"You told them what?!" Sam sputtered, the suspense choking him.

"...that you were a pre-op transsexual going to California for your gender reassignment surgery, and that they should treat you as a normal girl, since you're very sensitive about the issue and are slightly mentally imbalanced!"

Kyle said his line quickly in one breath, hoping to catch all of Sam's reaction in a single expression. It succeeded. Sam was dumbstruck, his face contorting between anger, horror, fury, embarrassment, rage, and several other unnamed emotions within seconds. Finally, he managed to speak.

"I'm going to kill you."

He said it calmly, as if merely commenting on the weather. "No seriously, I'm going to go into your room, and smother you with a pillow. Made of spikes. And fire. Dipped in poison. Then I'm going to cut your body into pieces, bake you into pies, and sell you to everyone on that plane."

Both brothers stared at each other for a long moment, then burst out laughing. Sam was actually still angry that he'd been had, but he tucked that anger away. Later, he'd use it to find the perfect opportunity to create a hopefully ironic revenge. The irony wasn't really necessary, but it would make it so much sweeter.

As they laughed, they felt the limo slow to a stop. The windows were heavily tinted and had fancy curtains on them, so neither boy had bothered looking out. The limo stopped and shut off. They heard the driver get out and come around to their door. He opened it and Sam hopped out. Kyle shuffled across to that side and climbed out as well. In front of them was...
1553322222222222.title: A Summer with Uncle

15533222222222221.content:
Before them stood a giant mansion. Made of a creamy white stone, it had columns out front and clearly dozens of rooms. As they were on a hill, they could also see the land stretching out behind the mansion. There was a hedge maze, multiple fancy patios, a field of flowers, and some thick woods off a few hundred meters off. The boys stood there, shell-shocked, their mouths hanging open slightly.

"...That's a big house." Sam managed to say.

"You think?" replied Kyle, "I knew Uncle Mark was pretty rich, but still...wow!"

As he spoke, the mahogany front doors opened and a man walked out. He was not quite middle aged, maybe late thirties, early forties at most. He was tall and slightly on the portly side, but not fat. His beard and mustache connected in a short trimmed circle, and his hair was pulled back in a short ponytail. He wore a casual Hawaiian shirt, light blue with pale green palm trees, and khaki shorts. A pair of cheap sunglasses sat on his forehead, and he walked towards them barefoot. Considering him as he approached, the boys concluded that there was no way this could be their uncle. Someone who owned a mansion would not dress like that. Maybe he's the gardener, they thought.

"Hey boys!" he called out jovially, "You made it! What, don't recognize me? I'm your uncle!"

"You're our Uncle?" asked Kyle, who looked skeptically at the strange man as if he'd just exited an alley and offered to sell a Rolex out of his trench coat.

"Course I am, though I suppose it's no wonder you don't remember me. You haven't seen me since you were this high." He said, lowering his hand to about knee height.

"Well, if you're our uncle," Kyle began, "Then whose house is that?"

"Why, it's mine. Didja think I'd just pick you up outside some random home?"

"But that's a rich guy's house." Sam interjected, "And rich guys don't dress like that. They wear formal suits and stuff."

"Hey, it took me a long time to get to where I am today. So I figured I'm rich enough now that I can dress however I want." He then sheepishly added, "Plus your Aunt Mary just left yesterday, so I can finally let loose and relax, ya feel me?"

The boys smiled. This uncle of theirs seemed to be a pretty cool guy. A bit weird, but still cool. Plus he was rich.

"So you guys want to go in? Where's your luggage, in the trunk?"

Kyle shook his head. "Mom said that the luggage charge on the plane was ridiculous, so she mailed our bags instead. She said it was cheaper."

Uncle Mark sighed and looked skyward. "That mother of yours. I'm sure she's a great mother but I have never seen a woman pinch a penny like my sister. Even when we were kids she would wait to go shopping till she could combine deals and coupons to get stuff for pennies on the dollar. Anyways, let's go in."

They walked towards the front doors as the limo drove away.

"So, Uncle Mark," Sam started, "just how are you so rich?"

He stopped in his tracks and turned to face hie nephews. "What? You mean your mother never told you?"

The boys shook their heads.

"She doesn't mention you much." Kyle commented.

"Sigh... that's so like her. Forgets to tell her kids about her own brother. Okay then, well, you know NuTech Inc.?"

"Uh, yeah," said Kyle sarcastically, "Who doesn't? It's a technological giant. It makes everything from toys to entertainment to appliances and junk. I've got a Nupod music player right here."

"Well," Uncle Mark began, "Twenty years ago, NuTech Inc. was called Gladstone Electronics. And it was started in a garage by Jerry Halson, and Jenny and Mark Gladstone. That was my friend, your mother, and me."

"WHAT?!" exclaimed both boys, equally shocked

At this, Uncle Mark burst into laughter. Nearly crying he doubled over, completely cracking up.

"What the...oh. It was a joke." said Sam dejectedly, "Don't mess with us like that."

"No, no it's true," Uncle Mark managed to say, finally regaining control, "It's just...oh man... the looks on your faces when I said that. Ooohh that was priceless!"

"So you got all your money from selling the company?" inquired Kyle.

"Nope. Never sold it."

"But... the Inc. at the end means "Incorporated" right? So it's owned by millions of stockholders and run by a board of directors. Maybe you have a controlling interest, but that doesn't really mean you own the company."

"Actually," Uncle Mark started, as he began to break into giggles once more "the 'Inc.' at the end of the company name is a massive troll I thought of years ago. There are no stockholders. I still own something like 99% of the company. I just pay Jerry the other 1% to run it for me, but he'd happily do it for free, he loves the work so much."

As they walked towards the house again, Uncle Mark explained.

"You see, ever since computers began showing up in people's houses, us Gladstones have been geniuses with them. Your mother, myself, even your grandparents were all exceptional with computers and building things. One day, tinkering in the garage with Jerry (who was Jenny's boyfriend at the time), we happened to create something cool and new. We marketed it, and got rich. Jenny managed the company, I provided the main creative force, and Jerry was our public image. Eventually, we grew older, moved apart and all settled down. Jenny left the company after she met your father, but by then the company was big enough that we had many people working for us. Jerry still runs day to day operations and appears as the face of the company. And I... I sit back and create new and cool stuff to market. The whole family does in fact. We're pretty much 75% of the R&D department. Your cousins, Sami and Amy, got the Gladstone tech genes too. In fact, that Nupod you've got there? Your cousin Sami invented it, and Amy wrote the programming. I bet even you boys are probably good with tech too."

Finally, they reached the doors and entered the house. The front hall was huge. It consisted of a large room with marble flooring, columns along the sides, several doors at the back, and a sweeping staircase in the middle that split into two where it hit the back wall. Each staircase swept along the back wall until they met up with the second floor balconies on the side walls. The balconies were lined with doors of various colors and designs. On the wall where the staircases split there was a larger than life sized portrait of Uncle Mark, Aunt Mary, Sami, and Amy all of whom were dressed to the nines.

While the boys stood still, awed at the house, Uncle Mark was unimpressed. It was his house after all. Noticing their expressions he said: "I know, that's a terrible portrait right? We look like a family from Victorian Europe. But your Aunt insists we keep it there to project an air of "normality" to any guests. She likes to play the debutante sometimes and occasionally worries that her socialite friends will discover that we're all massive uncultured nerds. Here I'll fix it."

He pulled some sort of remote from his pants pocket and pushed button on it, aiming it at the painting. With a fluid motion, the picture and frame began to rotate, revealing another picture affixed to the back. As it finished turning, he tucked away the remote back into his pocket. The space now held a larger than life size portrait of Uncle Mark, bare-chested, brandishing a pair of battleaxes, whilst posing heroically atop a hill of bones as skeleton and zombie warriors climbed towards him. His family stood around him in medieval fantasy style armor, brandishing weapons of their own. The backdrop consisted of thunderclouds with a bolt of lightning hitting one raised axe and illuminating their figures. It somehow managed to be both epic and slightly cringey at the same time, and looked quite out of place in the elegant entry hall.

"There. Much better. Ya like? I had it commissioned." he commented, "Now, would you boys like the tour, or would you wanna explore for yourselves?"
15533222222222221.title: Arriving at the Mansion

155332222222222212.content:
"I guess we'll explore." said Kyle, tactfully not commenting on the strange portrait. Regardless of his wealth, it was clear that their uncle was an oddball.

"Sounds great," Uncle Mark replied, clapping his hands once "Oh, wait, almost forgot. Boys, step forward about five or so steps."

Curious, Sam and Kyle did as he said. As they placed their feet on the last step, they heard a voice emanate from the walls.

"Welcome to the Gladstone Villa, GUEST_1 and GUEST_2." said a smooth female voice, though it put a strange accent on "guest".

"Meet MARCI" proclaimed Uncle Mark proudly, "our Intelligent House. She's incredibly interactive and controls the whole house. We've been building her into the walls and existing systems for years. Her name's an acronym for something really clever, but none of us remember what it was. The girls and I all have user accounts in her database, so she'll call us by name and keep track of our schedules and such. Right now, you two are guests, but I'll set you up some accounts later so you can start personalizing. She's really amazing. Watch this. MARCI?"

"Yes, Master Gladstone?"

"Change the floor in the main entrance please, random pattern."

"Certainly."

Beneath their feet, the elegant marble floor began to fade in color, revealing that it was some kind of advanced screen. The black and white marble faded to solid white, before new colors started to appear, greens and reds. Within seconds, the once marble floor was now a vibrant plaid. If the boys didn't know better, they'd have sworn they were standing on the the kilt of a Scottish giant.

"Cool stuff right?" beamed Uncle Mark, "Like I said, we invent a lot of gadgets to market, but we always keep the coolest stuff for ourselves. Most of it's not economically feasible to mass produce anyway. Well, what are you waiting for? You wanted to explore, so explore! If you need anything, just politely ask MARCI, or contact me on the intercom. I'll be in the kitchen making some dinner. Is brick-oven pizza okay?"

The boys nodded, but Sam had a question. "What does the intercom look like, in case I need to use it?"

Uncle Mark gave him a look like he'd just asked how much coal a computer ran on, then answered. "It's an intercom. It's a feature, built in. It's like on Star Trek. Please tell me you've seen that at least? Just say "contact Mark" and some of the digital wallpaper near you will render into a video display connected to the kitchen, or where ever I happen to be at the time. Most of the basic operations are pretty intuitive. Got it?"

The boys nodded, eager to explore the futuristic tech house of their dreams.

"Well go on then!" Uncle Mark chuckled.

"Thanks Uncle Mark!" They called out, dashing up the stairs, one taking a left, the other a right.

"And you can drop the "uncle" bit!" he yelled back, cupping his hands around his mouth like a megaphone, "we're all family here!" And then to himself, "Plus it makes me feel like an old man."

Who should we follow?
155332222222222212.title: Explore

choices: A lot girlier than Uncle Mark had said
1553322222222222121.content:
Sam had taken the left side of the stairs, and entered the second door on the balcony. It opened into a long corridor lined with more doors. He poked his head in the first. It was an entertainment center, with a huge Tv and massive sound system. He looked in the next doorway. It was a bathroom as big as his bedroom back home, equipped with some devices he didn't even recognize. The next door. Some kind of workshop filled with half assembled or half disassembled electronics. Oddly, the walls were pink. Coming to the end of the hall, he found a large room that seemed to be entirely storage. As he closed the door, he heard a beep on the wall next to him. Turning, Sam saw that part of the wall had changed and now showed a pulsing blue dot. He pressed it. An image of his uncle appeared with a backdrop of a fancy modern kitchen. He had some flour and a sheepish look on his face.

"Hey Sam," he started "You're brother just called me up with an important question I forgot about. He asked where the guest bedrooms were so he could pick a room."

"Yeah, I was wondering that too." Said Sam, "Where are they?"

"That's the trouble," Uncle Mark replied, "There are none. The house had seven bedrooms when we bought the place, but we converted one into a workshop, one into a library, and two into an indoor pool. I'm sorry to say it, but you're gong to have to crash in either Sami's or Amy's room. The girls are 'bout your ages, at least. But don't worry! They're not too girly! Both my daughters are pretty technologically inclined, but they do have some notable feminine touches."

"I guess that's okay,"Sam said hesitantly, "as long as there're no unicorns or ponies or anything."

"Don't fret bucko," Uncle Mark replied, smiling, "They grew out of those years ago. Let me pull up a map so you can go check then out. Remember, first come, first serve on who gets which."

As his image vanished, a simple map appeared of the floor Sam was on. He was indicated by a red dot and another dot indicated Kyle way across the building. Two rooms were also highlighted in blue, one near him and one near Kyle. He headed for the nearest one, which was two hallways over. He found himself in a hallway with deep blue walls. It was also filled with small tables and pedestals each containing some strange piece of what seemed to be abstract art. Sam picked one up and examined it. It was spherical, but with a flat base, and covered in swirling black and white patterns. He found two metal nubs on the top and a LCD screen on one side behind a removable piece. Obviously the art was some sort of device, but he put it back on it's pedestal since he had no idea what it was. He noticed the word "Amy" written on the door next to him in glittery letters. Opening the door, he walked inside.

What kind of room was it?
1553322222222222121.title: Follow Sam

15533222222222221211.content:
It wasn't too bad, the room could have been much girlier. The room was large and shaped like a sideways L. The door was at the center of the long side of it. There was a large four poster bed at the turn with light pink sheets. At the end of the long side was a desk with some papers, a lamp, and a few electronic components. In between there was a pair of bean bag chairs and a medium sized Tv built into the wall. There was also a small bookshelf and an end-table next to the bed, the second of which had something screen-like built into the top. Sam walked in and around the corner. It turned out that the room was more U shaped, and turning the corner led to another corner (and a vanity), which led to a bathroom with tub and shower. Filling up the space between the two parts of the room was an enormous walk-in-closet accessed by a sliding door near the bathroom. Overall, excluding the pink sheets and a few scattered plushies and posters, the room wasn't too girly. Curious, he went over to the end-table with the odd screen on top. The top rotated, and he turned it so the single button faced himself as he squatted on the floor. Pressing the button, he was greeted by the appearance of a holographic screen floating before his face.

"Wicked..." He breathed, impressed by the tech.

It presented him with a simple login page.
USER: AMY GLADSTONE
PASS:

Normally he would have stopped, morality kicking in and telling him not to go poking around in what was apparently his cousins personal computer. But the sudden occurrence of an idea made him pause. If he could get into the computer systems before his and Kyle's profiles were finished, he could play his best prank ever. Driven by his newfound idea, even as it was still forming in his head, he began the task of deciphering the password of girl he'd met once or twice nearly ten years before.

He started with the basics: "password", "amy", "amygladstone", before he realized that a tech-savvy girl like her would never use something so obvious. He looked around the room for inspiration. Noticing a popular boy band poster on the wall, he remembered an old trick a friend from school had once told him. Complex passwords filled with symbols and numbers swapped with letters are both hard to remember and really easy for hacking software to crack. But, a combination of even just four short random words can be easily remembered by a image or mnemonic device, yet are ridiculously hard to crack with a computer. Remembering this, he decided to try the names of the band.

With the names of the band's members in mind, he got the password right in four attempts, just before it would have locked him out of the system. What appeared was like a regular desktop screen, but in three dimensions. With a bit of hunting, he managed to find a "House Systems" folder. From there, through trial and elimination, he worked his way through "House Systems", "MARCI", "Operating Files", "Users". At "Users" he had an immense stroke of luck. Uncle Mark had apparently began making user accounts for him and Kyle, but had stopped after only their names and pictures. Entering Kyle's User controls, he created a hidden folder and opened Notepad. Quickly, he wrote out a paragraph of code indecipherable to any normal person, but clear as day to him. When he was finished, he saved it as a ".bat" file so the computer would run it as a program.

It was a simple virus really, but once it was activated, its effects would readily become apparent. Wanting the program to stay secret as long as possible, he decided to change Amy's password. He would never even consider doing such a thing normally, but he was more focused on revenge than ethics. Besides, she'd be gone for over two months. It's not like she'd be logging in anytime soon. He glanced around the room for inspiration. Glancing to a pile of books by the bed he decided, on a whim, to use the first word in every title. The end result was over seventy characters long; almost guaranteed uncrackable.

Content in his security and his program, he logged out of the computer, and left the room to explore the rest of the house, reminding himself to make sure to insist that he should get Sami's room later.
15533222222222221211.title: Kinda girly, but mostly gender-neutral

155332222222222212111.content:
After leaving his code in place, Sam headed off to the kitchen to check in on the pizza. As expected, it was delicious. During the meal, while his brother had his mouth full, Sam made sure to request Sami's room. Kyle, silenced by cheese, was unable to object.

After dinner, Uncle Mark mentioned that they should begin filling out their profiles when they had time. With quick thinking, Sam was able to derail the conversation by asking if there were any game consoles in the house. Rather than just the conversation, his question ended up derailing the entire evening and late into the night. Mark turned out to be quite an avid gamer, and his custom virtual reality system was years ahead of anything on the market. Nothing held the trio's thoughts that night save for swords, spaceships, and digital brawling. They all found their way to their rooms at nearly three in the morning, where all three quickly fell into deep slumbers.

---

The next morning, MARCI began her boot-up sequence automatically. This was entirely normal and happened everyday. Diagnostics were run, schedules collated, weather analyzed, and all the other background processes even regular computers did to rev up. However, today the computer discovered an error. As it tried to analyze the profiles of current household members it found itself trapped in a feedback loop. Attempting to access the files on User_Amy redirect its systems to the files on User_Kyle. Accessing the files of User_Kyle in turn redirected back to User_Amy. Finding itself trapped in a loop, MARCI activated the meta-cognitive troubleshooter.

The meta-cognitive troubleshooter was a program still in the testing portion of it's creation. It's purpose was to analyze technical problems from a human perspective (or as best an approximation as the Gladstone family could program) and enact repairs and patches. It was a learning system as well, designed to recognize new or repeating problems and take new actions accordingly. Viewing the trouble code, it analyzed the loop and decided that the it was the result of human programming error. Clearly, a programmer had meant for one file to reference the other, but had instead had made them both reference the other. Now it merely had to determine which file was meant to be referenced by the other. It peered into the contents of the personal accounts. One was full of years worth of personalization, preferences, schedules, and subroutines. The other was practically blank. Making the logical decision, it proceeded to copy relevant data from the first file into all the unfilled sections of the second; namely, everything except name and identification photo. It briefly encounter a roadblock in the form private user-protected files, but the advanced system quickly worked around the lack of authorization leaving scrambled firewalls and passwords in it's wake.

All this took place within a fraction of a second as the meta-cognitive troubleshooter deactivated, as satisfied as a machine can be with it's work. The main computer resumed it's normal initialization sequences. As it's schedule dictated, Amy required a wake-up call for her morning practice. Systems slowly revved to life in room, though their sound was drowned out by the boy snoring in a pile on top of Amy's bed. Noting Amy's absence, the computer nevertheless continued it's processes, since it's systems showed this user to have the same schedule and requirements. The soft voice of MARCI drifted quietly into the room.

"Good morning mistress. It is time to wake up."
155332222222222212111.title: The next morning...

1553322222222222121111.content:
"Huh... what?" Kyle asked, groggily, as he awoke.

"Your shower has been prepared to your specifications." MARCI replied.

"Specifications? I didn't even fill out my profile yet!" Kyle retorted. Then he thought for a moment, maybe Uncle Mark set up something just to show him how it was done. He'd take the shower and then he'd see how everything works.

"Your shower has been..." MARCI started.

"Yeah, yeah, I heard."

Kyle walked towards the bathroom and undressed, before stepping into the shower.

"A little warmer than I'm used to, but close enough." Kyle said.

The entire shower was automated, washing and scrubbing Kyle as he stood there.
1553322222222222121111.title: He wakes up

15533222222222221211111.content:
“Wow,” thought Kyle, as he stood in the shower. “This is kinda cool!”

Small whirling brushes moved up and down on poles mounted on the edges of the shower, effectively making it so that there was nowhere in the shower Kyle could move to get out of reach of the brushes. “Auto-washer. This is so cool!” He thought.

The shower notified Kyle when to turn so that each and every angle of his body was thoroughly scrubbed. A helmet attached to a tube lowered from the ceiling. A panel told Kyle to place it on his head, which he did. He could feel the helmet lathering and washing his hair, although he did catch a slight whiff of strawberries from the shampoo. He’d have to adjust that before tomorrow.

Even though Kyle thought he had been cleaned, the shower indicated for him to remain o place as the whirling brushes did more passes. He smelled a noxious odor as some new cleaning agent was applied automatically to the shower scrubbers. It wasn’t until he turned to have his front scrubbed again that he noticed all his body hair was being scrubbed right off of him. He danced, trying to get out of reach of the brushes, but there simply was no place to dodge them in the shower stall. He tried to push the stall door open, but it was locked.

Resigned to his fate, he thought it would be over soon. He then smelled a floral scent and felt the brushes applying lotion to his body, softening his now hairless skin.

There was a “ding” and the brushes retracted, stopping their spinning. The helmet was pulled off of his head, leaving a pleasant strawberry scented mop of long, wet, blonde hair cascading down his face.

Stepping out of the shower, a towel, held in several vertical rods was waiting for him. Kyle reached for it, but the two rods moved toward him, putting the towel under his outstretched arm, and wrapping it tightly around his body, just like a girl would. While that was going on, a blast of air pushed his hair up where a few more rods holding a towel caught it and wrapped it up, turban style.

Kyle blinked. If anyone could see him standing there, he would look very much like an undeveloped teen girl that just stepped out of the shower.

“Stupid bathroom,” he mumbled, as he lowered the towel to his waist. Much to his surprise, that towel was pulled off of him and the rods applied another towel, wrapping it around his chest.

“Uh...” he was starting to get a very bad feeling about this.
15533222222222221211111.title: The shower

155332222222222212111111.content:
The door opened and Kyle could hear some sort of movement in the bedroom. He walked into the bedroom to see that a bundle of clothing was sitting on the bed, which was also now remade. Kyle walked over to the bed and looked over the clothes, finding a pink tee shirt, capri pants and a pair of panties that were definitely not his. He tossed them back onto the bed.

"No freaking way!" Kyle exclaimed

Arms exited the ceiling to refold them, and place them gingerly back onto the bed.

"Would you like assistance, Mistress?" MARCI asked.

"Mistress?" Kyle thought to himself.

"No! What I would like are my clothes! These must be Amy's, not mine, Kyle's!" Kyle shouted at MARCI.

"Then are you dissatisfied with your outfit?" MARCI asked.

"You're damn right I am!" Kyle replied. "I want MY CLOTHES!"

"Selecting another outfit combination." MARCI stated. "New outfit selected."

The arms remove the old outfit and replace it with...
155332222222222212111111.title: Helped back to the bedroom

1553322222222222121111111.content:
The arms deposit a hot pink folded bundle on clothes on the bed. Digging through it, Kyle saw that everything was hot pink, it was like someone was caught in a cotton candy factory explosion.

There was a hot pink minidress, a hot pink push-up bra with matching thong, a hot pink waist cinch, hot pink thigh high stockings, and some impossibly high hot pink heels.

“Oh, come ON, MARCI,” Kyle shouted. “I can’t wear this!”

“Request for assistance noted, Mistress,” came MARCI’s voice.

Kyle backed away from the clothes, eventually putting his back to the wall. “I didn’t ask for assistance!”
1553322222222222121111111.title: Something girlier

1553322222222222121111112.content:
In it's place was a pink dress with a flowery design, and a pair of low-heeled open toed shoes, with a single flower on each one right before the opening.

"Oh no!" Kyle started rushing towards the door, and grabbed the knob, trying to twist it.

"House rules state that you are not permitted to walk around naked when there are guests. Do you require assistance?" MARCI asked.

"Keep that away from me! I don't need help from you!" Kyle shouted as he pounded on the door. "Someone! Help!"

"Need help." MARCI stated, before arms grabbed Kyle's arms, and lifted him with ease, over to the center of the room.

Quickly, the arms removed the towel, and before he had a chance to react, slid a pair of panties up his legs, and attached a bra across his chest. Kyle wriggled all he could, but the arms had an iron grip. The arms slid the dress over his head and carried him over to a chair with several attachments that sat in front of the vanity.

"Let me go! I don't need assistance!" Kyle argued.

The arms settled him down in the chair, before placing his hands and feet into the attachments on the arm foot rests. He felt something happening to them, and pressure being applied to his fingers but couldn't see. The towel on his head was removed and a metallic mask was placed onto his face, as the hair dryer dome was placed over his hair.

Kyle squirmed and pulled, but he was held securely, until all the attachments released at once. Before he could look at the mirror, the arms grabbed him, lifted him again and placed him down into the heels. Only then was he able to see himself.

"Oh my god..." Kyle muttered as he stared into the mirror.

If he was an underdeveloped teen girl when he got out of the shower... he was definitely one now. His hair had been styled, though not in an overly girly style, with a pink barrette. His face had been subtly made up, light coating of lip gloss and touches of blush and eye makeup. His fingernails had been extended and were now painted a bright, hot pink, same as his toenails, which peeked out from the shoes. Any attempts to remove the barrette, and presumably anything else, were met with the arms returning it to the same spot a moment later.

He heard a door click and immediately rushed to the door, turning the knob and rushing out, slamming it behind him.

"I have to find Sam or Uncle Mark..." Kyle said, "Maybe they can help reverse all this crap!"

Hearing noise coming from the kitchen, Kyle rushed downstairs and into the kitchen to find...
1553322222222222121111112.title: Something else

15533222222222221211111121.content:
Kyle took a deep breath and walked into the kitchen to find Uncle Mark and Sam sitting at the table, eating breakfast. They both looked up when Kyle walked in and Uncle Mark's eyes widened, while Sam suppressed a giggle.

"I can explain." Kyle said. "You see, when..."

But Uncle Mark cut him off.

"No need. I don't know what it's like at home, but there's no judgement here. This is supposed to be a fun summer where we get to know each other, so I'm willing to accept you." Uncle Mark said.

"That's nice but you don't understand! The computer!" Kyle started.

"Don't worry about the computer. I'll help you program in preferences that fit, and even help you pick out some of your own stuff, so you're not left wearing your cousins' clothes all summer." Uncle Mark interrupted again.

Suddenly, a ringing sound started and Uncle Mark looked at his phone.

"Whoops! Business call, gotta take this. We can talk later." Uncle Mark rushed out of the room.

Kyle sighed and slumped down into a chair. After Mark was out of earshot, Sam burst out into raucous laughter.

"Ahahahahaha!" Sam laughed. "That was great!"

"Did you do this?" Kyle asked.

"I don't know what you're talking about... Kylie!" Sam laughed again.

"You know that I didn't do this to myself! That stupid computer thought I was Amy and did all this..." Kyle complained.

"Well, you look very pretty... sis!" Sam laughed. "Serves you right for what you did on the plane!"

"That's different! It's not like I did... any of this to you!" Kyle said.

"The question is how you're going to explain it to Uncle Mark. He's pretty accepting of all this stuff. He might not buy you going back on it." Sam said.

"I know..." Kyle sighed.

Kyle started to pick at a plate of eggs and bacon when Uncle Mark returned from his phone call.

"Good news! I just got called in to one of our sites for a business meeting, but I'd be glad to let the two of ya tag along to see NuTech Inc. in action for yourselves." Uncle Mark said. As if noticing Kyle's discomfort, he quickly added. "Unless you aren't comfortable going out in public with me right now... then you two can stay here and explore. There's more than enough stuff to keep you busy and I'd be in and out, no more than a few hours, tops."

Kyle was about to attempt to explain his situation to Uncle Mark again when Sam interjected.

"I think we'll..." Sam started.
15533222222222221211111121.title: Uncle Mark and Sam

choices: Sam makes it a little better
155332222222222212111111212.content:
"I think we'll explore the house." Sam finished.

Kyle sighed in relief as Uncle Mark knowingly nodded.

"All righty, then." he said. "I'll be back soon. Feel free to take advantage of anything in the house that you please."

"We'll be sure to." Sam smiled as Uncle Mark grabbed a few things and headed out the front door.

Kyle turned to his brother.

"You have to help me get out of this crap and explain what happened to Uncle Mark... I can't spend the entire summer like this!" Kyle begged.

"Hm... I guess I could help you. Or I could let you live like this for a while." Sam said.

"Dressed like this or not, I can still kill you." Kyle seethed.

"Even though that wasn't the nicest way to put it, I will be obliging and I'll see what I can do." Sam replied. "Let's go check out Amy's room."

The brothers walked back upstairs and into Amy's room. Sam quickly started to root around on the computer, playing up figuring out the password, before pretending to have "cracked" the password that he himself set the day before. Kyle sat on the bed eagerly awaiting Sam's results.

"Okay..." Sam started. "Let's see this code..."

Sam thought to himself, this was good, and Uncle Mark was already making it better with his acceptance, but he had an opportunity now to either speed things up, or dial it down... which did he want?

Kyle sagged, defeated as he was again seated at the vanity, his legs crossed for him. A dome descended, as a vacuum pulled the damp hair up and into the dome. A mask settled over Kyle’s face as he “mmmphed” in protest. Sam could hear blowers and motors going. The manicure/pedicure machines proceeded to redo Kyle’s nails. This lasted several minutes.

When the dome and mask lifted, Kyle’s blonde hair was cascading in soft waves around his face and down his back. His makeup was flawless. His brows sat in perfect feminine arches above his eyes. His false lashes fluttered with every blink. His lips were glossy and pink to match his clothing. His ears were sporting multiple earrings, including a large gold hoop in each. He had a soft pink French manicure on squared off nails with his toes matching.

“We’re almost done, Kylie,” MARCI said as he was returned to the dressing area. Hot pink stilettos were slid onto his feet. His hair was sprayed with hairspray. A few rings were slid onto his fingers, along with a bracelet and anklet. A silver necklace with a script “Kylie” was draped around his neck.

“Now to make you smell nice,” MARCI added. “Don’t worry, Kylie, the pheromones in the perfume will attract your desired attention.” As a nozzle sprayed strategic points on Kyle’s now feminine body.

Sam took it all in. Kyle looked like a boy hungry 17 year old bimbo.

“I’m going to kill you,” Kyle started. And took a wobbly step towards Sam.

“Oh, that will never do!” MARCI said, an arm appearing and pinching Kyle’s nose together. He opened his mouth and another arm appeared and sprayed something into his throat.

Kyle coughed a few times. “There. Perfect.” MARCI said. “Enjoy your day, Kylie.”

After the coughing stopped, Kyle took another step towards Sam, “You’d better run... my voice!” The spray had given Kyle a rather sexy feminine voice.

Kyle was stunned. He then refocused his anger on Sam, who was still laughing, holding onto his sides, tears streaming out of his eyes. “When i get a hold of you....”

Kyle’s rage was interrupted by a voice.

“Hello!” Someone called from downstairs.

15533222222222221211111121222.content:
Sam’s face dropped in horror. “Shit!”

Again the voice, obviously female, called out, “Hello! Where are you two? I’m the neighbor! Your uncle said he had relatives around my age visiting? I’m Darla!”

Kyle grabbed Sam by his shirt collar and got in his face, “You asshole! Now what?”

Sam whispered, “Quiet! You’ve got to hide! I’ll get rid of her! Get into the bathroom!”

Kyle shoved Sam, letting his shirt loose, “You’d better! Then you’re going to fix this. Then I’m going to kick your ass!” He stormed into the bathroom.

“Hello?” Darla called again.

Sam looked around the room. He left, closing the door behind him. “Um... up here. Hang on a sec.”. He wanted to get away from the room where Kyle was but to his dismay, Darla appeared from around the corner.

She was cute! Long dark hair, piercing blue eyes, a warm smile on her face! “There you are!” She said. “I hope you don’t mind, your Uncle said it was Ok to let myself in. He thought it may be nice for you to get to know people your age this summer. You must be Sam, right?”

Meanwhile, Kyle had his ear pressed up against the bathroom door. “Shit!” He whispered when he heard the muffled sounds of a conversation just outside of the room. “What am I going to do! Think, Kyle! Think!”

He decided that the best place to hide and stay silent was as far from the door as he could get, which was the shower stall. He tiptoed across the bathroom, got into the shower, and quietly slid the door shut.

“Body scan indicates user Kylie,” MARCI suddenly blared. “Do you wish to take a shower?”

“Be quiet you stupid machine!” Kyle hissed.

“Response unclear,” MARCI again intoned.

Outside, Sam winced when he clearly heard MARCI activate again. What had his stupid brother done now? Was he trying to undo the changes on his own?

“What was that?” Darla asked, peering over Sam’s shoulder? “Is that your brother?”

“Uh...”

Back in the bathroom, MARCI again asked, “Do you wish to take a shower?”

“Shut up!” Kyle hissed loudly.

“In the absence of a clear response I’m going to assume that you wish to begin a cleansing and dressing sequence. Enjoy your shower!”

Arms came out and roughly disrobed Kyle. Within moments, he was again being subjected to the cleansing brushes and floral scents of MARCI’s shower.

Sam heard the water running outside the door and panicked. What was going on in there?

“Look, we’re kinda busy...”

“Sounds like someone’s getting ready. I can wait! It’ll be nice to show you two around and introduce you to people!”

Again, Kyle was dragged out of the bathroom and promptly redressed and restyled in exactly the same outfit as before. Apparently that was his clothing for the day.

Upon hearing the blowers going, Darla said, “Sounds like he’s finishing up getting ready!” She knocked on the door. “Are you decent? Can I come in?”

“No!” Sam said, trying to get himself between Darla and the door, but it was too late. She opened the door slowly and said, “Hi, I’m Darla....”

And there stood Kyle in all his tomboyish teen girl glory, looking aghast.

“Oh! I’m sorry!” Darla said. “I thought...” she peered at the necklace around Kyle’s neck.

She jumped to some conclusions. “You doofus,” she said, playfully smacking Sam’s shoulder. “Now I get why you were acting so weird. You could have just said that you didn’t have a brother, but a sister.

“I thought your uncle said her name was Kyle, and I just assumed it was two guys!” She smiled broadly. “No harm done. And it’s great to meet you Kylie!”

“Uh... same,” Kyle said, mortified.

“It’ll be fun! You seem shy! Not to worry, I’ll get both of you introduced around. And there’s lots to do, too! Your uncle said he didn’t want the two of you messing around inside all summer, so he called me!”

She turned to Sam, “i’ll Introduce you to the guys. They do a lot of team video games, and I’m sure they’d love another player!”

She beamed at Kyle, “And no wallflowers here! My girls are going to love hanging out with you, Kylie! There’s lots of great shopping, and Melissa has this great pool to relax by! Do you have a bikini?

“Anyway, we’re going to have a great time this summer!” Darla said, taking Sam’s and Kyle’s arms in her’s. “C’mon. Let’s get you introduced!”
