choices: Darla tags along on the trip back to Uncle Mark's mansion
155332222222222212111111212221.content:
Darla led the two boys (although in Kyle's case it was a very loose descriptor at the moment) out of the mansion. As they walked down the hill, towards one of the other mansions. Sam and Kyle hadn't noticed the others on the way up, but they were all similar looking in size, but many had distinct flairs. As they strolled down the hill, Darla made conversation.

"Your uncle is like, so cool!" Darla said.

"He seems that way. We've sorta only just met. Haven't seen him since we were kids." Sam replied. "So, do you know Sami and Amy?"

"Do I know Sami and Amy? That's a silly question! I'm practically their sister given how much we hang out. Still can't believe they ditched us for the summer to go on a cruise." Darla replied. "Don't worry, we promise not to say how much cooler they are... to your faces."

Darla laughed as Kyle fidgeted in his unfamiliar clothes. They came upon a large driveway, leading to another mansion.

"Come on, we're all meeting at Melissa's house today. Her dad just installed a new 4K TV in their gaming room." Darla said.

"Sounds cool." Sam said.

Darla walked up to the gate and punched in a code. The gate opened and she led the two into the compound, before heading to the door. Darla knocked on the door, which opened practically immediately. Behind the door was a redhead around Darla's age, presumably Melissa.

"These must be Sami and Amy's cousins..." Melissa looked them both up and down. "I thought you said it was two boys."

"I must've heard wrong. This is Sam and Kylie. Sam and Kylie, meet Melissa." Darla introduced.

"Nice to meet you." Sam said.

"Same." Kyle looked down at his feet.

"Come on inside." Melissa motioned.

The three entered the house and they walked down a long corridor. Like Uncle Mark's, the place was huge and gorgeous, though without the obvious tech flair of the Gladstone family. They turned into a short staircase that led into a movie theater-like room with two rows of chairs set up. Sam and Kyle both gaped as they entered, impressed.

"Woah." Sam remarked.

"Everyone, these are Sam and Kylie." Darla said, presenting the two to the rest of the room.

"The Gang" it turns out included Darla, Melissa, two guys named Liam and Eli and another girl named Robin. Despite Kyle's initial hesitance, it wasn't all that bad once pleasantries were out of the way. Apart from getting pulled into "girl talk" by Darla, Melissa and Robin, being Kylie wasn't all that bad, for the time being. Kyle kept trying to urge Sam to make up an excuse, but he was too distracted by the gaming console and between the three boys (that weren't dressed like girls), they had an intense tournament going.

"So Kylie. They're probably going to be a while." Darla said.

"Sorry if you wanted to play, but they always get like this." Melissa said. "We'll probably get a turn later. But in the meantime, I think we might hit the pool or just relax outside and tan a bit. Wanna come?"

"Uh..." Kyle started. "I don't have a suit with me."

"It's not that far back to your uncle's, we'll wait to go in if you need a few minutes to change." Darla said.

"But..." Kyle started again.

"Don't worry, it'll be fun." Melissa said.

"Let me just ask my brother something." Kyle excused himself and walked over to where Sam was sitting, furiously tapping buttons on a controller.

"Sam..." Kyle whispered.

"What?" Sam absentmindedly replied.

"They want me to go in the pool with them." Kyle said.

"Yeah, sure, go ahead." Sam replied.

"Sam..." Kyle urged, but Sam brushed him off and kept playing.

Kyle rolled his eyes and sighed.

"Let me run home and get a suit..." Kyle said.
155332222222222212111111212221.title: Meeting “The Gang”

1553322222222222121111112122212.content:
Kyle sighed. Sam was engrossed in his game on not helping him avoid this torture that was all his fault! But then he realized it was his ticket out of this mess. He could slip back to the house on this pretext and try to get MARCI reprogrammed. Perfect!

“Ok, I’ll run back to my Uncle’s and change!” Kyle said, appreciating the truth in that statement.

“Great! Hurry back!” Melissa said with a smile.

Kyle jogged back to his Uncle’s. The first thing he did upon getting indoors was try to pull that stupid wedgie from his thong out. He wanted to change clothes, but he had nothing to change into. Plus, not knowing that much about this house, he really didn’t want to sit around naked, just in case MARCI’s programming prevented it. She’d already mentioned that he had to be dressed for guests....

Going upstairs to the dreaded room, Kyle dashed n, grabbed his laptop, and made a beeline out of the room before something worse could happen to him.

He set up shop in the kitchen, getting on the network and trying to get into MARCI’s programming like Sam had. But Kyle’s programming and hacking skills weren’t quite up to his brother’s level, so he sat there, gloomily trying to think of possible passwords his brother used. He had three attempts left when he was startled by a knock on the patio door behind him. He turned to see Darla, Melissa, and Robin, in their bikinis, standing there.

“Come on, Kylie!” Darla called. “You can check Facebook later! Go get your bathing suit on!”

“Uh...” Kyle’s mind was a blank as he tried desperately to think of a reason to not change.

“I think I have a new bikini that I haven’t worn at my house if you don’t have one, Kylie!” Melissa added.

Kyle blinked. Given the lack of fabric on the girl’s bikinis, he was pretty sure that he did not want to wind up wearing something like Melissa’s string bikini she had on.

He slumped his shoulders, knowing he had to turn himself over to MARCI again. “OK, OK,” he called out. “I’ll go change.”

Kyle turned and trudged upstairs, not unlike his walking to the gallows.

Melissa nudged Robin. “Is it me, or does she not realize how cute she is? I mean, get her in the right bathing suit and the guys would be all over her, right?”

“Completely,” Robin said, watching Kyle sulk off. “Wonder why she doesn’t realize that?”

Kyle got upstairs to his room and stepped inside. “MARCI?” He called out.

“Yes, mistress?” MARCI’s chipper voice responded.

“I need...” he swallowed hard, “... a bathing suit.”

“Of course, Mistress, I have several...”

“Now hold on,” Kyle said, cutting MARCI off for once. “I do not want to be in display. I was to be covered as much as possible. I do not want to show too much.”

“Understood, mistress. I have just the style!”

Again the arms came out and undressed Kyle. He was finally free of the annoying thong, and it was nice having the right jeans off. A halter top was tied around his torso, supporting his new breasts, and a pair of rather short spandex shorts were slid up his legs.

“Hmmm” MARCI said. “Just a moment, mistress. Something seems off.”

His shorts were pulled to his knees and an arm came out and positioned his genitals up and into his body. A cold adhesive spray was applied and allowed to dry. When MARCI pulled his shorts back up, he had nothing that showed anything other than teen girl showing. Some flip flops were slid onto his manicured feet.

“There. Ready for your activity, mistress. If you’d like, I can contact a doctor regarding that growth you seem to have developed. I have also provided a beach towel for you.” An arm deposited a towel wth a unicorn on it on his bed.

Fearing the worst, Kyle quickly said, “No, MARCI! I don’t want you to do anything about my... growth. I’ll handle it!”

“Of course, mistress.” MARCI responded.

Kyle ran to the vanity and looked at himself in the mirror. He was stunned to see just how.... girlish he looked. He still felt like he was exposed, but it had to be better than one of those skimpy suits the other girls.... he corrected himself... the girls had on.

His heart pounding, he hoped he wouldn’t be exposed he grabbed the towel and slowly went downstairs and back into the kitchen. He peered around the corner, fearing the worst, but Robin saw him.

“C’on, Kylie!” She said. “Let’s get going!”

He slowly stepped around the corner, head down, trying to cover himself with his hands, trying to make himself small and invisible. His face burned red with embarrassment.

“That’s your bathing suit?” Darla asked, apparently surprised. Kyle nodded, sheepishly, certain he was going to be called out.

“Kylie, you need to show your body off more,” Melissa said. “You’re cute, and that outfit may give the guys the impression you’re not really interested in attracting their attention.”

Kyle’s head shot up in surprise. “I’m not really looking to attract any attention,” Kyle said nervously. “I’m not... I don’t wear bikinis often.” He added. “I feel exposed!”

“Girl, seriously,” Darla said. “You’ve got a hot little body! Show it off! Flirt! And that’s not exposed. You should see some of Melissa’s bikini collection!”

“We’ll get you some proper bikinis tomorrow, Kylie, don’t worry. We’ll be hanging at the pool a lot, and a girl needs choices.” Melissa said, smiling at the nervous Kylie. “Anyway, let’s get going, we work on her self esteem at my house. We’re getting near peak tanning time. And it’ll be fun to try to distract the guys from their game.” She winked at Kyle.

Beginning to realize how out of his depth he was a girl, Kyle began the walk back to Melissa’s, keeping to himself as the other girls talked.

15533222222222221211111121222121.content:
The girls tried to get Kyle involved in their conversation, but any talk about boys, shopping or otherwise, he quickly shrugged off. The girls wondered why that might be.

When they got back to Melissa's, the boys hadn't moved much, apart from picking new seats as they kept playing. Melissa strolled into the room in her bikini and stepped in front of the television.

"We're gonna go sunbathe out in the yard." Melissa smirked.

"That's cool, Liss." Liam said. "Can you stop blocking the screen now?"

"Well, if you need us." Darla called out as they strolled out of the room.

Kyle remained behind for a moment and went back over to Sam. He figured it was time for one last attempt at subtlety.

"Sam, was there anything we needed to do today?" he asked. "Any reason we might have to head home?"

"Nope." Sam absentmindedly said.

"Kylie, you coming?" Robin shouted from the doorway.

Kyle sighed and turned away from his brother.

"Just a sec!" Kyle shouted, then turned to glare at Sam, who didn't notice.

After Kyle exited the room, Liam and Eli were momentarily distracted as they sniffed in.

Kyle stepped out of the sliding glass door into the large backyard. There was a large in-ground pool, complete with two diving boards off to one side, and on the other a large patch of grass, where the three girls were setting up their towels.

Kyle made his way over to the girls and followed suit with his towel.

"You know, I don't usually do stuff like this." Kyle said.

"Sunbathe? Oh! That's cause you're from back east, right? The weather's not usually right for it." Darla asked.

"Something like that." Kyle said.

"Don't worry, it's easy. You just lay on your stomach and let the sun do it's work, and then flip." Robin laughed as she laid down.

Kyle weakly giggled along and sat down on the towel. Darla and Melissa set down and laid down as well. The girls started talking and kept trying to get Kyle involved in the conversation.

"Kylie, what do you think?" Melissa asked.

"What about you, Kylie?" Darla asked.

The conversations never ceased and they always wanted Kyle's opinion. And they always somehow drifted back to talking about Kyle's body. Kyle had always wished that his body would be the topic of conversation for a set of cute girls, but this was not how he envisioned it.

"Okay, flip!" Darla exclaimed as her phone buzzed.

As they flipped, the sliding glass door opened once again, revealing:
15533222222222221211111121222121.title: Sunbathing at Melissa’s

choices: Kylie is challenged to the next video game
Kylie is asked if she has a boyfriend
155332222222222212111111212221212.content:
A woman stepped out through the patio door, sliding it shut behind her. “Lissa?” She called. “Do you girls want some drinks?”

Kyle pushed himself up onto his elbows. The feeling of his breasts being pulled on by gravity was just too weird. The woman was attractive, in her 40’s, and obviously took care of herself. She was in shape, with shoulder length chestnut hair and a smile that would melt ice.

The woman put her hand over her eyes, visor-like and peered at Kyle. “And who’s this pretty thing that has joined your group, Lissa?” Kyle wanted the earth to swallow him up, blushing furiously.

“This is Kylie, she’s spending the summer with her uncle, Mr Gladstone. He didn’t want her to be cooped up in the house all summer, so we invited her and her brother,” Melissa made a dismissive gesture to the boys and the video game, “Sam over to hang out and introduce them around.”

The girls and Kyle stood at that point. Melissa’s mom came over and hugged Kyle. He wasn’t sure how to react to it, so he just awkwardly stiffened a little. “It’s very nice to meet you, Kylie. You’re welcome here anytime. I’m Theresa. If you need anything, just ask.”

“Uh... thanks?” Kyle said. The girls returned to their towels, and Kyle slowly did as well.

“Ok,” Theresa said. “Diet drinks, girls?”

Kyle hated the thought of diet anything, but the other girls seemed ok with it, and he didn’t want to rock the boat or draw attention to himself again.

Theresa went back into the house and returned a few minutes later with a tray of drinks and a pair of oversized sunglasses. The girls (and Kyle) got up and moved to the shaded patio where Theresa handed them all a diet soda. Everyone took a seat and crossed their legs, Kyle taking a moment to realize that he should do that too.

“Here, Kylie,” Theresa said, passing the sunglasses to him. “You shouldn’t be squinting like that. Crow’s feet.” She winked.

Sighing, realizing he actually wished he did have sunglasses, Kyle accepted them and put them on.

“Gorge!” Robin said, winking at him.

“Not too much sun, girls,” Theresa said. “You don’t want to burn or get leathery. And you all know about SPF in your makeup?”

The girls all mummured their acknowledgment of that and Theresa smiled. “And you, Kylie, you skin is gorgeous. You do take care of it, don’t you?”

“Uh...” again, Kyle was not prepared for any of this conversation.

Theresa frowned a little. “Well, Lissa here knows all about skin care. She’ll teach you everything you should be doing.”

Theresa stood. “Now to go see what the boys want to eat. They’re always hungry! It was very nice to meet you, Kylie, although I’m sure you’ll be around often! Have fun girls!” She went back inside through the patio door.

“Don’t get mad at her,” Melissa said, putting her hand on Kyle’s. “She’s a big shot at a Catholic Finishing School. She means well.”

“It’s OK,” Kyle said, not really caring what Theresa had to say. “I’m not hung up on skin care or anything.”

“Don’t let Theresa hear you say that,” Darla said, laughing. And Kyle loved it when she laughed. “She’ll have you at her vanity extolling the virtues of every cosmetic she owns. But you should be at least a little careful with your skin, Kylie. You don’t want to age prematurely.”

Robin piped in, “The way I see it, tomorrow we need to get Kylie some bikinis, sunglasses, start her on a skin care regimen... what else?”

“Does it matter?” Melissa said, laughing, “we’ll just spend the day shopping!”

Kyle did not like the sound of that. “Uh... I’m not sure I can afford any of that,” he quickly said, trying to put the brakes on things.

“Oh, not to worry,” Robin said with a dismissive flick of her wrist. “Daddy’s a Doctor. And we have at our disposal...” she looked at the other girls and the all smiled and said in unison, “A PLATINUM CARD!”

“Let’s say, 11 AM?” Darla said. “Kylie, I’ll pick you up first, then we’ll grab the other girls. That way we have the day ahead of us, and can sleep in a little.”

“Great!” Kyle said, trying to feign excitement.

“Kylie! It’ll be fun!” Robin said. “Besides, you need some stuff, and we’ll help you get it!”

“Ok, OK,” Kyle said, defeated. It looked like he was stuck spending another day as Kylie now.

The girls started drinking their sodas. Kyle made a face when he tried his. “You don’t like it?” Darla asked.

“No, it’s fine,” Kyle said, choking down a few more swallows. “I just like the non-diet.”

“Horrible for your figure, though,” Melissa said with a wink.

The girls (and Kyle) finished their drinks and returned to sunbathing, with the occasional lecture to kyle about caring for his skin and the passing around of sunscreen.

Kyle started to doze when he heard a camera shutter click. Robin has her phone and taking pictures of Kyle. She tapped on her phone a few times. “Aaaand.... done. Our new bestie! Group shot!”

“Uh...”Kyle was curious about what just happened, but he was hauled to his feet and the girls all huddled around him. Robin snapped a few selfies and again started taping on her phone. “There. Didn’t even use a filter,” she said.

“So what was...” Kyle started.

Darla hip checked him playfully. “Instagram. Gotta keep the fans happy!” She said.

Robin, still typing away at her phone, said without looking up, “What’s your Instagram ID, Kylie?”

“I don’t have one,” Kyle sheepishly admitted. Melissa lowered her sunglasses down her nose and stared at Kyle, mouth agape. “Girl, that needs to change, right now. Where’s your phone?”

“Back at the house,” Kyle said.

“And Facebook? I can’t find you on there...” Darla said, typing away on her phone, too.

“I’m not on Facebook, either,” Kyle said. Which, technically, was true. Kylie was not on Facebook...

“But we saw you on your laptop!” Robin said.

“Oh, I wasn’t on Facebook!” Kyle said. “I was trying to... fix something”

“Your laptop is acting up? Eli’s a computer whiz! He can get it working again, I’m sure!” Darla said. “We’ll ask him once they finish.”

“So tomorrow, remember your phone so we can get you on Instagram and Facebook!” Robin said. “That way we can tag you in pictures!”

Kyle was horrified. In one afternoon, he’d been roped into shopping for bikinis and god knows what else, promised the development of a skin care routine, having social media accounts made for him... what else could go wrong?

There was a shout inside, and Eli was raising his hands in triumph. “Looks like the game finished,” Melissa said.

The boys slid open the patio door and came out, sitting in the patio chairs while the girls (and Kyle) lounged on their towels.
155332222222222212111111212221212.title: Melissa's mother

1553322222222222121111112122212121.content:
After a while, the girls seemed satisfied with their tans, so they moved from the towels, over to the patio chairs. Darla, Robin and Melissa were preoccupied with Sam, no doubt fishing for information about his "sister", which he was more than happy to provide. As a consequence, Kyle was conversing with Eli and Liam, both very interested in the new girl in the neighborhood. Kyle kept trying to find an opportunity to grab Sam and run, but it never presented itself.

"So, Kylie, Sam was telling us that this is your first visit to this part of the country, right?" Liam asked.

"Yeah." Kyle replied. "For both of us."

"Cool." Eli said. "Enjoying it so far?"

"Well, it's only been a day and it takes some getting used to. Especially with Uncle Mark's house." Kyle replied.

"MARCI, right?" Liam asked. "She hounds Amy and Sami all the time. It was funny, a few years back Mark and Mrs. Gladstone went away for a week and programmed MARCI to stop all their activity if it looked like they were gonna throw a wild party."

"Yeah, I've been having trouble with it. Sam tried to fix it, but I think he made it worse." Kyle said.

"I'd never try to touch anything Gladstone until I get a Masters in IT." Eli laughed.

"Was the new TV all it was cracked up to be?" Kyle asked, hoping to shift the conversation off of himself.

"It was amazing!" Eli exclaimed.

"Do you play?" Liam asked.

"Uh, does a 12th level space knight carry a digisword?." Kyle replied. "Don't look so shocked."

"I'm not, it's just that while the girls like to play, they're not as into it as we are." Eli said. "Part of me thinks Lissa has the systems so that we hang around more."

"Wanna go a few rounds?" Liam asked.

"Yeah!" Kyle replied, happy to get out of the girl zone and into a game.

"Come on." Eli said and got up, walking back towards the house.

Liam followed Eli and Kyle eagerly followed the two boys into the house.

They sat down and started to play. Kyle was having fun, but his newly lengthened nails were taking some getting used to with the joysticks on the controller. Eli seemed to notice his trouble and reached over.

"Need help?" he asked.

"I'm just a little out of practice." Kyle replied.

"Lemme help you. The girls usually use their fingers like this." Eli said, positioning Kyle's fingers onto the controller a certain way. He seemed to linger more than he had to, but Kyle was quickly distracted by the game. "Usually helps them."

"Thanks." Kyle smiled.

"No prob." Eli smiled back.

Kyle started to play a lot better, though he kept thinking about the lingering. Eventually, Sam and the girls rejoined the group, watching Eli, Liam and Kyle playing the game.

"Sam, we were wondering if you have plans tonight, or if you and Kylie wanted to stay for dinner with the gang?" Melissa asked.

Sam was still internally laughing about how great the prank was going, but he can't let Kyle squirm for this long, can he? He figured that he should probably take Kyle home and let him relax after the day he put him through, but on the other hand, the three girls seemed pretty interested in him, and it was because of his "sister". He mused on the idea for a moment.

"Dinner? We probably should get back to Uncle Mark's, but..." Sam started.
1553322222222222121111112122212121.title: Kylie is challenged to the next video game

15533222222222221211111121222121211.content:
Sam’s stomach let out a growl which sealed the deal for him. He was hungry, in the company of some really cute girls, and Kyle was actively playing the game, trash talking and enjoying her... himself. So why not extend the prank a little.

“That sounds great!” Sam said. “I’m getting hungry, and Kylie isn’t much of a cook. Plus, we don’t really know what all supplies Uncle Mark has on hand.”

Melissa smiled, and Sam thought her smiling, in that bikini, was one of the best things he’d ever seen. “One thing though,” Melissa said, “Mom doesn’t like bathing suits at the table. So Kylie’s going to have to change.”

“Not a problem, Melissa!” Sam said. “We’ll be right back.”

Sam walked over and took the controller out of Kyle’s hand. “Hey!” Liam laughed as Kyle’s character died a spectacular death.

“C’mon, Kyle..eee,” Sam said, almost calling his “sister” the wrong name. “We have to run back to Uncle Mark’s for a bit.”

“Really?” Kyle asked, hoping that this day would be over soon.

“Yeah. You have to change for dinner.”

“What?!” Kyle asked, not relishing another outfit at all.

Melissa came over and put her hand on Sams’s shoulder. “Yeah... sorry. Mom doesn’t like bathing suits at the table. But it doesn’t have to be formal. Just throw on something cute. Oh, and bring your phone as we can get you on Instagram, too!”

Kyle slumped. Again, he was stuck.

“Ok, we’ll be right back!” Sam said, practically shoving his brother out the door toward their Uncle’s.

As they walked back, Kyle whispered, “I am going to kill you for this!”

“Oh come on, Kylie,” Sam said with a smile. “You didn’t like hanging out with some hot girls all day?”

“Not wearing this!” He gestured at his bathing suit.

“Hey,” Sam said, finally taking a good look at his brother. “Where’s your junk?”

“MARCI glued it up out of sight. It’s uncomfortable as Hell, and I want to get out of these clothes and back to my old self. And in case you didn’t know, the girls want Kylie to go shopping tomorrow.”

Sam laughed at the thought of Kyle trudging around from boutique to boutique. “Al least you’ll have eye candy!”

Kyle smacked Sam in the back of the head. “They want me to get bikinis, jerk!”

Sam really laughed at the thought of his brother trying on those. Kyle grabbed his ear and twisted it, pulling Sam’s head towards his shoulder. “Not funny, asshole. Let’s just get this over with. And tonight, you fix MARCI. “

“OK! OK!” Sam whined as Kyle released his ear with a shove.

The pair opened the door to the house and walked into the kitchen, surprised to see Uncle Mark sitting there, reading some online news. “Ah, there the two of you are. I trust you had fun with the kids? And Kylie! That’s a lovely bathing suit! I see you’re taking big steps!”

Kyle glared at Sam. He couldn’t tell if Uncle Mark was poking fun or not, so he just stood there.

“Meliissa’s invited us over for dinner. We weren’t expecting you to be here,” Sam said. “We told her we’d be right back, so...”

“Yes, yes. Go have fun with your friends. I’ll be here when you get back.”

Kyle trudged back upstairs to his room, followed closely by Sam. “What are you thinking as far as clothes go?” Sam asked.

“How the Hell should I know, dork?” Kyle said. “I have no idea with ‘something cute’ is!”

“Well, you could always let MARCI decide,” Sam said with a chuckle.
15533222222222221211111121222121211.title: Sam accepts the invitation

155332222222222212111111212221212111.content:
"No way. I don't trust that thing anymore." Kyle said. "I don't want to wear this stuff but I don't know how much more I can take of being manhandled."

"Good luck, then." Sam said, motioning towards Amy's room.

Kyle stepped inside the room very cautiously. He walked over to the walk-in closet and opened the door. He stepped inside and looked around. What he found were several racks of clothing, countless drawers, much bigger than any closet he had ever used before. There was every possibly article of clothing in any color of the known spectrum that Kyle could fathom.

"Guess that explains how MARCI had so many different outfits today. I bet there's stuff here that Amy's never even worn once!" Kyle remarked.

"You called, Mistress?" MARCI asked.

Kyle jumped, worried that MARCI was going to ambush makeover him again, but nothing happened.

"No, I didn't." Kyle replied.

"I will remain on standby in the event you need assistance." MARCI stated.

Kyle started picking through the piles, finding a pair of overalls in a pile of tight jeans and jean shorts. He thought for a moment, overalls were comfortable, and how girly can he really look in them? Were they cute? Kyle didn't really care, he just needed something. He tossed them over his shoulder and turned towards the other areas.

"Perfect," Kyle said as he started picking through the t-shirt pile.

Sam poked his head into the room and looked around, hearing movement in the closet.

"C'mon, Kyle! Hurry up! Melissa and the girls might come looking for you if we're not there soon!" Sam shouted.

"I'll be right out!" Kyle shouted back, picking through the clothes. "I'm almost done!"

"Allow me to help speed things along." MARCI stated.

"Don't you dare!" Kyle shouted as the arms grabbed the overalls off his shoulder and lifted him up.

"Crafting outfit based on desired primary article." MARCI stated as the overalls were pulled away.

"Let me go!" Kyle squirmed, but MARCI held firm.

An abridged version of the day's earlier events replayed for Kyle, with him being stripped from the bathing suit and redressed in proper clothes, starting with red panties and a red sports bra, before a red t-shirt was pulled down over his head, and the overalls were pulled up over his legs. Kyle was pleased, until he realized that they weren't full overalls. They were overalls where the legs were cut off at mid-thigh.

His makeup was retouched as the overalls were attached and socks and the high tops from before were returned to his feet. His hair was then pulled back into a ponytail as he was dropped back onto the ground.

Sam opened the door and rushed into the room.

"There you are! Come on!" Sam grabbed Kyle by the hand and pulled him out of the room.

As they approached the front door, Sam reached for the doorknob.

"Kids! You can't leave!" Uncle Mark shouted from the kitchen as he rushed towards the door.

"Thank god." Kyle muttered.

"What's up?" Sam asked.

"Usually I let Sami and Amy be my beta-testers, but since they're away, I'd figured I could pass this onto you two." Uncle Mark dug into his pocket and handed two smartphones to them, Sam's being dark blue and Kyle's being pink.

"What are these?" Sam asked.

"Gladstone NuPhone X's." Uncle Mark replied. "Fresh off the line. Don't worry about running up a bill or anything, so use 'em as much as you'd like and let me know how they work. They've got the newest everything."

"Wow! Thanks!" Sam exclaimed.

"Yeah..." Kyle said.

"Listen, Kylie. I just want you to know again that anything you need, we're family and I'm here to help, even if you just want to talk." Uncle Mark said.

"I know." Kyle said, quietly.

"Great!" Uncle Mark exclaimed. "Have fun, you two!"

Uncle Mark returned to the kitchen and Sam opened the front door, with Kyle following close behind.
155332222222222212111111212221212111.title: Kyle chooses “something cute”

1553322222222222121111112122212121111.content:
The pair left the house before Kyle said, “Pink? He had to give me a pink phone?”

“It’s your color, KYLIE,” Sam said with a big grin, emphasizing his brither’s feminized name.

Kyle’s phone buzzed and he looked at it, his face falling when he saw the notification.

Notification from MARCi:
Favorite color updated to pink

“Oh no! No, no, no, no!” Kyle said. “These things are linked to MARCI! You just set my favorite color to pink!”

Sam grabbed the phone from his brother and laughed as he read it. “You’d better be careful around Darla, then. MARCI could have a field day with that.”

Yeah, well...SAM’S FAVORITE COLOR IS PINK!” Kyle shouted, waiting for MARCI to note that for Sam.

Sam held his breath and stared at the phone.

Nothing happened.

“This has to be a bug,” Kyle said, glumly, continuing on. “But we get done with dinner and you undo everything, right?”

“Yeah, yeah,” Sam said, “buzzkill.”

Kyle slid the phone into his back pocket as they arrived at Melissa’s house. Sam knocked on the door, and it was promptly opened by Theresa.

“Sam!” She said, “And Kylie!” She hugged them both. “Come in, come in. We’re having chicken, I hope that’s OK!”

“That’s great!” Said Sam. He elbowed Kyle.

“Yeah. Great!” Kyle added.

Mellisa came bounding into the entryway. “Hi Sam! Kylie, rocking the shortalls!” She grabbed Kyle’s hand. “Give us a sec, Mom. Girl stuff!”

Melissa escorted Kyle back to meet the other girls, now clothed, sitting at the patio table by the pool. They jumped up and each hugged Kyle. He could get used to that!

Robin piped up. “Ok, girl, phone!” She held out her hand. Kyle reluctantly handed over his new pink phone.

“Oh!” Robin said as she inspected his phone. “Is this a new Samsung?”

Kyle shrugged. “My uncle just gave it to me.”

“Lucky!” Robin began. “This is a SUPER nice phone!” She began typing away on it.

Kyle was then pulled over and selfies were taken with him and each of the girls. They made him smile, and they all started typing away on their phones. Once Robin was done with Kyle’s new phone, she also took a picture with him on her phone. The girls all then huddled around Kyle for one last selfie with his phone. Robin took it back and did some last bit of typing before handing it back to Kyle.

Kyle’s new Instagram account was open, and he had pictures posted with the girls, and they had tagged him in all the pictures they just took with him. He sighed.

“So you’re now on Instagram and Facebook. We’ll have to get a ton more pics up, though!” Robin declared.

“Totally!” Darla agreed.

“You know, Kylie, the shortalls are cute, but you really should think about some more fitted clothes.” Darla said.

The phone buzzed and Kyle saw a notification pop up:

Notification from MARCI
Wear more fitted clothes

Kyle took the phone and shoved it into his back pocket before anything else could go wrong.

“Yeah, Kylie. You’ve got a cute figure! And that won’t last forever!”

Kyle felt another buzz and yabked the phone back out of his pocket to see

Notification from MARCI
Maintain figure

He began trying to figure out how to shut the phone off.

“Yeah,” Robin said, “Don’t you want a boyfriend?”

Kyle was desperately mashing the power button when

Notification from MARCI
Get boyfriend added to “to do” list

Popped up just before he got the phone shut off

He’d have to find a way to delete those things as soon as he could.

The patio door slid open a bit and Theresa stuck her head out, “Girls, it’s time to come eat!”

Kyle and the girls slid the patio door open and went into the house for dinner.
1553322222222222121111112122212121111.title: They head back to Melissa's

15533222222222221211111121222121211111.content:
Despite Kyle's general lack of desire to be in this situation, he hadn't eaten since breakfast, so dinner was a very welcome outcome to the day. Melissa and the other girls took a moment to take pictures of their food for social media, something that the boys, and Kyle did not do. Sam was quick to converse with Melissa, Robin and Darla, but they were busy trying to get Kylie to talk.

"I can't wait to show you around tomorrow." Darla said. "We haven't had a new girl in this group for years. Person who moved in the most recently was Eli and that was years ago!"

"I wasn't quite as interested in shopping as they would have liked." Eli joked.

Kyle weakly laughed as he thought about the shopping and all the girly activities he'd have to endure. If Sam couldn't fix MARCI... hell, even if Sam does, how do they explain why Kylie went missing? He either has to come clean about dressing this way, or keep dressing this way until the summer ends. Neither option is promising. Maybe he can sit down with Uncle Mark and explain everything and he has a mind wiper hidden away in a drawer somewhere...

"Remember Kylie, I'll pick you up around 11AM for the shopping trip." Darla said, snapping Kyle out of his trance.

MARCI buzzed in his pocket and Kyle sighed.

"Can't wait." Kyle smiled.

"The chicken is great, Theresa." Sam remarked.

"Thank you very much, Sam." Theresa replied.

Everyone nodded in agreement as they kept eating. Kyle was especially hungry and grabbed another piece of chicken off the tray and started digging in.

"Woah, Kylie. You've got quite an appetite." Theresa remarked.

"I uh... had a light breakfast, so I'm starving." Kyle replied. He might have to temper his appetite around her, or she'd be critiquing every thing he did.

"Oh to be that young and not worried about calories yet." Theresa laughed.

"Come on, Mom! You're pretty skinny yourself." Melissa interjected.

"And I work very hard at it." Theresa laughed again.

Conversations started cropping up here and there are dinner continued. Kyle's phone started to buzz and he worried that it was Marci again, but it turned out to be social media notifications. Kylie had amassed quite a few followers and likes in the short time since the accounts had been opened.

"Ooh! Nice" Darla nodded as she leaned over to see Kyle's phone.

"Looks like someone's popular..." Melissa grabbed the phone and started scrolling through. "Know her, know her... don't know her... She's pretty!"

Kyle wrestled the phone back and put it back in his pocket silently hoping that the meal would end soon as he was pulled into another conversation with the girls.
15533222222222221211111121222121211111.title: Dinner is served

155332222222222212111111212221212111111.content:
Dinner slowly wound to a close, and for Kyle, it couldn’t end soon enough. His phone buzzed at a steady pace with updates, likes, and friend requests. The girls insisted the he show them the updates with each buzz as they commented on people, having him accept the friend requests, replying, and sending out friend requests of his own all through dinner.

Kyle was ready to head back to Uncle Mark’s to end this day, but was dragged outside to the patio again after dinner.

“So tomorrow is shopping,” Melissa said, “and that’s our off day. Wednesday is cardio, so you can come with us!”

“Cardio?” Kyle asked. “Go where?”

“Workout day!” Robin answered. “We work out together every other day. We can get you a guest pass to our gym! We’ll be doing spinning, so make sure you have some workout gear.”

Kyle’s phone buzzed and he looked at it.

Notification from MARCI
Exercise at gym Wednesday AM and every other day.

“New like?” Darla asked.

“No,” Kyle said. “Just a notification by the system.”

“Aw,” Robin said. “We’ll work on getting more pictures up on your accounts, though. Don’t worry.”

“Great!” Kyle said, feigning excitement. He was feeling defeated after this long, uncomfortable day.

“Look, I’m sorry,” Kyle said, “But I’m exhausted. It’s been a... fun day!” He added, trying to be friendly. “And it’s been great hanging out with all of you, but I’m just tired. I want to get a shower and get into bed.”

The girls all said they understood, that beauty sleep was important, and that they’d see him tomorrow for a fun filled day of shopping.

Kyle found Sam, who was back playing video games. “Sam, I’d appreciate you coming back to uncle Mark’s with me so that you can fix that thing for me!” Kyle said.

Sighing, Sam exited out of the game. The pair thanked Melissa’s parents for the wonderful meal, and Kyle got another round of hugs from the girls.

After they trudged back to their uncle’s, Kyle told Sam, “Go get your laptop and fix this,” He gestured at his body. “I am beat and really want to go to bed!”

Sam ran up to his room and got his laptop. Kyle appeared in the doorway to his room and stood there, leaning against the doorway, arms crossed over his chest, looking really like an angry teenage girl.

Sam typed in the password, getting it wrong. “Two attempts remaining” came up on his screen.

“Two attempts left?” He asked and looked at Kyle. “We’re you trying to get into this?”

“Yeah,” Kyle said, “I was trying to get into it so that I didn’t have to sunbathe this afternoon.”

“Ok, no problem, just have to get in,” Kyle said, attempting another go at the password. But it was long, and he entered it incorrectly again.

“Dude, just put in the password!” Kyle said.

Sam began carefully and slowly typing In the password.

“Don’t mess it up this time! I want to get out of this outfit and get into bed!” Kyle said.

“Of course, mistress,” came MARCI’s automated response.

“Wait! What??” Kyle cried out as arms pulled him into an alcove and a wall slid into place, obscuring the view.

The sudden noise and Kyle’s shouting distracted Sam’s last attempt at the password. “Account locked. Contact System Administrator to reset password.”

“Crap!” Sam muttered, as Kyle was deposited back into the doorway. He was now in a lace trimmed nylon short set of pink pajamas, and his hair pulled back in a ponytail. His makeup had been removed, and he was obviously now dressed for bed.

“There. Shall I put you into bed, mistress?” MARCI asked the annoyed boy.

“No thank you!” Kyle said between clenched teeth. “Tell me you got in,” he said to Sam.

“You startled me!” Sam said defensively. “You made me get it wrong and I’m locked out!”

“I did it? Don’t you blame this mess on me!” Kyle shouted. “I ddn’t ask to wear... this!” He gestured at the pink short set.

“Would you prefer a nightgown, mistress?” MARCI asked.

“No!” Kyle shouted. “I just want...”. He sighed. “So who’s the sys admin?”

“Probably Uncle Mark?”

“Let’s find him and get him to reset it.”

The boys ran to find Uncle Mark, who was watching TV. The TV was the entire wall of his den, and he was snoring softly, sitting upright on a couch, his head leaning backwards.

“Uh... Uncle Mark?” Sam asked tentatively.

Uncle Mark awoke with a snort. “I’m awake!” He said bolting upright. “I’m awake!” He looked at the pair. “Oh. Sam! Kylie! What can I do for you?”

“I... accidentally locked Kyle out of his account for MARCI and I need to have his password reset.”

“Oh. Well, a few things there, Samuel,” Uncle Mark started, emphasizing Sam’s full name. “I find it offensive that you’re not accepting of who Kylie wants to be. From now on you are to use HER desired name and pronouns, am I clear?”

“But...” Kyle started to say.

“No, no, Kylie. I will not tolerate Samuel’s inability to accept his sister.”

“But...” Kyle started in again.

“And as for resetting the password, Amy is the sys admin. I don’t have the time to deal with things like that! So you’ll have no choice but to accept Kylie as she is!”

Kyle’s face dropped. He was stuck like this until Amy got back?

“Now, I’m off to bed. MARCI, bedtime protocol R28.”

The wall of the room reverted back to a plain appearing wall, and arms picked up both Sam and Kyle, carrying them off to their respective rooms.

Kyle was deposited in his bed, and the sheets were pulled up. “Your uncle is upset,” MARCI said. “The door to the room will be locked until tomorrow morning.” Kyle groaned. “Goodnight.”

Likewise, Sam was stripped and out into a pair of pajama pants and put into his bed and told about the lockdown.

Kyle stared blankly at the ceiling. His uncle thought he wanted to be like this. And now there wasn’t anything he could do about it. He was stuck as Kylie until Amy got home. It was a long time before Kyle’s running thoughts allowed him to drift off to sleep.
155332222222222212111111212221212111111.title: After dinner

choices: Try to get into MARCI again
1553322222222222121111112122212121111111.content:
"Good morning mistress. It is time to wake up." MARCI said as she played a pleasant, but subtly disruptive tone to rouse Kyle from his sleep. "Your first activity for the day is at 11AM."

"What time is it now?" Kyle asked as he pulled a pillow over his head.

"9:30AM." MARCI replied.

"Gimme another half hour." Kyle shoved his head under the pillow and held firmly.

"Impossible, mistress. Morning preparations will take at least 30 minutes and you must have proper time for breakfast and digestion before your day begins." MARCI stated.

The arms flew from the walls and pulled the blanket off of Kyle. He was immediately reminded of what he was wearing as he felt a sudden chill.

Please make your way to the bathroom. The shower has been prepared to your specifications. MARCI stated.

Kyle slowly sat up and blew a strand of hair from his face. He scowled as he walked into the bathroom. He opened the shower door and stepped inside, aware of what awaited him. He was immediately stripped and his hair was taken out of the ponytail, allowed to lay freely. The water turned on and Kyle was aware of the protocol. Kyle got a glimpse of himself in a mirror and noticed that he had noticeable tan lines.

"At least it's gonna be a while before I'm dressing normal again, so those can fade." Kyle sighed.

The shower once again notified Kyle when to turn so that each and every angle of his body was thoroughly scrubbed. The helmet descended once again and Kyle placed it onto his head. He could feel the helmet lathering and washing his hair, and caught the same slight whiff of strawberries from the shampoo. Thankfully, it skipped the hair removal portion, but only because there had not been any new hair growth since the last time.

When everything was finished, his hair was back in the towel turban and another was wrapped around his chest. Kyle chose to walk out of the bathroom by his own power and walked over to his remade bed. He found his new outfit and held it up. It was a pair of tight jeans and an equally tight black and red tank top.

"I'm not really sure about this..." Kyle mumbled.

"Are you dissatisfied with the outfit?" MARCI asked. "Since your activity is shopping I chose an outfit that you can enter and exit with ease while trying on other potential outfits."

Kyle had a flashback to the previous day where a decent outfit was replaced with the girliest thing ever. He shuddered at the thought of that outfit again.

"No, it's fine." Kyle said.

"Time limit for typical preparations passed. Providing assistance to speed things up." MARCI asked.

"MARCI, please, not again!" Kyle whined as the arms grabbed the towels and put him into his new outfit.

First a new set of undergarments, a black bra and panty set, then the jeans were pulled up and the tank top pulled down. Then it was back to the salon chair. The makeup and nail polish were touched up and he was placed back into the high tops. His hair was returned to the braid that it was placed in the day before and Kyle was released from MARCI's grip... for now.

"Thank god for small mercies." Kyle muttered. "Could be worse, I could be in heels again."

"Did you request a change in footwear?" MARCI asked.

"No, I did not. These are perfect." Kyle replied. Stupid machine...

"Breakfast is currently being served in the kitchen." MARCI stated.

Kyle started to walk towards the door as he decided what his course of action would be.
1553322222222222121111112122212121111111.title: Kyle’s new morning routine

1553322222222222121111112122212121111111.content:
Kyle headed down to breakfast. The jeans were tight, but kind of thin and stretchy. They weren’t anything like the jeans he was used to. The bra was an annoyance, and the tight tank top showed off his newly acquired curves a little too much to his liking. They seemed bug to him. On a girl, he’d love to look at them. On him, it was just unsettling. But it wasn’t as bad as it could have been. At least that’s what he kept telling himself.

He found his uncle and Sam already up and moving. Mark was in a somewhat ill-fitting shirt and tie, looking vaguely uncomfortable. Sam was... well, dressed as Sam usually was. And that annoyed Kyle.

“Uncle Mark?” He started.

“Yes Kylie? And please, I told you before to just call me Mark,” he smiled at Kyle.

“I was wondering... MARCI seems to be much more focused on me than Sam. Is there a reason for that?”

Uncle Mark was fussing with his shirt sleeves. “Hmm? Oh, yes! Of course! Personal bias, dear.

“You see, MARCI was primarily developed to help me deal with two teenage daughters. So she’s keyed to help deal with issues and problems that girls have. Not having boys, I’ve never thought to program her to deal with teen boys.

“MARCi helps me out with household things rather than my own issues, so I don’t need her talents as much as my girls do. And Amy tends to be the one that fiddles with her programming, so her AI is based on what a teenage girl needs. To her, Sam is akin to a footstool. Something that she just needs to make sure is in the right place when needed. But you, my dear, are something she understands and will help immensely.”

As of on cue, Kyle was presented with his breakfast, which was a bowl of yogurt with some fruit on top.

“Your breakfast, mistress,” MARCi said.

Kyle looked over at the bacon, eggs, and toast that Sam was having. “I’d prefer what Sam is having,” Kyle said hopefully.

“I’m sorry, mistress,” MARCI said. “This breakfast is nutritionally complete for a girl your age. Too many calories is not healthy for you, as women and men have different caloric requirements.”

“See? Helpful!” Mark said. He then fussed with his tie and the cuffs on his shirt before asking, “Kylie, do i look OK? I mean like a titan of industry? I’m not used to ties.”

“You look fine, I guess.” Kyle said, watching Sam taunt him by slowly crunching his bacon. “Why?”

“Important meeting this morning. So what are your plans today, kids?”

“Kyle...ee” Sam caught himself, “is going shopping with the...other girls. And I’m not sure what I’m doing.”

“Well, stay out of trouble, both of you. I’ll be back as soon as I can,”. Mark said. He asked MARCI for a cup of coffee to go, waved, and slipped out the garage door. His car was heard starting up, the garage door opening, and he drove off, the garage door closing slowly after him.

“I hate this,” Kyle said.

“I’m really sorry,” Sam said. “I never meant for this to go this far.”

“Look at me!” Kyle moaned. “Boobs! I have boobs! And I’m being dragged shopping for bikinis!”

“I know.” Sam said sadly. “Maybe I’ll see if I can hack into the system while you’re out.”

“Just... think about it carefully and be careful. MARCI already spends way too much time worring about me.”

“I will. I owe it to you.”

Kyle had Marci prepare a cup of coffee. He wanted cream in it, but MARCI would only give him something made with skim milk.

“That about sums up what this summer is going to be like. Apparently, I’m officially on a diet.”

“So what’s it like?” Sam asked.

“What’s what like?”

“Having boobs?”

“Annoying. They jiggle. Bras are annoying. And they’re always in the way,” Kyle said.

“Play your cards right and maybe you’ll get to see Darla’s,” Sam said with a grin.

Kyle thought about that. “Hey, maybe there is an upside to this mess! I mean, I’m being dragged for a workout to a woman!/‘ gym tomorrow.! Assuming there are showers, that could be amazing!”

“Uh, Kyle... Kylie,” Sam said. “I hate to rain on your parade, but... how are you going to be naked with girls without them seeing your junk?”

Kyle blanched. “I hadn’t thought about that... what am I going to do?”

A horn sounded outside. “Looks like your ride is here,” Sam said. “Have fun shopping! And we’ll figure a way out of the gym.”

“We’d better,” Kyle said.

MARCI deposited a small drawstring bag over Kyle’s shoulder. “I put together some things you may need for your outing, mistress,” MARCI said.

“Great,” Kyle said flatly.

The horn honked again, and Kyle exited the house.
1553322222222222121111112122212121111111.title: Head down to breakfast

1553322222222222121111112122212121111111.content:
As Kyle exited the house, Sam grabbed some provisions and planned to sit down and get to the bottom of MARCI's systems. Kyle, on the other hand, climbed into Darla's car, in the passenger seat.

"Morning, Kylie!" Darla exclaimed as Kyle fastened his seatbelt.

"Good morning to you, too." Kyle replied as he tried to find a comfortable position for the belt to sit.

"We've just gotta pick up the others and we'll be on our way." Darla said.

"No rush..." Kyle muttered.

"What was that?" Darla asked.

"I said I can't wait." Kyle smiled.

"That's what I thought you said!" Darla smiled back.

Melissa and Robin were soon picked up, climbed into the backseat and the girls were on their way to the mall. Their attempts to pull "Kylie" into their conversations continued, though Kyle was able to deflect most of the questions, especially when they pertained to "her" past.

"I saw you and Eli getting a bit close yesterday..." Robin joked.

"He was just helping me with the game. Not that easy to game with these, as I'm sure you know." Kyle wiggled his fingers towards the backseat.

"Ooh, that's a nice shade of pink. What's it called?" Melissa asked.

"I'm... uh... not really sure. MARCI did it, so it's not like she told me the brand names of everything." Kyle replied.

"Oh! You know what would be so cute?" Darla asked.

"What?" Robin replied.

"If we all got our nails done in matching styles!" Darla exclaimed.

Melissa and Robin squealed with delight and agreement. Kyle weakly played along as they started brainstorming colors.

Eventually, (not soon enough, thought Kyle) they arrived at the mall and started looking around stores, starting with the swimsuit section. Kyle stood near a rack of one-pieces, hoping that the rack would swallow him whole and he wouldn't have to endure this anymore.

Melissa soon ambushed him, holding a black push-up bikini top with a matching bottom up to his body.

"Here." Melissa handed it to him. "This one is perfect."

"Thanks." Kyle slung the items over his arm and started to look through a nearby rack.

"Come on, Kylie!" Robin shouted. "We're gonna go try on what we picked out!"

"And we got you a few choices." Darla smiled as she held up a pile of cloth.

Kyle sighed as he weighed his options. On the one hand, he could just let them buy it and not have to suffer the indignity for another day or so... but on the other hand, if they change together... he might be able to watch the girls change... He decided to:
1553322222222222121111112122212121111111.title: Shopping with Kylie

1553322222222222121111112122212121111111.content:
Kyle took his armful of choices and stated heading to the checkout. “Woah!” Robin said. “Aren’t you going to try those on?”

“Yes,” Melissa said, “She’s going to try those on first.”

“But I...” Kyle started to say, but Darla had already asked the salesgirl to unlock some dresssing rooms. Kyle was led to one of them and the door closed behind him.

He was annoyed at both having to try these nightmare things on as much as not getting to change with the girls. He started sorting through the pile of things he was given. The black bikini, a red bikini, a silver metallic bikini, a bright blue bikini, some coverups, a couple of pareos, three pairs of sunglasses, some espadrilles, and a few pairs of flip flops.

He stood there, looking at the mass of clothing, when a knock on the door came. “You OK in there? Do you need any other sizes?” The sales clerk asked.

“Uh, no...” Kyle said. “I’m good.” He held up the black bikini and stared at it.

“C’mon our, Kylie!” Melissa said. “Let’s see you!”

“Show us!” Robin called.

Defetedly, Kyle stripped. He examined his glued up crotch in the mirror for a few seconds. It was flat hidden, but up close it wouldn’t pass inspection. He had to get out of that gym visit tomorrow.

He noted the “do not remove this when trying on!” strip in the bikini bottoms, and pulled them in place. He tied the string around his neck for the top, taking a second to stare at his chest before stuffing himself into the cups and finally getting the back hooked. The push up top did a number on his false chest, and he was worried about looking like that. He stared at himself in the mirror, swallowing hard, when he was broken out of his reverie.

Darla was knocking on the door. “Can we come in?”

He opened the door a crack and Robin pulled it open. The girls gave him a critical look. “I don’t think that fits,” Robin said.

Melissa came over behind him and tightened up the tie around his neck, hoisting his boobs up further. “Yeah, I agree,” she said, looking Kyle over.

Darla had him spin, and he felt like his ass cheeks were hanging out. “Yep. Wrong size,” she finally said.

Kyle was relieved. He was certain that it was too small too. Darla went to the sales clerk and said, “The black bikini she’s in, could you get the next size down, please?”

“Darla!” Kyle said. “Isn’t this too small as it is?”

“Don’t worry, Kylie,” she replied. “We’ll make sure you look good,” drawing out and emphasizing the last word.

The clerk returned with the smaller sized bikini and again, Kyle was shoved into the dressing room. Trembling, he put it on. The bottoms practically rode up his ass and the push up top REALLY pushed up his boobs. He was summoned back out. Robin was in a similar bikini, and she pulled Kyle over and struck a pose.

Darla snapped a few pictures. “These will get a ton of likes!” She said, tapping away on her phone.

“You’re posting my picture online?” Kyle said, somewhat horrified.

“Yep,” Darla said. “Bikini....summer....babes!” She said as she typed. “And... posted.”

“And that’s the one,” Robin said, smiling. “Now let’s get others tried on.”

And so it went. The girls made him try on variations of the bikinis (which were mostly decided to be too big, so he had to try on the next size down) with the wraps, each pair of sunglasses, with the shoes. The girls made sure to get pictures of him in each bikini that went up online, and he could hear his phone buzzing, apparently from the likes. He wound up with the red, black, and metallic silver bikinis, the espadrilles, all three sunglasses, and several covers and wraps.

“That’s a start,” Robin said with a wink as she paid.

“Let’s grab some coffee,” suggested Darla. “We can plan what’s next to get. I want to look at some shoes, we need to get Kylie’s skin care straightened out.”

They went to the coffee shop in the atrium of the mall, got their coffees, and sat down at a table off to the side.

“Ok,” Darla said. “What’s the plan here? What else do we need to get besides her skin care stuff” she said, gesturing at Kyle.

“Workout year for the gym tomorrow,” Robin said. “Some cute outfits? Oh! Makeup!”

“How are you set for lingerie?” Melissa asked Kyle.

“Um... OK?” Kyle hesitantly answered.

“Girl, you can’t ever have enough undies.” Darla said with a wink. “Do you have your black lace set ready?”

“My black lace set of what?” Kyle asked.

“You know,” Robin said with a playful nudge on Kyle’s shoulder, “for when the right guy comes along. Something sexy to wear to impress him, get his motor going...”

“To jump your bones!” Melissa added with a wink.

“Uh...” Kyle tried to think of an answer.

“Speaking of,” Darla said, “Everone remembered their pill today?” The girls nodded yes.

“Pill?” Asked Kyle, hoping to change the subject away from guys for a while.

“BC?” Robin said. Kyle started blankly at her. “Birth control? You’re on the pill, aren’t you, Kylie?”

“No?” Kyle said, not really sure how to answer.

The girls all looked incredulously at Kyle. “Hang on,” Robin said, pulling out her phone. She hit a quick dial number and held it to her ear.

“Hi! It’s Robin. Sure. I’ll hang on.” She looked at Kyle and winked.

After a bit, Robin said, “Hi Daddy! Yes.... oh, we’re at the mall.... not too much, just got Kylie some bikinis..... yeah.” She held up a “one sec” finger at Kyle.

“So Kylie... Yeah, her.... she’s sexually active.. No, she isn’t on the pill. Could you.... sure! One sec,”. Robin handed Kyle the phone. “Daddy wants to talk to you.”

Kyle was sure he was in Hell. Sexually active? The girls thought that? Uncertain of what to do, Kyle put the phone to his ear. “Uh... hello?”

A pleasant baritone voice responded. “Hello, Kylie. I’m Robin’s dad, Pete. She’s been talking non-stop about you, and I’m happy you’ve found a group of girls your age to fit in with. I’m sure you heard her tell me you wanted to get on birth control.”

“Um... yeah,” Kyle said as the three girls watched him intently.

“Before I prescribe that to you, I wanted to ask you some questions. Are your periods regular, or do they seem to come at varying times?”

Kyle had no idea what to say here, so he guessed. “They... vary?” Surely a bodily function that occurred like clockwork would be unreasonable, he figured.

“And bleeding? Heavy? Manageable?”

“Manageable! Really manageable! They’re just fine!” He didn’t Pete to think he had blood trickling down his leg.

“Any severe cramping? Anything abnormal?”

“Oh, no!” Kyle said, “Everything’s normal! Normal as can be here!”

“Ok, great. I’ll call in your new prescription. You can pick it up after a while later today while you girls are out. If you could, please put Robin back on so I can fill her in.”

Shocked, Kyle handed the phone back to Robin. “Yep!” She said. “She’s thrilled! Yeah... OK, I know that pharmacy. Yeah.... got it. Kylie Gladstone... just as it sounds... G L A D S T O N E. Ok. Thank you, Daddy!

“He’ll call that in and we can pick it up on our way home,” Robin said. “You should be on the pill, Kylie. It’ll help even out your period.”

“And it may even make your boobs bigger!” Melissa said with a smile.

“You really shouldn’t be dating guys and not be on it,” Darla said. “But don’t worry, we all have each others’ backs.”

She turned to the other girls. “Ok, now that we’ve got Kylie safe for dating, what’s next? Shoes? Undies? Clothes?”
1553322222222222121111112122212121111111.title: Try on the bikinis

1553322222222222121111112122212121111111.content:
The lingerie store was the next stop and Kyle went beet-red as they entered the store. This was a forbidden kingdom for boys, and yet he had gained admission. The girls started browsing immediately and Kyle once again started to idly flip through a rack. He had to think of a way he could head this off at the pass... as he was thinking...

"Need any help, Miss?" a saleswoman suddenly appeared behind Kyle.

He jumped in surprise, before turning to the chipper associate.

"I think I'm good." Kyle said as he went back to checking the rack.

"Are you sure? Because these don't look like quite the right size. What cup size are you?" the saleswoman asked, eyeing Kyle's chest.

"Uh..." Kyle hesitated. They weren't huge, thankfully, but MARCI hadn't mentioned the exact size.

"How does your current bra fit?" she asked.

"Honestly, it feels a little snug." Kyle admitted honestly.

"Come on, I can measure you in the back." she started to lead Kyle towards the back of the store.

Kyle started to follow as Darla noticed that Kylie was no longer browsing the rack. She started looking around, spotting her friend walking with a saleswoman. Darla ran to catch up.

"Where ya going, Kylie?" Darla asked.

"I'm measuring her." the saleswoman replied.

"Mind if I come with?" Darla asked.

"Not really." Kyle replied.

They walked into the back and the saleswoman grabbed a measuring tape. She stood there for a few moments before Darla tapped Kyle on the shoulder.

"Kylie! You've got to take your shirt off." Darla said.

"Oh!" Kyle quickly grabbed his tank top and took it off.

The saleswoman started to measure and put the tape measure away. Kyle pulled the tank top back on.

"So, it looks like you're an A, but you were right about the snugness because you're just under a B, so if you want extra room, go a size up." the saleswoman said.

"Take the B." Darla said. "Trust me, when you start BC and they grow a bit, you'll want the extra room. I was close like that before I started and I had to go out and buy a bunch of new bras after a few months."

"Thank you." Kyle said to the saleswoman as he and Darla exited the room and returned to the others.

Darla informed them of the new sizing decision and they started to grab several choices for for Kyle to choose from.

"Kylie, do you have any nightgowns?" Melissa asked as she browsed a rack.

"I don't really wear them that much." Kyle replied.

"Well, if we have any sleepovers, it's gonna be mandatory, so you better get one." Melissa said.

The girls collectively handed Kyle a pile of lingerie and sent him off to the changing room once again.

Kyle sighed as they walked to the clothing store. He tried to wander away, but Robin quickly rushed up to him.

"Let's go look at shoes while they pick stuff out." Robin grabbed his hand and pulled him towards the shoe section.

"Don't I have enough shoes already?" Kyle asked.

Soon, Kyle was sitting down on one of the stools as Robin looked around as she checked her phone.

"You'll get the hang of them the more you wear them." Robin said. "And they make your legs look killer! Imagine those with the bustier and hose."

Kyle didn't want to, but he could imagine it and it was not pleasant. After taking a few photos, Robin let him return the heels to the box.

Kyle kept attempting to try on a nice pair of sneakers, or failing that, flats that he figured that Robin would find suitably "cute" but she kept diverting his attention back to her picks. Almost as if she already knew what shoes he was going to need to match with the clothes the other two were picking out.

“We’ve got a dressing room full of things for you to try on, Kylie! C’mon!” Darla said. Kyle’s stomach sank.

Again, he was in a dressing room, and almost everything the girls picked showed off his legs. There were dresses, skirts, short shorts, more skirts, fitted tops, blouses, tank tops, camisoles, and several pairs of yoga pants and cropped exercise tops. They also had pulled some very pink, very feminine sneakers for him. They had included several pairs of jeans, but they were all very tight, very low rise, and nothing that Kyle really wanted to wear. He was going to be trying things on for a while.

As before, Kyle had to model everything. He was changing shoes, trying on different heels with each outfit. The girls made him try on several sizes, critiquing on which looked best on him. Once optimal cuteness of each outfit was established, the girls snapped pictures, and his fashion show was posted online.

They also bombarded him with accessories. Belts, bracelets, rings, earrings. It was decided that he needed to get his ears pierced again, possibly a stud in his nose, and the discussion of a navel piercing was added too.

“Don’t I get any say in this?” Kyle whined.

Robin laughed, “No. you will achieve maximum hotness with us. Now go try on those white shorts!”

“With the slingbacks!” Melissa added.

The girls made Kyle turn over whatever they thought he looked best in, and they slowly started to turn those over to the register, building up things that Kylie was going to get.

When he thought he was finished with the fashion show, he looked around. The tank, jeans, and sneakers he had worn in were nowhere to be seen. There was a small pile of new clothing left, though.

“Uh, where are my clothes?” He asked, sticking his head out of the doorway. Melissa was the only one left.

“Robin has them. We decided that some of the outfits were just too cute on you to not have you wear them. Darla and Robin went to pay. Here,” she handed him some nude heels with a hidden platform. “Go get dressed. We have more stops.”

Sulking, Kyle took the shoes handed to him and went back into the dressing room. They had left him a tan pleated miniskirt and a red knit camisole with matching cardigan.

He slumped down on the bench. He was stuck. It was either wear this stuff or be trapped in the dressing room in his feminine underwear.

Reluctantly, he got dressed. The camisole was stretchy, and it clung to his bra enhanced curves. The cardigan fell open around his chest, making him feel like his boobs were on stage, the sweater forming a curtain on either side of them. The skirt was short, mid thigh, and the sensation on his bare legs was unsettling. He stepped into the heels, wavered for a second, then got his balance.

His earrings were changed, a necklace with a silver tear shaped pendant was placed around his neck. Again, he felt the silver drop, which rested right between his breasts, just drew attention to them.

Kyle took a wavering step, and the girls gave him a crash course in walking in heels that high. His calves were on fire, but he had little choice but to learn how to strut in those heels.

He was pulled to a piercing kisok where his ears were pierced again. Much to his relief, the girls were told if they wanted other piercings, they’d have to visit a more dedicated place, such as a tattoo shop.

With his newly pierced ears, mincing along in his heels, his drawstring bag slung over his shoulder, Kyle now looked like a “cute” teenage girl.

“Anyone hungry? Do we hit the food court, or get Kylie to a makeup counter for supplies?”

A teenage guy, standing over him, a sly smile on his face. “I couldn’t help but notice you, sitting all alone here. I’m Rob. Mind if I have a seat?”

Kyle was taken aback. He panicked, looking around for his friends, not really knowing what to do, other than not wanting any attention from a guy.

“Uh...” Kyle stammered, “My friends will be right back!” He squeaked.

“Then I’ll keep you company until they come back,” Rob said, pulling out a chair and sitting down. “So what’s your name? I don’t think I’ve seen you around here before.”

“Um... Kyle... ee,” said Kyle, desperately looking for the girls to save him. He finally spotted them walking back with some trays of food. They saw him, saw the guy sitting there, and all got big grins. They bumped hips, as their hands were full and slowly, much too slowly for Kyle, started walking over.

“Uh...” Kyle said looking down, not wanting to look at this guy that was obviously hitting on him. “I’m just visiting relatives.”

Rob got it. The hesitant speech. The flirty looks away. She was into him. And he thought she was hot, with legs that went on for miles.

“Well, i’ve lived here all my life, “ Rob said, smiling. “I can show you around.”

“Uh... thanks,” Kyle squeaked, “But I have my friends... and here they are now!” Kyle said, hoping that this idiot would leave him alone now.

“So who’s your friend, Kylie?” Darla said with a big grin.

“Um... Rob? Rob, this is Darla, Melissa, and Robin,” Kyle said, barely raising his eyes as they say the food on the table and seated themselves.

“Ladies,” Rob said, “It’s a pleasure to meet you all. Kylie here was just telling me how she’s just visiting.”

“Oh, she’ll be here all summer!” Melissa said. Kyle shot her a look.

“And she’s not seeing anyone!” Robin said.

Kyle wanted to die.

“Weren’t we going to get me a makeover?” He asked, trying to plead with them to get him out of there.

“Oh, we get it,” Melissa said with a wink, “You want to look your best for Rob!”

Kyle ground his teeth. He wasn’t going to get out of this anytime soon.

Rob stood, “Look, I’ll leave you guys to your lunch, but before I go, I need to get your number Kylie.”

Kyle’s head shot up, as he stared wide-eyed at Rob. “What?” He squeaked.

“She’s shy,” Darla said, playfully shoving Kyle’s shoulder. “Here’s her number, and here’s her instagram...” she grabbed a napkin and a pen out of her purse and scribbled the info down on a napkin.

Rob stood and took Kyle’s hand, gently kissing it. “I’ll let you ladies eat and get Kylie her makeover. But I think you’re gorgeous already, Kylie.” Rob said. He turned and started to leave.

He spun on his heel after taking a step and came back to the table. “Oh, I have a friend,” he said, smiling, “He’s throwing a killer party this weekend. His parent’s are out of town. You four lovelies are definitely invited!”

“We’ll be there!” Darla said, smiling brightly at Rob.

“I’ll call you later, Kylie, with the party details!” Rob said as he walked off.

Kyle slumped in his chair. “Girl he was cute!” Robin said.

“And he is so into you!” Melissa said.

“But I’m...” Kyle started to say.

“Ok girls, party invites. It’s now super important that we get Kylie ready. I want us to just blow away the other girls at that party!” Robin said.

“Yep. Eat up!” Darla said. “We need to get Kylie her makeover now!”

Kyle pushed around the pasta, not really feeling much like eating anymore.

When she was done, she turned Kyle towards the mirror.

"What do you think, Kylie?" she asked.

Kyle's mouth dropped open when he saw what he looked like. The smokey eyes, defined face, and kissable lips... he was a knockout!

"O...M...G!" Melissa exclaimed.

Kyle turned around to see the girls in a similar state of shock at his new look. Though their shock immediately gave way to excitement.

"You look great!" Darla exclaimed. "I love it!"

"Betcha can't wait to send a selfie to Rob..." Robin sang.

The girls quickly started snapping photos as Kyle's stomach turned.

Once they were done, and Kyle was able to get down from the chair, the girls paid for the makeover and thanked the employee, (making sure to get Kylie a bag filled with the same makeup so he could replicate the look on her own) before heading out of the store. As they walk through the mall...

Notification from MARCI
Location mapped to CVS. Pharmacy account updated.

Kyle sighed. Sam HAD to get this fixed and soon. He grabbed the beach towel and walked over to the door. He grumpily opened it to find...

Sam's eyes widened and he tried to stifle a laugh as Kyle walked out of the room and into the hallway.

"Wow..." Sam muttered. "You look..."

"Save it." Kyle cut him off. "Did you figure out how to reverse all this?"

"Well..." Sam started. "Not really. MARCI is really well protected and there's no easy way in without being the sysadmin. She might lock us out of the entire system if we mess with anything. Or worse, she might do something to us. Something worse than how you are! And the computer doesn't seem dumb enough for us to be able to trick it with a recording or anything like that. Though, there might be some old recordings of Amy we can use to try to reset MARCI if we string enough words together... Otherwise we'd have to wait until they get back from the cruise, which won't be for a while, and hope that Amy is more reasonable than Mark. I'm really sorry."

"This is just perfect..." Kyle tossed his towel to the floor. "These girls are relentless. The shopping, the trying on, did you know they got me a prescription for birth control? And there was this guy at the mall who wouldn't leave me alone and invited us to a party..."

"You're not going, right?" Sam asked.

"They won't let me sit it out! They think I'm, I dunno, ashamed of my body or something! Did you at least figure out a way to cover up at the gym?" Kyle replied.

"Not yet, I spent the whole time you were out figuring out what I couldn't do." Sam said.

"Just great... I'm supposed to spend the entire summer dressed like a girl, taking birth control and dating guys, and we can't fix it because the sysadmin isn't around and Uncle Mark is unreasonably tolerant..." Kyle said. "This sucks."

Kyle's phone started to buzz and chime like crazy. He picked it up and sighed.

"I've gotta go." Kyle whined.

"Good luck, sis." Sam joked.

"Bite me." Kyle spat.

Sam shrugged as Kyle walked out the front door.

The door closed behind Kyle, and he realized two things: he was still in heels and he had left his towel behind. Going back up to MARCI’s manhandling (womanhandling?) was not something he wanted to do right then. So he slipped off the heels, picked them up, and started to walk through the grass to Melissa’s. He looked at his phone to see what all the ruckus was.

Texts from the girls. Darla was running a little late. Can’t wait to see Kylie’s new bikini. And a text from Rob.

Kyle ignored that and walked on, looking for settings to stop MARCI from eavesdropping on his conversations. He reached the door to Melissa’s and stood there, lost in the depth of the phone’s settings

The door opened and Theresa greeted him with some air kisses, “My Kylie! Don’t you look amazing! Come in, come in!” And she ushered him into the house. Sighing, Kyle gave up on finding the settings for now.

“You didn’t bring a towel?” Theresa asked. “I’ll get you one. The girls are out back.”

Kyle was ushered out to the patio where Melissa and Robin were, lying on the grass, jabbering excitedly. Kyle gave a weak smile and waved at them.

“You look great!” Robin said, running over and hugging Kyle. That was the one thing Kyle liked about this current predicament, being hugged by hot girls in bikinis. Melissa also gave him a hug. Kyle both cursed and was thankful for the adhesive MARCI had used on his crotch.

“Let’s see the bikini in its glory!” Robin said.

Kyle shrugged and, slumping, kinda stomped in a circle.

“Not like that!” Robin said, “Here. Like this!”

She came over to stand next to him and executed a graceful twirl.

“Just try it. Please?” Robin begged.

Kyle tried a graceful twirl. It was no where close to what Robin had done.

“Better, but more like this.” Robin twirled again.

Kyle twirled and actually wasn’t that bad. Halfway through his spin he heard the dreaded shutter sound and Melissa had taken a picture. After some quick thumb typing, she handed her phone to Kyle.

It was an action shot, Kylie was smiling, her arms held in a graceful ex, her hair extended, her cleavage on display, clearly a girl having fun.

Kyle sank. “Do you guys have to post so many pictures?” He whined.

“Yes. Next question?” Robin asked, laughing.

The “girls” rubbed sunscreen on, with Kyle enjoying (and cursing the adhesive) rubbing their backs and having his rubbed.

They laid on their stomachs, phones at the ready, and proceeded to chat about clothes, celebrities, and boys.

Kyle tuned most of it out and being somewhat bored, fell asleep.

His nap was interrupted by loud laughing. He groggily got up to see that Darla had arrived and was standing by his feet with Robin and Melissa. They were all laughing and thumb typing. It took Kyle a second to register that they had his phone.
