He knew he didn't have a lot of time and stopped to catch his breath. Maybe the big guy didn't even see him run into the fitting room!

"Sir! You can't go in there!" a woman shouted from outside the dressing room.

"Outta my way! There's a dude in there!" the big guy shouted at the woman. "Just let me go in so we can finish our business outside of your store!"

"Oh no!" Andrew whined. "What am I going to..."

Andrew noticed a pile of clothing just sitting on the bench, likely discarded by the last woman to use the dressing room. He looked up and down for a vent before he started digging through the pile of clothes.

From outside, Andrew could hear curtains being pulled open as the brute got closer and closer to his booth. He didn't have much time. Andrew quickly pulled his shirt off and hid it underneath the pile of women's clothes. He pulled a light blue bra from the pile. It appeared to be padded, which was another fortunate development for Andrew. He undid his ponytail and let his long hair flow, and he mussed his hair up slightly to give it the appearance of being styled. He slid his arms into the straps of the bra and kept himself turned towards the mirror.

"I have you now!" the big guy shouted, yanking aside the curtain.

Andrew let out a high pitched scream as he feigned covering up his body and face. The big guy's eyes widened and he immediately jumped back. He started to stammer a reply:

"I'm... I... uh..." the big guy stammered.

He immediately left the room, with the attendant rushing into the fitting room after he left.

"I am so sorry about that, Miss. He pushed his way through and I had no way of stopping him." the attendant said. "Allow me to offer you something for all the trouble."

"Oh, it's quite all right." Andrew said, hoping the woman would leave so he could change back and get back to Brian.

"No, no, no, I insist. It's store policy." the attendant said.

"Well, okay then." Andrew replied.

"I'd like to offer you..." the attendant started.
155332231131.title: He dashes into a woman's clothing store

1553322311312.content:
"I'd like to offer you..." the attendant started. "A free makeover! I know the girl at the salon next door, and we sometimes do cross-promotions with offering makeovers. And considering what just happened, I think that's fitting compensation."

"I'm fine, really. I'd really just like to leave now." Andrew replied.

"Like I said, store policy." the attendant stated. "What's your name?"

"My name? Oh... my name is... Andre-a. Andrea." Andrew replied.

"Such a pretty name. I'm Kristi," Kristi stuck out her hand, which Andrew hesitantly shook in return. "Get dressed and we'll talk outside the changing room, kay?"

"Got it..." Andrew sighed as Kristi exited the changing room.

Andrew knew he couldn't just put his own shirt back on, so he dug through the clothing sitting on the bench, finding a relatively subdued blouse, which he put over his newly acquired bra. Thankfully, he still had his own pants and shoes, and he'd have to go buy a new shirt somewhere else once he escaped, but at least he was safe for now.

Andrew exited the changing room and ran back into Kristi who was waiting for him.

"Okay, so we can do this one of two ways, either you pick out your outfit and then go to the salon, or you do the salon first and then pick out an outfit. What do you wanna do?" Kristi asked.

"Uh..." Andrew started.
1553322311312.title: A free makeover

15533223113121.content:
There was NO way that Andrew was going near that salon, he had to escape before it came to that. But how? As he thought it over, he turned to Kristi.

"I'd like to pick the outfit first." Andrew said.

"All right, just let me know when you're done and I'll take the security tags off and bring you over to the salon." Kristi said.

"Sounds great." Andrew weakly smiled as he walked down an aisle.

He looked around for a bit, as Kristi kept a close eye on him and he was never entirely out of her sight. He poked and prodded, but never picked anything up.

He could sense that Kristi was starting to get confused by his actions, so he idly picked up a casual-looking powder blue dress with a fitted skirt and started looking over it, as Kristi observed. She seemed satisfied and eventually, Kristi was called away by another customer. Andrew saw his chance.

Andrew placed the dress down onto a display table and started to sprint towards the entrance of the store, only to be met by another young woman who he nearly ran into. Andrew started to apologize and start to walk away when Kristi caught up with him.

"Andrea!" Kristi exclaimed. "Where are you going?"

"Oh uh... something came up. I have to meet with my friend, Brian, so I can't stay." Andrew attempted to explain.

"Well, if you're meeting your boyfriend, then the makeover is just what you need." Kristi said.

"No, I didn't say that, he's not my..." Andrew started.

But he was cut off as Kristi dragged him into the salon next door, Beauty Mark. The salon was fairly empty, with one woman getting her hair done and several employees around the place, all women. Andrew froze as he figured that one of them would see through his not at all convincing disguise like Kristi had.

"Hey girls, this is Andrea. She's here for a makeover, on me. Give her the works." Kristi said, before turning to Andrew. "I'll finish putting together your outfit and meet you here when you're done, kay?"

"Wait, I..." Andrew started, but stopped. He turned towards the inside of the salon.

"Come on, honey, let's get to work." the woman standing near the empty salon chair said.

Andrew sighed and:
15533223113121.title: Clothes shopping first

155332231131212.content:
...turned to leave. He just needed to get out of this place.

He felt the woman’s hand grasp his wrist, spinning him around. She was a cute, peroxide blonde, complete with beauty mark, chewing gum. She had a definite sexy 50’s vibe about her.

She held his hand up and inspected it. “Oh, honey, these nails are horrible. Let me guess, you bite your fingernails? Don’t worry, we have just the thing. Here, have a seat and we’ll get started.”

“But..” Andrew started to say. But the blonde spun his wrist, depositing him into the salon chair. He went to stand up, but a hot pink cape was immediately flared over him and rapidly fastened around his neck. He again attempted to stand up, but the back of the chair was dropped, and his head was deposited into a sink. The beautician began spraying his hair with warm water from a hose.

She began washing his hair with floral scented shampoo. “Barbie?” The blonde called out. “We’re going to need some silk wraps on this one!”

She gazed down upon Andrew, massaging his scalp as she washed his hair. “Oh, honey, those brows... not to worry. You’re in good hands. I’m Donna, and we’re going to get you gorgeous!”

“Look, I...” Andrew started to say again, attempting to get out of the salon.

“Let me guess,” Donna said, “big date? That explains the new outfit and Kristi giving you the works,” Donna said, now rinsing his hair.

“I should...” Andrew tried again, as Donna wrapped a towel around his hair and sat him back up.

Donna cut him off again. “Smile for me, honey,” She said, giving him a scrutinizing look.

Sighing, Andrew gave him a big toothy grin. “I thought so. You drink coffee, don’t you? Your teeth are stained.

“Leslie! Bring the teeth whitening tray!” Donna called out.

“Look, if you could...” Andrew tried again.

Donna dropped a fashion magazine into his lap. “See if there’s a hair style in there that you like, Andrea. Although....” she grabbed his cheeks in a vice like grip and turned his head side to side, “if you’d like, I know exactly what would look hot on you!”

Donna pushed his head down and began vigorously drying his hair. He couldn’t get a word out. When she finally whipped the towel off, another woman was standing in front of him with a foam filled tray. She pinched his jaw open and popped the tray into his mouth.

“I’m Leslie,” the new woman said. “Try not to talk with that in. It’’ll burn a bit if you swallow any. Just trust Donna. She’s great!”

Andrew’s eyes went wide. He glanced worriedly up at Donna. She pushed his head down and began combing his hair out. “Ugh. The split ends. Don’t worry. We can fix that! So, did you find anything cute in the magazine?”

The magazine was unopened, still on Andrew’s lap. He slowly shook his head, feeling an impending doom descending upon him.

“That’s OK. I know just what to give you!” Donna said cheerfully. “So... been dating this guy long? Or... oh! Salon trip! New outfit! First date!” Donna said excitedly.

She began taking sections of his hair, combing them, and then, while holding them between two fingers, cutting off the ends.

A woman wheeled up a cart and took hold of Andrew’s right hand, placing it in a vat of warm wax. “Paraffin soak, honey,” the woman said. He guessed it was Barbie. “It’ll make your hands soft and smooth.”

She wheeled over to his other hand and placed it in another vat of warm wax.

“She’s got a first date with a new guy!” Donna said, snipping away at Andrew’s hair.

“Oh?” Barbie asked, looking up at Andrew. “Is he cute?”

Andrew sighed. He was in an insane asylum. Barbie took the sigh as a yes. “We’ll make him adore you!”

Barbie removed his hands from the wax and it rapidly cooled and hardened. She pulled it off easily, and began working on his cuticles. She also slid something under each nail.

At this point, Donna combed Andrew’s hair down over his face, obscuring his view. He could feel her combing and cutting, while something with an acrid solvent smell was being applied to his nails.

“Don’t move, honey,” Donna said.

To his horror, Andrew saw the scissors come in from his left and snip a clean, straight line across his forehead. He had bangs! And he could see Barbie finishing up painting a long nail onto little shelves she had slid under his real nails, and putting a carefully cut piece of fabric onto the nail. She took his hand and placed his fingertips into a small box. A blue light glowed inside the opening and he heard a small fan in the box whir. “Silk wraps,” Barbie said, winking at him. “They’re super durable. You won’t be able to bite them off once they harden under the light!”

Barbie moved to his other hand and began repeating the process of extending and hardening his nails. . Donna, meanwhile, had started taking a straight razor to his hair, shaving the ends off of it, giving him layers.

Donna leaned over from behind him, and asked softly in his ear, “So, do you want a nice deep auburn, something sexy and redhead? Or maybe a sexy blonde bedhead?

She laughed. “Sorry! Forgot about the teeth whitening. Blink once for auburn and twice for blonde!”
155332231131212.title: Tries to leave again

1553322311312121.content:
Andrew didn't want his hair colored at all! He tried to keep his eyes wide open and shake his head, but something flew into his eye and he quickly blinked to get it out, hoping that Donna would miss it.

She didn't.

"Ooh, that's exactly what I was thinking." Donna smiled and started to get to work.

"Mmph!" Andrew tried to mumble a reply, but the whitener was still in his mouth.

Andrew felt Donna painting goop into his hair as Barbie finished up putting his left hand under the light. The smells were almost overpowering. Andrew was helpless as Donna started applying foil to his hair. Andrew wanted the earth to open up and swallow him to save him from this hell.

"How was this even happening?" Andrew asked himself.

Andrew tried to angle his head to get a look at his hands, but they were being expertly obscured by the bustle of the three salon girls, no doubt trying to preserve the surprise for the unveiling at the end. Ironically, at this point, he was sort of wishing he was back at the clothing store with Kristi.

"Okay, your nails are just about done, and we need to let the dye set so now it's time for..." Barbie started.
1553322311312121.title: Andrew accidentally chooses auburn

choices: The women strike up a one sided conversation, asking if she has a boyfriend
The women convince the beauticians that Andrea needs some other treatments
15533223113121212.content:
“...those unsightly brows. You really should neaten them up more often!” Barbie said. “Leslie, can you handle the pedi?”

“Of course!” Leslie said cheerfully. Andrew felt his shoes begin removed and his feet were plunged into a warm bath of scented water.

Meanwhile, Barbie came at him with a loop of string, crossed over in a figure eight. “Threading is so much neater than anything else,” she said she leaned over, giving Andrew a closeup of her chest as she began rapidly whisking the string close to and then away from his face. With each motion, he could feel a sharp pinch as his eyebrows were slowly plucked away.

He was flinching with each pluck. Barbie chiluckled, “Beauty is pain, honey. But you’ll look great when we finish.”

She stopped and took a step back. She reached over to a cart and got a pencil and he felt her drawing some lines on his brows. “Now that we’ve got the heavy work done,” Barbie said, “we need to make sure we have the shape right.”

Meanwhile, Leslie had removed his feet from the bath, dried them, and was removing any rough spots with a file. She then applied a sweet smelling lotion. She rapidly shaped his toenails and dealt with the cuticles. Andrew didn’t think that felt too bad ,until he felt a foam object being wedged between each toe. He smelled a new smell and cold feel a cold liquid being applied to his toenails. They were painting his toes!

He “mmphed” in displeasure as the torments continued. Barbie was threading his brows, taking a step back every so often to make sure things were neat and even. Eventually, she took a small razor on a handle and made very precise angles on his brows. She then painted some of the hoop that Donna had used on his hair on his brows.

He could feel the foul packets on his head warming up. Donna moved to the front now and took his left hand, shaping his new nails and applying polish to them as well. His fingertips were again shoved into a box, and warm air blew over them, rapidly drying his new nail color.

He then felt Leslie push his pant leg up. “Girls, she has a little hair. What do you think? Waxing?”

“Sure!” Donna said, emphatically. Andrew shook his head, but the beauticians ignored him. “We’ll get to that later though. Donna moved back behind him and peeled open a foil packet. “I think she’s just about ready with the color.”

Andrew’s head was again dropped into the sink. Donna rapidly removed the foil packets and began rinsing his hair. He could smell ammonia as she did. He just hoped all of this could be undone. He’d have to get a buzz cut, maybe shave off his brows entirely. She wiped off his brows with a wet cloth, and sat him back up.

Mmphing his displeasure, Donna began putting curlers in his hair. “When you come back next time, we’ll see about some extensions,” Donna said. “But for now, let’s give your hair a bit more body, something that says, ‘Sex Kitten,’ for your date!”

Andrew tried to shake his head “no,” but Donna had a lock of his hair pulled tightly as she wound a large curled up, preventing him from moving his head much at all.

His head was slowly covered by tightly rolled curlers. Barbie announced that his nails were dry and started to clean up the mani/pedi equipment. Andrew fanned his fingers out at stared at his now feminine hand. Long oval fingernails extended from his fingers, each a deep pink color. They looked like a woman’s hand!

Donna meanwhile finished with setting his hair. The curlers were tight and uncomfortable.
“C’mon, let’s get you dry!”

Andrew wasn’t sure where his shoes and socks were. Leslie slipped some sort of disposable flip flop on his feet. The foam wedges between his toes remained made walking awkward. Getting out of here now was going to be impossible!

Barbie took him by the hand, and he waddled as she led him over to a bank of hairdryers. She sat him between two older women, put the dryer down over his curler filled head, and handed him a copy of Cosmopolitan.

“Enjoy yourself, Andrea!” Barbie said. “We’ll check back on you in a few!”

Andrew groaned as the dryer was turned on and warm air blew over his head. He could feel the hair tightening uncomfortably as it dried

“We’ll hello, Andrea!” one of the women said to him.
15533223113121212.title: "Your eyebrows."

155332231131212121.content:
Andrew's eye darted around, trying to locate his sneakers, to no avail. He sighed and relaxed his shoulders, sinking into the chair. He wasn't going anywhere.

"Andrea, are you okay?" the woman to his left asked.

"Oh, Gladys, she can't answer you, she has a teeth whitener in her mouth." the women to his right responded. "I'm Blanche, by the way."

"Mmph!" Andrew replied, hoping that would shut the two up.

"What's the occasion?" Gladys asked. "We come here every week. Have to retouch our color, you know."

Andrew silently whined as the women kept talking.

"You look just about my grandson's age. He just graduated college, you know. Doesn't really know what he wants to do, but he's still got time for his grandmother. Always meets his friends here, so he can drive me and Blanche to the salon." Gladys said.

Andrew nervously smiled

"Oh hush, all you do is try to set him up while you're here." Blanche said. "Don't mind her, she just can't help playing matchmaker."

Andrew decided to turn his attention to the magazine, and started flipping through the pages. Unfortunately, every page just reminded him of what situation he was stuck inside of.

"So?" Gladys asked. "Do you have a boyfriend?"

Andrew quickly shook his head no, before mentally smacking himself for telling the woman that he was single.

"My grandson, you'll like him, trust me. He's picking me up soon, so I'll make sure to introduce you." Gladys assured Andrew, patting his left hand. "That's a lovely color on you."

Thankfully, Gladys and Blanche finished in the dryer much earlier than you, so you were soon left alone as they continued onto their next treatment. Eventually, Barbie returned and lifted dryer, checking Andrew's hair.

"All done!" Barbie helped Andrew to his feet and started to lead him across the room.

Andrew spotted an empty chair by a mirror, and also a back room door left slightly ajar. Barbie started to lead him closer to one of the two.

"Now it's time for..." Barbie started.
155332231131212121.title: The women strike up a one sided conversation, a...

choices: Donna brushes out Andrea’s new hairstyle
1553322311312121212.content:
“... well, we noticed giving you your pedi that... well...”Barbie seemed to be searching for the right words. “Your legs... and we’re assuming other places... they’re a little... unkempt?” She smiles softly. “Let’s take care of that now. But first...”

Andrew wasn’t really listening. The curlers on his head were wound tight, and he was preoccupied by the pain in his scalp.

She led him over to a sink, put on some gloves, and popped the tray out of his mouth. popped the tray out of his mouth. She handed him a glass of water. “Rinse,” she told him.

He rinsed his mouth out several times and spit into the sink. He finally got a look at himself in the mirror. His face was rather feminine looking, especially with his thin angled brows. His hair, wound tightly around the curlers, was a sexy auburn. What was left of his brows matched his hair. He raised a hand to his face in shock and saw, essentially, a woman without makeup on. He showed his teeth and they were dazzling white. At least he had that.

“Don’t worry, Andrea, there’s still some work left to do,” Barbie said, misreading his shocked face.

“What the hell have you crazy bitches done to me!” He said. Or tried to. All that came out was a wheeze.

Barbie frowned. “Looks like someone swallowed some of the teeth whitener. Don’t worry, your voice will be back, probably tomorrow.”

Andrew made a motion of writing with his hands. He’d tell these women what they could do with themselves!

Again, Barbie misread him. “Oh, the bill? Don’t worry. Kristi is taking care of all of this! Now let’s go. We haven’t got all day, just most of it.” She laughed and ushered Andrew into the half open doorway. She removed his pink cape.

“There’s a robe and panties in there. Change into them and come out. You can take the spreaders out of your toes, too.”

She escorted Andrew through the door and closed it behind him. He looked around. Could he escape? The room was windowless. All that was in it was a light fixture, a bench, a mirror, and a couple of hooks. It didn’t even have a drop ceiling that he could maybe escape through.

He sat on the bench and stared at his pedicured toes, pulling the foam spreaders out and wiggling them. They looked so... feminine.

He looked at the hook on the back of the door and there was a pink nylon robe, and in cellophane, sitting on the bench, were apparently the panties he was supposed to wear. He opened the package and looked at them. They were essentially made of paper. Disposable, he figured.

There was a knock. “Are you ready yet?” Barbie said as she poked her head through the doorway. She frowned. “Andrea! Please get changed!” She closed the door again.

Not really sure what would happen if he didn’t change, but knowing that if he just rode this nightmare out, he’d soon be free of this madhouse, Andrew stripped, leaving his padded bra on. He pulled the panties up into place and thought that they itched. He slipped on the nylon robe. It was short. Shorter than he ever thought he would wear.

At that point, Barbie knocked on the door, saying, “Knock knock!” And opened the door, peeking inside.

“Great! Let’s go!” She said, once again, grabbing Andrew’s feminine hand and pulling him to a new section of the salon.

There was a padded table with a sheet of paper on it, and a pillow. She patted it with her hand and Andrew sat gingerly on it, not really knowing what to do about the shortness of the robe, so he crossed his legs in a rather feminine fashion.

“Ok, Andrea, lie back,” Barbie said as she gently guided him into position. She then got a pot of black syrupy liquid and began smoothing it onto his face with a spatula.

“Charcoal mask,” she said. “It’ll help clear out all those nasty little pores. It’ll harden up and we’ll peel it off. In the meantime...” She put a cucumber slice over each of his eyes.

Resting with his curler covered head on the pillow wasn’t uncomfortable, but he focused on the tightening of the mask she had applied. He crossed his hands on his stomach and just tried to relax.

Barbie rapped his foot. “Could you spread your legs a little, please?”

Without thinking, Andrew did just that. He was left to his thoughts for a few minutes, as Barbie was bustling around doing something. He felt her spreading something warm on his shin, then pressing something into what had been applied. With a sudden “rip” Andrew had a large swath of hair removed from his leg. He bolted upright, slightly.

“I know, honey,” Barbie said, rubbing she’d taken the hair off, which helped. “But if you did this on a regular basis, it eouldn’t be so bad. Try to sit still. Breathe for me. “

Andrew wanted out if this place. He endured her waxing his entire legs. She had him flip over onto his stomach as she did the back of them.

She had him take an arm at a time out of his robe as she waxed his arms and armpits. After each wa s finished, Barbie rubbed some floral scented lotion into his skin, and that helped a lot with the pain.

Barbie glanced at her phone. “Shoot. We don’t have time to give you a bikini wax. I’ll get you a voucher for that for your next visit!”

Andrew was positive there wasn’t going to be a next visit.

She led him back to the area with the dressing room and Andrew started to walk towards it.

“Not just yet, Missy!” Barbie said with a laugh. There are a few things left. And the mask isn’t quite ready to come off yet.”
1553322311312121212.title: Waxing

15533223113121212121.content:
Barbie dragged Andrew back over to the chair by the mirror and Donna returned, smiling upon seeing what had become of her project.

"Now, don't you look sexy?" Donna asked. "Your boyfriend's a lucky man."

If Andrew was able to move his face, he'd probably have pouted, but the mask had hardened so much that he was stuck making a neutral expression.

"Let's see how you turned out." Donna said as she started to undo the rollers.

She started slowly, pulling each one out carefully and letting the hair rest. A lock of auburn hair fell over Andrew's eyes.

Once she was finished unrolling them, she pulled out a brush and started brushing the hair back towards her. Eventually, she stopped for a moment to take stock of what she had done. Andrew gazed into the mirror, seeing a sexy redhead staring back at him.

"Almost... But I'm a perfectionist." Donna put a few drops of liquid into her hands and started playing with the hair, giving it more volume and leaving Andrew with expertly messy hair that screamed "Sex Kitten".

Donna seemed satisfied and started to spray hairspray onto the hair.

"And... voilà!" Donna exclaimed.

"Amazing work!" Barbie shouted from across the salon.

"O. M. G." Kristi exclaimed as she walked back into the salon, the tapping of her heels reverberating across the floor. "I nearly dropped the bag, you look so gorgeous!"

"And we haven't even touched her makeup yet. Though I have to admit, the mask is rather fetching." Barbie giggled.

"Andrea, here's your outfit. I noticed a few things you had your eye on and threw in a dash of my personal picks, I hope you won't mind." Kristi said, handing the bag off to Donna.

You tried to shout back at her, but again, all you got was a wheeze.

"Swallowed the whitener? Happens to the best of us, girl." Kristi sighed. "Make sure to come see me before you leave, but I have to get back to the store. Can't wait to see the final product."

"Neither can we." Donna laughed.

Kristi left, her clicking getting more and more faint as she returned to the store, Barbie rushed back over and started to peel off the mask. Once it was pulled off, she started to scrub the remainder off of Andrew's face with a warm cloth.

"Perfect! Your skin is positively glowing!" Barbie said. "And now it's time to..."
15533223113121212121.title: Donna brushes out Andrea’s new hairstyle

choices: Andrew’s old clothes are gone, leaving him with what Kristi selected.
Andrew puts his old clothes back on, ignoring what Kristi selected.
155332231131212121211.content:
“...get your makeup on!”

Andrew scowled.

“Oh, come on,” Donna said with a smile. We’re in the home stretch! You’ve been a great client and we do hope you come back to see us. If you’d like, you can make your next appointment in your way out.”

Barbie smiled at Andrew and said, “I put the voucher for the bikini wax in the dressing room with your clothes. Now let’s get you ready!”

Sulking, but knowing at this point he was almost out of this madhouse, he let Barbie lead him over to get another salon chair. Still in his short robe, he sat down and crossed his legs. Barbie put another pink cape around his neck as he squirmed a little. She turned the chair away from the mirror so Andrew could no longer see himself.

“Now hold still and do as I tell you,”. Barbie said.

She started with some concealer, dabbing it on all over his “problem areas” and then blending it in. She brushed some loose powder over his face, then started covering his face with foundation. Next, she “contoured” his face. Barbie seed intent on describing and teaching Andrew about how she was doing his makeup. He didn’t care.

“Look up, Andrea,” and she began lining his eyes. He tried not to blink as Barbie smeared the liner to give him a smoky eye look.

Eyeshadow was next, with lots of blending. Andrew wasn’t sure how many colors she used. Barbie kept taking a few steps back, looking thoughtfully at him, and then turning his face side to side before brushing more eyeshadow on.

She then glued false lashes on him. That was annoying to Andrew. What was worse was her applying several coats of mascara and then coming at him with a lash curler. It seemed like he had eyelashes that went on for miles, always in his vision. He found it unsettling.

Blush was next, as Barbie made him suck in his cheeks. She blended it for what seemed like ages.

She lined his lips, then stained them. “It’s kissproof, so don’t worry about your date,” she said with a grin. She smeared some lipgloss on next, and he felt it tingle. He raised a manicured hand to his mouth, burn barbie swatted it away.

“Lip plumping gloss,” she explained. “Don’t worry, the tingles will go away shortly.”

Barbie stepped behind him and was rummaging in the drawers of the station he sat at. Andrew craned his neck to see what she was up to. “No peeking!” Barbie scolded, grabbing his face and making him look away.

“A few final touches,” Barbie said from behind. Andrew coughed a little as he was sprayed with some musky perfume. “To drive the guys crazy,” she explained.

“Now hold still,” Barbie said. Andrew felt her wipe something cold on his earlobe and before he knew it, there was a “pop” and a pinch on his earlobe. This was followed in rapid succession by two more. He cringed. She was piercing his ears. Several times.

She moved to his other ear and repeated the process.

She then came around the chair, and leaned in close, again giving Andrew a nice view of her chest. “Now, time for the unveiling...”

Barbie sounds the chair around and Andrew, if he had been able to talk, would have been speechless. His reflection was that of a sexy redhead, her hair flowing gently around her shoulders. Her open mouth showed surprise. She raised a hand to touch her cheek, mirroring what Andrew did. Surely that woman wasn’t him? He stood and peered closer into the mirror.

“C’mon, Andrea,” Barbie said with a grin. “Just think how your date is going to react if you’re that in love with your new look. Let’s go see what Kristi left for you.” She removed the cape, leaving Andrew in his short nylon robe. There was nothing about the reflection that said “guy” at all.

Andrew found it difficult to look away from the mirror as Barbie led him back to the changing room.

“You can just leave the robe on the hook,” Barbie said, guiding him in and closing the door behind him.
155332231131212121211.title: "Do your makeup!"

choices: Gladys stops him on the way out
Andrew runs into Brian as he exits the salon
1553322311312121212111.content:
Andrew went over to the bench and moved the bag to the side, looking for his jeans and underwear, which were nowhere to be found. He started to panic, searching the entire room, and finding nothing.

With no other options, Andrew looked into the shopping bag. On top was a soft pink patent leather purse, with a note clipped to it. Andrew took the note into his manicured hands and unfolded it. It read:

"Hey Andrea,

Wanted to make sure that you didn't get cold feet and put on your new outfit. You can pick up your old stuff after your date. Don't worry about your phone, wallet or keys, we moved them all to the purse, plus we added some samples that we think you might like.

- Leslie"

"Great, just great." Andrew thought, opening the purse to confirm that his stuff was in it, and finding various cosmetics strewn around the bag, along with the voucher for the bikini wax. "I hope they didn't look through my wallet..."

Going further into the shopping bag, Andrew pulled out a dress, nearly identical to the one that he had been holding onto in the store earlier, but instead colored pink, no doubt to match his nails. Unsurprisingly, there was also a shoebox, which contained a pair of peep-toe platform slingback heels, the same shade of pink as the dress. Underneath that was also a lingerie set, similar to the padded bra that Andrew was currently wearing, but also in pink. Evidently, all these maniacs think that's his color.

Barbie suddenly poked her head into the room.

"Hurry up! We need the room for other customers!" Barbie shouted before closing the door.

Andrew had little choice and hung the robe onto the hook and kicked off the flip-flops. There was no way he was getting out of here without putting the outfit on. What's another set of bra and panties after the makeover, right?

It took some doing, but Andrew was soon standing in front of the mirror, teetering in the unfamiliar heels as he made a sickened face. How could this have happened? He slung the purse over his shoulder and sighed. There was another knock on the door and Barbie poked her head into the room again.

"Andrea, are you..." Barbie trailed off as she took in the sight. "O! M! G!"

Barbie quickly grabbed Andrew's arm and dragged him out into the main area of the salon.

"You look gorgeous!" Donna exclaimed.

"Ooh! I need to get a picture of this for our website!" Barbie shouted, quickly snapping a few shots with her phone.

"You're gonna knock your boyfriend dead, girl!" Leslie encouraged.

Andrew nervously smiled and started to walk towards the exit when...
1553322311312121212111.title: Andrew’s old clothes are gone, leaving him wi...

choices: Andrew sees Brian in the food court
15533223113121212121111.content:
"Oh, Andrea!" Gladys shouted from across the salon.

Gladys and Blanche were sitting on a bench, finished with their visit. Andrew hesitantly waved and started to walk away, bumping into a very broad, and very familiar chest. Andrew looked up and saw the face of the man who had chased Andrew through the mall only an hour or so earlier. If he could speak, he'd have screamed, but instead, all that came out was a quiet "Eep!"

However, unlike the last time, the large man wasn't angry, he was instead... apologetic?

"I'm so sorry, miss. I guess I wasn't watching where I was going." he apologized, clearly not recognizing you, the you from the fountain or the you from the dressing room.

Gladys rushed up behind you and smiled at the man.

"Andrea, this is my grandson Axel, I was telling you about!" Gladys exclaimed as Blanche rolled her eyes.

"Grandma, not again." Axel sighed, turning to Andrew. "She does this all the time. I'm sorry about that."

Andrew started quickly looking for an escape route, but found none available.

"Oh, don't apologize, trust me." Gladys said. "Now, me and Blanche want to go do some shopping, so why don't you two get to know each other while you wait?"

"Grandma, you can't be..." Axel started, but gave up as Gladys and Blanche started walking out of the salon.

"I'll meet you in the food court in an hour or so!" Gladys shouted.

Axel sighed and waved his grandmother off, before turning back to Andrew, who was starting to walk away.

"Hey, this is going to sound bad but, I know you just had to sit for a while listening to her go on, and... can I buy you a coffee or something to make up for it?" Axel asked.

Andrew tried to speak, but his voice still hadn't returned to full strength, so what came out was a hoarse whisper.

"Sounds like you need something to drink. Please, allow me, in return for humoring Grandma for so long." Axel said.

Andrew, not wanting to set any alarm bells off in Axel's head, and unsure of where to even go dressed like this, weakly resigned himself and followed Axel towards the food court.
15533223113121212121111.title: Gladys stops him on the way out

choices: Andrew's voice starts to return (but higher)
155332231131212121211111.content:
Thankfully, Axel didn't suspect a thing as he walked with Andrew towards the food court. Andrew stumbled a few times, but with Axel's help, he managed to make it to a table.

"I'll go get you a tea, all right?" Axel asked.

Andrew weakly nodded and Axel walked towards the coffee stand. While he was gone, Andrew coughed several times, trying to get his voice to return, but to no avail.

Andrew suddenly remembered his phone and quickly opened the purse, pulling his phone out. Unfortunately, he was unable to input the correct password with his newly lengthened nails and temporarily locked it.

Dejected, Andrew put the phone back in his purse just as Axel arrived with two coffee cups, one with a string hanging from the lid, which he placed in front of Andrew. Axel sat down across from Andrew and started drinking.

"Again, I'm really sorry about Grandma. She's got it in her head that she has to find me a girlfriend, it's embarrassing." Axel said.

Andrew took a sip from his cup as he shrugged his shoulders, unable to do much in terms of response to Axel's attempts to start a conversation.

"What's your deal, anyway? Too shy to talk or...?" Axel asked.

Andrew pursed his lips, in an unintentionally feminine manner, before smiling and pointing at his teeth.

"Your teeth?" Axel asked.

Andrew pointed again, tapping his front tooth with the nail of his pointer finger, then his throat.

"What are you.... Oh! Teeth whitener! You swallowed it?" Axel asked.

Andrew excitedly nodded his head, smiling for the first time, nearly forgetting the situation he found himself in.

Thus, using a mixture of charades and occasionally out, the two carried on a conversation, mainly pertaining to what exactly Gladys had said to Andrew, which thankfully for Axel, wasn't that much.

"Grandma can be sort of an oversharer sometimes." Axel admitted.

Andrew continued to search for an out from the conversation, but was starting to realize that all he had to do was ride it out until Gladys wanted to leave, and he would be left to his own devices once more. He didn't want to start roaming until he was sure he wouldn't run into Gladys again.

As he drank his tea, Andrew felt his throat start to feel soothed, and:
155332231131212121211111.title: Getting a drink with Axel

1553322311312121212111111.content:
"Feeling better?" Axel asked.

"Mhmmm." Andrew replied. "Ah, I..."

Andrew stopped, noticing his voice had returned, but was slightly higher, and sultrier than it was before.

"You got your voice back?" Axel asked.

Andrew had to admit, the fact that he showed real concern was strange, given his earlier behavior.

"Sorta." Andrew replied, scowling as he heard his voice. "It's not usually like this."

"I'm not sure it can get any sexier than it already is," Axel said.

Andrew wasn't sure how to respond to that, so he didn't.

"I'm sorry, that was weird, I don't know why I said that." Axel said.

"It's fine, but now that I can talk, I sort of have to meet someone." Andrew said.

"Oh! Oh..." Axel sighed.

"Not that you weren't a perfect gentleman, and exactly like Gladys said, but..." you started.

"No, no, I get it. Grandma's probably ready to go home now anyway. It was nice meeting you, Andrea." Axel smiled.

"Likewise. I'm not sure I'll ever forget any of this." Andrew said, standing up.

"Maybe we'll see each other around." Axel said as he also stood up.

"Maybe!" Andrew remarked as they went their separate ways.

Now was his chance! As quickly as the heels could move him, Andrew rushed back towards the bench that Brian had been sitting at. Thankfully, Brian was still there, tapping away at his computer.

"Brian!" Andrew shouted as he approached.

Confused, Brian looked up and...
1553322311312121212111111.title: Andrew's voice starts to return (but higher)

choices: Andrew reveals his identity to Brian
15533223113121212121111111.content:
"Brian! Thank god I found you!" Andrew exclaimed.

Brian took a moment to take in the feminine sight standing before him.

"I know what you're thinking but..." Andrew started.

Brian cut him off.

"God dammit, Andrew." Brian muttered. "Listen, I don't know what my brain dead friend told you, but I'm just not looking for anyone right now. I wish he would stop worrying about my love life. I'm just not cut out for dating."

Andrew knew it had annoyed Brian that he had kept butting in, and that Brian had been having trouble lately, but hearing it like this made it sting a lot more. He was practically ready to give up on the whole thing!

Andrew opened his mouth and tried to speak, but he was having trouble formulating the words. On the one hand, he should tell Brian who he is, so Brian can help him get out of this feminine get-up and they can both go home. Despite how embarrassing that would be, Andrew was willing to take the hit to his masculinity, after all, how much worse could it get?

On the other hand... what Brian really lacked was the confidence. Maybe "Andrea" could help with that, and so the entire day getting made up might actually count for something. He could always take all the stuff off at home, and give Brian the boost he needed. Andrew wasn't entirely sure where that thought had come from, but it was a valid idea.

What will he do?
15533223113121212121111111.title: Brian doesn't recognize Andrew

choices: Brian is touched and decides to take 'Andrea' on a date
Brian is freaked out and leaves Andrew at the mall
155332231131212121211111111.content:
"It's..." Andrew started. "It's me, Brian."

"Huh?" Brian asked as he squinted, before he pieced together what the girl in front of him was saying. "Andrew?"

"Yeah..." Andrew sighed, feeling a hot wash of shame roll over him. "It's a long story."

"It probably is. What the hell are you wearing?" Brian asked.

"Well, it all started when..." Andrew started, but he was interrupted by a familiar voice.

"Andrea!" Kristi exclaimed, walking towards where Andrew and Brian were standing. "You look even better than the picture! And this must be Brian."

"Uh, yeah, how do you know 'Andrea'?" Brian asked.

"She was in my store trying on some clothes and there was some unpleasant business, so I treated her to a free makeover and shopping spree so that she'd look gorgeous for her date." Kristi said.

Andrew was so utterly embarrassed and in shock, that he could barely muster a whisper to deny what Kristi was saying.

"A date?" Brian asked, stifling a giggle. "With who?"

"You, of course!" Kristi exclaimed. "Unless she knows another Brian who she desperately had to get to."

"Is that so?" Brian asked. "Did you do this all for me?"

Andrew simply shook his head 'No', and tried to speak up, but like a bad dream, he was unable to make anything come out.

"Brian... I..." he started.

"I just wanted to see the final product, but I'll leave you two lovebirds alone. Hope to see you around, Andrea." Kristi winked as she walked back towards her store.

"So..." Brian said.

"So..." Andrew muttered.
155332231131212121211111111.title: Andrew reveals his identity to Brian

1553322311312121212111111111.content:
"Brian, it's not what you think." Andrew started, but Brian cut him off.

"Listen, I get it. You've been telling me that I needed to get out there and find a date, and I hardly put any effort into it. This makes sense, it's a little overboard, but also very flattering. If it's that important to you that you went to all this trouble, the least I can do is take you out on a date." Brian said, grabbing Andrew's hand in his.

Andrew had no idea how to respond. How was he not disgusted or annoyed right now? And why couldn't Andrew find any words to use to dispute the claims. And would Brian even accept his story now, after Kristi gave him all the wrong info?

"This isn't..." Andrew started once more.

"How you wanted us to meet? I'd guess that. But let's go somewhere nice. My treat, since that is usually what the guy does." Brian chuckled.

He was taking this all in stride! What rotten luck for Andrew!

"I think a new place opened in the mall, too. Let's go!" Brian started walking, escorting his "date" across the mall towards the restaurant.
1553322311312121212111111111.title: Brian is touched and decides to take 'Andre...

1553322312.content:
Justin checked his watch again. He'd only been at the mall for a half hour when his friend had texted and told him that they had to cancel their plans for the day. He played it off and decided that since he was already there, he'd stick around and make his own fun. It had only been another ten minutes and he was already bored. He usually enjoyed wandering around the mall, but for some reason, there just wasn't anything piquing his interest today.

"I'd just go home," Justin thought. "But I'd hate to say I wasted all that effort getting here..."

Justin looked around at all the other shoppers, everyone with a purpose, except for him. He sighed as he started walking towards the end of the east side of the mall for the 3rd time. As he turned the corner, he noticed something out of the corner of his eye that he hadn't before.

Justin sees...
1553322312.title: Bored guy looking for something to do.

choices: One if his clothes accidentally breaks.
15533223121.content:
Huh, was that store there before? Justin couldn't quite remember but he felt certain it wasn't too familiar. Then again, he didn't shop here all that often to begin with so what did he knew. From the looks of things, it was just another clothing store, but it wasn't like he had anything better to do with his time.

So, he casually walked inside, with the store not being overly busy. Well at least there was plenty of room. It wasn't the biggest store, but certainly not small either. Just enough to house a large variety of clothing.

Speaking of clothes, they all looked pretty normal too, stuff he had seen many times before. He didn't have any pressing clothing needs, but what the heck. He had all day.
15533223121.title: A new department store

choices: The clothes start to undress Justin
155332231211.content:
As Justin wandered up and down the aisles, he couldn't help but feel like there was someone following him. Yet every time he turned around, there was nobody there.

"I must be going crazy..." Justin muttered.

But just in case, Justin decided to throw off his supposed stalker by rushing through aisles and cutting through random racks until he was across the store. The feeling seemed to have passed, so Justin relaxed and looked around, realizing that he had ended up in the women's department.

Justin started to back out of the aisle when he bumped into a mannequin, nearly apologizing to it, before walking off. Now that he thought about it, this store was pretty empty...

"And how did that mannequin get in the middle of the aisle like that?" Justin asked himself.

He turned back towards the mannequin and started to walk backwards, but tripped and fell to the floor. Or at least, that's what he expected to happen. Instead, he found himself being caught by sleeves wrapping themselves around his wrists and ankles.

"What's going on?" Justin asked. "Help! Help!"

A scarf suddenly tied itself around Justin's mouth as the sleeves started to stand him upright. Justin struggled against his bonds and...
155332231211.title: Wandering around

1553322312111.content:
Justin continued to struggle against the clothing bonds around him, his voice muffled by the scarf. What in the world was going on?! Was he just dreaming this all up? It would certainly make more sense that way.

I mean, why were clothes jumping on him like this? And how? And why was the store empty? Nothing made sense in the slightest.

"I need to get out of here!" he thought to himself, unable to say it verbally.

However, at that moment, he began to feel something weird. Was his shirt rising up? He looked down, and his eyes widened at the fact that more clothes were going around him, seemingly rising up his shirt as well as pulling at his pants and shoes. What the hell? Were they undressing him or something?

He struggled more against the clothes, but it seemed like they were knotted. They began pulling him every which way to get the clothes off of him without letting him go. Eventually, it got to his underwear and they started pulling that down too, making him completely naked. He blushed heavily at the idea of being nude in public, actually hoping that no one could see him now.

Of course this also made him wonder just what these freaks of nature were even planning with him now that he was naked and helpless. Well, he seemed to get sort of an answer afterwards, as he saw two more sleeves holding up some feminine undergarments. A bra and panties to be specific.

"What?! You got to be kidding!" he thought. "Why those of all things?!"

Still unable to actually say anything, the clothes continued to slip themselves on him. They fixed the bra over his chest and shoulders, it hanging on him with nothing to fill them. The panties were then slipped on him, feeling really tight against his manhood, and pretty loose everywhere else.
1553322312111.title: The clothes start to undress Justin

15533223121111.content:
The next thing that Justin saw was a dark blue fabric falling over his face. The fabric continued down until he was squeezed into a sleeveless dark blue floral print dress that went down to about his mid-thigh. He continued to struggle, but the scarf stayed put and his arms and legs were at the mercy of the sleeves.

Almost as quick, he was turned upright and his feet were placed into a pair of tan heeled espadrille wedge sandals, before the sleeves released his ankles and allowed him to stand under his own power.

"Mhhm!" Justin tried to shout, looking around and not seeing a single other person in the store.

The sleeves on his arms loosened slightly, and Justin took the opportunity and broke out, tumbling to the floor as he was not used to walking in heels. Justin quickly stood up, tore the scarf from his mouth and started running, as fast as his heeled feet could carry him, towards the entrance, but when he arrived at the entrance, he found that the gate had been lowered and there was no way to open it.

"Help!" he shouted, banging on the gate, but no one could hear him.

He turned around, seeing various clothing items following him, including a corset, so he started to run in another direction. After running for a period longer than he felt was necessary, given the fact that the store didn't seem nearly as big from the outside, he came upon a door marked with an "Exit" sign above it.

"Thank god." Justin sighed as he rushed through the door.

He stopped dead in his tracks when he realized that the exit did not provide his salvation, but...
15533223121111.title: A girlish outfit

155332231211111.content:
This....this was a beauty salon! But how could that be? Justin knew there was one here, but it wasn't anywhere close to this clothing store. Just what kind of trippy nonsense was going on here? Not to mention, the place was just as eerily quiet as the store was.

"What is with this place?" Justin said. "It's like some weird dream...or a nightmare."

Still, making sure the door was closed so those demon-possessed clothes couldn't follow him anymore, he began walking forward, which allowed him to fully take in what he was wearing. Ugh, talk about a really feminine outfit. He'd think it'd look really nice on any actual girl. On him, it just looked creepy. The feeling of nothing but underwear underneath the dress also felt so weird, like being naked. Not to mention how ill-fitting everything was. The dress clearly wasn't made for quite someone of his build, nor were the heeled sandals. Honestly, it'd perhaps be best to take the shoes off at least.

He reached down to try and do so, and yet it was like the shoes were glued on to his feet, not budging at all.

"Oh come on!" he groaned.

Right as he talked, there was a sound, making him pause and wonder if someone was around. He called out, to no answer at all. However, right at that moment, he felt something trip him, making him cry out as he fell backwards. Conveniently, it was right into a chair, a pretty comfortable one in all honesty. Still, where did it come from?

"What the?!" Justin said, trying to get out of the chair.

However, right then, clasps appeared around his wrists, waist, and ankles, preventing him from getting out. These were considerably harder than the clothing binds before, as evidenced by how they didn't budge. Still, he groaned as he tried to get out, as the chair began to move forward, going to who knows where.

After he struggled for a minute, the chair arrived at was pretty much a normal salon room. Of course, there was nothing normal about stuff beginning to fly around just like the clothes did before. Justin was pretty convinced he was in some kind of drunken state or something, despite not being much of a drinker. I mean, what else could explain this?

The chair brought him up to a spot, making him lean back into a sink. Now, he knew what most stuff was for, as his mom had taken him to a salon for high school pictures a while ago. There was where his hair got cleaned up, though he could only wonder what this was for. He was suddenly jerked back, his hair reaching water as various supplies like combs and whatnot were flying around it, messing every which way with his hair.

Oh, and to add insult to injury, he could feel something along his hands, something that felt like a filer. Was something cleaning up his nails? He couldn't see for sure given his vision was facing upwards thanks to his head being forced into the sink. He wasn't sure how much time passed as his head remained in the sink for quite a while.

Eventually, after what seemed like a while, he was finally allowed to move his head back up, only to see....
155332231211111.title: A beauty salon

choices: An exit back into the mall
1553322312111111.content:
He didn't know how it was possible, but his normally close-cropped blonde hair was now wavy and flowing past his shoulders. He tried to reach for it, but struggled against the clasps. Justin looked down at his hands and got another surprise, his fingernails had been lengthened, shaped, and polished, now sporting a french-tip design that Justin reluctantly acknowledged, probably complimented the outfit he was now trapped in.

"Come on..." Justin struggled to pull his wrists free.

Suddenly, his legs were pulled upwards by a pair of shower hoses and an aerosol bottle sprayed its contents, a white cream, onto his legs. In doing so, Justin was given a look at his feet. A quick glance at his feet saw that his toes matched his fingernails in their grooming. The can then moved to his arms, and the lower part of his face, lathering those as well.

"Yuck! What is this stuff?" Justin sniffed and made a disgusted face.

The cream began to tingle, then burn, before wet towels came from the sink and rubbed Justin's legs down, taking all the hair on them with, then going to his arms, and then his face. Just as quickly as this had all happened, he was now practically hairless from the neck-down. His legs were released and he was left alone for a few moments.

"Let! Me! Go!" Justin struggled against his bonds again.

One of his wrists suddenly released, and he quickly went to work freeing his other wrist, easier said than done with his newly lengthened nails, but he managed to do it. He pushed himself out of the chair and ran to the next exit on the other side of the room. No way he was going back into the department store, but he couldn't stay here.

He rushed through the new door to find...
1553322312111111.title: Perfectly long and styled hair

15533223121111111.content:
As Justin went through the next door, he ran right into....a makeup counter?

"Oh come on, what's going on here?!" he cried out.

This made no sense at all! It was like something out of a supernatural movie. How in the world was his hair suddenly so long? And they grew his nails out? It all looked so....girly, as if that was what they were trying to change him in to. Well, whatever the case, he was unwilling to go along with it. Hopefully he could make his way out of here. That way, he could at least get a haircut and cut his nails. Hopefully the hair would come back on its own in time.

"Just ignore everything. Find another exit," he said to himself, looking for wherever the exit to this had to be.

However, just like before, a chair came right up behind him, startling him a little as it pushed him up to a mirror, the content around full of various kits. Again, they tried to bind him, and pretty much succeeded. Justin struggled against them again, although his nails were making it a lot harder.

Suddenly, his head was forced into a straight position, likely something done by the chair, to keep his face from moving around. Groaning, various cosmetics began to fly, all circling around him like predators around their prey. Some lip gloss came first, and as much as he tried to keep his mouth away from it, the possessed chair somehow forced his lips out, allowing the lip gloss to cover them in a bright shine. Justin could even smell a hint of cherry coming from them...and did his lips feel bigger?

From there, more cosmetics came out. Some powder got applied to his cheeks, while light mascara was applied to his eyes as well as eyeliner. All the pretty usual works for a girl and whatnot. All the more, Justin continued to struggle against the bonds, slowly getting out. What made this all worse was the mirror in front of him, so he could see what was happening in real time.

The more make-up was applied, the more it was hard to tell there was a guy underneath it all. Each cosmetic only further made him appear more womanly, not too heavy on the makeup, but just enough to be beautiful. Heck, he would love it if it were on anyone but himself.

What the heck was all this about? Preparing him for a date or something? He'd prefer to be the guy in such a situation.

"Let....go....NOW!" he yelled, very frustrated by now.

Eventually, he finally got out, even with other stuff still flying around. God, everything was just making it harder. The dress, heels, the long hair, just everything was making it more difficult. Still, at least he found another exit, though he could only wonder where he'd end up now.
15533223121111111.title: A makeup counter

155332231211111111.content:
Justin bolted as fast as the heels could take him through the exit, expecting to be in another aspect of this feminine labyrinth, and tripped over the threshold, falling to the floor. The change in lighting blinded him, and his eyes slowly adjusted to the new area he was in. Before he could react, a hand reached out to him.

"Need any help, Miss?" the owner of the hand asked.

Justin grabbed the hand and was pulled up onto his feet. He looked around, seeing that he had been deposited back into the mall, in fact, deposited right where the entrance of the department store was. The helpful hand belonged to a man, slightly taller than Justin with broad shoulders and a friendly grin on his face.

"You have to help me. This store, the clothes were flying and they put me in this dress and..." Justin trailed off as the panic rose in his body.

"Calm down there, what's going on?" the man asked.

"This store. It's cursed or something!" Justin exclaimed in reply.

"What store?" the man asked.

"This one!" Justin turned to the door he exited from, only to be confronted with a blank wall. "No, it was here!"

Justin ran down the entire section, seeing nothing that indicated that a store had ever been present. Just a wall.

"It was... it was there..." Justin sighed, on the verge of tears.

"Hold on, it's okay uh..." the man started. "I didn't catch your name."

"It's Justin-ah!" Justin exclaimed as a woman pushing a stroller abruptly pushed past him, knocking him into the man's chest.

"Justina, eh? I'm Axel." the man said.

"I... uh..." Justin stammered. "I really need to sit down."

"Why don't we go get a coffee? My treat." Axel said.

Justin considered Axel's offer. A drink does sound nice, but on the other hand, he should really investigate the store's disappearance. Decisions, decisions...
155332231211111111.title: Back into the mall

1553322312111111111.content:
Well....he supposed he could do it right afterwards. A little drink did sound pretty good. Although, Justin wondered if that was really a good idea. Axel really seemed to think he was a woman, though he wondered just how he could think that.

Despite the hair, make-up, and clothes, Justin couldn't believe he looked all that feminine. Heck, he still had a man's build, and no breasts or curves or anything. Not that he wanted any of that of course, as he just wanted to get things back to normal. Still, Axel really didn't seem to be finding anything weird. Either that or he was playing him.

"...Sure," Justin said finally.

"Awesome," Axel smiled. "The shop is just around the corner here."

With that, Axel began to walk Justin over to the coffee shop. All in all, it actually didn't feel all that bad. Still incredibly awkward though. Justin could only wonder how ridiculous he appeared right now. Surely there had to be people who saw how weird this all looked. And yet, no passeby even gave him a second glance. He wasn't sure if that was a good thing or just spooky.

In any case, Axel got the two of them a little table, taking in what Justin preferred for a coffee. The two got their drinks not too long afterwards.

"This is actually my first time to this shop," smiled Axel. "I heard good things about this shop though."

"Hmm...." Justin hummed a bit before taking a sip. Wow, it actually was really good. "Yeah, it is good."

"Great," Axel nodded, before beginning to sip his drink as well. He seemed to like it just as much. "So, how are you on this fine day, Justina?"

Was he really going to have get used to hearing that? Ugh, well at least he could probably get back to normal once this conversation was done.
1553322312111111111.title: Accept Axel's offer

15533223121111111111.content:
"I'm a little confused actually. I mean, with that store situation, and I don't even know where to start with that one..." Justin started.

"You're sure there was a store there? You might have just gotten turned around." Axel said.

"No, I'm sure. It was weird, I wasn't even sure what was going on, but I know it was real." Justin said.

"What were you shopping for?" Axel asked.

"I wasn't shopping for anything, really. A friend cancelled on me, so I was wandering around, strolled in there by complete impulse." Justin said.

"Looks like you found a purpose, though." Axel laughed. "Now instead of wandering, you'll be searching."

Justin couldn't help but giggle at what Axel said. He was right, the store had given him a purpose. Though he'd have preferred his purpose involving pants and sneakers.

"Want me to help you look when we finish?" Axel asked.

"I don't think that..." Justin started to think, if he ended up finding it and got trapped again... might be better to have backup. "That would be great, actually. Thank you."

"No problem. It'll be great to spend more time with you anyway," Axel said.

But is backup worth all this? Justin finished his coffee, which Axel tossed in the trash with his own empty cup, before the couple stood up and left the coffee shop. They returned to the blank wall, which was still just a wall.

"I'm not nuts, I swear it was right here. I walked in, those floating clothes undressed me and... Oh!" Justin exclaimed.

"What's wrong?" Axel asked.

"My stuff! My wallet, keys, all the things that were in my pants are gone!" Justin shouted.

You quickly pick up your purse and shoes and try to run out of that damned store immediately, from there, out of the mall.

1553322312111111111111111111111212112.title: You made it home

15533223121111111111111111111112121122.content:
You got home and tossed the purse and heels right by the entrance(why did I bring those in?), you checked the junk drawer for glue solvent, you were in luck.

You slipped out of the dress, stockings, bra and panties applied the solvent to the orbs stuck to your chest. One quick shower after that, and you were free.

You smiled at yourself in the mirror, “hey handsome! I haven’t see you in a while!”

You then flexed your muscles, “you see that? You see what that is? That’s a MAN Right there!”

After about 20 minutes of basking in this, you returned to your room and threw on a comfortable pair of boxers, a worn down undershirt, stained sweatpants from spilled food past.

You had finally returned to normal and you intended to celebrate by doing absolutely NOTHING! Just watch TV and go to bed early- without your tits pushed under your chin or a thong riding up your ass.
—-

You collapsed into your bed, cozy and familiar. It was glorious. After the days you’ve had this was the best way to unwind.
15533223121111111111111111111112121122.title: Chill until it’s time for bed

choices: It Was All A Dream, or WAS it?!
155332231211111111111111111111121211221.content:
Axel had been busy all day at work, having to stay much later to wrap up a task before he could leave. It was too late to make any plans, but he didn’t want Justina to think that he had forgotten about her.

—-

It was 9pm and Justin was out cold for 55 minutes when his phone started ringing, the caller ID read “Axel”

Justin didn’t hear the phone ring and the call just went to voicemail, but there were other entities that heard that particular phone ring.

From the floor of the bathroom, the clothes started slowly coming to life. They lifted up and floated down the hallway to Justin’s room. They circled around his sleeping body before the stockings wrapped around the comforter and pulled it off his bed.

The clothes immediately seemed aghast to see what had previously been so beautiful reduced to this state and attire.

They then grabbed this sleeping man out from the bed: the shoes placed themselves on his feet, the dress grabbed his waist, the stockings wrapped themselves around his arms, and the purse kept his head level. They then carried him out of his room and out of his house while the breast forms followed closely behind.

—-

I’m the middle of the night, you began to feel a little bit chilly and you heard the leaves rustling.

“What the-? Did I leave a window open or something?” You asked yourself.

You then opened your eyes to see that you were outside and moving. You looked up to see your arms appeared to be tied, something was wrapped around your waist, and there was something shiny on your feet. You were being carried, it looked like but you couldn’t see anyone around.

You looked around to see where you were, when you looked down you saw that you were being carried towards the mall- and that’s when it all clicked. Your arms were tied by stockings, a dress was wrapped around your waist and those shiny things on your feet were heels.

“Wait! Wait! Stop! Let me go! I don’t want this!” You tried to plead with the sentient clothes that remained unphased. You switched it up to wrestling and wiggling out of of your hold the clothes had on you, but they had a good hold on you. You tried a combination of the two, which of course was unsuccessful.

“Well, the malls closed now, they shouldn’t be able to go in.” You hoped, while looking around and seeing the vacant parking lot.

You were carried towards a door that opened on its own. “That door wasn’t even an automatic one,” you worried to yourself. Everything seemed to be working in tandem to ensure that you fulfilled the role of Justina.

Once you were in the mall being carried to that glowing department store you screamed at the top of your lungs while wrestling with all of your might, “STOP IT! STOP IT RIGHT NOW! I DONT WANT TO BE JUSTINA! LET ME GO YOU STUPID CLOTHES! LET ME GO!”

The rides and the arcade machines became activated as you were pulled past them. Karaoke booths each activated as you were dragged past. The first one played “Man, I Feel Like a Woman”, the second one “More Than A Woman”, and the last one “Pretty Woman”

Finally, the clothes brought you to the front of the glowing department store, the gate guarding the store started to rise- like a kingdom expecting its knights return from a conquest. When the gate was fully up, the clothes carried you the rest of the way into the store.

And then, the gate closed.
155332231211111111111111111111121211221.title: While he sleeps

1553322312111111111111111111111212112211.content:
You heard the gate collide with the ground when it finally closed.

You looked up from your hold towards the gate to see the interior of the mall disappear into a haze.

“Please,” you beg, “there must be some mistake. I’m a man!” You direct it at all the sentient clothes around, “you must be looking for someone else....you HAVE to be.”

The clothes let you go, but instead of falling to the ground you are lifted up well past the point where the ceiling would be. You float up to an area where you’re surrounded by full body mirrors and an assortment of women’s attire.

The dress that carried you floats up and orbits around you, you continue to plead, “I mean, surely you can see that this isn’t right, right? Please take me back, let me live my life as I should- as Justin, I’ll even help you find the right person for this role- SHE would probably really love to live in your reality.

The dress stops moving and turns it’s back on you.

“It’s nothing against you all, its just- it’s me. I’m a dude. It isn’t right.”

Your body is moved behind the dress and is turned to face it, before you you see a full length mirror reflecting back an image of you behind the dress- lined up. It was almost as like this reality was making its arguments to you.

“Oh no! No no no” you respond defensively- what you thought earlier was hurt feelings and insults was just the choreography for this reflection. “Noooo no. You see how silly this looks? This doesn’t work at all. But we can fix this! I can HELP you fix this, just take me back and”

You get distracted by a shiny object floating towards you- as it gets closer you can make out that it’s a chain. It floats towards you and wraps around your neck before clicking into place. You look down and see a charm that reads “Justina” indicating that the reality you’re in is not seeing your case.

“I see I’m not getting through to you. I’m not ‘Justina’, I’m ‘Justin’. I’m a man, I am clearly a man.”

The hair you had from earlier lowers down and places itself on your head.

“Maybe less clearly now, but still- please, hear me out”

Your sweatpants are pulled off.

“No. Please. Listen. This is a mistake.”

Your boxers follow suit, leaving you naked from the waist down.

Fake fingernails fly out and tear your rip your shirt down the middle before ripping it off your body.

“Stop it. You’re not listening to me”

The fingernails jump onto your fingers.

“Please! This is a mistake!”

The panties from before shoot up your legs and rest on your hips.

“Stop!”

The bra straps entangle your arms, ride up, push your shoulders back and snap on in the back.

“Stop!”

The breast forms lower down from above and slip themselves into the cups of the bra.

“Stop this!”

The stockings slide up your legs.

“Stop!”

You’re flipped upside down and appear to be falling towards the floor, you hold your hands up to save yourself, only to be ensnarled by the dress from earlier.

You’re floated back up to where you’re were, except now you’re surrounded by full body mirrors. While in midair you’re being rotated while seeing clothing flying around you and cosmetics darting towards your face. You feel the endless shifting of clothes and each new mirror you look at you’re in a completely new outfit and your face a little more made up.

A voice echos from all around you repeating “Justina”

You plead futilely for this error to be corrected, until the makeups done, you’re back in the dress that carried you here and you’re standing in your heels in the department store.

“Justina?” You hear from behind you.

You turn around to see...
1553322312111111111111111111111212112211.title: Welcome Home Justina

choices: I’ve got a lot I need to do today
1553322312111111111111111111111212112211.content:
“I knew that I’d find you here!” Axel said, “you love this place.”

“I assure you that I don’t,” you said while trying to tug at your clothes that were once again stuck on you. You rolled your eyes and sighed. “I was out...I was free” you thought.

“What are you doing here, by the way” you asked.

“I tried to call you last night, I left you a voicemail, but you didn’t call me back- I thought maybe you were mad at me or something, so I had to find you. I was hoping that time we met wasn’t going to be the only time we’d see each other.”

“No, it doesn’t look like it will be” you said, still seething, “Wait, you said you called me? What time?”

“About 9, I guess you were out clubbing or-“

“At the mall...” it dawned on you. You couldn’t figure out what it was, but you knew it was significant.

“Wasn’t the mall closed by then?”

“It wasn’t for me...”

“Ah! Well, it looks like the occasion wasn’t put to waste- you look phenomenal!”

“Thanks,” you say sarcastically.

“You want me to take your picture for you?”

“No thank you, I’m good” you said as your hands reached into your purse, pulled out your phone, unlocked it and handed it to Axel.

On three, Axel took your picture while your body struck a pose. He handed it back to you and your hands instinctively started posting it on social media- only this time you weren’t posting it on “Miss Justina”s account but on your real account.

The picture was captioned “Finally becoming the girl I was always meant to be #CallMeJustina #MagicAtTheMall”

It seemed as though this Justina that was influencing your actions and attire was aware of your struggle and was mocking it, relishing it. As though she was saying “you’re mine now” to the point where she wanted to declare her victory over you to your world.

“Well, since we’re here, would you like to grab another cup of coffee?” Axel suggested.
1553322312111111111111111111111212112211.title: Axel

1553322312111111111111111111111212112211.content:
“I’m sorry Axel, but I’ve got a lot to investigate, erm, I mean take care of today. I’m gonna have to take a rain check on that coffee, okay?”

Axel hung his head low, “okay...yeah...that’s fine. Do you need a ride anywhere?”

“I’ll be fine, thanks” trying as politely to send him away.

“Oh right, of course” and then he left.

You immediately pulled out your phone and saw the voicemail notification. The phone rang across dimensions, something in this voicemail has to explain why you were pulled back. And if it did, maybe there might be a clue as to how you could get back.

—-
“Hey Justina, it’s Axel. Sorry I’m just now calling I was busy at work all day haha....ANYway...I had a lot of fun hanging out with you the other day, I was hoping maybe we could see each other again? Like maybe...on a date...? Ha! Sorry, that’s a little bit forward, it’s just that you’re the prettiest girl I’ve ever seen...yikes! Well I’m going to get off here before I say something else embarrassing like ‘I love you’ or something.

Oh! But I’m not saying that! It was just a joke. Not that loving you would be a joke to me. Oh...yikes...call me”

That was Axels voicemail, though you listened to it again to hear the stuff going on in the background.

Right off the bat, Axels calling you “Justina” seems liked it was edited and spliced together, you heard a slight click.

Also, in the background, you heard a faint whisper. You played it back multiple times until you finally heard it “Justin Ah. Bring back Justin Ah. Purposely spacing out your name. As though it was recognizing you as both Justin and Justina.

That message must’ve been sent through the dimensions, but that wasn’t for you to hear- it was for the clothes you were wearing. Everything in this dimension is an agent FOR this dimension. That explains the initial assault at the department store. “As soon as they saw me, they sought to take me” you concluded and played the recording over.

“Hey Justina, it’s Ax-“ the recording distorted and cut off.

“Hey Chris,” a you heard a familiar girls voice.
“Hello?” You heard Chris, the friend you were supposed to meet at the mall, “who’s this?”
“It’s Karen,” that was the girl that called you when you were at Justina’s place! “We’re in the same history class at college.”
“I didn’t know there was a Karen in that class”
“I’m great! I got your number from the school phone book and I just wanted to say I think you’re cute and that we should hang out.”
“Oh really? I’m down with that!”
“Oh! And before I forget, I need a date for my best friend. So please invite one of your friends, maybe that Justin guy I see you hang around with!”
“You got it!”

What’s going on? You pondered. What were you listening to?

“Let’s plan to meet on Saturday at Frosties, that ice cream place at the mall across from that new department store that just opened up.”
“Sounds good. I’ll see you there.”
“Great! And don’t forget to invite Justin, okay?”
“I won’t.”
“You promise?”
“I’ll text him right now.”
“Great! See ya!”

You heard them both hang up. What was going on?

“Hello?” Chris answered.
“Hey it’s me, Karen.”
“Oh cool! I’m on my way to the mall now”
“Actually, there’s been a change of plans. I’m actually over by Bakersfield 20 minutes away from the mall- my car is busted and I’m hanging out over here if you want to come?”
“Sure, where should Justin and I meet you?”
“Actually, my friend couldn’t make it, so it would just be the two of us?”
“I can’t just cancel on Justin, that’s rude.”
“Oh come on! He’ll be alright do you really want to bring him just to be a third wheel?”
“I guess not”

You stared in shock. This wasn’t a coincidence. This alternate dimension specifically wanted you to be Justina to the point of orchestrating you, not only to be stranded at the mall, but to be in the vicinity of that damn department store. It did everything it could to get you here, to keep you here, and once out, to bring you back.

It was dead set on making you Justina the entire time.

But why?
1553322312111111111111111111111212112211.title: I’ve got a lot I need to do today

1553322312111111111111111111111212112211.content:
It was Karen that orchestrated everything. She was the one that made sure Chris invited you to the mall that day and placed in the vicinity of that department store. All of this kicked off because of her. It would only be of benefit to know who she is, why she did this, why you, and how she called Chris, or even knew who you were to begin with.

You had her number. So finding her wouldn’t be an issue.

“Justina!” Karen answered her phone, “we had plans to get together yesterday! What happened?!”

You were too impatient to not start interrogating her.

“Oh right! About that. I went out of town...but I was pulled back at the last minute.” You said in a serious tone.

“Well I’m SO GLAD you’re back” she said and you couldn’t tell how she was responding to you.

“Would you like to make up for it today?”

“Nothing would make me happier than to see you around”
1553322312111111111111111111111212112211.title: Further investigating
