“Thanks,” you shrug it off.

“So have you been seeing anybody?” Karen asks.

“Cut the crap and tell me what’s going on”

Is what you wanted to say, but what you really said was, “Actually, I just met this guy named Axel. He’s attractive but hes a little weird. I just don’t think he’s the one for me” you were stunned at that outburst. What was that? Was that Justina? Were you not just trapped in Justinas clothes, but also trapped in Justinas actions? A man trapped in a cage of Justinas life?

“It happens to the best of us, I’m sure you’ll find someone some day”

And the rest of the conversation went that way, every time you thought you were in control and were able to ask questions- Justina ended up popping out of your mouth.

When the night was starting to come to a close, Karen concluded everything with “and don’t think you’re going to just slip out of town again and forget about me, I’m going to hang out with you everyday just so I can keep my eye on you! Seriously girl” she laughed and looked back at you soberly, “seriously. Girl.” What was she doing?

She then leaned in to whisper in your ear, “some people choose their destinies, others have their destinies chosen for them.”

She pulled away from you ear, “but anyway, welcome back Justina. After your one day trip you’re now right back home. See you tomorrow Justina!”
1553322312111111111111111111111212112211.title: Meeting up with Karen

You’ve tried to reach for them multiple times, only to have your hand smacked away and then get shoved into something that still had the sting of emasculation.

“Seriously? What woman dresses this way if they’re just going to be hanging at home?”

You try to adjust the articles that are too eagerly crawling into your crevasses. Your attempts are denied.

The phone flies into your hand and you find the phone dialing...

An hour later, you arrive at the pool Karen said she’d be at.

You walked up to the only person laying out, “Karen?”

“Justina!” She yelled, “glad you could make it!”

You were opening you mouth to begin interrogating her as to what was going on, when she cut you off, “did you bring a suit?”

“Well, that’s not important-“ She cut you off again.

“I KNEW you’d forget!” She reached into her bag and pulled out a pink bikini and shoved it in your hands, “you’re lucky you’re friends with me! I’m always looking out for my girlfriends.”

“Maybe later, I just want to ask-“

“If you think I’m going to have this conversation while you’re dressed like that...here...you’re out of your mind”

“But I just want to-“

“But-“

“I can’t hear you.”

He tried taking the dress off so that he could put the swimsuit on manually, but it still wouldn’t budge.

“I wouldn’t think you clothes would have a problem with me putting on a different humiliating outfit” he said.

He tried again, still to no avail, “what gives?”

“I want to talk to you, which you apparently won’t do until I put this on.”

“Honestly no”

“Why m-“

“Fine. Whatever. Sure.”

“Sure what?”

“I want to put on the bikini?”

Just then you were lifted from the ground as the outfit you were forced into departed from you and the swimsuit Karen gave you swarmed onto your body. Once you were returned to the ground you found that the concept of getting in a bikini was much easier in theory than practice as you now felt compelled to try and cover up your body.

1553322312111111111111111111111212112211.title: Head to the changing room

1553322312111111111111111111111212112211.content:
You two were laying out by the pool.

“Why are you doing this to me?” You asked.

“Please. We’re doing you a favor. You’re decisions in life are so messed up” Karen began, “do you have any idea the value of that outfit you left in was? And when you get back, what’s The first thing you get into? A t-shirt and sweatpants. Ugh!”

“I was just chilling at home.”

“Fashion is a lifestyle, Justina. And besides the day you came to the mall, look at what you were wearing- jeans and a t shirt. Before we pulled you in, I had not once seen you in a pretty dress or cute skirt outfit.”

“That’s because I was a man.” You countered, “am!” You corrected yourself.

“You were right the first time.” Karen laughed.

“I heard your phone conversation,” you switched the subject, “why was it so important to pull me into this? Why couldn’t you have grabbed someone else? Like an actual woman? How did you even find me?”

“We grabbed you, because it HAD to be you. There was no one else suitable to be Justina here. There was no finding you, because we’ve always been aware of you- and we’ve just been waiting for the right time to collect you.”

“I refuse to play along. I refuse to be your Justina. And you’re going to tell me how to get back.”

“Well, the portal opens in ten years. So, you’re welcome to wait for that. Until then, you’ll have to survive in a world that will only see you as Justina. Not to mention even IF you manage to get out again, we’ll grab you again.”

“I just have to wait for the portal to close and I’ll be safe”

“When you got back the last time, what time was it?”

“What do you mean?”

“If you had been paying attention, you would have noticed that your return was only 3 seconds after you were pulled in here.”

“So?”

“SO! Time moves slower here. To the point where you spent an entire day or so over here and it only accounted for 3 seconds there.”

“I’m still not following.”

“Our portal to your world is near constant and it can be anywhere. It could even be inside your house, which, if you got out- there’s a good possibility it would be.”

You stared at her in astonishment.

“It is very important to us that you be Justina. If you want to stop being thrown around and maybe able to dress yourself, perhaps it should be important to you too”

You continued to stare in disbelief.

“And if not, we’ve got other ways of fitting you to the role”

155332232.content: Accidental Enchantment: A well-meaning, but terribly misinformed fairy godmother does her best to grant the deepest wishes of her charge. If only she'd found the right person.
155332232.title: Something Else

1553322321.content:
A warm breeze blew across the night sky, rustling the handful of leaves in the concrete jungle and stirring up small whirlwinds of trash and plastic. A good few miles away, a thriving nightlife scene brimmed with life as cars and customers kept the pulse of the city alive all night long. But in this small corner of apartment blocks, things were quieter. Quiet, that is, except for a small glittering ball of light that tinkled and hummed as it careened through the sky like a leaf in the wind.

Unlike a leaf, this ball of light had a clear destination in mind. If only she knew where it was.

"Oh dear, oh dear, oh dearie me." Within the light was a small pudgy woman with steely grey hair and golden gossamer wings who muttered to herself as she flew. "My first day back on the job and I'm already late!"

She glanced at a scroll held tight in one hand as she fought the wind. "I've got to get this right, I've got to! I'm already on probation after the last incident. One more mistake and they'll revoke my fairy godmother license!" She darted into the air vents of a nondescript apartment building, banging and bumping into the walls as the air patterns suddenly changed.

She exited the vent in a hallway, horn-rimmed glasses askew and slightly bruised, but otherwise no worse for wear. "There we go. Any landing you can walk away from, as they say." She adjusted her glasses as she unrolled her scroll. "Now, my new charge is one Cindy Lawson, age twenty-two." She squinted at the excessively curly handwriting of her case manager. She'd been meaning to go see her fairy optometrist about getting a stronger prescription, but for the moment she had to make do. "Let's see... emotionally abusive childhood, dangerously low self-esteem, body and confidence issues... how terrible, the poor dear. At least there's a bright spot; her sorrow is my salvation. This should be an easy case to get back in my superior's good graces. And all I have to do is go and help that unfortunate darling in apartment 36C."

And so she flittered away, using her magic to phase through the door of apartment 36C.

Unfortunately, between her bad eyesight, her manager's ornately cursive writing, and a smudge caused by her bump in the vents, the earnest fairy godmother had made a terrible mistake. Cindy Lawson lived in apartment 36D, not 36C. The room just below Cindy's (which she had just entered) was actually occupied by a young man who had no idea what chaos was about to enter his life.
1553322321.title: Accidental Enchantment

choices: Cast a Spell on the World
15533223211.content:
The first thing the fairy godmother noticed was how cold the apartment felt. Not in terms of temperature, but in atmosphere. The furniture was tasteful and of decent quality, but there were no decorations. It was like the set from a photo shoot. There were no pictures, no knick-knacks, nothing to give it an identity. Neither feminine nor masculine, it was as if no one actually lived there.

But clearly someone did. There was food in the cabinets and dishes in the sink. The fairy godmother flitted about until she found the door that led to the bedroom.

The bedroom, at least, looked lived in, but in a state that made the fairy shake her head. Clothing was strewn about, mostly simple shirts and jeans, nothing to flatter a girl's figure. The attached bathroom had the bare minimum of toiletries, but even that was all generic store brands. It wasn't until she heard a snore that she noticed her new charge.

"Oh the poor dear..." she couldn't help but sigh. Though young Miss Cindy was oddly blurry and half covered by a wadded and tangled blanket, the fairy could see more than enough to know that the girl needed serious help. She was a stick, with almost no figure to speak of. Her breasts were hidden since she laid on her stomach, but they couldn't have been more than A-cups. Her hair was on the shorter side of long, but poorly kept, as though all she cared about was having it out of her eyes. Her limbs were long and gangly, and she didn't even want to think about the state of the girl's nails. No wonder she had such troubles. The vicious cycle between low self-esteem and a bad body image was clearly evident.

But not for much longer, not with a fairy godmother at hand. She whipped out her wand, ready to cast a spell that would grant all this poor girl's wishes and fix all her problems... when she stopped. Maybe it would be better to not be so hasty. She didn't want to frighten the dear, after all.

On one hand, she could change the girl's body. Slowly or quickly, to give her a chance to grow into it or the joy of a miraculous change. Maybe add a few enchantments about the apartment to help her adjust.

On the other hand, fixing a problem this advanced with a big job; one that would require a lot of magic. In that case, why not go all the way? Why not change the whole world to help Cindy become what she most desired to be? Or maybe send her to another world entirely, where powers not found on this one could help her?

She pondered this as she hovered over the sleeping "girl" for some minutes until she came to a decision.
15533223211.title: Entering the apartment

1553322322.content: Right of Succession: When a sick king dies, his oldest son is set to take the throne. However, his sneaky younger brother comes up with a plan to turn the kingdom and royal advisers against his brother.
1553322322.title: Something Else

choices: Eli decides to meet with the advisers first
15533223221.content:
It was a sad time for the kingdom of Eowin. Their beloved king, King Elias XVI had just passed away, leaving his kingdom to be ruled over by Elias' son, Elias XVII, or as he preferred to be called, Eli. Eli was not only beloved by his parents, but he was also beloved by his adoring public, princesses throwing themselves at him, always the center of attention at any diplomatic function he attended, but most of all, he was compassionate and all set to be the best ruler that Eowin had ever seen.

But Prince Eli was not the only son of Elias, however, Elias also had another son, Kane, who was a year younger than his brother, and prone to scheming. It's not that he was less loved, but he had known that he'd never be the perfect son who would take over the throne, despite how much he wanted it. Their father's illness was sudden, but Kane wasn't about to watch himself lose any chance of ever gaining the throne. Kane was independently wealthy thanks to a mix of gambling and smart investments, which was why it was relatively easy to bribe the servants of the castle into following his commands.

Kane sat in his office and tapped a button on his desk, which turned off a nearby television, broadcasting the ceaseless coverage of the death of King Elias. A knock came on the door.

"Come!" Kane stated.

The door opened and a young bearded man, Kane's assistant, Marco, walked in.

"How are you going to do it?" Marco asked. "I mean, he's not just going to abdicate the throne. And you're not a killer."

"Killing is unnecessary. And he will abdicate. Once I give him reason to do so." Kane replied. "The official coronation is in six months, he'll have power for those six months, but all I have to do is turn the public against him."

"And how can you do that? He's the golden son!" Marco replied.

"Then we just have to make sure he's no longer a son of any kind." Kane stated.

The sun streamed into Eli's room through the curtains, as one of the servants entered the room, carrying a tray with a mug of coffee on it.

"Your highness, it is time to wake up." the servant stated.

Eli rolled over and put his head under the pillow. The servant continued to stand at attention.

"Sir, you have your appointment with the royal physician today. This can't be kept waiting." the servant said.

Eli groaned and sat up in his bed, his messy blonde hair covering his face. He brushed it back and reached for the mug.

"Thank you. That will be all." Eli said.

The servant nodded and walked out of the room. Eli stretched and got out of bed, quickly getting dressed and heading out the door.
15533223221.title: Right of Succession

155332232211.content:
The upper levels of the castle were living spaces, but to make everything easier, especially in the past when rulers died of long drawn out illnesses, a royal physician was located just downstairs. Eli strolled into the exam room, where the doctor, Dr. Bratford, stood looking at a chart. He looked up when Eli walked in.

"Ah, your majesty. Nice to see you." Dr. Bratford said.

"Same to you, doc. Why is this so important?" Eli asked.

"Since your father died suddenly, we have to ensure you have a clean bill of health before you can start as king." Dr. Bratford replied. "Wouldn't want for you to start as King and then suddenly drop dead of something preventable."

"Makes sense." Eli said.

"Hop up onto the exam table and let's get this over with." Dr. Bratford said.

Eli complied and the doctor began to run the usual gauntlet of items. Reflex test, checked blood pressure and heart rate, and took a blood sample. Once he finished, a nurse brought in a needle and Bratford prepped Eli's arm.

"What's the injection? I'm up to date with all vaccines." Eli said.

"This is a new one. New strain of flu, and given that you're fairly important, it's imperative that you receive it." Dr. Bratford replied.

"All right, then." Eli said.

Bratford injected the needle into Eli's arm, before marking a sheet of paper whose letterhead showed the name of K-Corp, owned and operated by Prince Kane of Eowin.

"And that's it?" Eli asked.

"That's it." Dr. Bratford replied.

Eli hopped off the table and headed out of the physician's office, running into...
155332232211.title: Eli visits the royal physician

15533223222.content: From Soldier to Army Wife: A soldier, returning from deployment, ends up making a big life change by becoming an Army Wife.
15533223222.title: Something else

info.brief_description: A collection of story ideas. In each one, a guy ends up having to dress like a girl.
info.description:
This is a collection of different story ideas in which a guy ends up having to dress like a girl. Forced, accidental, begrudgingly or some other reason.

Rules:

Keep to the idea of one or all of the characters are forced to dress and act like woman.

Absolutely nothing related to children (under 18 years old)
